en: CHAPTER I. THE GUN CLUB
zh: 第一章，枪支俱乐部

en: During the War of the Rebellion, a new and influential club was established in the city of Baltimore in the State of Maryland.
zh: 在起义战争期间，一个新的有影响力的俱乐部在巴尔的摩市的马里兰州成立。

en: It is well known with what energy the taste for military matters became developed among that nation of ship-owners, shopkeepers, and mechanics.
zh: 众所周知，在这个由船主、店主和机械师组成的国家里，人们对军事事务的兴趣发展到了何种程度。

en: Simple tradesmen jumped their counters to become extemporized captains, colonels, and generals, without having ever passed the School of Instruction at West Point;
zh: 简单的商人跳过他们的柜台成为即兴的上尉，上校和将军，从来没有通过学校的教学在西点军校;

en: nevertheless; they quickly rivaled their compeers of the old continent, and, like them, carried off victories by dint of lavish expenditure in ammunition, money, and men.
zh: 尽管如此，他们还是迅速地与旧大陆的竞争对手相抗衡，并且像他们一样，凭借在弹药、金钱和人员上的大量花费而取得了胜利。

en: But the point in which the Americans singularly distanced the Europeans was in the science of gunnery.
zh: 但是美国人与欧洲人之间唯一的距离是在枪炮科学上。

en: Not, indeed, that their weapons retained a higher degree of perfection than theirs, but that they exhibited unheard-of dimensions, and consequently attained hitherto unheard-of ranges.
zh: 事实上，他们的武器并没有保留比他们更高的完美程度，而是他们展示了前所未闻的尺寸，从而达到了前所未闻的射程。

en: In point of grazing, plunging, oblique, or enfilading, or point-blank firing, the English, French, and Prussians have nothing to learn;
zh: 在放牧、俯冲、倾斜或包围，或近距离射击方面，英国人、法国人和普鲁士人没有什么可学的;

en: but their cannon, howitzers, and mortars are mere pocket-pistols compared with the formidable engines of the American artillery.
zh: 但是他们的大炮、榴弹炮和迫击炮与美国大炮的强大发动机相比只是袖珍手枪。

en: This fact need surprise no one. The Yankees, the first mechanicians in the world, are engineers—just as the Italians are musicians and the Germans metaphysicians—by right of birth.
zh: 这个事实无需惊讶任何人。美国佬是世界上第一批机械师，他们是工程师ーー正如意大利人是音乐家，德国人是形而上学家ーー因为他们的出身。

en: Nothing is more natural, therefore, than to perceive them applying their audacious ingenuity to the science of gunnery.
zh: 因此，没有什么比看到他们将他们大胆的创造性应用于射击科学更自然的了。

en: Witness the marvels of Parrott, Dahlgren, and Rodman.
zh: 见证帕罗特，达尔格伦和罗德曼的奇迹。

en: The Armstrong, Palliser, and Beaulieu guns were compelled to bow before their transatlantic rivals.
zh: 阿姆斯特朗、帕利泽和比尤利厄的大炮被迫向他们的跨大西洋对手低头。

en: Now when an American has an idea, he directly seeks a second American to share it.
zh: 现在，当一个美国人有一个想法，他直接寻求第二个美国人分享它。

en: If there be three, they elect a president and two secretaries.
zh: 如果有三个，他们选举一个主席和两个秘书。

en: Given four, they name a keeper of records, and the office is ready for work;
zh: 给出四个名字，他们任命一个记录保管员，这个办公室就可以开始工作了;

en: five, they convene a general meeting, and the club is fully constituted.
zh: 他们召开股东大会，俱乐部完全成立。

en: So things were managed in Baltimore.
zh: 所以巴尔的摩的事情都处理好了。

en: The inventor of a new cannon associated himself with the caster and the borer.
zh: 新大炮的发明者把自己与施法者和钻孔机联系在一起。

en: Thus was formed the nucleus of the “Gun Club.” In a single month after its formation it numbered 1,833 effective members and 30,565 corresponding members.
zh: 这样就形成了“枪支俱乐部”的核心在其成立后的一个月内，有效会员达1,833人，相应会员达30,565人。

en: One condition was imposed as a sine quâ non upon every candidate for admission into the association, and that was the condition of having designed, or (more or less) perfected a cannon;
zh: 有一个条件被强加给每一个加入协会的候选人，那就是设计或(或多或少)完善一门大炮的条件;

en: or, in default of a cannon, at least a firearm of some description.
zh: 或者，在没有大炮的情况下，至少是某种类型的武器。

en: It may, however, be mentioned that mere inventors of revolvers, fire-shooting carbines, and similar small arms, met with little consideration.
zh: 然而，我们可以提到，仅仅发明左轮手枪、射击卡宾枪和类似的小型武器，几乎没有受到重视。

en: Artillerists always commanded the chief place of favor.
zh: 炮兵总是占据主要的优势地位。

en: The estimation in which these gentlemen were held, according to one of the most scientific exponents of the Gun Club,
zh: 根据枪支俱乐部最科学的支持者之一的估计这些先生们被关押的时间,

en: was “proportional to the masses of their guns, and in the direct ratio of the square of the distances attained by their projectiles.”
zh: “与他们的火炮的质量成正比，与他们的炮弹所达到的距离的平方成正比。”

en: The Gun Club once founded, it is easy to conceive the result of the inventive genius of the Americans.
zh: 枪支俱乐部一旦成立，很容易想象出美国人创造性天才的结果。

en: Their military weapons attained colossal proportions, and their projectiles, exceeding the prescribed limits, unfortunately occasionally cut in two some unoffending pedestrians.
zh: 他们的军事武器达到了巨大的比例，他们的射弹，超过了规定的限制，不幸的是偶尔切断两个一些非正常的行人。

en: These inventions, in fact, left far in the rear the timid instruments of European artillery.
zh: 事实上，这些发明把欧洲火炮那些胆小的仪器远远地抛在了脑后。

en: It is but fair to add that these Yankees, brave as they have ever proved themselves to be,
zh: 不得不说，这些北方佬尽管他们已经证明了自己的勇敢,

en: did not confine themselves to theories and formulae, but that they paid heavily, in propriâ personâ, for their inventions.
zh: 他们并不局限于理论和公式，而是为自己的发明付出了高昂的代价。

en: Among them were to be counted officers of all ranks, from lieutenants to generals;
zh: 其中包括从中尉到将军的各级军官;

en: military men of every age, from those who were just making their début in the profession of arms up to those who had grown old in the gun-carriage.
zh: 各个年龄段的军人，从刚刚开始从事武器行业的人，到在炮车里慢慢变老的人。

en: Many had found their rest on the field of battle whose names figured in the “Book of Honor” of the Gun Club;
zh: 许多人在战场上找到了安息，他们的名字出现在枪支俱乐部的“荣誉之书”上;

en: and of those who made good their return the greater proportion bore the marks of their indisputable valor.
zh: 而那些归来的人中，有更大比例的人身上有他们无可争议的勇气的印记。

en: Crutches, wooden legs, artificial arms, steel hooks, caoutchouc jaws, silver craniums, platinum noses, were all to be found in the collection;
zh: 拐杖、木制假腿、义肢、钢制挂钩、胶布下巴、银色头盖骨、铂金鼻子等，都可以在收藏品中找到;

en: and it was calculated by the great statistician Pitcairn that throughout the Gun Club there was not quite one arm between four persons and two legs between six.
zh: 根据伟大的统计学家皮特凯恩的计算，在整个枪支俱乐部中，四个人之间没有完全的一只胳膊，六个人之间没有完全的两条腿。

en: Nevertheless, these valiant artillerists took no particular account of these little facts,
zh: 然而，这些英勇的炮兵并没有特别注意到这些小事实,

en: and felt justly proud when the despatches of a battle returned the number of victims at ten-fold the quantity of projectiles expended.
zh: 当一场战斗的报道使受害者人数增加了十倍时，他们感到自豪，这是理所当然的。

en: One day, however—sad and melancholy day!—peace was signed between the survivors of the war;
zh: 然而，有一天ーー悲伤而忧郁的一天! ーー战争幸存者之间签署了和平协议;

en: the thunder of the guns gradually ceased, the mortars were silent, the howitzers were muzzled for an indefinite period, the cannon,
zh: 大炮的轰鸣声逐渐停止，迫击炮沉默了，榴弹炮被无限期地蒙上了口罩，大炮,

en: with muzzles depressed, were returned into the arsenal, the shot were repiled, all bloody reminiscences were effaced;
zh: 带着沉重的口吻，被送回军火库，枪声被击退，一切血腥的回忆被抹去;

en: the cotton-plants grew luxuriantly in the well-manured fields, all mourning garments were laid aside, together with grief;
zh: 棉花在肥沃的田野里茂盛地生长着，所有的哀衣都随着悲伤一起放在一边;

en: and the Gun Club was relegated to profound inactivity.
zh: 而枪支俱乐部则陷入了极度的无所作为。

en: Some few of the more advanced and inveterate theorists set themselves again to work upon calculations regarding the laws of projectiles.
zh: 一些更为先进和根深蒂固的理论家再次着手于有关射弹定律的计算。

en: They reverted invariably to gigantic shells and howitzers of unparalleled caliber.
zh: 他们无一例外地变成了巨大的炮弹和口径无与伦比的榴弹炮。

en: Still in default of practical experience what was the value of mere theories?
zh: 仍然缺乏实践经验，单纯理论的价值何在？

en: Consequently, the clubrooms became deserted, the servants dozed in the antechambers,
zh: 结果，俱乐部里空无一人，仆人们在前厅打瞌睡,

en: the newspapers grew mouldy on the tables, sounds of snoring came from dark corners,
zh: 报纸在桌子上发霉了，黑暗的角落传来鼾声,

en: and the members of the Gun Club, erstwhile so noisy in their seances,
zh: 还有枪支俱乐部的成员以前他们的降神会很吵,

en: were reduced to silence by this disastrous peace and gave themselves up wholly to dreams of a Platonic kind of artillery.
zh: 在这场灾难性的和平中陷入了沉默完全沉浸在柏拉图式的炮火的梦想中。

en: “This is horrible!” said Tom Hunter one evening, while rapidly carbonizing his wooden legs in the fireplace of the smoking-room;
zh: “这太可怕了!”一天晚上，汤姆 · 亨特一边说，一边在吸烟室的壁炉里迅速地把他的木腿烧焦;

en: “nothing to do! nothing to look forward to! what a loathsome existence! When again shall the guns arouse us in the morning with their delightful reports?”
zh: “无事可做！没什么好期待的！多么令人厌恶的存在！什么时候我们才能在早晨听到枪炮的欢快报告呢?”

en: “Those days are gone by,” said jolly Bilsby, trying to extend his missing arms.
zh: “那些日子已经一去不复返了,”快活的比尔斯比说着，试图伸出他失去的手臂。

en: “It was delightful once upon a time! One invented a gun, and hardly was it cast, when one hastened to try it in the face of the enemy!
zh: “很久很久以前，这是一件令人愉快的事情！一个人发明了一把枪，当他在敌人面前急于尝试的时候，它几乎还没有被铸造出来！

en: Then one returned to camp with a word of encouragement from Sherman or a friendly shake of the hand from McClellan.
zh: 然后，一个人带着谢尔曼的鼓励或麦克莱伦友好的握手回到营地。

en: But now the generals are gone back to their counters;
zh: 但现在，将军们都回到了他们的柜台前;

en: and in place of projectiles, they despatch bales of cotton.
zh: 他们用成捆的棉花代替炮弹。

en: By Jove, the future of gunnery in America is lost!”
zh: 天啊，美国枪炮的未来已经不复存在了!”

en: “Ay! and no war in prospect!” continued the famous James T.
zh: “啊! 不会有战争的!”著名的詹姆斯 · T 继续说道。

en: Maston, scratching with his steel hook his gutta-percha cranium.
zh: Maston 用他的铁钩抓他的头骨。

en: “Not a cloud on the horizon! and that too at such a critical period in the progress of the science of artillery!
zh: “地平线上没有一片云！而且也是在炮兵科学发展的关键时期！

en: Yes, gentlemen! I who address you have myself this very morning perfected a model (plan, section, elevation, etc.) of a mortar destined to change all the conditions of warfare!”
zh: 是的，先生们！今天上午我亲自向你们发表讲话，完善了一个迫击炮的模型(平面图、剖面图、立面图等等) ，这个模型注定要改变战争的所有条件!”

en: “No! is it possible?” replied Tom Hunter, his thoughts reverting involuntarily to a former invention of the Hon.J.T.
zh: “不! 这可能吗?”汤姆 · 亨特回答道，他的思绪不由自主地回到了 Hon.J.T 以前的发明上。

en: Maston, by which, at its first trial, he had succeeded in killing three hundred and thirty-seven people.
zh: 在第一次审判中，他成功地杀死了三百三十七个人。

en: “Fact!” replied he.
zh: “事实!”他回答。

en: “Still, what is the use of so many studies worked out, so many difficulties vanquished? It’s mere waste of time! The New World seems to have made up its mind to live in peace;
zh: “然而，如此多的研究成果，如此多的困难被克服，有什么用呢？这纯粹是浪费时间！新世界似乎已经下定决心要和平地生活;

en: and our bellicose Tribune predicts some approaching catastrophes arising out of this scandalous increase of population.”
zh: 我们好战的《论坛报》预测，由于这种可耻的人口增长，一些灾难即将发生。”

en: “Nevertheless,” replied Colonel Blomsberry, “they are always struggling in Europe to maintain the principle of nationalities.”
zh: “尽管如此,”布卢姆斯伯里上校回答说，“他们在欧洲一直在为维护民族原则而斗争。”

en: “Well?”
zh: “怎么样?”

en: “Well, there might be some field for enterprise down there;
zh: “嗯，那里可能有一些企业的领域;

en: and if they would accept our services”
zh: 如果他们愿意接受我们的服务”

en: “What are you dreaming of?” screamed Bilsby;
zh: “你梦见什么了?”比尔斯比尖叫道;

en: “work at gunnery for the benefit of foreigners?”
zh: “为了外国人的利益在炮兵部队工作?”

en: “That would be better than doing nothing here,” returned the colonel.
zh: “那总比在这里什么都不做要好,”上校回答说。

en: “Quite so,” said J.T. Matson;
zh: “确实如此,”J.T. 马特森说;

en: “but still we need not dream of that expedient.”
zh: “但我们仍然不必幻想这种权宜之计”

en: “And why not?” demanded the colonel.
zh: “为什么不呢?”上校问道。

en: “Because their ideas of progress in the Old World are contrary to our American habits of thought.
zh: “因为他们对旧世界进步的看法与我们美国人的思维习惯相悖。

en: Those fellows believe that one can’t become a general without having served first as an ensign;
zh: 那些家伙认为，一个人不能成为一个将军，没有作为一个少尉;

en: which is as much as to say that one can’t point a gun without having first cast it oneself!”
zh: 也就是说，没有自己的枪，就不能用枪指着别人!”

en: “Ridiculous!” replied Tom Hunter, whittling with his bowie-knife the arms of his easy chair;
zh: “太荒谬了!”汤姆 · 亨特回答，用他的猎刀削他的安乐椅扶手;

en: “but if that be the case there, all that is left for us is to plant tobacco and distill whale-oil.”
zh: “但如果是这样的话，我们所剩下的就是种植烟草和蒸馏鲸油了”

en: “What!” roared J.T.Maston,
zh: “什么!”J.T.Maston 吼道,

en: “shall we not employ these remaining years of our life in perfecting firearms?
zh: 难道我们不应该利用余生来完善武器吗？

en: Shall there never be a fresh opportunity of trying the ranges of projectiles?
zh: 难道就没有一个新的机会来尝试射程吗？

en: Shall the air never again be lighted with the glare of our guns?
zh: 我们的枪炮再也不能点亮空气了吗？

en: No international difficulty ever arise to enable us to declare war against some transatlantic power?
zh: 从来没有出现过任何国际困难，使我们能够向某个跨大西洋大国宣战？

en: Shall not the French sink one of our steamers, or the English, in defiance of the rights of nations, hang a few of our countrymen?”
zh: 难道法国人不能击沉我们的一艘轮船，或者英国人，无视国家的权利，绞死我们的几个同胞吗?”

en: “No such luck,” replied Colonel Blomsberry;
zh: “没有这样的运气,”布卢姆斯伯里上校回答说;

en: “nothing of the kind is likely to happen;
zh: “这种事情不太可能发生;

en: and even if it did, we should not profit by it.
zh: 即使有，我们也不应该从中获利。

en: American susceptibility is fast declining, and we are all going to the dogs.”
zh: 美国人的敏感度正在迅速下降，我们都要倒霉了。”

en: “It is too true,” replied J.T.Maston, with fresh violence;
zh: “这太对了,”J.T.Maston 带着新的暴力回答道;

en: “there are a thousand grounds for fighting, and yet we don’t fight.
zh: “有一千个战斗的理由，但我们不战斗”。

en: We save up our arms and legs for the benefit of nations who don’t know what to do with them!
zh: 我们把我们的胳膊和腿保存起来，为了那些不知道如何处理它们的国家的利益！

en: But stop—without going out of one’s way to find a cause for war—did not North America once belong to the English?”
zh: 但是，停下来ーー不去寻找战争的原因ーー北美不是曾经属于英国吗?”

en: “Undoubtedly,” replied Tom Hunter, stamping his crutch with fury.
zh: “毫无疑问,”汤姆 · 亨特愤怒地跺着拐杖回答。

en: “Well, then,” replied J.T.Maston, “why should not England in her turn belong to the Americans?”
zh: “好吧，那么,”J.T.Maston 回答，“为什么英格兰不应该轮到属于美国人呢?”

en: “It would be but just and fair,” returned Colonel Blomsberry.
zh: “这是公正和公平的,”布卢姆斯伯里上校回答说。

en: “Go and propose it to the President of the United States,” cried J.T.Maston, “and see how he will receive you.”
zh: “去向美国总统提议吧,”J.T.Maston 喊道，“看看他会怎么接待你。”

en: “Bah!” growled Bilsby between the four teeth which the war had left him;
zh: “呸!”比尔斯比咬着战争留给他的四颗牙发出咆哮;

en: “that will never do!”
zh: “绝对不行!”

en: “By Jove!” cried J.T.Maston, “he mustn’t count on my vote at the next election!”
zh: “天哪!”J.T.Maston 喊道，“他不能指望我在下次选举中投他一票!”

en: “Nor on ours,” replied unanimously all the bellicose invalids.
zh: “对我们也是,”所有好战的残疾人一致回答。

en: “Meanwhile,” replied J.T.Maston,
zh: “与此同时,”J.T.Maston 回答道,

en: “allow me to say that, if I cannot get an opportunity to try my new mortars on a real field of battle,
zh: 请允许我说，如果我没有机会在真正的战场上尝试我的新型迫击炮,

en: I shall say good-by to the members of the Gun Club, and go and bury myself in the prairies of Arkansas!”
zh: 我要向枪支俱乐部的成员们告别，然后去阿肯色州的大草原埋葬自己吧!”

en: “In that case we will accompany you,” cried the others.
zh: “那样的话，我们就陪你去。”其他人喊道。

en: Matters were in this unfortunate condition, and the club was threatened with approaching dissolution,
zh: 事情处于这种不幸的境地，俱乐部受到解散的威胁,

en: when an unexpected circumstance occurred to prevent so deplorable a catastrophe.
zh: 当一个意想不到的情况发生，以防止如此悲惨的灾难。

en: On the morrow after this conversation every member of the association received a sealed circular couched in the following terms:
zh: 在这次谈话之后的第二天，协会的每个成员都收到了一份密封的通知，内容如下:

en: BALTIMORE, October 3.
zh: 巴尔的摩，10月3日。

en: The president of the Gun Club has the honor to inform his colleagues that, at the meeting of the 5th instant,
zh: 枪支俱乐部主席有幸通知他的同事们在第五次会议上,

en: he will bring before them a communication of an extremely interesting nature.
zh: 他将带给他们一种极其有趣的交流方式。

en: He requests, therefore, that they will make it convenient to attend in accordance with the present invitation.
zh: 因此，他请求他们根据本邀请方便出席。

en: Very cordially, IMPEY BARBICANE, P.G.C.
zh: 非常诚挚的 IMPEY BABICANE，P.G.C。

en: CHAPTER II. PRESIDENT BARBICANE’S COMMUNICATION
zh: 第二章巴比肯总统的公报

en: On the 5th of October, at eight p.m., a dense crowd pressed toward the saloons of the Gun Club at No. 21 Union Square.
zh: 10月5日晚上8点，一大群人涌向联合广场21号枪支俱乐部的酒吧。

en: All the members of the association resident in Baltimore attended the invitation of their president.
zh: 所有居住在巴尔的摩的协会成员都出席了他们主席的邀请。

en: As regards the corresponding members, notices were delivered by hundreds throughout the streets of the city,
zh: 对于相应的会员，在全市的大街小巷都有数百人发出通知,

en: and, large as was the great hall, it was quite inadequate to accommodate the crowd of savants.
zh: 和大厅一样大，也不足以容纳一群学者。

en: They overflowed into the adjoining rooms, down the narrow passages, into the outer courtyards.
zh: 他们涌进相邻的房间，沿着狭窄的通道，进入外面的院子。

en: There they ran against the vulgar herd who pressed up to the doors, each struggling to reach the front ranks,
zh: 在那里，他们与挤在门前的粗俗的人群对抗，每个人都在奋力地向前排挤,

en: all eager to learn the nature of the important communication of President Barbicane;
zh: 都渴望了解巴比肯总统交流的重要性;

en: all pushing, squeezing, crushing with that perfect freedom of action
zh: 所有的推挤，挤压，挤压与行动的完美自由

en: which is so peculiar to the masses when educated in ideas of “self-government.”
zh: 这对于接受“自治”思想教育的群众来说是很特别的

en: On that evening a stranger who might have chanced to be in Baltimore could not have gained admission for love or money into the great hall.
zh: 那天晚上，一个可能碰巧在巴尔的摩的陌生人不可能因为爱情或金钱而被允许进入大厅。

en: That was reserved exclusively for resident or corresponding members;
zh: 专门为常驻成员或相应成员保留的;

en: no one else could possibly have obtained a place;
zh: 其他任何人都不可能获得一个位置;

en: and the city magnates, municipal councilors,
zh: 还有城市巨头，市议员,

en: and “select men” were compelled to mingle with the mere townspeople in order to catch stray bits of news from the interior.
zh: 而“精英人士”则被迫与普通市民打成一片，以便从内地获取零星的消息。

en: Nevertheless the vast hall presented a curious spectacle.
zh: 然而，大厅呈现出一种奇特的景象。

en: Its immense area was singularly adapted to the purpose.
zh: 它广阔的面积奇异地适应了这个目的。

en: Lofty pillars formed of cannon, superposed upon huge mortars as a base,
zh: 由大炮构成的高大的柱子，叠加在巨大的迫击炮上作为底座,

en: supported the fine ironwork of the arches, a perfect piece of cast-iron lacework.
zh: 支撑着精美的铁制拱门，一块完美的铸铁花边。

en: Trophies of blunderbuses, matchlocks, arquebuses, carbines, all kinds of firearms,
zh: 大口径短枪，火柴枪，火绳枪，卡宾枪，各种武器的战利品,

en: ancient and modern, were picturesquely interlaced against the walls.
zh: 古代和现代，在墙上交错如画。

en: The gas lit up in full glare myriads of revolvers grouped in the form of lustres,
zh: 无数的左轮手枪组成了光泽的形式,

en: while groups of pistols, and candelabra formed of muskets bound together, completed this magnificent display of brilliance.
zh: 一组组手枪和由步枪组成的烛台，完成了这壮观的辉煌展示。

en: Models of cannon, bronze castings, sights covered with dents, plates battered by the shots of the Gun Club,
zh: 大炮模型，青铜铸件，满是凹痕的瞄准镜被枪支俱乐部的枪击打得粉碎的盘子,

en: assortments of rammers and sponges, chaplets of shells, wreaths of projectiles, garlands of howitzers—in short, all the apparatus of the artillerist,
zh: 各种各样的锤子和海绵，一串串的炮弹，一圈圈的炮弹，一圈圈的榴弹炮ーー简而言之，所有炮兵的装备,

en: enchanted the eye by this wonderful arrangement and induced a kind of belief that their real purpose was ornamental rather than deadly.
zh: 这种奇妙的排列方式迷住了人们的眼睛，使人们相信它们的真正用途是装饰而不是致命的。

en: At the further end of the saloon the president, assisted by four secretaries, occupied a large platform.
zh: 在酒吧的另一端，校长在四位秘书的协助下占据了一个大平台。

en: His chair, supported by a carved gun-carriage, was modeled upon the ponderous proportions of a 32-inch mortar.
zh: 他的椅子由一个雕刻的炮架支撑，是以一个32英寸的迫击炮的笨重比例为原型的。

en: It was pointed at an angle of ninety degrees, and suspended upon truncheons,
zh: 它指向一个九十度的角度，悬挂在警棍上,

en: so that the president could balance himself upon it as upon a rocking-chair, a very agreeable fact in the very hot weather.
zh: 这样总统就可以像坐在摇椅上一样在椅子上保持平衡，这在炎热的天气里是一个非常令人愉快的事实。

en: Upon the table (a huge iron plate supported upon six carronades) stood an inkstand of exquisite elegance, made of a beautifully chased Spanish piece,
zh: 在桌子上(一个巨大的铁盘子支撑着六个卡罗奈尔)放着一个精致优雅的墨水瓶，墨水瓶是由一件精美的西班牙艺术品制成的,

en: and a sonnette, which, when required, could give forth a report equal to that of a revolver.
zh: 还有一首十四行诗，如果需要的话，可以写出和左轮手枪一样的报告。

en: During violent debates this novel kind of bell scarcely sufficed to drown the clamor of these excitable artillerists.
zh: 在激烈的辩论中，这种新奇的钟声几乎不足以淹没这些易激动的炮兵的喧闹。

en: In front of the table benches arranged in zigzag form, like the circumvallations of a retrenchment, formed a succession of bastions and curtains set apart for the use of the members of the club;
zh: 桌子前面的长凳呈之字形排列，就像一个缩小的圆环，形成了一连串的堡垒和窗帘，分开供俱乐部成员使用;

en: and on this especial evening one might say, “All the world was on the ramparts.”
zh: 在这个特别的夜晚，人们可能会说，“整个世界都在城墙上。”

en: The president was sufficiently well known, however, for all to be assured that he would not put his colleagues to discomfort without some very strong motive.
zh: 然而，总统的知名度足以让所有人相信，如果没有某种非常强烈的动机，他不会让同僚们感到不安。

en: Impey Barbicane was a man of forty years of age, calm, cold, austere;
zh: 英佩 · 巴比康是一个四十岁的人，冷静、冷酷、严肃;

en: of a singularly serious and self-contained demeanor, punctual as a chronometer, of imperturbable temper and immovable character;
zh: 举止异常严肃、自足，像计时器一样准时，脾气沉稳，性格稳重;

en: by no means chivalrous, yet adventurous withal, and always bringing practical ideas to bear upon the very rashest enterprises;
zh: 决不是骑士精神，而是勇于冒险，总是把实际的想法强加于最轻率的企业;

en: an essentially New Englander, a Northern colonist, a descendant of the old anti-Stuart Roundheads,
zh: 一个基本上是新英格兰人，一个北方殖民者，一个反斯图亚特的老光头的后裔,

en: and the implacable enemy of the gentlemen of the South, those ancient cavaliers of the mother country.
zh: 以及南方绅士们的死敌，祖国的古老骑士们。

en: In a word, he was a Yankee to the backbone.
zh: 总之，他是个彻头彻尾的北方佬。

en: Barbicane had made a large fortune as a timber merchant.
zh: 巴比康作为木材商人发了大财。

en: Being nominated director of artillery during the war, he proved himself fertile in invention.
zh: 在战争期间被提名为炮兵指挥官，他证明了自己在发明方面的才能。

en: Bold in his conceptions, he contributed powerfully to the progress of that arm and gave an immense impetus to experimental researches.
zh: 在他的大胆构想，他有力地贡献了进步的手臂，并给予了巨大的推动力，实验研究。

en: He was personage of the middle height, having, by a rare exception in the Gun Club, all his limbs complete.
zh: 他是个中等身材的人物，除了枪支俱乐部里的一个罕见的例外，他四肢健全。

en: His strongly marked features seemed drawn by square and rule;
zh: 他那鲜明的特征似乎是由正方形和规则勾勒出来的;

en: and if it be true that, in order to judge a man’s character one must look at his profile, Barbicane, so examined, exhibited the most certain indications of energy, audacity, and sang-froid.
zh: 如果要判断一个人的性格，真的必须看他的侧面像，那么巴比肯经过这样的检查，显示出精力充沛、胆大妄为和冷静沉着的最确定的迹象。

en: At this moment he was sitting in his armchair, silent, absorbed, lost in reflection,
zh: 此刻，他正坐在扶手椅上，沉默不语，全神贯注，陷入沉思,

en: sheltered under his high-crowned hat—a kind of black cylinder which always seems firmly screwed upon the head of an American.
zh: 藏在他的高顶帽子下面ーー一种黑色的圆柱体，似乎总是紧紧地拧在一个美国人的头上。

en: Just when the deep-toned clock in the great hall struck eight, Barbicane, as if he had been set in motion by a spring, raised himself up.
zh: 正当大厅里低沉的钟声敲响八点的时候，巴比肯仿佛被弹簧启动了一样，站了起来。

en: A profound silence ensued, and the speaker, in a somewhat emphatic tone of voice, commenced as follows:
zh: 接着是一阵沉默，演讲者用略带强调的语气开始说:

en: “My brave, colleagues, too long already a paralyzing peace has plunged the members of the Gun Club in deplorable inactivity.
zh: “我勇敢的同事们，长久以来令人麻痹的和平已经使枪支俱乐部的成员陷入可悲的无所作为。

en: After a period of years full of incidents we have been compelled to abandon our labors, and to stop short on the road of progress.
zh: 在经历了多年的事件之后，我们不得不放弃我们的劳动，在前进的道路上止步不前。

en: I do not hesitate to state, baldly, that any war which would recall us to arms would be welcome!” (Tremendous applause!) “But war, gentlemen, is impossible under existing circumstances;
zh: 我毫不犹豫地直言不讳地声明，任何召回我们武装的战争都是受欢迎的!”(热烈的掌声)“但是，先生们，在当前的情况下，战争是不可能的;

en: and, however we may desire it, many years may elapse before our cannon shall again thunder in the field of battle.
zh: 无论我们多么渴望，许多年过去了，我们的大炮才会再次在战场上轰鸣。

en: We must make up our minds, then, to seek in another train of ideas some field for the activity which we all pine for.”
zh: 那么，我们必须下定决心，在另一条思路中为我们都渴望从事的活动寻找一块场地。”

en: The meeting felt that the president was now approaching the critical point, and redoubled their attention accordingly.
zh: 会议认为总统正在接近临界点，因此加倍关注。

en: “For some months past, my brave colleagues,” continued Barbicane, “I have been asking myself whether,
zh: “在过去的几个月里，我勇敢的同事们,”巴比肯继续说道，“我一直在问自己,

en: while confining ourselves to our own particular objects, we could not enter upon some grand experiment worthy of the nineteenth century;
zh: 当我们把自己局限于我们自己特定的对象时，我们就不能进行一些值得十九世纪的伟大实验;

en: and whether the progress of artillery science would not enable us to carry it out to a successful issue.
zh: 以及炮兵科学的进步是否能够使我们把它推向一个成功的问题。

en: I have been considering, working, calculating;
zh: 我一直在考虑，工作，计算;

en: and the result of my studies is the conviction that we are safe to succeed in an enterprise which to any other country would appear wholly impracticable.
zh: 我的研究结果是，我相信我们在一个在任何其他国家看来都完全不切实际的事业中取得成功是安全的。

en: This project, the result of long elaboration, is the object of my present communication.
zh: 这个项目，长期阐述的结果，是我目前的沟通对象。

en: It is worthy of yourselves, worthy of the antecedents of the Gun Club;
zh: 它配得上你们自己，配得上枪支俱乐部的前身;

en: and it cannot fail to make some noise in the world.”
zh: 它必然会在世界上制造一些噪音。”

en: A thrill of excitement ran through the meeting.
zh: 会议中充满了兴奋的激动情绪。

en: Barbicane, having by a rapid movement firmly fixed his hat upon his head, calmly continued his harangue:
zh: 巴比康迅速地把帽子稳稳地戴在头上，平静地继续他的长篇大论:

en: “There is no one among you, my brave colleagues, who has not seen the Moon, or, at least, heard speak of it.
zh: “我勇敢的同事们，你们当中没有人没有见过月亮，或者至少没有人听说过它。

en: Don’t be surprised if I am about to discourse to you regarding the Queen of the Night.
zh: 如果我要和你谈论夜之女王的事，你不要惊讶。

en: It is perhaps reserved for us to become the Columbuses of this unknown world.
zh: 它也许是为我们保留成为这个未知世界的哥伦布。

en: Only enter into my plans, and second me with all your power, and I will lead you to its conquest, and its name shall be added to those of the thirty-six states which compose this Great Union.”
zh: 只要加入我的计划，用你们所有的力量支持我，我将带领你们征服它，它的名字将被加入到组成这个伟大联盟的三十六个州中。”

en: “Three cheers for the Moon!” roared the Gun Club, with one voice.
zh: “为月亮欢呼三声!”大炮俱乐部用同一个声音吼道。

en: “The moon, gentlemen, has been carefully studied,” continued Barbicane;
zh: “先生们，月亮已经被仔细研究过了,”巴比康接着说;

en: “her mass, density, and weight;
zh: 她的质量，密度和重量

en: her constitution, motions, distance, as well as her place in the solar system, have all been exactly determined.
zh: 她的体质、运动、距离，以及她在太阳系中的位置，都已经被精确地确定了。

en: Selenographic charts have been constructed with a perfection which equals, if it does not even surpass, that of our terrestrial maps.
zh: 海底地形图已经完美地绘制出来了，即使不能超越地球上的地形图，也已经相当于地球上的地形图了。

en: Photography has given us proofs of the incomparable beauty of our satellite;
zh: 摄影给我们证明了我们的卫星无与伦比的美丽;

en: all is known regarding the moon which mathematical science, astronomy, geology, and optics can learn about her.
zh: 有关月球的一切都是已知的，数学科学、天文学、地质学和光学都可以了解月球。

en: But up to the present moment no direct communication has been established with her.”
zh: 但到目前为止，还没有与她建立直接联系。”

en: A violent movement of interest and surprise here greeted this remark of the speaker.
zh: 演讲者的这句话引起了一场激烈的兴趣和惊讶的运动。

en: “Permit me,” he continued, “to recount to you briefly how certain ardent spirits, starting on imaginary journeys, have penetrated the secrets of our satellite.
zh: “请允许我,”他继续说，“向你们简要地叙述一下，某些热情的灵魂，从想象中的旅程开始，是如何穿透我们卫星的秘密的。

en: In the seventeenth century a certain David Fabricius boasted of having seen with his own eyes the inhabitants of the moon.
zh: 在十七世纪，一个叫大卫 · 法布里修斯的人夸口说他亲眼看到了月球上的居民。

en: In 1649 a Frenchman, one Jean Baudoin, published a ‘Journey performed from the Earth to the Moon by Domingo Gonzalez,’ a Spanish adventurer.
zh: 1649年，法国人让 · 波多因(Jean Baudoin)出版了一本名为《多明戈 · 冈萨雷斯(Domingo Gonzalez)的西班牙探险家从地球到月球的旅行》。

en: At the same period Cyrano de Bergerac published that celebrated ‘Journeys in the Moon’ which met with such success in France.
zh: 在同一时期，西哈诺·德·贝杰拉克出版了《月球之旅》 ，在法国取得了巨大的成功。

en: Somewhat later another Frenchman, named Fontenelle, wrote ‘The Plurality of Worlds,’ a chef-d’œuvre of its time.
zh: 不久后，另一个名叫 Fontenelle 的法国人写了《世界的多样性》 ，这是当时的一位大厨。

en: About 1835 a small treatise, translated from the New York American, related how Sir John Herschel,
zh: 大约在1835年，一篇从《纽约美国人》翻译过来的小论文讲述了约翰·赫歇尔

en: having been despatched to the Cape of Good Hope for the purpose of making there some astronomical calculations,
zh: 被派往好望角进行一些天文计算,

en: had, by means of a telescope brought to perfection by means of internal lighting, reduced the apparent distance of the moon to eighty yards!
zh: 通过内部照明使望远镜达到了完美的效果，把月球的表观距离缩短到了80码！

en: He then distinctly perceived caverns frequented by hippopotami, green mountains bordered by golden lace-work, sheep with horns of ivory,
zh: 然后他清楚地看到河马经常出没的洞穴，金色花边镶边的青山，长着象牙角的绵羊,

en: a white species of deer and inhabitants with membranous wings, like bats.
zh: 一种白色的鹿和有膜状翅膀的居民，像蝙蝠。

en: This brochure, the work of an American named Locke, had a great sale.
zh: 这本小册子，是一个叫洛克的美国人的作品，卖得很好。

en: But, to bring this rapid sketch to a close, I will only add that a certain Hans Pfaal, of Rotterdam,
zh: 但是，为了结束这个快速素描，我只想补充一点，鹿特丹的汉斯 · 帕法尔,

en: launching himself in a balloon filled with a gas extracted from nitrogen, thirty-seven times lighter than hydrogen, reached the moon after a passage of nineteen hours.
zh: 他乘坐一个充满从氮气中提取的气体的气球升空，这个气球比氢气轻37倍，经过19个小时后到达了月球。

en: This journey, like all previous ones, was purely imaginary;
zh: 这次旅行，和以前所有的旅行一样，纯粹是想象的;

en: still, it was the work of a popular American author—I mean Edgar Poe!”
zh: 尽管如此，它仍然是一位受欢迎的美国作家的作品ーー我的意思是埃德加 · 坡!”

en: “Cheers for Edgar Poe!” roared the assemblage, electrified by their president’s words.
zh: “为埃德加 · 坡干杯!”听到他们的总统的话，全体人员激动地大声喊道。

en: “I have now enumerated,” said Barbicane, “the experiments which I call purely paper ones, and wholly insufficient to establish serious relations with the Queen of the Night.
zh: “我现在已经列举了,”巴比肯说，“我称之为纯粹的纸上实验，完全不足以与夜之女王建立严肃的关系。

en: Nevertheless, I am bound to add that some practical geniuses have attempted to establish actual communication with her.
zh: 尽管如此，我还是要补充一点，一些实际的天才试图与她建立实际的交流。

en: Thus, a few days ago, a German geometrician proposed to send a scientific expedition to the steppes of Siberia.
zh: 因此，几天前，一位德国几何学家提议派遣一支科学考察队前往西伯利亚大草原。

en: There, on those vast plains, they were to describe enormous geometric figures, drawn in characters of reflecting luminosity,
zh: 在那里，在那片广阔的平原上，他们描绘出巨大的几何图形，用反射光线的特征描绘出来,

en: among which was the proposition regarding the ‘square of the hypothenuse,’ commonly called the ‘Ass’s Bridge’ by the French.
zh: 其中一个命题是关于“斜边的正方形”，通常被法国人称为“驴桥”。

en: ‘Every intelligent being,’ said the geometrician, ‘must understand the scientific meaning of that figure.
zh: “每一个有智慧的生物,”几何学家说，“都必须理解这个数字的科学意义。”。

en: The Selenites, do they exist, will respond by a similar figure;
zh: 塞莱尼特人，如果他们真的存在的话，将会以一个相似的数字作出回应;

en: and, a communication being thus once established, it will be easy to form an alphabet which shall enable us to converse with the inhabitants of the moon.’ So spoke the German geometrician;
zh: 而且，一旦建立了这样的交流，就很容易形成一个字母表，使我们能够与月球上的居民交谈。德国几何学家是这么说的;

en: but his project was never put into practice, and up to the present day there is no bond in existence between the Earth and her satellite.
zh: 但是他的计划从未付诸实施，而且直到今天，地球和她的卫星之间并不存在任何联系。

en: It is reserved for the practical genius of Americans to establish a communication with the sidereal world.
zh: 与现实世界建立联系是美国人的实际才能。

en: The means of arriving thither are simple, easy, certain, infallible—and that is the purpose of my present proposal.”
zh: 到达那里的方法简单、容易、可靠、绝对正确ーー这就是我现在提议的目的。”

en: A storm of acclamations greeted these words.
zh: 这些话受到了热烈的欢迎。

en: There was not a single person in the whole audience who was not overcome, carried away, lifted out of himself by the speaker’s words!
zh: 在整个听众中，没有一个人不被演讲者的话所征服、冲昏头脑、振作精神！

en: Long-continued applause resounded from all sides.
zh: 持续已久的掌声从四面八方响起。

en: As soon as the excitement had partially subsided, Barbicane resumed his speech in a somewhat graver voice.
zh: 兴奋的情绪一消退，巴比肯又重新开始讲话，声音有些严肃。

en: “You know,” said he, “what progress artillery science has made during the last few years, and what a degree of perfection firearms of every kind have reached.
zh: “你知道,”他说，“在过去的几年里，炮兵科学取得了多大的进步，各种武器都达到了多么完美的程度。

en: Moreover, you are well aware that, in general terms, the resisting power of cannon and the expansive force of gunpowder are practically unlimited.
zh: 此外，你很清楚，一般来说，大炮的抵抗力和火药的膨胀力几乎是无限的。

en: Well! starting from this principle, I ask myself whether, supposing sufficient apparatus could be obtained constructed upon the conditions of ascertained resistance,
zh: 好吧！从这个原理出发，我问自己，假设在确定的电阻条件下可以得到足够的设备,

en: it might not be possible to project a shot up to the moon?”
zh: 也许不可能向月球发射一颗卫星?”

en: At these words a murmur of amazement escaped from a thousand panting chests;
zh: 听到这些话，一千个气喘吁吁的箱子里发出一阵惊奇的低语;

en: then succeeded a moment of perfect silence, resembling that profound stillness which precedes the bursting of a thunderstorm.
zh: 接着是一阵完全的寂静，就像雷雨爆发前的那种深深的寂静。

en: In point of fact, a thunderstorm did peal forth, but it was the thunder of applause, or cries, and of uproar which made the very hall tremble.
zh: 事实上，确实有一场雷雨，但正是雷鸣般的掌声、呼喊声和喧哗声使整个大厅都在颤抖。

en: The president attempted to speak, but could not.
zh: 总统试图发言，但未能成功。

en: It was fully ten minutes before he could make himself heard.
zh: 过了整整十分钟，他才让别人听到自己的声音。

en: “Suffer me to finish,” he calmly continued.
zh: “让我说完,”他平静地继续说。

en: “I have looked at the question in all its bearings, I have resolutely attacked it,
zh: 我仔细研究了这个问题，我坚决地进行了攻击,

en: and by incontrovertible calculations I find that a projectile endowed with an initial velocity of 12,000 yards per second,
zh: 通过无可争议的计算我发现一枚初速度为每秒12000码的炮弹,

en: and aimed at the moon, must necessarily reach it.
zh: 并且瞄准月球，必须到达那里。

en: I have the honor, my brave colleagues, to propose a trial of this little experiment.”
zh: 我很荣幸，我勇敢的同事们，提议对这个小实验进行一次试验。”

en: CHAPTER III. EFFECT OF THE PRESIDENT’S COMMUNICATION
zh: 第三章总统沟通的效果

en: It is impossible to describe the effect produced by the last words of the honorable president—the cries,
zh: 我们无法描述这位光荣的总统最后一句话所产生的效果ーー那些哭喊声,

en: the shouts, the succession of roars, hurrahs, and all the varied vociferations which the American language is capable of supplying.
zh: 喊叫声，一连串的吼叫声，欢呼声，以及美国语言所能提供的各种各样的呼喊声。

en: It was a scene of indescribable confusion and uproar.
zh: 这是一个无法形容的混乱和骚动的场面。

en: They shouted, they clapped, they stamped on the floor of the hall.
zh: 他们大喊大叫，鼓掌，在大厅的地板上跺脚。

en: All the weapons in the museum discharged at once could not have more violently set in motion the waves of sound.
zh: 博物馆里所有的武器一下子全部开火，再也没有比这更激烈地引起声波的震动了。

en: One need not be surprised at this.
zh: 人们不必对此感到惊讶。

en: There are some cannoneers nearly as noisy as their own guns.
zh: 有些炮手几乎和他们自己的炮一样吵。

en: Barbicane remained calm in the midst of this enthusiastic clamor;
zh: 在这热烈的喧闹声中，巴比康保持镇静;

en: perhaps he was desirous of addressing a few more words to his colleagues, for by his gestures he demanded silence, and his powerful alarum was worn out by its violent reports.
zh: 也许他想对同事多说几句话，因为他的手势要求他保持沉默，而他那强有力的警报声已经被暴力的报道耗尽了。

en: No attention, however, was paid to his request.
zh: 然而，他的要求没有得到重视。

en: He was presently torn from his seat and passed from the hands of his faithful colleagues into the arms of a no less excited crowd.
zh: 不一会儿，他就被从座位上拽了下来，从他忠实的同事手中接过来，投入了同样兴奋的人群的怀抱。

en: Nothing can astound an American.
zh: 没什么能让美国人吃惊。

en: It has often been asserted that the word “impossible” is not a French one.
zh: 人们经常断言“不可能”这个词不是法语的。

en: People have evidently been deceived by the dictionary.
zh: 人们显然被字典欺骗了。

en: In America, all is easy, all is simple;
zh: 在美国，一切都很容易，一切都很简单;

en: and as for mechanical difficulties, they are overcome before they arise.
zh: 至于机械方面的困难，在出现之前就已经克服了。

en: Between Barbicane’s proposition and its realization no true Yankee would have allowed even the semblance of a difficulty to be possible.
zh: 在巴比肯的主张和它的实现之间，没有一个真正的北方佬会允许哪怕是表面上的困难成为可能。

en: A thing with them is no sooner said than done.
zh: 他们之间的事说起来容易做起来难。

en: The triumphal progress of the president continued throughout the evening.
zh: 总统的胜利进程持续了整个晚上。

en: It was a regular torchlight procession.
zh: 这是一个常规的火炬游行。

en: Irish, Germans, French, Scotch, all the heterogeneous units which make up the population of Maryland shouted in their respective vernaculars;
zh: 爱尔兰人、德国人、法国人、苏格兰人，所有构成马里兰州人口的异质单位都用各自的方言叫喊;

en: and the “vivas,” “hurrahs,” and “bravos” were intermingled in inexpressible enthusiasm.
zh: “ vivas”、“ hurrahs”和“ bravos”混杂在难以言喻的热情中。

en: Just at this crisis, as though she comprehended all this agitation regarding herself, the moon shone forth with serene splendor, eclipsing by her intense illumination all the surrounding lights.
zh: 就在这个危机时刻，仿佛她理解了关于她自己的所有这些激动，月亮发出了宁静的光辉，在她强烈的照明下使周围所有的光都黯然失色。

en: The Yankees all turned their gaze toward her resplendent orb, kissed their hands, called her by all kinds of endearing names.
zh: 北方佬们都把目光转向她那闪闪发光的圆球，亲吻他们的手，用各种可爱的名字叫她。

en: Between eight o’clock and midnight one optician in Jones’-Fall Street made his fortune by the sale of opera-glasses.
zh: 在八点到午夜之间，琼斯福尔街的一位眼镜商靠卖歌剧眼镜发了财。

en: Midnight arrived, and the enthusiasm showed no signs of diminution.
zh: 午夜来临，热情丝毫没有减退的迹象。

en: It spread equally among all classes of citizens—men of science, shopkeepers, merchants, porters, chair-men, as well as “greenhorns,” were stirred in their innermost fibres.
zh: 它平均分布在所有阶层的公民中ーー科学家、店主、商人、搬运工、主持人以及“新手”，他们内心深处的纤维被搅动着。

en: A national enterprise was at stake.
zh: 国家事业岌岌可危。

en: The whole city, high and low, the quays bordering the Patapsco, the ships lying in the basins, disgorged a crowd drunk with joy, gin, and whisky.
zh: 整个城市，高高低低，与 Patapsco 接壤的码头，停泊在盆地里的船只，倾泻出一群喝得酩酊大醉的人群。

en: Every one chattered, argued, discussed, disputed, applauded, from the gentleman lounging upon the barroom settee with his tumbler of sherry-cobbler
zh: 每个人都在喋喋不休，争论不休，争论不休，鼓掌喝彩，那位绅士懒洋洋地躺在酒吧间的长椅上，手里拿着一杯雪利酒

en: before him down to the waterman who got drunk upon his “knock-me-down” in the dingy taverns of Fell Point.
zh: 在他之前，还有在费尔波因特昏暗的小酒馆里喝醉了他的“击倒我”的水手。

en: About two A.M., however, the excitement began to subside.
zh: 然而，凌晨两点左右，兴奋开始消退。

en: President Barbicane reached his house, bruised, crushed, and squeezed almost to a mummy.
zh: 巴比肯总统到达他的房子，擦伤，压碎，挤压几乎到木乃伊。

en: Hercules could not have resisted a similar outbreak of enthusiasm.
zh: 赫拉克勒斯无法抗拒类似的热情爆发。

en: The crowd gradually deserted the squares and streets.
zh: 人群渐渐地离开了广场和街道。

en: The four railways from Philadelphia and Washington, Harrisburg and Wheeling,
zh: 从费城到华盛顿的四条铁路哈里斯堡和惠灵,

en: which converge at Baltimore, whirled away the heterogeneous population to the four corners of the United States,
zh: 聚集在巴尔的摩，将异质人口带到美国的四个角落,

en: and the city subsided into comparative tranquility.
zh: 这座城市也相对平静了下来。

en: On the following day, thanks to the telegraphic wires, five hundred newspapers and journals, daily, weekly, monthly, or bi-monthly, all took up the question.
zh: 第二天，多亏了电报、五百份报纸和杂志，每日、每周、每月或每两个月，都回答了这个问题。

en: They examined it under all its different aspects, physical, meteorological, economical, or moral, up to its bearings on politics or civilization.
zh: 他们从物理、气象、经济、道德等各个方面审视它，直到它对政治或文明的影响。

en: They debated whether the moon was a finished world, or whether it was destined to undergo any further transformation.
zh: 他们在争论月球是否已经完成，或者它是否注定要经历任何进一步的变化。

en: Did it resemble the earth at the period when the latter was destitute as yet of an atmosphere?
zh: 它是否类似于地球在后者还没有大气层的时期？

en: What kind of spectacle would its hidden hemisphere present to our terrestrial spheroid?
zh: 它隐藏的半球会给我们的地球球体带来什么样的奇观？

en: Granting that the question at present was simply that of sending a projectile up to the moon,
zh: 假设目前的问题只是向月球发射一枚炮弹,

en: every one must see that that involved the commencement of a series of experiments.
zh: 每个人都必须看到，这涉及到一系列实验的开始。

en: All must hope that some day America would penetrate the deepest secrets of that mysterious orb;
zh: 所有人都必须希望有一天美国能够洞悉这个神秘球体最深层的秘密;

en: and some even seemed to fear lest its conquest should not sensibly derange the equilibrium of Europe.
zh: 有些人甚至担心它的征服不会明智地扰乱欧洲的平衡。

en: The project once under discussion, not a single paragraph suggested a doubt of its realization.
zh: 这个项目曾经在讨论中，没有一个段落表明它的实现有任何疑问。

en: All the papers, pamphlets, reports—all the journals published by the scientific, literary, and religious societies enlarged upon its advantages;
zh: 所有的论文、小册子、报告ーー所有由科学、文学和宗教团体出版的期刊都扩大了它的优势;

en: and the Society of Natural History of Boston, the Society of Science and Art of Albany,
zh: 以及波士顿自然历史学会，奥尔巴尼科学与艺术学会,

en: the Geographical and Statistical Society of New York, the Philosophical Society of Philadelphia,
zh: 纽约地理统计学会，费城哲学学会,

en: and the Smithsonian of Washington sent innumerable letters of congratulation to the Gun Club, together with offers of immediate assistance and money.
zh: 华盛顿的史密森尼博物馆向枪支俱乐部发出了无数的祝贺信，同时提供了紧急援助和资金。

en: From that day forward Impey Barbicane became one of the greatest citizens of the United States, a kind of Washington of science.
zh: 从那天起，英佩 · 巴比肯成为美国最伟大的公民之一，一种科学的华盛顿。

en: A single trait of feeling, taken from many others, will serve to show the point which this homage of a whole people to a single individual attained.
zh: 从其他许多人身上汲取的一种感情特质，将有助于表明一个民族对一个个体的这种敬意所达到的程度。

en: Some few days after this memorable meeting of the Gun Club, the manager of an English company announced, at the Baltimore theatre,
zh: 枪支俱乐部这次令人难忘的会议之后几天一家英国公司的经理在巴尔的摩剧院宣布,

en: the production of “Much ado about Nothing.” But the populace, seeing in that title an allusion damaging to Barbicane’s project,
zh: “无事生非”的制作但是民众看到这个标题暗指破坏了巴比肯的计划,

en: broke into the auditorium, smashed the benches, and compelled the unlucky director to alter his playbill.
zh: 闯入礼堂，砸碎了长椅，迫使那个倒霉的导演改变了他的海报。

en: Being a sensible man, he bowed to the public will and replaced the offending comedy by “As you like it”;
zh: 作为一个明智的人，他屈服于公众的意志，用“随你喜欢”取代了那个令人讨厌的喜剧;

en: and for many weeks he realized fabulous profits.
zh: 几个星期以来，他实现了惊人的利润。

en: CHAPTER IV. REPLY FROM THE OBSERVATORY OF CAMBRIDGE
zh: 第四章剑桥天文台的答复

en: Barbicane, however, lost not one moment amid all the enthusiasm of which he had become the object.
zh: 然而，巴比康在他成为目标的所有热情中，一刻也没有浪费。

en: His first care was to reassemble his colleagues in the board-room of the Gun Club.
zh: 他首先关心的是在枪支俱乐部的会议室里重新召集他的同事们。

en: There, after some discussion, it was agreed to consult the astronomers regarding the astronomical part of the enterprise.
zh: 在那里，经过一些讨论，同意就企业的天文部分咨询天文学家。

en: Their reply once ascertained, they could then discuss the mechanical means, and nothing should be wanting to ensure the success of this great experiment.
zh: 他们的回答一旦确定，他们就可以讨论机械手段，没有什么可以保证这个伟大实验的成功。

en: A note couched in precise terms, containing special interrogatories, was then drawn up and addressed to the Observatory of Cambridge in Massachusetts.
zh: 然后起草了一份措辞精确的便条，其中包含了特殊的问题，并寄给了马萨诸塞州的剑桥天文台。

en: This city, where the first university of the United States was founded, is justly celebrated for its astronomical staff.
zh: 这座城市是美国第一所大学的建立地，因其天文学工作人员而闻名。

en: There are to be found assembled all the most eminent men of science.
zh: 这里聚集着所有最杰出的科学家。

en: Here is to be seen at work that powerful telescope which enabled Bond to resolve the nebula of Andromeda, and Clarke to discover the satellite of Sirius.
zh: 我们将在这里看到强大的望远镜它使邦德能够解析仙女座星云克拉克发现了天狼星的卫星。

en: This celebrated institution fully justified on all points the confidence reposed in it by the Gun Club.
zh: 这个著名的机构在所有方面都完全证明枪支俱乐部对它的信任是正确的。

en: So, after two days, the reply so impatiently awaited was placed in the hands of President Barbicane.
zh: 于是，两天之后，巴比肯总统收到了这份迫不及待的答复。

en: It was couched in the following terms:
zh: 它的措辞如下:

en: The Director of the Cambridge Observatory to the President of the Gun Club at Baltimore.
zh: 剑桥天文台台长致巴尔的摩枪支俱乐部主席。

en: CAMBRIDGE, October 7.
zh: 剑桥10月7日。

en: On the receipt of your favor of the 6th instant, addressed to the Observatory of Cambridge in the name of the members of the Baltimore Gun Club,
zh: 收到你6号的请求以巴尔的摩枪支俱乐部成员的名义寄往剑桥天文台,

en: our staff was immediately called together, and it was judged expedient to reply as follows:
zh: 我们的员工立即被召集到一起，并被认为有利于回答如下问题:

en: The questions which have been proposed to it are these:
zh: 向它提出的问题有:

en: “1. Is it possible to transmit a projectile up to the moon?
zh: “1. 有没有可能向月球发射射弹？

en: “2. What is the exact distance which separates the earth from its satellite?
zh: “2. 地球与其卫星之间的确切距离是多少？

en: “3. What will be the period of transit of the projectile when endowed with sufficient initial velocity?
zh: “3. 如果给予足够的初速度，弹丸的过境周期将是多长？

en: and, consequently, at what moment ought it to be discharged in order that it may touch the moon at a particular point?
zh: 因此，它应该在什么时候发射，以便在某一特定点接触月球？

en: “4. At what precise moment will the moon present herself in the most favorable position to be reached by the projectile?
zh: 4.什么时候月亮会出现在抛射物到达的最有利位置？

en: “5. What point in the heavens ought the cannon to be aimed at which is intended to discharge the projectile?
zh: “5. 大炮应该瞄准天上的什么地方发射炮弹？

en: “6. What place will the moon occupy in the heavens at the moment of the projectile’s departure?”
zh: “6. 在抛射物离开的那一刻，月亮将在天空中占据什么位置?”

en: Regarding the first question, “Is it possible to transmit a projectile up to the moon?” Answer. Yes;
zh: 关于第一个问题，“有没有可能向月球发射射弹?”答案是肯定的;

en: provided it possess an initial velocity of 1,200 yards per second;
zh: 只要它具有每秒1200码的初速度;

en: calculations prove that to be sufficient.
zh: 计算证明这是足够的。

en: In proportion as we recede from the earth the action of gravitation diminishes in the inverse ratio of the square of the distance;
zh: 当我们离开地球的时候，引力的作用与距离的平方成反比;

en: that is to say, at three times a given distance the action is nine times less.
zh: 也就是说，在给定距离的三倍时，动作要小九倍。

en: Consequently, the weight of a shot will decrease, and will become reduced to zero at the instant that the attraction of the moon exactly counterpoises that of the earth;
zh: 因此，当月球的吸引力与地球的吸引力完全相等的时候，子弹的重量就会减少，并且会减少到零;

en: that is to say at 47/52 of its passage.
zh: 也就是说，在它通过的47/52。

en: At that instant the projectile will have no weight whatever;
zh: 在那一瞬间，抛射物将没有任何重量;

en: and, if it passes that point, it will fall into the moon by the sole effect of the lunar attraction.
zh: 而且，如果它通过了那个点，它就会由于月球吸引力的单一作用而落入月球。

en: The theoretical possibility of the experiment is therefore absolutely demonstrated;
zh: 因此，实验的理论可能性得到了充分的论证;

en: its success must depend upon the power of the engine employed.
zh: 它的成功必须取决于所使用的发动机的动力。

en: As to the second question, “What is the exact distance which separates the earth from its satellite?”
zh: 至于第二个问题，“地球与其卫星的确切距离是多少?”

en: Answer.—The moon does not describe a circle round the earth, but rather an ellipse, of which our earth occupies one of the foci;
zh: 月亮不是在描述一个环绕地球的圆，而是一个椭圆，我们的地球占据其中的一个焦点;

en: the consequence, therefore, is, that at certain times it approaches nearer to, and at others it recedes farther from, the earth;
zh: 因此，结果就是，在某些时候，它接近地球，而在另一些时候，它远离地球;

en: in astronomical language, it is at one time in apogee, at another in perigee.
zh: 在天文学语言中，它一次出现在远地点，另一次出现在近地点。

en: Now the difference between its greatest and its least distance is too considerable to be left out of consideration.
zh: 现在它的最大距离和最小距离之间的差别太大了，不容忽视。

en: In point of fact, in its apogee the moon is 247,552 miles, and in its perigee, 218,657 miles only distant;
zh: 事实上，在其远地点，月亮是247,552英里，而在其近地点，218,657英里只是遥远;

en: a fact which makes a difference of 28,895 miles, or more than one-ninth of the entire distance.
zh: 相差28,895英里，或超过整个距离的九分之一。

en: The perigee distance, therefore, is that which ought to serve as the basis of all calculations.
zh: 因此，近地点距离是所有计算的基础。

en: To the third question:
zh: 第三个问题:

en: Answer: If the shot should preserve continuously its initial velocity of 12,000 yards per second, it would require little more than nine hours to reach its destination;
zh: 答: 如果射击持续保持其初始速度每秒12,000码，那么到达目的地只需要9个多小时;

en: but, inasmuch as that initial velocity will be continually decreasing, it will occupy 300,000 seconds,
zh: 但是由于初速度会不断减小它会占用30万秒,

en: that is 83hrs. 20m. in reaching the point where the attraction of the earth and moon will be in equilibrio.
zh: 也就是83小时20米到达地球和月球的吸引力将处于平衡的点。

en: From this point it will fall into the moon in 50,000 seconds, or 13hrs. 53m. 20sec.
zh: 从这里开始，它将在5万秒或13小时后落入月球。53米。20秒。

en: It will be desirable, therefore, to discharge it 97hrs. 13m. 20sec.
zh: 因此，最好在97小时13分20秒内排放。

en: before the arrival of the moon at the point aimed at.
zh: 在月亮到达目的地之前。

en: Regarding question four, “At what precise moment will the moon present herself in the most favorable position, etc.?”
zh: 关于第四个问题，“月亮在什么时候会出现在最有利的位置，等等?”

en: Answer.—After what has been said above, it will be necessary, first of all, to choose the period when the moon will be in perigee,
zh: 在上面所说的之后，首先有必要选择月球将处于近地点的时间,

en: and also the moment when she will be crossing the zenith,
zh: 也是她即将跨越天顶的时刻,

en: which latter event will further diminish the entire distance by a length equal to the radius of the earth, i.e. 3,919 miles;
zh: 后一事件将使整个距离进一步减少一个等于地球半径的长度，即3,919英里;

en: the result of which will be that the final passage remaining to be accomplished will be 214,976 miles.
zh: 其结果将是，最后一条尚待完成的通道将是214,976英里。

en: But although the moon passes her perigee every month, she does not reach the zenith always at exactly the same moment.
zh: 但是尽管月亮每个月都会经过近地点，它并不总是在同一时刻达到天顶。

en: She does not appear under these two conditions simultaneously, except at long intervals of time.
zh: 在这两种情况下，她不会同时出现，除非时间间隔很长。

en: It will be necessary, therefore, to wait for the moment when her passage in perigee shall coincide with that in the zenith.
zh: 因此，有必要等待她在近地点的经过与天顶的经过相吻合的时刻。

en: Now, by a fortunate circumstance, on the 4th of December in the ensuing year the moon will present these two conditions.
zh: 现在，在一个幸运的情况下，在接下来的一年的12月4日，月亮将呈现这两种情况。

en: At midnight she will be in perigee, that is, at her shortest distance from the earth, and at the same moment she will be crossing the zenith.
zh: 午夜时分，她将到达近地点，也就是离地球最近的地方，与此同时，她将飞越天顶。

en: On the fifth question, “At what point in the heavens ought the cannon to be aimed?”
zh: 关于第五个问题，“大炮应该瞄准天上的什么地方?”

en: Answer.—The preceding remarks being admitted, the cannon ought to be pointed to the zenith of the place.
zh: 前面的话已经承认了，大炮应该指向那个地方的最高点。

en: Its fire, therefore, will be perpendicular to the plane of the horizon;
zh: 因此，它的火焰将垂直于地平线的平面;

en: and the projectile will soonest pass beyond the range of the terrestrial attraction.
zh: 飞弹很快就会超出地球引力的范围。

en: But, in order that the moon should reach the zenith of a given place, it is necessary that the place should not exceed in latitude the declination of the luminary;
zh: 但是，为了使月亮达到一个给定的地方的天顶，这个地方在纬度上不应该超过光度的偏差;

en: in other words, it must be comprised within the degrees 0° and 28° of lat. N. or S.
zh: 换句话说，它必须包含在纬度的0 ° 和28 ° 之内。

en: In every other spot the fire must necessarily be oblique, which would seriously militate against the success of the experiment.
zh: 其他地方的火必须是倾斜的，这会严重影响实验的成功。

en: As to the sixth question, “What place will the moon occupy in the heavens at the moment of the projectile’s departure?”
zh: 至于第六个问题，“在抛射物离开的那一刻，月亮将在天空中占据什么位置?”

en: Answer.—At the moment when the projectile shall be discharged into space, the moon, which travels daily forward 13° 10′ 35″, will be distant from the zenith point by four times that quantity,
zh: --在发射物进入太空的那一刻，每天向前运行13 ° 10′35′的月球距离天顶点的距离将是这个数量的四倍,

en: i.e. by 52° 41′ 20″, a space which corresponds to the path which she will describe during the entire journey of the projectile.
zh: 即52 ° 41′20′ ，这个空间对应于她将描述的整个抛射过程中的路径。

en: But, inasmuch as it is equally necessary to take into account the deviation which the rotary motion of the earth will impart to the shot,
zh: 但是，由于同样需要考虑到地球的旋转运动会给铅球带来的偏差,

en: and as the shot cannot reach the moon until after a deviation equal to 16 radii of the earth, which, calculated upon the moon’s orbit,
zh: 由于射击必须经过相当于地球半径16的偏差才能到达月球，根据月球的轨道计算,

en: are equal to about eleven degrees, it becomes necessary to add these eleven degrees to those which express the retardation of the moon just mentioned:
zh: 大约等于11度，有必要把这11度，加到刚才提到的那些表示月球迟钝的地方:

en: that is to say, in round numbers, about sixty-four degrees.
zh: 也就是说，以整数计算，大约是64度。

en: Consequently, at the moment of firing the visual radius applied to the moon will describe, with the vertical line of the place, an angle of sixty-four degrees.
zh: 因此，在点火的瞬间，应用于月球的视觉半径将描述与垂直线的地方，角度64度。

en: These are our answers to the questions proposed to the Observatory of Cambridge by the members of the Gun Club:
zh: 以下是我们对枪支俱乐部成员向剑桥天文台提出的问题的回答:

en: To sum up:
zh: 总而言之:

en: 1st. The cannon ought to be planted in a country situated between 0° and 28° of N. or S. lat.
zh: 1. 大炮应种植在北纬0度至北纬28度之间的国家。

en: 2nd. It ought to be pointed directly toward the zenith of the place.
zh: 它应该直接指向这个地方的顶点。

en: 3rd. The projectile ought to be propelled with an initial velocity of 12,000 yards per second.
zh: 炮弹应该以每秒12,000码的初速推进。

en: 4th. It ought to be discharged at 10hrs. 46m. 40sec. of the 1st of December of the ensuing year.
zh: 应于次年12月1日10时46分40秒排放。

en: 5th. It will meet the moon four days after its discharge, precisely at midnight on the 4th of December, at the moment of its transit across the zenith.
zh: 第五名。它将在发射后四天与月亮相会，准确地说是在12月4日的午夜，在它经过天顶的那一刻。

en: The members of the Gun Club ought, therefore, without delay, to commence the works necessary for such an experiment, and to be prepared to set to work at the moment determined upon;
zh: 因此，枪支俱乐部的成员应该毫不拖延地开始进行这种实验所必需的工作，并准备在决定的时刻着手工作;

en: for, if they should suffer this 4th of December to go by, they will not find the moon again under the same conditions of perigee and of zenith until eighteen years and eleven days afterward.
zh: 因为，如果他们忍受着12月4日的这一天，他们将不会在同样的近地点和天顶的条件下再次找到月亮，直到18年11天之后。

en: The staff of the Cambridge Observatory place themselves entirely at their disposal in respect of all questions of theoretical astronomy;
zh: 剑桥天文台的工作人员对理论天文学的所有问题完全听命于他们;

en: and herewith add their congratulations to those of all the rest of America.
zh: 在此向全美国人民表示祝贺。

en: For the Astronomical Staff, J.M. BELFAST, Director of the Observatory of Cambridge.
zh: 剑桥大学天文台台长 J.M。

en: CHAPTER V. THE ROMANCE OF THE MOON
zh: 第五章月亮的浪漫

en: An observer endued with an infinite range of vision, and placed in that unknown center around which the entire world revolves,
zh: 一个拥有无限视野的观察者置身于整个世界围绕的未知中心,

en: might have beheld myriads of atoms filling all space during the chaotic epoch of the universe.
zh: 可能会看到在宇宙的混沌时代，无数的原子充满了所有的空间。

en: Little by little, as ages went on, a change took place;
zh: 随着时间的推移，一点一点地发生了变化;

en: a general law of attraction manifested itself, to which the hitherto errant atoms became obedient:
zh: 一个普遍的吸引力法则(新思维)显现了出来，迄今为止还不稳定的原子变得顺从了:

en: these atoms combined together chemically according to their affinities, formed themselves into molecules,
zh: 这些原子根据它们的亲和力化学结合形成分子,

en: and composed those nebulous masses with which the depths of the heavens are strewed.
zh: 组成了那些散布在天空深处的星云。

en: These masses became immediately endued with a rotary motion around their own central point.
zh: 这些物体立即围绕着它们自己的中心点旋转起来。

en: This center, formed of indefinite molecules, began to revolve around its own axis during its gradual condensation;
zh: 这个由不确定分子组成的中心，在逐渐冷凝过程中开始围绕自己的轴旋转;

en: then, following the immutable laws of mechanics, in proportion as its bulk diminished by condensation,
zh: 然后，遵循不变的力学定律，按照它的体积因凝结而减小的比例,

en: its rotary motion became accelerated, and these two effects continuing,
zh: 它的旋转运动变得加速，这两个效应继续,

en: the result was the formation of one principal star, the center of the nebulous mass.
zh: 其结果是形成了一颗主恒星，即星云质量的中心。

en: By attentively watching, the observer would then have perceived the other molecules of the mass,
zh: 通过仔细观察，观察者就会感觉到质量的其他分子,

en: following the example of this central star, become likewise condensed by gradually accelerated rotation,
zh: 以这颗中央恒星为例，逐渐加速旋转,

en: and gravitating round it in the shape of innumerable stars.
zh: 以无数恒星的形状围绕着它。

en: Thus was formed the Nebulæ, of which astronomers have reckoned up nearly 5,000.
zh: 这样就形成了星云，天文学家估计其中有近5000个。

en: Among these 5,000 nebulæ there is one which has received the name of the Milky Way,
zh: 在这5000个星云中有一个被称为银河系,

en: and which contains eighteen millions of stars, each of which has become the center of a solar world.
zh: 它包含了1800万颗恒星，每一颗都成为了太阳世界的中心。

en: If the observer had then specially directed his attention to one of the more humble and less brilliant of these stellar bodies,
zh: 如果观察者当时特别将注意力转向这些恒星中较为谦逊和不那么耀眼的一个,

en: a star of the fourth class, that which is arrogantly called the Sun,
zh: 第四级的一颗恒星，被傲慢地称为太阳,

en: all the phenomena to which the formation of the Universe is to be ascribed would have been successively fulfilled before his eyes.
zh: 所有形成宇宙的现象都会在他眼前相继发生。

en: In fact, he would have perceived this sun, as yet in the gaseous state,
zh: 事实上，他应该已经察觉到这个太阳还处于气态,

en: and composed of moving molecules, revolving round its axis in order to accomplish its work of concentration.
zh: 由运动的分子组成，围绕其轴旋转，以完成其浓缩工作。

en: This motion, faithful to the laws of mechanics, would have been accelerated with the diminution of its volume;
zh: 这种运动，忠实于力学定律，随着体积的减小而加速;

en: and a moment would have arrived when the centrifugal force would have overpowered the centripetal,
zh: 有一刻离心力会压倒向心,

en: which causes the molecules all to tend toward the center.
zh: 使得所有的分子都趋向于中心。

en: Another phenomenon would now have passed before the observer’s eye,
zh: 另一个现象将会在观察者眼前经过,

en: and the molecules situated on the plane of the equator, escaping like a stone from a sling of which the cord had suddenly snapped,
zh: 分子位于赤道平面上，就像一块石头从绳索上突然断裂,

en: would have formed around the sun sundry concentric rings resembling that of Saturn.
zh: 会在太阳周围形成各种类似土星的同心环。

en: In their turn, again, these rings of cosmical matter, excited by a rotary motion about the central mass,
zh: 反过来，这些宇宙物质的光环被围绕中心质量的旋转运动所激发,

en: would have been broken up and decomposed into secondary nebulosities, that is to say, into planets.
zh: 会被分解，分解成次级星云，也就是说，分解成行星。

en: Similarly he would have observed these planets throw off one or more rings each,
zh: 同样地，他会观察到这些行星每个都抛出一个或多个光环,

en: which became the origin of the secondary bodies which we call satellites.
zh: 成为我们称之为卫星的第二天体的起源。

en: Thus, then, advancing from atom to molecule, from molecule to nebulous mass, from that to principal star,
zh: 因此，从原子到分子，从分子到星云质量，从星云质量到主星,

en: from star to sun, from sun to planet, and hence to satellite, we have the whole series of transformations undergone by the heavenly bodies during the first days of the world.
zh: 从恒星到太阳，从太阳到行星，进而到卫星，在世界诞生的最初几天里，我们看到了天体所经历的一系列变化。

en: Now, of those attendant bodies which the sun maintains in their elliptical orbits by the great law of gravitation, some few in turn possess satellites.
zh: 现在，在那些伴随着太阳的物体中，太阳通过伟大的万有引力定律使它们保持在椭圆形轨道上，一些物体反过来拥有卫星。

en: Uranus has eight, Saturn eight, Jupiter four, Neptune possibly three, and the Earth one.
zh: 天王星有八颗，土星八颗，木星四颗，海王星可能三颗，地球一颗。

en: This last, one of the least important of the entire solar system, we call the Moon;
zh: 这最后一个，整个太阳系中最不重要的一个，我们称之为月球;

en: and it is she whom the daring genius of the Americans professed their intention of conquering.
zh: 正是她，美国人的大胆天才宣称他们有征服的意图。

en: The moon, by her comparative proximity, and the constantly varying appearances produced by her several phases,
zh: 月亮，由于她的相对接近，以及由于她的几个阶段所产生的不断变化的外观,

en: has always occupied a considerable share of the attention of the inhabitants of the earth.
zh: 一直占据着地球上居民相当大的一部分注意力。

en: From the time of Thales of Miletus, in the fifth century B.C., down to that of Copernicus in the fifteenth and Tycho Brahé in the sixteenth century A.D.,
zh: 从公元前五世纪的泰勒斯到十五世纪的哥白尼和十六世纪的第谷 · 布拉热,

en: observations have been from time to time carried on with more or less correctness,
zh: 观察结果时不时地或多或少地正确进行,

en: until in the present day the altitudes of the lunar mountains have been determined with exactitude.
zh: 直到今天，月球山脉的高度都是精确测定的。

en: Galileo explained the phenomena of the lunar light produced during certain of her phases by the existence of mountains,
zh: 伽利略解释了月光在她的某些阶段由山脉的存在而产生的现象,

en: to which he assigned a mean altitude of 27,000 feet.
zh: 他给出的平均高度是27000英尺。

en: After him Hévelius, an astronomer of Dantzic, reduced the highest elevations to 15,000 feet;
zh: 在他之后，天文学家 Hévelius 把最高海拔降低到15000英尺;

en: but the calculations of Riccioli brought them up again to 21,000 feet.
zh: 但是根据里奇奥利的计算，他们又上升到了21000英尺。

en: At the close of the eighteenth century Herschel, armed with a powerful telescope, considerably reduced the preceding measurements.
zh: 在十八世纪末，赫歇尔装备了一个强大的望远镜，大大减少了以前的测量。

en: He assigned a height of 11,400 feet to the maximum elevations, and reduced the mean of the different altitudes to little more than 2,400 feet.
zh: 他给最大海拔设定了11400英尺的高度，并将不同海拔的平均值降低到2400英尺多一点。

en: But Herschel’s calculations were in their turn corrected by the observations of Halley, Nasmyth, Bianchini, Gruithuysen, and others;
zh: 但是赫歇尔的计算被哈雷、 Nasmyth、比安奇尼、格鲁修森和其他人的观测结果修正了;

en: but it was reserved for the labors of Boeer and Maedler finally to solve the question.
zh: 但最终还是留给了 Boeer 和 Maedler 的劳动者来解决这个问题。

en: They succeeded in measuring 1,905 different elevations, of which six exceed 15,000 feet, and twenty-two exceed 14,400 feet.
zh: 他们成功测量了1905个不同的海拔高度，其中6个高度超过15000英尺，22个高度超过14400英尺。

en: The highest summit of all towers to a height of 22,606 feet above the surface of the lunar disc.
zh: 所有塔的最高峰，在月球圆盘表面以上22,606英尺的高度。

en: At the same period the examination of the moon was completed.
zh: 在同一时期，月球的检测工作也完成了。

en: She appeared completely riddled with craters, and her essentially volcanic character was apparent at each observation.
zh: 她看起来完全布满了火山口，每次观察都能明显看出她本质上的火山特征。

en: By the absence of refraction in the rays of the planets occulted by her we conclude that she is absolutely devoid of an atmosphere.
zh: 由于她所遮蔽的行星光线没有折射，我们得出结论，她绝对没有大气层。

en: The absence of air entails the absence of water.
zh: 没有空气就意味着没有水。

en: It became, therefore, manifest that the Selenites, to support life under such conditions, must possess a special organization of their own, must differ remarkably from the inhabitants of the earth.
zh: 因此，显而易见的是，塞莱尼特人，要在这样的条件下维持生命，必须拥有自己的特殊组织，必须与地球上的居民有显著的不同。

en: At length, thanks to modern art, instruments of still higher perfection searched the moon without intermission, not leaving a single point of her surface unexplored;
zh: 最后，多亏了现代艺术，更加完美的仪器不间断地在月球表面搜索，没有留下任何一点未被探索;

en: and notwithstanding that her diameter measures 2,150 miles, her surface equals the one-fifteenth part of that of our globe,
zh: 尽管它的直径有2150英里它的表面相当于地球表面的十五分之一,

en: and her bulk the one-forty-ninth part of that of the terrestrial spheroid—not one of her secrets was able to escape the eyes of the astronomers;
zh: 她的体积是地球球体的四十九分之一，她的任何一个秘密都逃不过天文学家的眼睛;

en: and these skillful men of science carried to an even greater degree their prodigious observations.
zh: 而这些技艺高超的科学家在更大程度上进行了他们惊人的观察。

en: Thus they remarked that, during full moon, the disc appeared scored in certain parts with white lines; and, during the phases, with black.
zh: 因此，他们注意到，在满月期间，圆盘的某些部分似乎刻有白线，而在阶段，刻有黑线。

en: On prosecuting the study of these with still greater precision, they succeeded in obtaining an exact account of the nature of these lines.
zh: 在更加精确地研究这些问题之后，他们成功地对这些问题的性质作出了准确的说明。

en: They were long and narrow furrows sunk between parallel ridges, bordering generally upon the edges of the craters.
zh: 它们是又长又窄的沟槽，在平行的山脊之间凹陷下去，大体上接近火山口的边缘。

en: Their length varied between ten and 100 miles, and their width was about 1,600 yards.
zh: 它们的长度在10英里到100英里之间，宽度约为1600码。

en: Astronomers called them chasms, but they could not get any further.
zh: 天文学家称它们为裂缝，但它们无法进一步深入。

en: Whether these chasms were the dried-up beds of ancient rivers or not they were unable thoroughly to ascertain.
zh: 这些裂缝是否是古代河流干涸的河床，他们无法彻底确定。

en: The Americans, among others, hoped one day or other to determine this geological question.
zh: 美国人和其他人一样，希望有朝一日能确定这个地质问题。

en: They also undertook to examine the true nature of that system of parallel ramparts discovered on the moon’s surface by Gruithuysen,
zh: 他们还着手研究格鲁图森在月球表面发现的平行壁垒系统的真实性质,

en: a learned professor of Munich, who considered them to be “a system of fortifications thrown up by the Selenitic engineers.” These two points, yet obscure, as well as others,
zh: 慕尼黑的一位博学的教授，认为它们是“塞莱尼特工程师建造的一系列防御工事。”这两点虽然模糊不清，还有其他一些,

en: no doubt, could not be definitely settled except by direct communication with the moon.
zh: 毫无疑问，除非通过与月球的直接交流，否则不能肯定地解决。

en: Regarding the degree of intensity of its light, there was nothing more to learn on this point.
zh: 关于它的光的强度，在这一点上没有什么可学的了。

en: It was known that it is 300,000 times weaker than that of the sun, and that its heat has no appreciable effect upon the thermometer.
zh: 众所周知，它比太阳弱300,000倍，它的热量对温度计没有明显的影响。

en: As to the phenomenon known as the “ashy light,” it is explained naturally by the effect of the transmission of the solar rays from the earth to the moon,
zh: 至于所谓的“灰光”现象，自然是用太阳光从地球到月球的传播效应来解释的,

en: which give the appearance of completeness to the lunar disc, while it presents itself under the crescent form during its first and last phases.
zh: 这使得月盘看起来完整，同时在它的第一阶段和最后阶段以新月的形式出现。

en: Such was the state of knowledge acquired regarding the earth’s satellite, which the Gun Club undertook to perfect in all its aspects, cosmographic, geological, political, and moral.
zh: 这就是关于地球卫星所获得的知识状态，大炮俱乐部承诺在宇宙学、地质学、政治学和道德学的各个方面加以完善。

en: CHAPTER VI. PERMISSIVE LIMITS OF IGNORANCE AND BELIEF IN THE UNITED STATES
zh: 第六章美国对无知和信仰的许可限度

en: The immediate result of Barbicane’s proposition was to place upon the orders of the day all the astronomical facts relative to the Queen of the Night.
zh: 巴比肯的提议的直接结果是把所有与夜之女王有关的天文事实列入白天的命令。

en: Everybody set to work to study assiduously.
zh: 大家开始刻苦学习。

en: One would have thought that the moon had just appeared for the first time, and that no one had ever before caught a glimpse of her in the heavens.
zh: 人们会以为月亮是第一次出现，以前从来没有人在天空中看到过她。

en: The papers revived all the old anecdotes in which the “sun of the wolves” played a part;
zh: 报纸复兴了所有“狼的太阳”扮演一部分的古老轶事;

en: they recalled the influences which the ignorance of past ages ascribed to her;
zh: 他们回忆起过去时代的无知归因于她的影响;

en: in short, all America was seized with selenomania, or had become moon-mad.
zh: 简而言之，整个美国都被疯狂的月亮所控制，或者已经变得疯狂。

en: The scientific journals, for their part, dealt more especially with the questions which touched upon the enterprise of the Gun Club.
zh: 就科学期刊而言，它们更多地涉及枪支俱乐部事业的问题。

en: The letter of the Observatory of Cambridge was published by them, and commented upon with unreserved approval.
zh: 剑桥天文台的信由他们出版，并得到了他们毫无保留的赞许。

en: Until that time most people had been ignorant of the mode in which the distance which separates the moon from the earth is calculated.
zh: 直到那时，大多数人还不知道计算月球与地球之间距离的方法。

en: They took advantage of this fact to explain to them that this distance was obtained by measuring the parallax of the moon.
zh: 他们利用这个事实向他们解释，这个距离是通过测量月球的视差得到的。

en: The term parallax proving “caviare to the general,”
zh: 视差这个术语证明了“鱼子酱是一般的”

en: they further explained that it meant the angle formed by the inclination of two straight lines drawn from either extremity of the earth’s radius to the moon.
zh: 他们进一步解释说，这意味着从地球半径的任一端到月球的两条直线的倾斜形成的角度。

en: On doubts being expressed as to the correctness of this method, they immediately proved that not only was the mean distance 234,347 miles,
zh: 对这种方法的正确性表示怀疑之后，他们立即证明，平均距离不仅仅是234,347英里,

en: but that astronomers could not possibly be in error in their estimate by more than seventy miles either way.
zh: 但是，天文学家不可能在他们的估计超过70英里的任何一种方式错误。

en: To those who were not familiar with the motions of the moon, they demonstrated that she possesses two distinct motions,
zh: 对于那些不熟悉月球运动的人来说，他们证明了月球有两种截然不同的运动,

en: the first being that of rotation upon her axis, the second being that of revolution round the earth,
zh: 第一个是绕地轴旋转，第二个是绕地球旋转,

en: accomplishing both together in an equal period of time, that is to say, in twenty-seven and one-third days.
zh: 在同样的时间内，也就是说，在二十七天和三分之一天的时间内完成这两件事。

en: The motion of rotation is that which produces day and night on the surface of the moon;
zh: 自转运动是在月球表面产生昼夜的运动;

en: save that there is only one day and one night in the lunar month, each lasting three hundred and fifty-four and one-third hours.
zh: 除了阴历月只有一天一夜，每天三百五十四小时三分之一。

en: But, happily for her, the face turned toward the terrestrial globe is illuminated by it with an intensity equal to that of fourteen moons.
zh: 但是，令她高兴的是，转向地球的脸被它照亮了，强度相当于十四个月亮。

en: As to the other face, always invisible to us, it has of necessity three hundred and fifty-four hours of absolute night, tempered only by that “pale glimmer which falls upon it from the stars.”
zh: 至于另一张脸，我们总是看不见，它必须有三百五十四个小时的绝对黑夜，只有“从星星上落下来的苍白的微光”才能磨练它

en: Some well-intentioned, but rather obstinate persons, could not at first comprehend how,
zh: 有些心地善良但固执的人一开始不明白,

en: if the moon displays invariably the same face to the earth during her revolution, she can describe one turn round herself.
zh: 如果月亮在公转期间总是向地球显示相同的面孔，她可以描述自己的一个转身。

en: To such they answered, “Go into your dining-room, and walk round the table in such a way as to always keep your face turned toward the center;
zh: 对此，他们回答说: “走进你的餐厅，围着桌子走一圈，使你的脸总是朝着中央;

en: by the time you will have achieved one complete round you will have completed one turn around yourself, since your eye will have traversed successively every point of the room.
zh: 当你完成一个完整的回合时，你已经完成了自己的一个回合，因为你的眼睛会先后穿过房间的每一个点。

en: Well, then, the room is the heavens, the table is the earth, and the moon is yourself.” And they would go away delighted.
zh: 那么，房间就是天堂，桌子就是地球，月亮就是你自己。”他们会高兴地离开。

en: So, then the moon displays invariably the same face to the earth;
zh: 因此，月亮总是向地球表现出相同的面孔;

en: nevertheless, to be quite exact, it is necessary to add that, in consequence of certain fluctuations of north and south,
zh: 不过，确切地说，有必要补充一点，由于南北方的某些波动,

en: and of west and east, termed her libration, she permits rather more than half, that is to say, five-sevenths, to be seen.
zh: 在东西方，被称为她的平动，她允许看到一半以上，也就是说，七分之五。

en: As soon as the ignoramuses came to understand as much as the director of the observatory himself knew,
zh: 一旦那些无知的人像天文台台长自己所知道的那样了解了这一切,

en: they began to worry themselves regarding her revolution round the earth, whereupon twenty scientific reviews immediately came to the rescue.
zh: 他们开始担心她的地球公转，于是立即有二十篇科学评论来拯救他们。

en: They pointed out to them that the firmament, with its infinitude of stars,
zh: 他们向他们指出，无穷无尽的星空,

en: may be considered as one vast dial-plate, upon which the moon travels, indicating the true time to all the inhabitants of the earth;
zh: 可以被认为是一个巨大的刻度盘，月亮在其上运行，向地球上所有的居民表明真实的时间;

en: that it is during this movement that the Queen of Night exhibits her different phases;
zh: 正是在这个运动中，夜女王展现了她不同的阶段;

en: that the moon is full when she is in opposition with the sun, that is when the three bodies are on the same straight line, the earth occupying the center;
zh: 当月亮与太阳相对时，即三个物体在同一条直线上，地球占据中心时，月亮就是满的;

en: that she is new when she is in conjunction with the sun, that is, when she is between it and the earth;
zh: 当她与太阳相连时，也就是她在太阳和地球之间时，她是新的;

en: and, lastly that she is in her first or last quarter, when she makes with the sun and the earth an angle of which she herself occupies the apex.
zh: 最后，她是在她的第一个季度或最后一个季度，当她与太阳和地球的角度，她自己占据顶点。

en: Regarding the altitude which the moon attains above the horizon, the letter of the Cambridge Observatory had said all that was to be said in this respect.
zh: 关于月亮到达地平线以上的高度，剑桥天文台的信已经说明了这方面的一切。

en: Every one knew that this altitude varies according to the latitude of the observer.
zh: 每个人都知道这个高度随观察者的纬度而变化。

en: But the only zones of the globe in which the moon passes the zenith, that is, the point directly over the head of the spectator,
zh: 但是地球上唯一一个月亮经过天顶的区域也就是观众头顶的那一点,

en: are of necessity comprised between the twenty-eighth parallels and the equator.
zh: 必然包含在二十八度纬线和赤道之间。

en: Hence the importance of the advice to try the experiment upon some point of that part of the globe,
zh: 因此，建议在地球那一部分的某个地方进行实验是非常重要的,

en: in order that the projectile might be discharged perpendicularly, and so the soonest escape the action of gravitation.
zh: 为了使弹丸可以垂直发射，从而最快地逃脱引力的作用。

en: This was an essential condition to the success of the enterprise, and continued actively to engage the public attention.
zh: 这是企业成功的必要条件，并继续积极吸引公众的注意。

en: Regarding the path described by the moon in her revolution round the earth,
zh: 关于月球绕地球公转时所描述的路径,

en: the Cambridge Observatory had demonstrated that this path is a re-entering curve,
zh: 剑桥天文台已经证明这条路径是一条重新进入的曲线,

en: not a perfect circle, but an ellipse, of which the earth occupies one of the foci.
zh: 不是一个完美的圆，而是一个椭圆，地球占据其中的一个焦点。

en: It was also well understood that it is farthest removed from the earth during its apogee, and approaches most nearly to it at its perigee.
zh: 人们也很清楚，它在远地点离地球最远，在近地点离地球最近。

en: Such was then the extent of knowledge possessed by every American on the subject, and of which no one could decently profess ignorance.
zh: 这就是当时每个美国人在这个问题上所掌握的知识的程度，没有人能够像样地承认自己对此一无所知。

en: Still, while these principles were being rapidly disseminated many errors and illusory fears proved less easy to eradicate.
zh: 然而，尽管这些原则正在迅速传播，但事实证明，许多错误和虚幻的恐惧并不容易消除。

en: For instance, some worthy persons maintained that the moon was an ancient comet which,
zh: 例如，一些有身份的人认为月球是一颗古老的彗星,

en: in describing its elongated orbit round the sun, happened to pass near the earth, and became confined within her circle of attraction.
zh: 在描述它围绕太阳的细长轨道时，碰巧经过地球附近，并被限制在她的吸引圈内。

en: These drawing-room astronomers professed to explain the charred aspect of the moon—a disaster which they attributed to the intensity of the solar heat;
zh: 这些客厅里的天文学家声称他们解释了月球被烧焦的原因ーー他们将这场灾难归因于太阳热量的强度;

en: only, on being reminded that comets have an atmosphere, and that the moon has little or none, they were fairly at a loss for a reply.
zh: 只是，当他们被提醒彗星有大气层，而月球只有很少或根本没有大气层时，他们就不知道该如何回答了。

en: Others again, belonging to the doubting class, expressed certain fears as to the position of the moon.
zh: 还有一些人，属于怀疑派，对月亮的位置表示了某种担忧。

en: They had heard it said that, according to observations made in the time of the Caliphs, her revolution had become accelerated in a certain degree.
zh: 他们听说，根据哈里发时期的观察，她的革命在一定程度上加速了。

en: Hence they concluded, logically enough, that an acceleration of motion ought to be accompanied by a corresponding diminution in the distance separating the two bodies;
zh: 因此，他们得出结论，从逻辑上来说，运动的加速度应该伴随着两个物体之间距离的相应减小;

en: and that, supposing the double effect to be continued to infinity, the moon would end by one day falling into the earth.
zh: 假设双重效应持续到无穷远，月球将在某一天落入地球。

en: However, they became reassured as to the fate of future generations on being apprised that,
zh: 然而，当他们被告知,

en: according to the calculations of Laplace, this acceleration of motion is confined within very restricted limits,
zh: 根据拉普拉斯的计算这种运动的加速度被限制在非常有限的范围内,

en: and that a proportional diminution of speed will be certain to succeed it.
zh: 而且减速一定会成功。

en: So, then, the stability of the solar system would not be deranged in ages to come.
zh: 因此，太阳系的稳定性在未来的岁月里不会被扰乱。

en: There remains but the third class, the superstitious.
zh: 只剩下第三类人，迷信的人。

en: These worthies were not content merely to rest in ignorance;
zh: 这些有价值的人物不满足于仅仅停留在无知中;

en: they must know all about things which had no existence whatever, and as to the moon, they had long known all about her.
zh: 他们一定知道所有不存在的东西，至于月亮，他们早就知道她的一切。

en: One set regarded her disc as a polished mirror, by means of which people could see each other from different points of the earth and interchange their thoughts.
zh: 有一套把她的圆盘当作一面抛光的镜子，通过这种方式，人们可以从地球的不同角度看到对方，并交换他们的思想。

en: Another set pretended that out of one thousand new moons that had been observed,
zh: 另一组假装在观测到的一千个新月中,

en: nine hundred and fifty had been attended with remarkable disturbances,
zh: 九百五十人受到了惊人的骚动,

en: such as cataclysms, revolutions, earthquakes, the deluge, etc.
zh: 如大灾难、革命、地震、洪水等。

en: Then they believed in some mysterious influence exercised by her over human destinies—that every Selenite was attached to some inhabitant of the earth by a tie of sympathy;
zh: 然后他们相信她对人类命运施加了某种神秘的影响ーー每一个赛伦特人都通过同情心的纽带与地球上的某个居民相连;

en: they maintained that the entire vital system is subject to her control, etc.
zh: 他们坚持认为整个生命系统都受她的控制，等等。

en: But in time the majority renounced these vulgar errors, and espoused the true side of the question.
zh: 但随着时间的推移，大多数人放弃了这些粗俗的错误，并支持问题的真实一面。

en: As for the Yankees, they had no other ambition than to take possession of this new continent of the sky,
zh: 至于北方佬，他们没有别的野心，只想占领这片新的天空大陆,

en: and to plant upon the summit of its highest elevation the star- spangled banner of the United States of America.
zh: 将美利坚合众国的星条旗插在海拔最高的山峰上。

en: CHAPTER VII. THE HYMN OF THE CANNON-BALL
zh: 第七章炮弹的圣歌

en: The Observatory of Cambridge in its memorable letter had treated the question from a purely astronomical point of view.
zh: 剑桥天文台在其令人难忘的信中从纯粹的天文学角度处理了这个问题。

en: The mechanical part still remained.
zh: 机械部分还在。

en: President Barbicane had, without loss of time, nominated a working committee of the Gun Club.
zh: 巴比肯总统不失时机地提名了一个枪支俱乐部的工作委员会。

en: The duty of this committee was to resolve the three grand questions of the cannon, the projectile, and the powder.
zh: 这个委员会的职责是解决大炮、炮弹和火药这三个重大问题。

en: It was composed of four members of great technical knowledge, Barbicane (with a casting vote in case of equality),
zh: 它由四个伟大的技术知识成员组成，巴比肯(在平等的情况下有决定性的一票) ,

en: General Morgan, Major Elphinstone, and J.T. Maston, to whom were confided the functions of secretary.
zh: 摩根将军，埃尔芬斯通少校和 J.T. 马斯顿，他们被委以秘书的职务。

en: On the 8th of October the committee met at the house of President Barbicane, 3 Republican Street.
zh: 10月8日，委员会在共和街3号巴比肯总统府举行会议。

en: The meeting was opened by the president himself.
zh: 会议由总统本人宣布开幕。

en: “Gentlemen,” said he, “we have to resolve one of the most important problems in the whole of the noble science of gunnery.
zh: “先生们,”他说，“我们必须解决整个高尚的射击科学中最重要的问题之一。

en: It might appear, perhaps, the most logical course to devote our first meeting to the discussion of the engine to be employed.
zh: 也许，将我们的第一次会议专门用于讨论将要使用的发动机似乎是最合乎逻辑的过程。

en: Nevertheless, after mature consideration, it has appeared to me that the question of the projectile must take precedence of that of the cannon,
zh: 尽管如此，经过深思熟虑，在我看来，炮弹的问题必须优先于大炮的问题,

en: and that the dimensions of the latter must necessarily depend on those of the former.”
zh: 而后者的规模必然取决于前者的规模。”

en: “Suffer me to say a word,” here broke in J.T. Maston.
zh: “让我说句话吧,”这里打断了 J.T. Maston。

en: Permission having been granted, “Gentlemen,” said he with an inspired accent, “our president is right in placing the question of the projectile above all others.
zh: “先生们,”他带着鼓舞人心的口音说，“我们的总统把发射问题放在首位是正确的。

en: The ball we are about to discharge at the moon is our ambassador to her, and I wish to consider it from a moral point of view.
zh: 我们即将在月球上举行的舞会是我们对她的大使，我希望从道德的角度来考虑这个问题。

en: The cannon-ball, gentlemen, to my mind, is the most magnificent manifestation of human power.
zh: 炮弹，先生们，在我看来，是人类力量最壮观的体现。

en: If Providence has created the stars and the planets, man has called the cannon-ball into existence.
zh: 如果说上帝创造了恒星和行星，那么人类就把炮弹叫做了存在。

en: Let Providence claim the swiftness of electricity and of light, of the stars, the comets, and the planets, of wind and sound—we claim to have invented the swiftness of the cannon-ball,
zh: 让上帝宣称电和光的迅速，星星、彗星和行星的迅速，风和声音的迅速，我们宣称发明了炮弹的迅速,

en: a hundred times superior to that of the swiftest horses or railway train.
zh: 比速度最快的马或火车要快一百倍。

en: How glorious will be the moment when, infinitely exceeding all hitherto attained velocities,
zh: 那一刻将是多么的光荣，无限地超越迄今为止所达到的速度,

en: we shall launch our new projectile with the rapidity of seven miles a second!
zh: 我们将以每秒7英里的速度发射我们的新炮弹！

en: Shall it not, gentlemen—shall it not be received up there with the honors due to a terrestrial ambassador?”
zh: 难道不应该吗，先生们难道不应该由地球上的大使给予这样的荣誉吗?”

en: Overcome with emotion the orator sat down and applied himself to a huge plate of sandwiches before him.
zh: 演说家激动地坐了下来，专心致志地吃着面前的一大盘三明治。

en: “And now,” said Barbicane, “let us quit the domain of poetry and come direct to the question.”
zh: “现在,”巴比肯说，“让我们离开诗歌的领域，直接进入这个问题。”
