en: “By all means,” replied the members, each with his mouth full of sandwich.
zh: “当然可以,”队员们回答说，每个人嘴里都塞满了三明治。

en: “The problem before us,” continued the president, “is how to communicate to a projectile a velocity of 12,000 yards per second.
zh: “摆在我们面前的问题,”总统继续说道，“是如何与每秒12,000码的速度传递信息。

en: Let us at present examine the velocities hitherto attained.
zh: 现在让我们来检验一下迄今为止所达到的速度。

en: General Morgan will be able to enlighten us on this point.”
zh: 摩根将军会在这一点上给我们一些启示。”

en: “And the more easily,” replied the general, “that during the war I was a member of the committee of experiments.
zh: “而且更容易,”将军回答说，“在战争期间，我是实验委员会的成员。

en: I may say, then, that the 100-pounder Dahlgrens, which carried a distance of 5,000 yards, impressed upon their projectile an initial velocity of 500 yards a second.
zh: 那么，我可以说，100磅重的达尔格伦炮，射程为5000码，炮弹的初速度为每秒500码。

en: The Rodman Columbiad threw a shot weighing half a ton a distance of six miles, with a velocity of 800 yards per second—a result which Armstrong and Palisser have never obtained in England.”
zh: 罗德曼 · 哥伦比亚号发射了一枚重达半吨、距离6英里、速度为每秒800码的炮弹，这是阿姆斯特朗和 Palisser 在英格兰从未取得过的成绩。”

en: “This,” replied Barbicane, “is, I believe, the maximum velocity ever attained?”
zh: “这,”巴比康回答，“我相信，是有史以来达到的最大速度?”

en: “It is so,” replied the general.
zh: “是这样的,”将军回答说。

en: “Ah!” groaned J.T. Maston, “if my mortar had not burst”
zh: “啊!”J.T. 马斯顿呻吟道，“如果我的迫击炮没有爆炸的话。”

en: “Yes,” quietly replied Barbicane, “but it did burst.
zh: “是的,”巴比肯平静地回答，“但它确实破了。

en: We must take, then, for our starting point, this velocity of 800 yards.
zh: 我们必须以800码的速度作为起点。

en: We must increase it twenty-fold.
zh: 我们必须增加二十倍。

en: Now, reserving for another discussion the means of producing this velocity, I will call your attention to the dimensions which it will be proper to assign to the shot.
zh: 现在，保留另一个讨论产生这个速度的方法，我将提请你们注意的尺寸，它将是适当的分配给拍摄。

en: You understand that we have nothing to do here with projectiles weighing at most but half a ton.”
zh: 你要明白，我们在这里与重量不超过半吨的炮弹毫无关系。”

en: “Why not?” demanded the major.
zh: “为什么不呢?”少校问道。

en: “Because the shot,” quickly replied J.T. Maston, “must be big enough to attract the attention of the inhabitants of the moon, if there are any?”
zh: “因为这个镜头,”J.T. 马斯顿迅速回答，“必须足够大，以吸引月球居民的注意力，如果有的话?”

en: “Yes,” replied Barbicane, “and for another reason more important still.”
zh: “是的,”巴比肯回答，“还有一个更重要的原因。”

en: “What mean you?” asked the major.
zh: “你是什么意思?”少校问。

en: “I mean that it is not enough to discharge a projectile, and then take no further notice of it;
zh: “我的意思是，仅仅发射一枚炮弹，然后不再注意它是不够的;

en: we must follow it throughout its course, up to the moment when it shall reach its goal.”
zh: 我们必须跟随它，直到它达到目标的那一刻。”

en: “What?” shouted the general and the major in great surprise.
zh: “什么?”将军和少校大吃一惊。

en: “Undoubtedly,” replied Barbicane composedly, “or our experiment would produce no result.”
zh: “毫无疑问,”巴比康镇定地回答，“否则我们的实验将不会产生任何结果。”

en: “But then,” replied the major, “you will have to give this projectile enormous dimensions.”
zh: “但是,”少校回答说，“你必须给这个抛射体一个巨大的尺寸。”

en: “No! Be so good as to listen.
zh: “不! 好好听着。

en: You know that optical instruments have acquired great perfection;
zh: 你知道，光学仪器已经获得了极大的完美;

en: with certain instruments we have succeeded in obtaining enlargements of 6,000 times and reducing the moon to within forty miles’ distance.
zh: 通过某些仪器，我们已经成功地将月球放大了6000倍，并将其距离缩小到了40英里以内。

en: Now, at this distance, any objects sixty feet square would be perfectly visible.
zh: 现在，在这个距离，任何物体60平方英尺将完全可见。

en: “If, then, the penetrative power of telescopes has not been further increased, it is because that power detracts from their light;
zh: “如果说望远镜的穿透能力没有进一步提高，那是因为这种能力减弱了它们的光线;

en: and the moon, which is but a reflecting mirror, does not give back sufficient light to enable us to perceive objects of lesser magnitude.”
zh: 而月亮只是一面反射镜，不会发出足够的光，使我们能够看到较小星等的物体。”

en: “Well, then, what do you propose to do?” asked the general.
zh: “那么，你打算怎么办?”将军问。

en: “Would you give your projectile a diameter of sixty feet?”
zh: “你能给你的炮弹直径60英尺吗?”

en: “Not so.”
zh: “不是这样的。”

en: “Do you intend, then, to increase the luminous power of the moon?”
zh: “那么，你打算增加月亮的发光能力吗?”

en: “Exactly so. If I can succeed in diminishing the density of the atmosphere through which the moon’s light has to travel I shall have rendered her light more intense.
zh: 正是如此。如果我能成功地减小月亮光线穿过的大气层的密度，我将使她的光线更加强烈。

en: To effect that object it will be enough to establish a telescope on some elevated mountain.
zh: 为了实现那个目标，在某个高山上建立一个望远镜就足够了。

en: That is what we will do.”
zh: 这就是我们将要做的。”

en: “I give it up,” answered the major.
zh: “我放弃了,”少校回答。

en: “You have such a way of simplifying things.
zh: “你总是把事情简单化。

en: And what enlargement do you expect to obtain in this way?”
zh: 你希望通过这种方式得到什么样的放大?”

en: “One of 48,000 times, which should bring the moon within an apparent distance of five miles;
zh: “四万八千次中的一次，它应该把月球带到视距五英里之内;

en: and, in order to be visible, objects need not have a diameter of more than nine feet.”
zh: 而且，为了能够被看到，物体的直径不必超过9英尺。”

en: “So, then,” cried J.T. Maston, “our projectile need not be more than nine feet in diameter.”
zh: “那么,”J.T. 马斯顿喊道，“我们的炮弹直径不能超过9英尺。”

en: “Let me observe, however,” interrupted Major Elphinstone, “this will involve a weight such as—”
zh: “不过，让我观察一下,”埃尔芬斯通少校打断道，“这将涉及到一个重量，比如——”

en: “My dear major,” replied Barbicane, “before discussing its weight permit me to enumerate some of the marvels which our ancestors have achieved in this respect.
zh: “我亲爱的少校,”巴比肯回答说，“在讨论它的重量之前，请允许我列举一些我们的祖先在这方面所取得的奇迹。

en: I don’t mean to pretend that the science of gunnery has not advanced,
zh: 我不想假装射击科学没有进步,

en: but it is as well to bear in mind that during the middle ages they obtained results more surprising,
zh: 但也要记住，在中世纪，他们取得了更令人惊讶的成果,

en: I will venture to say, than ours.
zh: 我敢说，比我们的还多。

en: For instance, during the siege of Constantinople by Mahomet II., in 1453, stone shot of 1,900 pounds weight were employed.
zh: 例如，在1453年被穆罕默德二世围攻君士坦丁堡期间，使用了1900磅重的石弹。

en: At Malta, in the time of the knights, there was a gun of the fortress of St.
zh: 在骑士时代的马耳他，有一支圣保罗要塞的枪。

en: Elmo which threw a projectile weighing 2,500 pounds.
zh: 埃尔默发射了一枚重达2500磅的炮弹。

en: And, now, what is the extent of what we have seen ourselves? Armstrong guns discharging shot of 500 pounds, and the Rodman guns projectiles of half a ton!
zh: 那么，现在，我们看到自己的程度如何？阿姆斯特朗的炮弹重达500磅，而罗德曼的炮弹重达半吨！

en: It seems, then, that if projectiles have gained in range, they have lost far more in weight.
zh: 看起来，如果射程增加，它们的重量就会减少很多。

en: Now, if we turn our efforts in that direction, we ought to arrive, with the progress on science, at ten times the weight of the shot of Mahomet II.
zh: 现在，如果我们朝那个方向努力，随着科学的进步，我们应该可以达到，重量是穆罕默德二世射击重量的十倍。

en: and the Knights of Malta.”
zh: 和马耳他骑士团”

en: “Clearly,” replied the major;
zh: “显然,”少校回答说;

en: “but what metal do you calculate upon employing?”
zh: “但你打算用什么金属呢?”

en: “Simply cast iron,” said General Morgan.
zh: 摩根将军说: “简直就是铸铁。”。

en: “But,” interrupted the major, “since the weight of a shot is proportionate to its volume, an iron ball of nine feet in diameter would be of tremendous weight.”
zh: “但是,”少校打断了他，“因为一发子弹的重量与它的体积成正比，一个直径九英尺的铁球将会有巨大的重量。”

en: “Yes, if it were solid, not if it were hollow.”
zh: “是的，如果是实心的，而不是空心的。”

en: “Hollow? then it would be a shell?”
zh: “空心的? 那就是贝壳了?”

en: “Yes, a shell,” replied Barbicane;
zh: “是的，一个贝壳,”巴比康回答说;

en: “decidely it must be.
zh: 一定是。

en: A solid shot of 108 inches would weigh more than 200,000 pounds, a weight evidently far too great.
zh: 一个108英寸的实心镜头的重量将超过200,000磅，这个重量显然太大了。

en: Still, as we must reserve a certain stability for our projectile, I propose to give it a weight of 20,000 pounds.”
zh: 尽管如此，由于我们必须为我们的炮弹保留一定的稳定性，我建议给它一个20,000磅的重量。”

en: “What, then, will be the thickness of the sides?” asked the major.
zh: “那么，两边的厚度是多少呢?”少校问。

en: “If we follow the usual proportion,” replied Morgan, “a diameter of 108 inches would require sides of two feet thickness, or less.”
zh: “如果我们按照通常的比例,”摩根回答说，“直径为108英寸的边需要两英尺或更小的厚度。”

en: “That would be too much,” replied Barbicane;
zh: “那太多了,”巴比肯回答说;

en: “for you will observe that the question is not that of a shot intended to pierce an iron plate;
zh: “因为你们会发现问题不在于打穿铁板的子弹;

en: it will suffice to give it sides strong enough to resist the pressure of the gas.
zh: 足以使它的侧面强大到足以抵抗气体的压力。

en: The problem, therefore, is this—What thickness ought a cast-iron shell to have in order not to weight more than 20,000 pounds? Our clever secretary will soon enlighten us upon this point.”
zh: 因此，问题在于: 一个铸铁外壳应该有多厚才不会超过20,000磅？我们聪明的秘书很快就会告诉我们这一点。”

en: “Nothing easier.” replied the worthy secretary of the committee;
zh: “没有比这更容易的了。”委员会的秘书回答说

en: and, rapidly tracing a few algebraical formulae upon paper, among which n2 and x2 frequently appeared, he presently said:
zh: 他迅速地在纸上描述了几个代数公式，其中经常出现 n2和 x2，他立刻说:

en: “The sides will require a thickness of less than two inches.”
zh: “两边的厚度要小于两英寸”

en: “Will that be enough?” asked the major doubtfully.
zh: “这样够了吗?”少校疑惑地问。

en: “Clearly not!” replied the president.
zh: “显然不是!”总统回答。

en: “What is to be done, then?” said Elphinstone, with a puzzled air.
zh: “那该怎么办呢?”埃尔芬斯通带着疑惑的神情问道。

en: “Employ another metal instead of iron.”
zh: “用另一种金属代替铁”

en: “Copper?” said Morgan.
zh: “铜?”摩根说。

en: “No! that would be too heavy.
zh: “不行，那样太重了。

en: I have better than that to offer.”
zh: 我有更好的提议。”

en: “What then?” asked the major.
zh: “然后呢?”少校问。

en: “Aluminum!” replied Barbicane.
zh: “铝!”巴比康回答。

en: “Aluminum?” cried his three colleagues in chorus.
zh: “铝?”他的三个同事齐声喊道。

en: “Unquestionably, my friends.
zh: 毫无疑问，我的朋友们。

en: This valuable metal possesses the whiteness of silver, the indestructibility of gold, the tenacity of iron, the fusibility of copper, the lightness of glass.
zh: 这种贵重金属具有银的白度、金的不可破坏性、铁的韧性、铜的可熔性、玻璃的轻度。

en: It is easily wrought, is very widely distributed, forming the base of most of the rocks, is three times lighter than iron,
zh: 它易于锻造，分布非常广，形成大部分岩石的基底，比铁轻三倍,

en: and seems to have been created for the express purpose of furnishing us with the material for our projectile.”
zh: 似乎是为了给我们的发射物提供材料而创造出来的。”

en: “But, my dear president,” said the major, “is not the cost price of aluminum extremely high?”
zh: “可是，我亲爱的总统,”少校说，“铝的成本不是非常高吗?”

en: “It was so at its first discovery, but it has fallen now to nine dollars a pound.”
zh: “第一次发现时是这样，但现在已跌至每磅9美元。”

en: “But still, nine dollars a pound!” replied the major, who was not willing readily to give in;
zh: “可是，还是九块钱一磅!”少校回答，他不愿意屈服;

en: “even that is an enormous price.”
zh: “即便如此，代价也是巨大的。”

en: “Undoubtedly, my dear major;
zh: “毫无疑问，我亲爱的少校;

en: but not beyond our reach.”
zh: 但不会超出我们的能力范围”

en: “What will the projectile weigh then?” asked Morgan.
zh: “那么这个炮弹的重量是多少?”摩根问道。

en: “Here is the result of my calculations,” replied Barbicane.
zh: “这是我的计算结果,”巴比肯回答说。

en: “A shot of 108 inches in diameter, and twelve inches in thickness, would weigh, in cast-iron, 67,440 pounds;
zh: “一个直径108英寸，厚12英寸的镜头，铸铁的重量是67,440磅;

en: cast in aluminum, its weight will be reduced to 19,250 pounds.”
zh: 用铝铸造，它的重量将减少到19,250磅。”

en: “Capital!” cried the major;
zh: “太好了!”少校喊道;

en: “but do you know that, at nine dollars a pound, this projectile will cost—”
zh: “但是你知道吗，这种炮弹的价格是每磅9美元ーー”

en: “One hundred and seventy-three thousand and fifty dollars ($173,050).
I know it quite well.
zh: 我很清楚。

en: But fear not, my friends;
zh: 但是不要害怕，我的朋友们;

en: the money will not be wanting for our enterprise.
zh: 我们的企业不会缺钱。

en: I will answer for it.
zh: 我会为此负责的。

en: Now what say you to aluminum, gentlemen?”
zh: 先生们，你们对铝有什么看法?”

en: “Adopted!” replied the three members of the committee.
zh: “领养的!”委员会的三个成员答道。

en: So ended the first meeting.
zh: 第一次会议就这样结束了。

en: The question of the projectile was definitely settled.
zh: 抛射物的问题已经解决了。

en: CHAPTER VIII. HISTORY OF THE CANNON
zh: 第八章大炮的历史

en: The resolutions passed at the last meeting produced a great effect out of doors.
zh: 上次会议通过的决议在户外产生了很大的影响。

en: Timid people took fright at the idea of a shot weighing 20,000 pounds being launched into space;
zh: 胆小的人们一想到一个重达20000磅的火箭被发射到太空，就会感到害怕;

en: they asked what cannon could ever transmit a sufficient velocity to such a mighty mass.
zh: 他们问，什么样的大炮能够将足够的速度传递给如此巨大的质量。

en: The minutes of the second meeting were destined triumphantly to answer such questions.
zh: 第二次会议的记录注定要胜利地回答这些问题。

en: The following evening the discussion was renewed.
zh: 第二天晚上，讨论重新开始。

en: “My dear colleagues,” said Barbicane, without further preamble, “the subject now before us is the construction of the engine, its length, its composition, and its weight.
zh: “我亲爱的同事们,”巴比肯没有多说，“现在摆在我们面前的主题是发动机的结构、长度、组成和重量。

en: It is probable that we shall end by giving it gigantic dimensions;
zh: 我们很可能以赋予它巨大的尺寸作为结束;

en: but however great may be the difficulties in the way, our mechanical genius will readily surmount them.
zh: 但是无论前进的道路上有多大的困难，我们的机械天才都能轻易地克服它们。

en: Be good enough, then, to give me your attention, and do not hesitate to make objections at the close.
zh: 那么，请把你们的注意力放在我身上，并且在结束的时候毫不犹豫地提出反对意见。

en: I have no fear of them.
zh: 我不怕他们。

en: The problem before us is how to communicate an initial force of 12,000 yards per second to a shell of 108 inches in diameter, weighing 20,000 pounds.
zh: 摆在我们面前的问题是如何将每秒12,000码的初始力量传递给一个直径108英寸，重达20,000磅的炮弹。

en: Now when a projectile is launched into space, what happens to it? It is acted upon by three independent forces:
zh: 现在，当一个抛射物被发射到太空时，它会发生什么? 它受到三个独立的力的作用:

en: the resistance of the air, the attraction of the earth, and the force of impulsion with which it is endowed.
zh: 空气的阻力，地球的吸引力，以及赋予它的冲力。

en: Let us examine these three forces.
zh: 让我们来研究一下这三种力。

en: The resistance of the air is of little importance.
zh: 空气的阻力并不重要。

en: The atmosphere of the earth does not exceed forty miles.
zh: 地球的大气层不超过四十英里。

en: Now, with the given rapidity, the projectile will have traversed this in five seconds, and the period is too brief for the resistance of the medium to be regarded otherwise than as insignificant.
zh: 现在，按照给定的速度，炮弹将在5秒内穿过这里，这个时间段太短了，媒介的阻力太小了，以至于被认为是微不足道的。

en: Proceding, then, to the attraction of the earth, that is, the weight of the shell, we know that this weight will diminish in the inverse ratio of the square of the distance.
zh: 继续研究地球的吸引力，也就是外壳的重量，我们知道这个重量会以距离的平方反比减小。

en: When a body left to itself falls to the surface of the earth, it falls five feet in the first second;
zh: 当一个物体落到地球表面时，它会在第一秒钟落下五英尺;

en: and if the same body were removed 257,542 miles further off, in other words, to the distance of the moon, its fall would be reduced to about half a line in the first second.
zh: 如果同一个物体被移到离月球257,542英里远的地方，换句话说，它的坠落将在第一秒钟减少到大约半条直线。

en: That is almost equivalent to a state of perfect rest.
zh: 这几乎等同于完全休息的状态。

en: Our business, then, is to overcome progressively this action of gravitation.
zh: 那么，我们的任务就是逐步克服这种引力作用。

en: The mode of accomplishing that is by the force of impulsion.”
zh: 实现这一目标的方式是通过冲动的力量。”

en: “There’s the difficulty,” broke in the major.
zh: “这就是困难所在,”少校插嘴说。

en: “True,” replied the president;
zh: “没错,”校长回答说;

en: “but we will overcome that, for the force of impulsion will depend on the length of the engine and the powder employed, the latter being limited only by the resisting power of the former.
zh: “但我们会克服这一点，因为冲力将取决于发动机的长度和所使用的火药，后者只受到前者的阻力的限制。

en: Our business, then, to-day is with the dimensions of the cannon.”
zh: 那么，我们今天的任务就是研究大炮的尺寸。”

en: “Now, up to the present time,” said Barbicane, “our longest guns have not exceeded twenty-five feet in length.
zh: “现在，到目前为止,”巴比肯说，“我们最长的枪还没有超过25英尺长。

en: We shall therefore astonish the world by the dimensions we shall be obliged to adopt.
zh: 因此，我们不得不采取的措施将使世界感到震惊。

en: It must evidently be, then, a gun of great range, since the length of the piece will increase the detention of the gas accumulated behind the projectile;
zh: 那么，这显然是一支射程很远的枪，因为这支枪的长度会增加弹丸后面积累的气体的滞留量;

en: but there is no advantage in passing certain limits.”
zh: 但超过某些限制并没有好处。”

en: “Quite so,” said the major.
zh: “确实如此,”少校说。

en: “What is the rule in such a case?”
zh: “这种情况下的规则是什么?”

en: “Ordinarily the length of a gun is twenty to twenty-five times the diameter of the shot, and its weight two hundred and thirty-five to two hundred and forty times that of the shot.”
zh: 一般来说，枪的长度是子弹直径的二十到二十五倍，重量是子弹直径的二百三十五到二百四十倍

en: “That is not enough,” cried J. T. Maston impetuously.
zh: “那是不够的,”J.T. 马斯顿激动地喊道。

en: “I agree with you, my good friend;
zh: “我同意你的观点，我的好朋友;

en: and, in fact, following this proportion for a projectile nine feet in diameter, weighing 30,000 pounds,
zh: 事实上，根据这个比例一个直径9英尺重达30,000磅的炮弹,

en: the gun would only have a length of two hundred and twenty- five feet, and a weight of 7,200,000 pounds.”
zh: 这把枪的长度只有225英尺，重量只有720万磅。”

en: “Ridiculous!” rejoined Maston.
zh: “荒谬!”马斯顿回答道。

en: “As well take a pistol.”
zh: “还不如带把手枪”

en: “I think so too,” replied Barbicane;
zh: “我也这么认为,”巴比康回答说;

en: “that is why I propose to quadruple that length, and to construct a gun of nine hundred feet.”
zh: “这就是为什么我提议将这个长度增加四倍，并建造一支900英尺长的枪”

en: The general and the major offered some objections;
zh: 将军和少校提出了一些反对意见;

en: nevertheless, the proposition, actively supported by the secretary, was definitely adopted.
zh: 尽管如此，这个得到秘书积极支持的建议还是被采纳了。

en: “But,” said Elphinstone, “what thickness must we give it?”
zh: “可是,”埃尔芬斯通说，“我们该给它多厚呢?”

en: “A thickness of six feet,” replied Barbicane.
zh: “六英尺厚,”巴比康回答。

en: “You surely don’t think of mounting a mass like that upon a carriage?” asked the major.
zh: 少校问道: “你肯定不会想到在马车上安装一个这样的东西吧?”。

en: “It would be a superb idea, though,” said Maston.
zh: “不过，这将是一个极好的主意,”马斯顿说。

en: “But impracticable,” replied Barbicane.
zh: “但是不切实际,”巴比康回答。

en: “No, I think of sinking this engine in the earth alone, binding it with hoops of wrought iron, and finally surrounding it with a thick mass of masonry of stone and cement.
zh: “不，我想把这台发动机单独沉入地下，用铁箍把它捆起来，最后用厚厚的石块和水泥围起来。

en: The piece once cast, it must be bored with great precision, so as to preclude any possible windage.
zh: 一旦铸件，它必须非常精确地钻孔，以防止任何可能的偏差。

en: So there will be no loss whatever of gas, and all the expansive force of the powder will be employed in the propulsion.”
zh: 所以不会损失任何气体，火药的所有膨胀力都将用于推进。”

en: “One simple question,” said Elphinstone: “is our gun to be rifled?”
zh: “一个简单的问题,”埃尔芬斯通说: “我们的枪是用来装膛的吗?”

en: “No, certainly not,” replied Barbicane;
zh: “不，当然不是,”巴比康回答说;

en: “we require an enormous initial velocity;
zh: “我们需要巨大的初速度;

en: and you are well aware that a shot quits a rifled gun less rapidly than it does a smooth-bore.”
zh: 而且你很清楚，膛线枪射出子弹的速度要比平膛枪慢。”

en: “True,” rejoined the major.
zh: “是的,”少校回答道。

en: The committee here adjourned for a few minutes to tea and sandwiches.
zh: 委员会在这里休会几分钟，喝喝茶，吃吃三明治。

en: On the discussion being renewed, “Gentlemen,” said Barbicane, “we must now take into consideration the metal to be employed.
zh: “先生们,”巴比肯说，“我们现在必须考虑采用哪种金属。

en: Our cannon must be possessed of great tenacity, great hardness, be infusible by heat, indissoluble, and inoxidable by the corrosive action of acids.”
zh: 我们的大炮必须具有很强的韧性，很强的硬度，不能被热融化，不能溶解，不能被酸的腐蚀作用氧化。”

en: “There is no doubt about that,” replied the major;
zh: “这是毫无疑问的,”少校回答说;

en: “and as we shall have to employ an immense quantity of metal, we shall not be at a loss for choice.”
zh: “由于我们将不得不使用大量的金属，我们不会无从选择”

en: “Well, then,” said Morgan, “I propose the best alloy hitherto known, which consists of one hundred parts of copper, twelve of tin, and six of brass.”
zh: “那么,”摩根说，“我建议使用迄今为止所知道的最好的合金，它由一百份铜、十二份锡和六份黄铜组成。”

en: “I admit,” replied the president, “that this composition has yielded excellent results, but in the present case it would be too expensive, and very difficult to work.
zh: “我承认,”校长回答说，“这个作品已经产生了很好的效果，但是在目前的情况下，它太昂贵了，而且很难工作。

en: I think, then, that we ought to adopt a material excellent in its way and of low price, such as cast iron.
zh: 那么，我认为我们应该采用一种性能优良、价格低廉的材料，如铸铁。

en: What is your advice, major?”
zh: 你有什么建议，少校?”

en: “I quite agree with you,” replied Elphinstone.
zh: “我完全同意你的看法,”埃尔芬斯通回答。

en: “In fact,” continued Barbicane, “cast iron costs ten times less than bronze;
zh: “事实上,”巴比康接着说，“铸铁比青铜便宜十倍;

en: it is easy to cast, it runs readily from the moulds of sand, it is easy of manipulation, it is at once economical of money and of time.
zh: 它易于铸造，易于从砂型中流出，易于操纵，既省钱又省时。

en: In addition, it is excellent as a material, and I well remember that during the war, at the siege of Atlanta, some iron guns fired one thousand rounds at intervals of twenty minutes without injury.”
zh: 此外，它作为一种材料非常优秀，我清楚地记得在战争期间，在亚特兰大围城期间，一些铁枪每隔二十分钟发射一千发子弹，没有造成任何伤害。”

en: “Cast iron is very brittle, though,” replied Morgan.
zh: “不过，铸铁很脆,”摩根回答说。

en: “Yes, but it possesses great resistance.
zh: “是的，但它有很大的阻力。

en: I will now ask our worthy secretary to calculate the weight of a cast-iron gun with a bore of nine feet and a thickness of six feet of metal.”
zh: 我现在要请我们尊敬的秘书计算一把口径为九英尺，金属厚度为六英尺的铸铁枪的重量。”

en: “In a moment,” replied Maston.
zh: “等一下,”马斯顿回答。

en: Then, dashing off some algebraical formulae with marvelous facility, in a minute or two he declared the following result:
zh: 然后，他以一种不可思议的方式匆匆写下一些代数公式，一两分钟后，他宣布了下面的结果:

en: “The cannon will weigh 68,040 tons.
zh: 大炮重达68040吨。

en: And, at two cents a pound, it will cost—”
zh: 而且，每磅两美分的价格是... ...”

en: “Two million five hundred and ten thousand seven hundred and one dollars.”
zh: “二百五十一万七百零一美元”

en: Maston, the major, and the general regarded Barbicane with uneasy looks.
zh: 少校马斯顿和将军不安地看着巴比肯。

en: “Well, gentlemen,” replied the president, “I repeat what I said yesterday.
zh: “好了，先生们,”总统回答说，“我重复我昨天说的话。

en: Make yourselves easy;
zh: 放轻松

en: the millions will not be wanting.”
zh: 数百万美元将不再匮乏。”

en: With this assurance of their president the committee separated, after having fixed their third meeting for the following evening.
zh: 在主席的保证下，委员会把第三次会议安排在第二天晚上举行，然后分开了。

en: CHAPTER IX. THE QUESTION OF THE POWDERS
zh: 第九章粉末问题

en: There remained for consideration merely the question of powders.
zh: 剩下的只是考虑粉末的问题。

en: The public awaited with interest its final decision.
zh: 公众饶有兴趣地等待着最后的决定。

en: The size of the projectile, the length of the cannon being settled, what would be the quantity of powder necessary to produce impulsion?
zh: 炮弹的大小，加农炮的长度，需要多少火药才能产生推进力？

en: It is generally asserted that gunpowder was invented in the fourteenth century by the monk Schwartz, who paid for his grand discovery with his life.
zh: 人们普遍认为火药是由修道士施瓦茨在14世纪发明的，他为他的伟大发现付出了生命的代价。

en: It is, however, pretty well proved that this story ought to be ranked among the legends of the middle ages.
zh: 然而，这个故事已经很好地证明了它应该被列入中世纪的传说之中。

en: Gunpowder was not invented by any one;
zh: 火药不是任何人发明的;

en: it was the lineal successor of the Greek fire, which, like itself, was composed of sulfur and saltpeter.
zh: 它是希腊火的直系继承者，和它本身一样，是由硫磺和硝石组成的。

en: Few persons are acquainted with the mechanical power of gunpowder.
zh: 很少有人知道火药的机械力量。

en: Now this is precisely what is necessary to be understood in order to comprehend the importance of the question submitted to the committee.
zh: 现在，为了理解提交给委员会的问题的重要性，这正是必须理解的。

en: A litre of gunpowder weighs about two pounds;
zh: 一升火药重约两磅;

en: during combustion it produces 400 litres of gas.
zh: 在燃烧过程中产生400升气体。

en: This gas, on being liberated and acted upon by temperature raised to 2,400 degrees, occupies a space of 4,000 litres:
zh: 这种气体一旦被释放出来，随着温度升高到2400度而作用，占据了4000升的空间:

en: consequently the volume of powder is to the volume of gas produced by its combustion as 1 to 4,000.
zh: 因此，粉末的体积等于其燃烧产生的气体的体积为1至4,000。

en: One may judge, therefore, of the tremendous pressure on this gas when compressed within a space 4,000 times too confined.
zh: 因此，人们可以判断，当这种气体被压缩在一个过于狭窄的4000倍的空间里时，它所承受的巨大压力。

en: All this was, of course, well known to the members of the committee when they met on the following evening.
zh: 当然，第二天晚上委员会的成员们开会时，他们都知道这一切。

en: The first speaker on this occasion was Major Elphinstone, who had been the director of the gunpowder factories during the war.
zh: 这次会议的第一位发言者是埃尔芬斯通少校，他是战争期间火药厂的厂长。

en: “Gentlemen,” said this distinguished chemist, “I begin with some figures which will serve as the basis of our calculation.
zh: “先生们,”这位杰出的化学家说，“我从一些数字开始，这些数字将作为我们计算的基础。

en: The old 24-pounder shot required for its discharge sixteen pounds of powder.”
zh: 旧的24磅炮弹需要发射16磅的火药。”

en: “You are certain of this amount?” broke in Barbicane.
zh: “你确定这个数目?”在 Barbicane 插嘴问道。

en: “Quite certain,” replied the major.
zh: “非常确定,”少校回答。

en: “The Armstrong cannon employs only seventy-five pounds of powder for a projectile of eight hundred pounds,
zh: “阿姆斯特朗加农炮的火药只有75磅，炮弹重达800磅”

en: and the Rodman Columbiad uses only one hundred and sixty pounds of powder to send its half ton shot a distance of six miles.
zh: 罗德曼 · 哥伦比亚号只用了160磅的火药将其半吨重的炮弹射出6英里的距离。

en: These facts cannot be called in question, for I myself raised the point during the depositions taken before the committee of artillery.”
zh: 这些事实不容置疑，因为我自己在炮兵委员会听取证词时就提出了这一点。”

en: “Quite true,” said the general.
zh: “非常正确,”将军说。

en: “Well,” replied the major, “these figures go to prove that the quantity of powder is not increased with the weight of the shot;
zh: “嗯,”少校回答说，“这些数字可以证明火药的数量并没有随着子弹的重量而增加;

en: that is to say, if a 24-pounder shot requires sixteen pounds of powder;
zh: 也就是说，如果一发24磅的子弹需要16磅的火药;

en: in other words, if in ordinary guns we employ a quantity of powder equal to two-thirds of the weight of the projectile, this proportion is not constant.
zh: 换句话说，如果在普通火炮中，我们使用的火药量相当于炮弹重量的三分之二，那么这个比例就不是恒定的。

en: Calculate, and you will see that in place of three hundred and thirty-three pounds of powder, the quantity is reduced to no more than one hundred and sixty pounds.”
zh: 计算一下，你就会发现333磅的火药被减少到不超过160磅。”

en: “What are you aiming at?” asked the president.
zh: “你的目标是什么?”总统问道。

en: “If you push your theory to extremes, my dear major,” said J. T. Maston, “you will get to this, that as soon as your shot becomes sufficiently heavy you will not require any powder at all.”
zh: “如果你把你的理论推向极端，我亲爱的少校,”J · T · 马斯顿说，“你就会知道，一旦你的弹药足够重，你就不需要任何火药了。”

en: “Our friend Maston is always at his jokes, even in serious matters,” cried the major;
zh: “我们的朋友马斯顿总是爱开玩笑，即使是在严肃的事情上,”少校叫道;

en: “but let him make his mind easy, I am going presently to propose gunpowder enough to satisfy his artillerist’s propensities.
zh: “不过让他放心吧，我现在打算提供足够的火药来满足他的炮兵的嗜好。

en: I only keep to statistical facts when I say that, during the war, and for the very largest guns,
zh: 我只是在统计数据的基础上说，在战争期间，对于最大的枪支,

en: the weight of the powder was reduced, as the result of experience, to a tenth part of the weight of the shot.”
zh: 根据经验，火药的重量减少到了子弹重量的十分之一。”

en: “Perfectly correct,” said Morgan;
zh: “完全正确,”摩根说;

en: “but before deciding the quantity of powder necessary to give the impulse, I think it would be as well—”
zh: “但在决定冲击所需的粉末数量之前，我认为还是...”

en: “We shall have to employ a large-grained powder,” continued the major;
zh: “我们将不得不使用大颗粒的粉末,”少校继续说;

en: “its combustion is more rapid than that of the small.”
zh: “它的燃烧速度比小的要快”

en: “No doubt about that,” replied Morgan;
zh: “毫无疑问,”摩根回答说;

en: “but it is very destructive, and ends by enlarging the bore of the pieces.”
zh: 但它具有很强的破坏性，最终会扩大碎片的孔径

en: “Granted; but that which is injurious to a gun destined to perform long service is not so to our Columbiad.
zh: “当然，但是对一把注定要长期服役的枪有害的东西，对我们的 Columbiad 却不是这样。

en: We shall run no danger of an explosion;
zh: 我们不会有爆炸的危险;

en: and it is necessary that our powder should take fire instantaneously in order that its mechanical effect may be complete.”
zh: 我们的火药必须立即着火，这样才能达到完全的机械效果。”

en: “We must have,” said Maston, “several touch-holes, so as to fire it at different points at the same time.”
zh: “我们一定有好几个接触孔,”马斯顿说，“这样才能同时在不同的地方发射。”

en: “Certainly,” replied Elphinstone;
zh: “当然,”埃尔芬斯通答道;

en: “but that will render the working of the piece more difficult.
zh: ”但这会使作品的制作更加困难。

en: I return then to my large-grained powder, which removes those difficulties.
zh: 然后我回到我的大颗粒粉末，这消除了这些困难。

en: In his Columbiad charges Rodman employed a powder as large as chestnuts, made of willow charcoal, simply dried in cast- iron pans.
zh: 在他的哥伦比亚指控中，罗德曼使用了一种像栗子那么大的粉末，由柳木炭制成，简单地在铸铁锅中烘干。

en: This powder was hard and glittering, left no trace upon the hand, contained hydrogen and oxygen in large proportion,
zh: 这种粉末坚硬而闪亮，手上没有任何痕迹，含有大量的氢气和氧气,

en: took fire instantaneously, and, though very destructive, did not sensibly injure the mouth-piece.”
zh: 立即开火，尽管破坏性很大，但没有明显地损伤口罩。”

en: Up to this point Barbicane had kept aloof from the discussion;
zh: 到目前为止，巴比康一直置身于讨论之外;

en: he left the others to speak while he himself listened;
zh: 他留下其他人说话，自己听着;

en: he had evidently got an idea.
zh: 他显然有了一个主意。

en: He now simply said, “Well, my friends, what quantity of powder do you propose?”
zh: 他现在只是简单地说，“那么，我的朋友们，你们打算用多少火药呢?”

en: The three members looked at one another.
zh: 三个成员面面相觑。

en: “Two hundred thousand pounds.” at last said Morgan.
zh: “二十万英镑。”摩根终于说道。

en: “Five hundred thousand,” added the major.
zh: “五十万,”少校补充道。

en: “Eight hundred thousand,” screamed Maston.
zh: “八十万,”马斯顿尖叫道。

en: A moment of silence followed this triple proposal;
zh: 在这三重提议之后，我们默哀了一会儿;

en: it was at last broken by the president.
zh: 它最终被总统打破了。

en: “Gentlemen,” he quietly said, “I start from this principle, that the resistance of a gun, constructed under the given conditions, is unlimited.
zh: “先生们,”他平静地说，“我从这个原则出发，在给定条件下构造的枪的阻力是无限的。

en: I shall surprise our friend Maston, then, by stigmatizing his calculations as timid;
zh: 那么，我要给我们的朋友马斯顿一个惊喜，说他的计算是胆小的;

en: and I propose to double his 800,000 pounds of powder.”
zh: 我提议把他的80万磅火药加倍”

en: “Sixteen hundred thousand pounds?” shouted Maston, leaping from his seat.
zh: “十六万英镑?”马斯顿从座位上跳起来喊道。

en: “Just so.”
zh: “就是这样。”

en: “We shall have to come then to my ideal of a cannon half a mile long;
zh: “到那时，我们将不得不实现我的理想——半英里长的大炮;

en: for you see 1,600,000 pounds will occupy a space of about 20,000 cubic feet;
zh: 因为你看一百六十万磅就占据了大约两万立方英尺的空间;

en: and since the contents of your cannon do not exceed 54,000 cubic feet, it would be half full;
zh: 而且由于你们的大炮装载量不超过54,000立方英尺，它将是半满的;

en: and the bore will not be more than long enough for the gas to communicate to the projectile sufficient impulse.”
zh: 孔的长度不足以使气体与弹丸产生足够的冲力。”

en: “Nevertheless,” said the president, “I hold to that quantity of powder.
zh: “尽管如此,”总统说，“我还是坚持那个数量的火药。

en: Now, 1,600,000 pounds of powder will create 6,000,000,000 litres of gas.
zh: 现在，160万磅的火药将产生60亿公升的气体。

en: Six thousand millions! You quite understand?”
zh: 六千万! 你明白吗?”

en: “What is to be done then?” said the general.
zh: “那该怎么办呢?”将军说。

en: “The thing is very simple;
zh: “事情很简单;

en: we must reduce this enormous quantity of powder, while preserving to it its mechanical power.”
zh: 我们必须减少这种巨大数量的火药，同时保留它的机械力量。”

en: “Good; but by what means?”
zh: “很好，但是用什么方法呢?”

en: “I am going to tell you,” replied Barbicane quietly.
zh: “我要告诉你,”巴比肯平静地回答。

en: “Nothing is more easy than to reduce this mass to one quarter of its bulk.
zh: “没有什么比把这个质量减少到其体积的四分之一更容易的了。

en: You know that curious cellular matter which constitutes the elementary tissues of vegetable?
zh: 你知道构成蔬菜基本组织的那种奇怪的细胞物质吗？

en: This substance is found quite pure in many bodies, especially in cotton, which is nothing more than the down of the seeds of the cotton plant.
zh: 这种物质在许多人的身体里都可以找到，特别是在棉花中，它只不过是棉花种子的绒毛而已。

en: Now cotton, combined with cold nitric acid, become transformed into a substance eminently insoluble, combustible, and explosive.
zh: 现在，棉花和冷硝酸结合在一起，变成了一种不溶于水、易燃易爆的物质。

en: It was first discovered in 1832, by Braconnot, a French chemist, who called it xyloidine.
zh: 1832年，法国化学家布拉科诺特首次发现了木糖苷。

en: In 1838 another Frenchman, Pelouze, investigated its different properties, and finally, in 1846, Schonbein, professor of chemistry at Bale, proposed its employment for purposes of war.
zh: 1838年，另一个法国人，Pelouze，研究了它的不同性质，最后，在1846年，贝尔大学的化学教授肖恩拜因，提议将其用于战争目的。

en: This powder, now called pyroxyle, or fulminating cotton, is prepared with great facility by simply plunging cotton for fifteen minutes in nitric acid,
zh: 这种粉末，现在被称为焦炭，或爆炸棉花，是制备非常容易，只需将棉花在硝酸中浸泡15分钟,

en: then washing it in water, then drying it, and it is ready for use.”
zh: 然后用水冲洗，然后烘干，就可以使用了。”

en: “Nothing could be more simple,” said Morgan.
zh: “没有比这更简单的了,”摩根说。

en: “Moreover, pyroxyle is unaltered by moisture—a valuable property to us, inasmuch as it would take several days to charge the cannon.
zh: “此外，水分不会改变火山灰的性质，这对我们来说是一种宝贵的财富，因为给大炮充电需要好几天的时间。

en: It ignites at 170 degrees in place of 240, and its combustion is so rapid that one may set light to it on the top of the ordinary powder, without the latter having time to ignite.”
zh: 它的燃烧温度是170度，而不是240度，它的燃烧速度如此之快，以至于人们可以在普通粉末上点燃它，而普通粉末没有时间点燃。”

en: “Perfect!” exclaimed the major.
zh: “太好了!”少校叫道。

en: “Only it is more expensive.”
zh: “只是它更贵。”

en: “What matter?” cried J. T. Maston.
zh: “什么事?”J.T. 马斯顿叫道。

en: “Finally, it imparts to projectiles a velocity four times superior to that of gunpowder.
zh: “最后，它赋予弹丸四倍于火药的速度。

en: I will even add, that if we mix it with one-eighth of its own weight of nitrate of potassium, its expansive force is again considerably augmented.”
zh: 我还要补充一点，如果我们把它和它自身重量的八分之一的硝酸钾混合，它的膨胀力会再次大大增强。”

en: “Will that be necessary?” asked the major.
zh: “有这个必要吗?”少校问。

en: “I think not,” replied Barbicane.
zh: “我不这么认为,”巴比肯回答。

en: “So, then, in place of 1,600,000 pounds of powder, we shall have but 400,000 pounds of fulminating cotton;
zh: “那么，取代160万磅火药的是40万磅爆炸棉花;

en: and since we can, without danger, compress 500 pounds of cotton into twenty-seven cubic feet, the whole quantity will not occupy a height of more than 180 feet within the bore of the Columbiad.
zh: 由于我们可以毫无危险地把500磅的棉花压缩成27立方英尺，所以整个数量不会占据哥伦比亚号钻孔内超过180英尺的高度。

en: In this way the shot will have more than 700 feet of bore to traverse under a force of 6,000,000,000 litres of gas before taking its flight toward the moon.”
zh: 通过这种方式，在60亿升气体的作用下，射程将超过700英尺，然后飞向月球。”

en: At this juncture J. T. Maston could not repress his emotion;
zh: 在这个节骨眼上，J · T · 马斯顿无法抑制自己的情绪;

en: he flung himself into the arms of his friend with the violence of a projectile, and Barbicane would have been stove in if he had not been boom-proof.
zh: 他猛地投入朋友的怀抱，如果不是防爆，巴比肯早就被火烧死了。

en: This incident terminated the third meeting of the committee.
zh: 这一事件终止了委员会的第三次会议。

en: Barbicane and his bold colleagues, to whom nothing seemed impossible, had succeeding in solving the complex problems of projectile, cannon, and powder.
zh: 巴比康和他勇敢的同事们，对他们来说没有什么是不可能的，他们成功地解决了弹丸、大炮和火药的复杂问题。

en: Their plan was drawn up, and it only remained to put it into execution.
zh: 他们的计划已经制定好了，只剩下实施的时间了。

en: “A mere matter of detail, a bagatelle,” said J. T. Maston.
zh: “仅仅是一个细节问题，一个小问题,”J.T.Maston 说。

en: CHAPTER X. ONE ENEMY v.
zh: 第十章一个敌人。

en: TWENTY-FIVE MILLIONS OF FRIENDS
zh: 2500万朋友

en: The American public took a lively interest in the smallest details of the enterprise of the Gun Club.
zh: 美国公众对枪支俱乐部事业的细枝末节产生了浓厚的兴趣。

en: It followed day by day the discussion of the committee.
zh: 委员会的讨论日复一日地进行着。

en: The most simple preparations for the great experiment, the questions of figures which it involved, the mechanical difficulties to be resolved—in one word,
zh: 这个伟大实验最简单的准备工作，所涉及的数字问题，需要解决的机械难题ーー总之,

en: the entire plan of work—roused the popular excitement to the highest pitch.
zh: 整个工作计划ーー把公众的兴奋情绪激发到了极点。

en: The purely scientific attraction was suddenly intensified by the following incident:
zh: 以下事件突然加强了纯科学的吸引力:

en: We have seen what legions of admirers and friends Barbicane’s project had rallied round its author.
zh: 我们已经看到，巴比肯的项目吸引了大批的崇拜者和朋友，他们都支持该项目的作者。

en: There was, however, one single individual alone in all the States of the Union who protested against the attempt of the Gun Club.
zh: 然而，在美国的所有州中，只有一个人反对枪支俱乐部的企图。

en: He attacked it furiously on every opportunity, and human nature is such that Barbicane felt more keenly the opposition of that one man than he did the applause of all the others.
zh: 他抓住每一个机会猛烈地攻击它，而人的本性是如此的强烈，以至于巴比肯对那个人的反对比对其他所有人的掌声感到更加强烈。

en: He was well aware of the motive of this antipathy, the origin of this solitary enmity, the cause of its personality and old standing, and in what rivalry of self-love it had its rise.
zh: 他非常清楚这种反感的动机，这种孤独的敌意的起源，它的个性和古老地位的原因，以及它在自爱的竞争中产生了什么。

en: This persevering enemy the president of the Gun Club had never seen.
zh: 这位枪支俱乐部主席从未见过的顽强敌人。

en: Fortunate that it was so, for a meeting between the two men would certainly have been attended with serious consequences.
zh: 幸运的是，这两个人之间的会面肯定会带来严重的后果。

en: This rival was a man of science, like Barbicane himself, of a fiery, daring, and violent disposition;
zh: 这个竞争对手和巴比肯一样，都是一个有科学头脑的人，脾气暴躁，胆大妄为;

en: a pure Yankee. His name was Captain Nicholl;
zh: 一个纯粹的北方佬。他的名字是尼克尔上尉;

en: he lived at Philadelphia.
zh: 他住在费城。

en: Most people are aware of the curious struggle which arose during the Federal war between the guns and armor of iron-plated ships.
zh: 大多数人都知道在联邦战争期间发生的一场奇怪的战争，这场战争发生在镀铁战舰的枪炮和装甲之间。

en: The result was the entire reconstruction of the navy of both the continents;
zh: 其结果是两大洲海军的全面重建;

en: as the one grew heavier, the other became thicker in proportion.
zh: 随着一个变得越来越重，另一个也成比例地变得越来越厚。

en: The Merrimac, the Monitor, the Tennessee, the Weehawken discharged enormous projectiles themselves, after having been armor-clad against the projectiles of others.
zh: 梅里马克，摩尼特号，田纳西号，Weehawken 自己发射了巨大的炮弹，这些炮弹都是在穿上了防弹衣之后发射的。

en: In fact they did to others that which they would not they should do to them—that grand principle of immortality upon which rests the whole art of war.
zh: 事实上，他们对别人做了他们不应该对别人做的事情ーー这个伟大的不朽原则是整个战争艺术的基础。

en: Now if Barbicane was a great founder of shot, Nicholl was a great forger of plates;
zh: 如果说巴比肯是铅球的伟大创始人，尼科尔则是一个伟大的模板伪造者;

en: the one cast night and day at Baltimore, the other forged day and night at Philadelphia.
zh: 一个在巴尔的摩日夜演出，另一个在费城日夜演出。

en: As soon as ever Barbicane invented a new shot, Nicholl invented a new plate;
zh: 就在巴比肯发明了一种新的打法之后，尼科尔又发明了一种新的打法;

en: each followed a current of ideas essentially opposed to the other.
zh: 每一个都跟随着一股本质上相互对立的思潮。

en: Happily for these citizens, so useful to their country, a distance of from fifty to sixty miles separated them from one another, and they had never yet met.
zh: 对于这些对他们的国家如此有用的公民来说，幸运的是，五六十英里的距离把他们彼此分隔开来，他们从来没有见过面。

en: Which of these two inventors had the advantage over the other it was difficult to decide from the results obtained.
zh: 这两个发明家中哪一个比另一个有优势，很难从所获得的结果来判断。

en: By last accounts, however, it would seem that the armor-plate would in the end have to give way to the shot;
zh: 然而，根据最后的描述，似乎装甲板最终不得不让位给子弹;

en: nevertheless, there were competent judges who had their doubts on the point.
zh: 然而，也有胜任的法官对这一点表示怀疑。

en: At the last experiment the cylindro-conical projectiles of Barbicane stuck like so many pins in the Nicholl plates.
zh: 在最后一个实验中，巴比康的圆柱-圆锥形弹丸像尼科尔板上的许多针一样卡住了。

en: On that day the Philadelphia iron-forger then believed himself victorious, and could not evince contempt enough for his rival;
zh: 那一天，这位费城的铁匠相信自己获得了胜利，并且对他的对手表现出不够的蔑视;

en: but when the other afterward substituted for conical shot simple 600-pound shells, at very moderate velocity, the captain was obliged to give in.
zh: 但是当另一枚炮弹以非常中等的速度代替了600磅的简单锥形炮弹时，船长不得不屈服了。

en: In fact, these projectiles knocked his best metal plate to shivers.
zh: 事实上，这些炮弹打得他最好的金属板颤抖不已。

en: Matters were at this stage, and victory seemed to rest with the shot, when the war came to an end on the very day when Nicholl had completed a new armor-plate of wrought steel.
zh: 事情已经到了这个阶段，胜利似乎取决于射击，就在尼科尔完成一个新的锻钢盔甲的那一天，战争结束了。

en: It was a masterpiece of its kind, and bid defiance to all the projectiles of the world.
zh: 它是同类的杰作，是对世界上所有抛射物的蔑视。

en: The captain had it conveyed to the Polygon at Washington, challenging the president of the Gun Club to break it.
zh: 船长把它送到华盛顿的多边形，要求枪支俱乐部主席打破它。

en: Barbicane, peace having been declared, declined to try the experiment.
zh: 已经宣布和平的巴比康拒绝尝试这个实验。

en: Nicholl, now furious, offered to expose his plate to the shock of any shot, solid, hollow, round, or conical.
zh: 尼科尔现在非常生气，他提出要把他的盘子暴露在任何射击的冲击下，无论是实心的、空心的、圆形的还是圆锥形的。

en: Refused by the president, who did not choose to compromise his last success.
zh: 总统拒绝了，他没有选择放弃他上一次的成功。

en: Nicholl, disgusted by this obstinacy, tried to tempt Barbicane by offering him every chance.
zh: 尼科尔对这种固执感到厌恶，试图通过给巴比肯一切机会来诱惑他。

en: He proposed to fix the plate within two hundred yards of the gun.
zh: 他提议在离枪200码的范围内修理金属板。

en: Barbicane still obstinate in refusal.
zh: 巴比康仍然顽固地拒绝。

en: A hundred yards? Not even seventy-five!
zh: 100码? 连75码都不到！

en: “At fifty then!” roared the captain through the newspapers.
zh: “那就五十岁吧!”船长在报纸上咆哮道。

en: “At twenty-five yards! and I’ll stand behind!”
zh: “在25码外! 我会站在后面!”

en: Barbicane returned for answer that, even if Captain Nicholl would be so good as to stand in front, he would not fire any more.
zh: 巴比肯回答说，即使尼科尔船长能站在前面，他也不会再开火了。

en: Nicholl could not contain himself at this reply;
zh: 尼科尔听到这个回答，情不自禁;

en: threw out hints of cowardice;
zh: 流露出一丝怯懦;

en: that a man who refused to fire a cannon-shot was pretty near being afraid of it;
zh: 一个拒绝发射大炮的人几乎害怕它;

en: that artillerists who fight at six miles distance are substituting mathematical formulae for individual courage.
zh: 在六英里外作战的炮兵正在用数学公式代替个人的勇气。

en: To these insinuations Barbicane returned no answer;
zh: 对于这些暗示，巴比肯没有回答;

en: perhaps he never heard of them, so absorbed was he in the calculations for his great enterprise.
zh: 也许他从来没有听说过他们，他是如此全神贯注地计算着他的伟大事业。

en: When his famous communication was made to the Gun Club, the captain’s wrath passed all bounds;
zh: 当他与枪支俱乐部进行著名的交流时，船长的愤怒溢于言表;

en: with his intense jealousy was mingled a feeling of absolute impotence.
zh: 他强烈的嫉妒心掺杂着一种完全无能为力的感觉。

en: How was he to invent anything to beat this 900-feet Columbiad? What armor-plate could ever resist a projectile of 30,000 pounds weight?
zh: 他是怎么发明东西来打败这个900英尺高的哥伦比亚人的？什么样的盔甲能抵挡得住30000磅重的炮弹？

en: Overwhelmed at first under this violent shock, he by and by recovered himself, and resolved to crush the proposal by weight of his arguments.
zh: 起初，他被这种强烈的震惊所压倒，渐渐地恢复了过来，决心用自己的论据压倒这个建议。

en: He then violently attacked the labors of the Gun Club, published a number of letters in the newspapers, endeavored to prove Barbicane ignorant of the first principles of gunnery.
zh: 然后他暴力攻击枪支俱乐部的工人，在报纸上发表了一些信件，试图证明巴比肯对枪支的基本原理一无所知。

en: He maintained that it was absolutely impossible to impress upon any body whatever a velocity of 12,000 yards per second;
zh: 他坚持认为，无论任何物体的速度是每秒12,000码，都绝对不可能给它留下深刻印象;

en: that even with such a velocity a projectile of such a weight could not transcend the limits of the earth’s atmosphere.
zh: 即使有这样的速度，这样一个重量的抛射物也不能超越地球大气层的极限。

en: Further still, even regarding the velocity to be acquired, and granting it to be sufficient,
zh: 更进一步，即使考虑到要获得的速度，并且给予它足够的速度,

en: the shell could not resist the pressure of the gas developed by the ignition of 1,600,000 pounds of powder;
zh: 炮弹无法抵抗由1,600,000磅粉末燃烧产生的气体压力;

en: and supposing it to resist that pressure, it would be less able to support that temperature;
zh: 假设它能抵抗那个压力，它就不能支撑那个温度;

en: it would melt on quitting the Columbiad, and fall back in a red-hot shower upon the heads of the imprudent spectators.
zh: 一旦退出 Columbiad，它就会融化，然后像一场炽热的大雨，落在那些轻率的观众头上。

en: Barbicane continued his work without regarding these attacks.
zh: 巴比肯继续他的工作，没有关于这些攻击。

en: Nicholl then took up the question in its other aspects.
zh: 尼科尔接着从其他方面讨论了这个问题。

en: Without touching upon its uselessness in all points of view, he regarded the experiment as fraught with extreme danger, both to the citizens,
zh: 他没有从任何角度谈论这个实验的无用性，他认为这个实验充满了极端的危险，对公民来说都是如此,

en: who might sanction by their presence so reprehensible a spectacle, and also to the towns in the neighborhood of this deplorable cannon.
zh: 他们的出现可能会制造一个应该受到谴责的奇观，也可能会制造一个应该受到谴责的大炮附近的城镇。

en: He also observed that if the projectile did not succeed in reaching its destination (a result absolutely impossible),
zh: 他还观察到，如果炮弹没有成功到达目的地(这是绝对不可能的) ,

en: it must inevitably fall back upon the earth, and that the shock of such a mass, multiplied by the square of its velocity, would seriously endanger every point of the globe.
zh: 它必然会不可避免地回落到地球上，而这种质量的冲击，再乘以其速度的平方，将会严重危及地球上的每一个点。

en: Under the circumstances, therefore, and without interfering with the rights of free citizens,
zh: 因此，在这种情况下，在不干涉自由公民权利的情况下,

en: it was a case for the intervention of Government, which ought not to endanger the safety of all for the pleasure of one individual.
zh: 这是政府干预的一个例子，政府不应该为了一个人的利益而危及所有人的安全。

en: In spite of all his arguments, however, Captain Nicholl remained alone in his opinion.
zh: 然而，尽管他说了那么多，尼科尔船长还是一个人坚持自己的观点。

en: Nobody listened to him, and he did not succeed in alienating a single admirer from the president of the Gun Club.
zh: 没有人听他的，他也没有成功地疏远一个崇拜者，从枪支俱乐部主席。

en: The latter did not even take the pains to refute the arguments of his rival.
zh: 后者甚至没有煞费苦心地反驳对手的论点。

en: Nicholl, driven into his last entrenchments, and not able to fight personally in the cause, resolved to fight with money.
zh: 尼科尔被逼进了他最后的防线，不能亲自参与这项事业，于是决定用金钱来战斗。

en: He published, therefore, in the Richmond Inquirer a series of wagers, conceived in these terms, and on an increasing scale:
zh: 因此，他在《里士满询问报》(Richmond Inquirer)上发表了一系列的赌注，按照这些术语构思，并且规模越来越大:

en: No. 1 ($1,000).—That the necessary funds for the experiment of the Gun Club will not be forthcoming.
zh: 第一条(1000美元)ーー枪支俱乐部实验所需的资金将不会到位。

en: No. 2 ($2,000).—That the operation of casting a cannon of 900 feet is impracticable, and cannot possibly succeed.
zh: 第二条(2000美元)——铸造900英尺的大炮是不可行的，也不可能成功。

en: No. 3 ($3,000).—That is it impossible to load the Columbiad, and that the pyroxyle will take fire spontaneously under the pressure of the projectile.
zh: 第三名($3,000)。这是不可能装载 Columbiad，而且在抛射物的压力下，火焰石会自动着火。

en: No. 4 ($4,000).—That the Columbiad will burst at the first fire.
zh: 第四条(4000美元)——哥伦比亚号将在第一场大火中爆炸。

en: No. 5 ($5,000).—That the shot will not travel farther than six miles, and that it will fall back again a few seconds after its discharge.
zh: 第五名($5,000)。射程不会超过6英里，而且在发射后几秒钟就会再次回落。

en: It was an important sum, therefore, which the captain risked in his invincible obstinacy.
zh: 因此，这是一笔重要的数目，船长以其不可战胜的顽固冒着这个险。

en: He had no less than $15,000 at stake.
zh: 他的赌注不少于15000美元。

en: Notwithstanding the importance of the challenge, on the 19th of May he received a sealed packet containing the following superbly laconic reply:
zh: 尽管这项质疑很重要，5月19日他还是收到了一个密封的包裹，里面有以下极其简洁的答复:

en: “BALTIMORE, October 19. Done. BARBICANE.”
zh: “巴尔的摩，10月19日，成交，芭比”

en: CHAPTER XI. FLORIDA AND TEXAS
zh: 第十一章佛罗里达州和德克萨斯州

en: One question remained yet to be decided;
zh: 还有一个问题尚未决定;

en: it was necessary to choose a favorable spot for the experiment.
zh: 为实验选择一个有利的地点是必要的。

en: According to the advice of the Observatory of Cambridge, the gun must be fired perpendicularly to the plane of the horizon, that is to say, toward the zenith.
zh: 根据剑桥天文台的建议，炮口必须垂直于地平线的平面，也就是说，朝着天顶发射。

en: Now the moon does not traverse the zenith, except in places situated between 0° and 28° of latitude.
zh: 现在，月亮不会经过天顶，除非是在纬度0 ° 到28 ° 之间的地方。

en: It became, then, necessary to determine exactly that spot on the globe where the immense Columbiad should be cast.
zh: 因此，有必要精确地确定地球上巨大的哥伦比亚号应该投射的位置。

en: On the 20th of October, at a general meeting of the Gun Club, Barbicane produced a magnificent map of the United States.
zh: 10月20日，在枪支俱乐部的一次全体会议上，巴比肯制作了一幅宏伟的美国地图。

en: “Gentlemen,” said he, in opening the discussion, “I presume that we are all agreed that this experiment cannot and ought not to be tried anywhere but within the limits of the soil of the Union.
zh: “先生们,”他在开始讨论时说，“我想我们都同意，这个实验不能也不应该在任何地方进行，除非在联邦的范围内。

en: Now, by good fortune, certain frontiers of the United States extend downward as far as the 28th parallel of the north latitude.
zh: 现在，幸运的是，美国的某些边界向下延伸到北纬28度线。

en: If you will cast your eye over this map, you will see that we have at our disposal the whole of the southern portion of Texas and Florida.”
zh: 如果你把目光投向这张地图，你会看到我们可以支配整个德克萨斯州和佛罗里达州的南部地区。”

en: It was finally agreed, then, that the Columbiad must be cast on the soil of either Texas or Florida.
zh: 最后双方达成一致，哥伦比亚号必须在德克萨斯州或佛罗里达州的土地上铸造。

en: The result, however, of this decision was to create a rivalry entirely without precedent between the different towns of these two States.
zh: 然而，这个决定的结果是在这两个国家的不同城镇之间创造了一个完全没有先例的竞争。

en: The 28th parallel, on reaching the American coast, traverses the peninsula of Florida, dividing it into two nearly equal portions.
zh: 北纬28度线到达美国海岸时，横穿佛罗里达半岛，将其分成两个几乎相等的部分。

en: Then, plunging into the Gulf of Mexico, it subtends the arc formed by the coast of Alabama, Mississippi, and Louisiana;
zh: 然后，它坠入墨西哥湾，向阿拉巴马州、密西西比州和路易斯安那州海岸形成的弧形地带伸展;

en: then skirting Texas, off which it cuts an angle, it continues its course over Mexico, crosses the Sonora, Old California, and loses itself in the Pacific Ocean.
zh: 然后绕过德克萨斯州，从那里切出一个角度，继续在墨西哥上空航行，穿过索诺拉，老加利福尼亚，在太平洋中迷失了自己。

en: It was, therefore, only those portions of Texas and Florida which were situated below this parallel which came within the prescribed conditions of latitude.
zh: 因此，只有德克萨斯州和佛罗里达州的部分地区位于这个平行线以下，才符合规定的纬度条件。

en: Florida, in its southern part, reckons no cities of importance;
zh: 佛罗里达州，在其南部，认为没有重要的城市;

en: it is simply studded with forts raised against the roving Indians.
zh: 这里只是布满了抵抗流浪印第安人的堡垒。

en: One solitary town, Tampa Town, was able to put in a claim in favor of its situation.
zh: 一个孤立的小镇，坦帕镇，能够提出索赔，以支持它的情况。

en: In Texas, on the contrary, the towns are much more numerous and important.
zh: 相反，在德克萨斯州，城镇数量更多，也更重要。

en: Corpus Christi, in the county of Nueces, and all the cities situated on the Rio Bravo, Laredo, Comalites, San Ignacio on the Web, Rio Grande City on the Starr,
zh: 科珀斯克里斯蒂，在 Nueces 和所有城市位于里奥布拉沃，拉雷多，Comalites，圣伊格纳西奥在网上，里奥格兰德城在斯塔尔,

en: Edinburgh in the Hidalgo, Santa Rita, Elpanda, Brownsville in the Cameron, formed an imposing league against the pretensions of Florida.
zh: 伊达尔戈的爱丁堡，Elpanda 的圣丽塔，布朗斯维尔的卡梅伦，形成了一个强大的联盟，反对佛罗里达的自命不凡。

en: So, scarcely was the decision known, when the Texan and Floridan deputies arrived at Baltimore in an incredibly short space of time.
zh: 因此，当德克萨斯州和 Floridan 的代表们在极短的时间内抵达巴尔的摩时，人们几乎不知道他们的决定。

en: From that very moment President Barbicane and the influential members of the Gun Club were besieged day and night by formidable claims.
zh: 从那一刻起，巴比肯总统和枪支俱乐部的有影响力的成员日夜被强大的要求包围。

en: If seven cities of Greece contended for the honor of having given birth to a Homer, here were two entire States threatening to come to blows about the question of a cannon.
zh: 如果说希腊有七个城市争夺生育荷马的荣誉，那么这两个州就威胁要就大炮的问题发生冲突。

en: The rival parties promenaded the streets with arms in their hands;
zh: 敌对政党手持武器在街上游行;

en: and at every occasion of their meeting a collision was to be apprehended which might have been attended with disastrous results.
zh: 在他们会面的每一个场合，都要防止发生碰撞，这可能会造成灾难性的后果。

en: Happily the prudence and address of President Barbicane averted the danger.
zh: 令人高兴的是，巴比肯总统的谨慎和讲话避免了危险。

en: These personal demonstrations found a division in the newspapers of the different States.
zh: 这些个人的示威活动在不同州的报纸上出现了分歧。

en: The New York Herald and the Tribune supported Texas, while the Times and the American Review espoused the cause of the Floridan deputies.
zh: 《纽约先驱报》和《论坛报》支持德克萨斯州，而《泰晤士报》和《美国评论》则支持佛罗里达州议员的事业。

en: The members of the Gun Club could not decide to which to give the preference.
zh: 枪支俱乐部的成员无法决定优先考虑哪一个。

en: Texas produced its array of twenty-six counties;
zh: 德克萨斯州有26个县;

en: Florida replied that twelve counties were better than twenty-six in a country only one-sixth part of the size.
zh: 佛罗里达州回答说，12个县比26个县好，而这个国家的面积只有这个国家的六分之一。

en: Texas plumed itself upon its 330,000 natives;
zh: 德克萨斯州以其33万土著人为傲;

en: Florida, with a far smaller territory, boasted of being much more densely populated with 56,000.
zh: 佛罗里达州的面积要小得多，号称人口密度要大得多，有5.6万人。

en: The Texans, through the columns of the Herald claimed that some regard should be had to a State which grew the best cotton in all America,
zh: 德克萨斯人通过《先驱报》的专栏声称应该尊重一个种植全美最好棉花的州,

en: produced the best green oak for the service of the navy, and contained the finest oil, besides iron mines, in which the yield was fifty per cent. of pure metal.
zh: 为海军服役生产了最好的绿橡木，除了铁矿以外，还有最好的油，产量是百分之五十。纯金属。

en: To this the American Review replied that the soil of Florida, although not equally rich,
zh: 对此，《美国评论》回答说，佛罗里达州的土壤虽然不同样肥沃,

en: afforded the best conditions for the moulding and casting of the Columbiad, consisting as it did of sand and argillaceous earth.
zh: 为 Columbiad 的铸造提供了最好的条件，包括沙子和泥土。

en: “That may be all very well,” replied the Texans;
zh: “那也许很好,”德克萨斯人回答说;

en: “but you must first get to this country.
zh: 但你必须先到达这个国家。

en: Now the communications with Florida are difficult, while the coast of Texas offers the bay of Galveston,
zh: 现在与佛罗里达州的通讯很困难而德克萨斯州的海岸线提供了加尔维斯顿

en: which possesses a circumference of fourteen leagues, and is capable of containing the navies of the entire world!”
zh: 方圆十四里格，足以容纳全世界的海军!”

en: “A pretty notion truly,” replied the papers in the interest of Florida, “that of Galveston bay below the 29th parallel!
zh: “真是一个美丽的想法,”报纸为了佛罗里达的利益答道，“那就是北纬29度以下的加尔维斯顿！

en: Have we not got the bay of Espiritu Santo, opening precisely upon the 28th degree, and by which ships can reach Tampa Town by direct route?”
zh: 难道我们没有 Espiritu Santo 吗? 正好在28度的时候开放，船只可以通过它直接到达坦帕镇。”

en: “A fine bay; half choked with sand!”
zh: “一个美丽的海湾，被沙子淹没了一半!”

en: “Choked yourselves!” returned the others.
zh: “掐死你们自己!”其他人回答。

en: Thus the war went on for several days, when Florida endeavored to draw her adversary away on to fresh ground;
zh: 战争就这样持续了好几天，佛罗里达努力把她的对手引到新的地方;

en: and one morning the Times hinted that, the enterprise being essentially American, it ought not to be attempted upon other than purely American territory.
zh: 一天早上，《泰晤士报》暗示说，这个企业本质上是美国的，除了纯粹的美国领土之外，不应该在其他地方进行尝试。

en: To these words Texas retorted, “American! are we not as much so as you? Were not Texas and Florida both incorporated into the Union in 1845?”
zh: 德克萨斯反驳道: “美国人！我们是不是不如你们？德克萨斯州和佛罗里达州不都是在1845年并入联邦的吗?”

en: “Undoubtedly,” replied the Times;
zh: “毫无疑问,”《泰晤士报》回答说;

en: “but we have belonged to the Americans ever since 1820.”
zh: “但自1820年以来，我们一直属于美国人”

en: “Yes!” returned the Tribune;
zh: “是的!”护民官回答

en: “after having been Spaniards or English for two hundred years, you were sold to the United States for five million dollars!”
zh: “在成为西班牙人或英国人200年后，你被以500万美元的价格卖到了美国!”

en: “Well! and why need we blush for that? Was not Louisiana bought from Napoleon in 1803 at the price of sixteen million dollars?”
zh: “好吧！我们为什么要脸红呢？路易斯安那不是1803年以1600万美元从拿破仑手中买下的吗?”

en: “Scandalous!” roared the Texas deputies.
zh: “太可耻了!”德克萨斯州的议员们咆哮道。

en: “A wretched little strip of country like Florida to dare to compare itself to Texas, who, in place of selling herself, asserted her own independence, drove out the Mexicans in March 2, 1846, and declared herself a federal republic after the victory gained by Samuel Houston,
zh: “一个像佛罗里达这样可怜的小地方居然敢把自己和德克萨斯州相提并论”“德克萨斯州没有出卖自己，而是宣称自己的独立”“在1846年3月2日驱逐了墨西哥人”“在塞缪尔 · 休斯顿取得胜利后宣布自己为联邦共和国”

en: on the banks of the San Jacinto, over the troops of Santa Anna!—a country, in fine, which voluntarily annexed itself to the United States of America!”
zh: 在圣哈辛托的岸边，在桑塔 · 安纳的军队上空ーー一个自愿并入美利坚合众国的国家!”

en: “Yes; because it was afraid of the Mexicans!” replied Florida.
zh: “是的，因为它害怕墨西哥人!”佛罗里达回答。

en: “Afraid!” From this moment the state of things became intolerable.
zh: “害怕!”从这一刻起，事情变得无法忍受。

en: A sanguinary encounter seemed daily imminent between the two parties in the streets of Baltimore.
zh: 在巴尔的摩的街道上，双方似乎每天都会发生血腥的冲突。

en: It became necessary to keep an eye upon the deputies.
zh: 有必要留意一下副手们。

en: President Barbicane knew not which way to look.
zh: 巴比肯总统不知道该往哪里看。

en: Notes, documents, letters full of menaces showered down upon his house.
zh: 笔记，文件，满是威胁的信件如雨点般落在他的房子上。

en: Which side ought he to take? As regarded the appropriation of the soil, the facility of communication, the rapidity of transport, the claims of both States were evenly balanced.
zh: 他应该站在哪一边？在土地占有、通讯设施、运输速度等方面，两国的主张是平衡的。

en: As for political prepossessions, they had nothing to do with the question.
zh: 至于政治前提，它们与这个问题毫无关系。

en: This dead block had existed for some little time, when Barbicane resolved to get rid of it all at once.
zh: 这个死气沉沉的街区已经存在了很短的一段时间，当巴比肯决定一次性把它全部清除掉的时候。

en: He called a meeting of his colleagues, and laid before them a proposition which, it will be seen, was profoundly sagacious.
zh: 他召集了同事们开会，向他们提出了一个建议，我们将看到，这个建议非常睿智。

en: “On carefully considering,” he said, “what is going on now between Florida and Texas, it is clear that the same difficulties will recur with all the towns of the favored State.
zh: “仔细考虑一下,”他说，“佛罗里达州和德克萨斯州之间现在正在发生的事情，很明显，同样的困难将在这个受到青睐的州的所有城镇重演。”。

en: The rivalry will descend from State to city, and so on downward.
zh: 竞争将从一个州蔓延到另一个城市，以此类推。

en: Now Texas possesses eleven towns within the prescribed conditions, which will further dispute the honor and create us new enemies, while Florida has only one.
zh: 现在德克萨斯州拥有11个城镇在规定的条件下，这将进一步争议的荣誉和创造我们新的敌人，而佛罗里达州只有一个。

en: I go in, therefore, for Florida and Tampa Town.”
zh: 因此，我前往佛罗里达州和坦帕市。”

en: This decision, on being made known, utterly crushed the Texan deputies.
zh: 这个决定一经公布，就彻底击垮了德克萨斯州的议员们。

en: Seized with an indescribable fury, they addressed threatening letters to the different members of the Gun Club by name.
zh: 他们被一种难以形容的愤怒抓住，给枪支俱乐部的不同成员写了威胁信。

en: The magistrates had but one course to take, and they took it.
zh: 地方法官只有一条路可走，他们照办了。

en: They chartered a special train, forced the Texans into it whether they would or no;
zh: 他们包了一列特别的火车，不管德克萨斯人愿不愿意，都强迫他们坐上去;

en: and they quitted the city with a speed of thirty miles an hour.
zh: 他们以每小时三十英里的速度离开了这座城市。

en: Quickly, however, as they were despatched, they found time to hurl one last and bitter sarcasm at their adversaries.
zh: 然而，很快，当他们被派遣时，他们找到了时间对他们的敌人最后一次发表尖刻的讽刺。

en: Alluding to the extent of Florida, a mere peninsula confined between two seas,
zh: 指的是佛罗里达的范围，仅仅是一个半岛，被限制在两个海洋之间,

en: they pretended that it could never sustain the shock of the discharge, and that it would “bust up” at the very first shot.
zh: 他们假装它永远无法承受放电的冲击，并且在第一次拍摄时就会“爆炸”。

en: “Very well, let it bust up!” replied the Floridans, with a brevity of the days of ancient Sparta.
zh: “很好，让它破裂吧!”佛罗里达人回答，简短地说着古代斯巴达的日子。

en: CHAPTER XII. URBI ET ORBI
zh: 第十二章城市与轨道

en: The astronomical, mechanical, and topographical difficulties resolved, finally came the question of finance.
zh: 天文学、机械学和地形学的困难解决了，最后是财政问题。

en: The sum required was far too great for any individual, or even any single State, to provide the requisite millions.
zh: 任何个人，甚至任何一个国家都无法提供所需的数百万美元。

en: President Barbicane undertook, despite of the matter being a purely American affair, to render it one of universal interest, and to request the financial co-operation of all peoples.
zh: 巴比肯总统承诺，尽管这是一个纯粹的美国事务，使其成为一个普遍利益，并要求所有人民的金融合作。

en: It was, he maintained, the right and duty of the whole earth to interfere in the affairs of its satellite.
zh: 他坚持认为，干涉地球卫星的事务是整个地球的权利和义务。

en: The subscription opened at Baltimore extended properly to the whole world—Urbi et orbi.
zh: 在巴尔的摩开始的订阅适当地扩展到全世界ーー Urbi et orbi。

en: This subscription was successful beyond all expectation;
zh: 这次认购成功得出乎所有人的意料;

en: notwithstanding that it was a question not of lending but of giving the money.
zh: 尽管这不是贷款的问题，而是给钱的问题。

en: It was a purely disinterested operation in the strictest sense of the term, and offered not the slightest chance of profit.
zh: 从最严格的意义上讲，这是一种纯粹无利害关系的经营，没有提供丝毫获利的机会。

en: The effect, however, of Barbicane’s communication was not confined to the frontiers of the United States;
zh: 然而，巴比肯的沟通效果并不局限于美国的边境;

en: it crossed the Atlantic and Pacific, invading simultaneously Asia and Europe, Africa and Oceanica.
zh: 它跨越大西洋和太平洋，同时入侵亚洲和欧洲，非洲和 Oceanica。

en: The observatories of the Union placed themselves in immediate communication with those of foreign countries.
zh: 欧洲联盟的观察站立即与外国的观察站保持联系。

en: Some, such as those of Paris, Petersburg, Berlin, Stockholm, Hamburg, Malta, Lisbon, Benares, Madras, and others, transmitted their good wishes;
zh: 一些国家，如巴黎、彼得堡、柏林、斯德哥尔摩、汉堡、马耳他、里斯本、贝拿勒斯、马德拉斯和其他国家，传达了他们的良好祝愿;

en: the rest maintained a prudent silence, quietly awaiting the result.
zh: 其他人保持着谨慎的沉默，静静地等待着结果。

en: As for the observatory at Greenwich, seconded as it was by the twenty- two astronomical establishments of Great Britain, it spoke plainly enough.
zh: 至于格林威治的天文台，由于是大不列颠二十二个天文机构的附属机构，它说得很清楚。

en: It boldly denied the possibility of success, and pronounced in favor of the theories of Captain Nicholl.
zh: 它大胆地否认成功的可能性，并宣布赞成尼科尔船长的理论。

en: But this was nothing more than mere English jealousy.
zh: 但这不过是英国人的嫉妒罢了。

en: On the 8th of October President Barbicane published a manifesto full of enthusiasm, in which he made an appeal to “all persons of good will upon the face of the earth.”
zh: 10月8日，巴比肯总统发表了一份充满热情的宣言，他在宣言中呼吁“地球上所有善良的人们”

en: This document, translated into all languages, met with immense success.
zh: 这份文件被翻译成各种语言，获得了巨大的成功。

en: Subscription lists were opened in all the principal cities of the Union, with a central office at the Baltimore Bank, 9 Baltimore Street.
zh: 订阅名单在联邦的所有主要城市开放，在巴尔的摩银行的中心办公室，巴尔的摩街9号。

en: In addition, subscriptions were received at the following banks in the different states of the two continents:
zh: 此外，两大洲不同国家的下列银行也接受了认购:

en: At Vienna, with S. M. de Rothschild.
zh: 在维也纳，和 S · M · 德 · 罗斯柴尔德一起。

en: At Petersburg, Stieglitz and Co.
zh: 在彼得堡，斯蒂格利茨公司。

en: At Paris, The Credit Mobilier.
zh: 在巴黎，动产信贷公司。

en: At Stockholm, Tottie and Arfuredson.
zh: 在斯德哥尔摩，托蒂和 Arfuredson。

en: At London, N. M. Rothschild and Son.
zh: 在伦敦，N. M. Rothschild 父子。

en: At Turin, Ardouin and Co.
zh: 在都灵，Ardouin 和公司。

en: At Berlin, Mendelssohn.
zh: 在柏林，门德尔松。

en: At Geneva, Lombard, Odier and Co.
zh: 在日内瓦，隆巴德，奥迪耶公司。

en: At Constantinople, The Ottoman Bank.
zh: 在君士坦丁堡，奥斯曼银行。

en: At Brussels, J. Lambert.
zh: 在布鲁塞尔，J · 兰伯特。

en: At Madrid, Daniel Weisweller.
zh: 在马德里，丹尼尔 · 魏斯威勒。

en: At Amsterdam, Netherlands Credit Co.
zh: 在阿姆斯特丹，荷兰信贷公司。

en: At Rome, Torlonia and Co.
zh: 在罗马，托洛尼亚和公司。

en: At Lisbon, Lecesne.
zh: 在里斯本，莱塞内。

en: At Copenhagen, Private Bank.
zh: 在哥本哈根，私人银行。

en: At Rio de Janeiro, Private Bank.
zh: 在里约热内卢，私人银行。

en: At Montevideo, Private Bank.
zh: 在蒙得维的亚，私人银行。

en: At Valparaiso and Lima, Thomas la Chambre and Co.
zh: 在瓦尔帕莱索和利马，托马斯拉钱伯和公司。

en: At Mexico, Martin Daran and Co.
zh: 在墨西哥，Martin Daran 和 Co。

en: Three days after the manifesto of President Barbicane $4,000,000 were paid into the different towns of the Union.
zh: 在巴比肯总统宣言发表三天后，四百万美元支付给了联邦的各个城镇。

en: With such a balance the Gun Club might begin operations at once.
zh: 有了这样的平衡，枪支俱乐部可以立即开始运作。

en: But some days later advices were received to the effect that foreign subscriptions were being eagerly taken up.
zh: 但是几天后，人们收到了一些建议，大意是外国订阅正在被热切接受。

en: Certain countries distinguished themselves by their liberality;
zh: 某些国家以其自由而著称;

en: others untied their purse-strings with less facility—a matter of temperament.
zh: 另一些人则不那么容易解开钱包，这是性格问题。

en: Figures are, however, more eloquent than words, and here is the official statement of the sums which were paid in to the credit of the Gun Club at the close of the subscription.
zh: 然而，数字比言语更有说服力，这里是枪支俱乐部在订购结束时支付给该俱乐部的款项的正式声明。

en: Russia paid in as her contingent the enormous sum of 368,733 roubles.
zh: 俄罗斯作为代表团支付了368,733卢布的巨额款项。

en: No one need be surprised at this, who bears in mind the scientific taste of the Russians, and the impetus which they have given to astronomical studies—thanks to their numerous observatories.
zh: 没有人会对此感到惊讶，因为他们牢记俄罗斯人的科学品味，以及他们对天文学研究的推动力ーー这要归功于他们众多的天文台。

en: France began by deriding the pretensions of the Americans.
zh: 法国开始嘲笑美国人的自命不凡。

en: The moon served as a pretext for a thousand stale puns and a score of ballads, in which bad taste contested the palm with ignorance.
zh: 月亮成了一千个陈腐的双关语和二十首民谣的借口，在这些民谣中，恶趣味与无知争夺着掌心。

en: But as formerly the French paid before singing, so now they paid after having had their laugh, and they subscribed for a sum of 1,253,930 francs.
zh: 但是，就像以前法国人在唱歌之前付钱一样，现在他们在笑过之后付钱，他们认购了一笔1,253,930法郎的款项。

en: At that price they had a right to enjoy themselves a little.
zh: 按照这个价格，他们有权享受一下。

en: Austria showed herself generous in the midst of her financial crisis.
zh: 奥地利在金融危机中表现得很慷慨。

en: Her public contributions amounted to the sum of 216,000 florins—a perfect godsend.
zh: 她的公共捐款总额达到21.6万弗罗林，简直是天赐之物。

en: Fifty-two thousand rix-dollars were the remittance of Sweden and Norway;
zh: 五万两千里克斯美元是瑞典和挪威的汇款;

en: the amount is large for the country, but it would undoubtedly have been considerably increased had the subscription been opened in Christiana simultaneously with that at Stockholm.
zh: 这个数额对国家来说是很大的，但是如果在克里斯蒂安纳和斯德哥尔摩同时开放订阅的话，这个数额无疑会大大增加。

en: For some reason or other the Norwegians do not like to send their money to Sweden.
zh: 出于某种原因，挪威人不喜欢把钱寄到瑞典。

en: Prussia, by a remittance of 250,000 thalers, testified her high approval of the enterprise.
zh: 普鲁士以25万泰勒的汇款证明了她对这家企业的高度赞赏。

en: Turkey behaved generously;
zh: 土耳其表现慷慨;

en: but she had a personal interest in the matter.
zh: 但她对此事有个人兴趣。

en: The moon, in fact, regulates the cycle of her years and her fast of Ramadan.
zh: 事实上，月亮控制着她的生命周期和斋月。

en: She could not do less than give 1,372,640 piastres;
zh: 她不能少于1,372,640皮亚斯特;

en: and she gave them with an eagerness which denoted, however, some pressure on the part of the government.
zh: 她给了他们一个热切的，然而，这表明，一些压力，在政府的一部分。

en: Belgium distinguished herself among the second-rate states by a grant of 513,000 francs—about two centimes per head of her population.
zh: 比利时以赠款513000法郎(约合人均2厘米)跻身二等国家之列。

en: Holland and her colonies interested themselves to the extent of 110,000 florins, only demanding an allowance of five per cent.
zh: 荷兰及其殖民地对此感兴趣的程度高达11万弗罗林，只要求5% 的补贴。

en: discount for paying ready money.
zh: 现金折扣。

en: Denmark, a little contracted in territory, gave nevertheless 9,000 ducats, proving her love for scientific experiments.
zh: 丹麦虽然在领土上签了一点合同，但还是给了她9000金币，证明了她对科学实验的热爱。

en: The Germanic Confederation pledged itself to 34,285 florins.
zh: 日耳曼联邦承诺捐赠34,285弗罗林。

en: It was impossible to ask for more;
zh: 要求更多是不可能的;

en: besides, they would not have given it.
zh: 而且，他们也不会给我的。

en: Though very much crippled, Italy found 200,000 lire in the pockets of her people.
zh: 尽管残疾严重，意大利人民口袋里还是有20万里拉。

en: If she had had Venetia she would have done better; but she had not.
zh: 如果她有威尼斯，她会做得更好，但她没有。

en: The States of the Church thought that they could not send less than 7,040 Roman crowns;
zh: 教会的国家认为，他们不能送少于7,040罗马克朗;

en: and Portugal carried her devotion to science as far as 30,000 cruzados.
zh: 和葡萄牙带着她对科学的热爱远达30,000克鲁扎多。

en: It was the widow’s mite—eighty-six piastres;
zh: 这是寡妇的遗物ーー八十六皮亚斯特;

en: but self-constituted empires are always rather short of money.
zh: 但是自建的帝国总是相当缺钱。

en: Two hundred and fifty-seven francs, this was the modest contribution of Switzerland to the American work.
zh: 257法郎，这是瑞士对美国工作的微薄贡献。

en: One must freely admit that she did not see the practical side of the matter.
zh: 我们必须坦率地承认，她没有看到问题的实际方面。

en: It did not seem to her that the mere despatch of a shot to the moon could possibly establish any relation of affairs with her;
zh: 在她看来，仅仅向月球发射一颗卫星似乎不可能与她建立任何关系;

en: and it did not seem prudent to her to embark her capital in so hazardous an enterprise.
zh: 对她来说，把她的资本投入到如此危险的事业中似乎是不明智的。

en: After all, perhaps she was right.
zh: 毕竟，也许她是对的。

en: As to Spain, she could not scrape together more than 110 reals.
zh: 至于西班牙，她凑不到110雷亚尔。

en: She gave as an excuse that she had her railways to finish.
zh: 她借口说她还有铁路要修。

en: The truth is, that science is not favorably regarded in that country, it is still in a backward state;
zh: 事实上，那个国家对科学并不看好，它仍然处于落后的状态;

en: and moreover, certain Spaniards, not by any means the least educated, did not form a correct estimate of the bulk of the projectile compared with that of the moon.
zh: 此外，某些西班牙人，绝非教育程度最低的人，也没有正确估计出与月球相比，发射物的体积。

en: They feared that it would disturb the established order of things.
zh: 他们担心这会扰乱既定的秩序。

en: In that case it were better to keep aloof;
zh: 在这种情况下，最好保持冷漠;

en: which they did to the tune of some reals.
zh: 他们用一些雷亚尔的调子做了这件事。

en: There remained but England;
zh: 只剩下英格兰

en: and we know the contemptuous antipathy with which she received Barbicane’s proposition.
zh: 我们也知道她对巴比肯的建议是多么不屑一顾。

en: The English have but one soul for the whole twenty-six millions of inhabitants which Great Britain contains.
zh: 对于大不列颠所包含的二千六百万居民来说，英国人只有一个灵魂。

en: They hinted that the enterprise of the Gun Club was contrary to the “principle of non-intervention.” And they did not subscribe a single farthing.
zh: 他们暗示枪支俱乐部的企业违背了“不干涉原则”他们一分钱也没有订。

en: At this intimation the Gun Club merely shrugged its shoulders and returned to its great work.
zh: 听到这个消息，大炮俱乐部只是耸了耸肩，继续他们伟大的工作。

en: When South America, that is to say, Peru, Chili, Brazil, the provinces of La Plata and Columbia, had poured forth their quota into their hands, the sum of $300,000,
zh: 当南美洲，也就是说秘鲁，智利，巴西，拉普拉塔和哥伦比亚省，把他们的配额，三十万美元,

en: it found itself in possession of a considerable capital, of which the following is a statement:
zh: 它发现自己拥有一笔可观的资本，其中包括:

en: United States subscriptions, $4,000,000
zh: 美国订阅，四百万美元

en: Foreign subscriptions $1,446,675 Total, $5,446,675
Such was the sum which the public poured into the treasury of the Gun Club.
zh: 这就是公众投入枪支俱乐部财政部的金额。

en: Let no one be surprised at the vastness of the amount.
zh: 不要让任何人对数额的巨大感到惊讶。

en: The work of casting, boring, masonry, the transport of workmen, their establishment in an almost uninhabited country,
zh: 铸造，挖掘，砌筑，运送工人他们在一个几乎无人居住的国家建立,

en: the construction of furnaces and workshops, the plant, the powder, the projectile, and incipient expenses, would, according to the estimates, absorb nearly the whole.
zh: 据估计，熔炉和车间的建设、工厂、火药、炮弹和初期费用将几乎全部消耗掉。

en: Certain cannon-shots in the Federal war cost one thousand dollars apiece.
zh: 在联邦战争中，某些炮弹每发要花费一千美元。

en: This one of President Barbicane, unique in the annals of gunnery, might well cost five thousand times more.
zh: 这张巴比肯总统的画像，在炮兵史上是独一无二的，可能要贵上五千倍。

en: On the 20th of October a contract was entered into with the manufactory at Coldspring, near New York, which during the war had furnished the largest Parrott, cast-iron guns.
zh: 10月20日，与纽约附近的 Coldspring 工厂签订了一项合同，该厂在战争期间提供了最大的 Parrott 铸铁枪支。

en: It was stipulated between the contracting parties that the manufactory of Coldspring should engage to transport to Tampa Town, in southern Florida, the necessary materials for casting the Columbiad.
zh: 根据合同双方的约定，Coldspring 的制造商应将铸造哥伦比亚号所需的材料运往佛罗里达州南部的坦帕镇。

en: The work was bound to be completed at latest by the 15th of October following,
zh: 这项工程最迟必须在10月15日之前完成,

en: and the cannon delivered in good condition under penalty of a forfeit of one hundred dollars a day to the moment when the moon should again present herself under the same conditions—that is to say, in eighteen years and eleven days.
zh: 而且大炮的状况良好，每天罚款100美元，直到月亮再次出现在同样的情况下ーー也就是说，在18年11天之后。

en: The engagement of the workmen, their pay, and all the necessary details of the work, devolved upon the Coldspring Company.
zh: 工人的雇佣、工资和工作的所有必要细节都交给了冷泉公司。

en: This contract, executed in duplicate, was signed by Barbicane, president of the Gun Club, of the one part, and T.
zh: 这份合同一式两份，由枪支俱乐部的主席巴比肯和 T。

en: Murchison director of the Coldspring manufactory, of the other, who thus executed the deed on behalf of their respective principals.
zh: Murchison 是 Coldspring 制造厂的主管，他代表各自的委托人执行了契约。

en: CHAPTER XIII. STONES HILL
zh: 第十三章石山

en: When the decision was arrived at by the Gun Club, to the disparagement of Texas, every one in America, where reading is a universal acquirement, set to work to study the geography of Florida.
zh: 当枪支俱乐部做出这个决定时，德克萨斯州受到了蔑视，在美国，阅读是一种普遍的需求，每个人都开始研究佛罗里达州的地理。

en: Never before had there been such a sale for works like “Bertram’s Travels in Florida,” “Roman’s Natural History of East and West Florida,”
zh: 以前从来没有这样的作品拍卖，如“伯特伦的佛罗里达游记”，“罗马的自然历史的东部和西部佛罗里达州,”

en: “William’s Territory of Florida,” and “Cleland on the Cultivation of the Sugar-Cane in Florida.” It became necessary to issue fresh editions of these works.
zh: “佛罗里达州威廉领地”和“克莱兰德在佛罗里达州种植甘蔗”有必要发行这些作品的新版本。

en: Barbicane had something better to do than to read.
zh: 巴比康有比读书更重要的事要做。

en: He desired to see things with his own eyes, and to mark the exact position of the proposed gun.
zh: 他希望亲眼看到事情的真相，并标记出所提议的枪的确切位置。

en: So, without a moment’s loss of time, he placed at the disposal of the Cambridge Observatory the funds necessary for the construction of a telescope,
zh: 所以，他毫不犹豫地把建造望远镜所需的资金交给了剑桥天文台,

en: and entered into negotiations with the house of Breadwill and Co., of Albany, for the construction of an aluminum projectile of the required size.
zh: 并与奥尔巴尼的 Breadwill 公司进行了谈判，以建造所需尺寸的铝弹。

en: He then quitted Baltimore, accompanied by J. T. Maston, Major Elphinstone, and the manager of the Coldspring factory.
zh: 随后，他在 J.T. 马斯顿、艾尔芬斯通少校和冷泉工厂经理的陪同下离开了巴尔的摩。

en: On the following day, the four fellow-travelers arrived at New Orleans.
zh: 第二天，四个旅伴到达了新奥尔良。

en: There they immediately embarked on board the Tampico, a despatch-boat belonging to the Federal navy, which the government had placed at their disposal;
zh: 在那里，他们立即登上了坦比科号，这是一艘隶属于联邦海军的快艇，政府已经把它交给他们支配;

en: and, getting up steam, the banks of Louisiana speedily disappeared from sight.
zh: 路易斯安那州的河岸迅速地消失在人们的视线中。

en: The passage was not long.
zh: 通道不长。

en: Two days after starting, the Tampico, having made four hundred and eighty miles, came in sight of the coast of Florida.
zh: 出发两天后，坦比科号已经航行了480英里，到达了佛罗里达海岸。

en: On a nearer approach Barbicane found himself in view of a low, flat country of somewhat barren aspect.
zh: 再走近一点，巴比康发现自己看到的是一片低矮、平坦、有些贫瘠的土地。

en: After coasting along a series of creeks abounding in lobsters and oysters, the Tampico entered the bay of Espiritu Santo,
zh: 在沿着一系列充满龙虾和牡蛎的小溪滑行之后，坦比科进入了 Espiritu Santo

en: where she finally anchored in a small natural harbor, formed by the embouchure of the River Hillisborough, at seven P.M., on the 22d of October.
zh: 10月22日下午7点，她终于在希利斯伯勒河口形成的一个天然小港口停泊。

en: Our four passengers disembarked at once.
zh: 我们的四位乘客同时下车。

en: “Gentlemen,” said Barbicane, “we have no time to lose;
zh: “先生们,”巴比肯说，“我们没有时间可以浪费了;

en: tomorrow we must obtain horses, and proceed to reconnoiter the country.”
zh: 明天我们必须得到马匹，然后去侦察这个国家。”

en: Barbicane had scarcely set his foot on shore when three thousand of the inhabitants of Tampa Town came forth to meet him, an honor due to the president who had signalized their country by his choice.
zh: 巴比肯刚一上岸，坦帕镇就有三千居民前来迎接他，这是总统的荣幸，因为他选择了他们的国家。

en: Declining, however, every kind of ovation, Barbicane ensconced himself in a room of the Franklin Hotel.
zh: 然而，巴比肯没有得到任何热烈的掌声，而是在富兰克林酒店的一个房间里安顿了下来。

en: On the morrow some of the small horses of the Spanish breed, full of vigor and of fire, stood snorting under his windows;
zh: 第二天，一些西班牙种的小马，充满活力和火焰，站在他的窗户下面哼哼;

en: but instead of four steeds, here were fifty, together with their riders.
zh: 但这里没有四匹战马，而是五十匹，还有他们的骑手。

en: Barbicane descended with his three fellow- travelers;
zh: 巴比肯和他的三个同行者一起下来了;

en: and much astonished were they all to find themselves in the midst of such a cavalcade.
zh: 他们都惊奇地发现自己置身于这样一支队伍之中。

en: He remarked that every horseman carried a carbine slung across his shoulders and pistols in his holsters.
zh: 他说，每个骑手肩上都挂着一把卡宾枪，枪套里都装着手枪。

en: On expressing his surprise at these preparations, he was speedily enlightened by a young Floridan, who quietly said:
zh: 在表达了他对这些准备工作的惊讶之后，他很快被一个年轻的佛罗里达人启发了，他悄悄地说:

en: “Sir, there are Seminoles there.”
zh: “先生，那里有塞米诺人”

en: “What do you mean by Seminoles?”
zh: “塞米诺人是什么意思?”

en: “Savages who scour the prairies.
zh: ”在大草原上肆虐的野蛮人。

en: We thought it best, therefore, to escort you on your road.”
zh: 因此，我们认为最好是护送你们上路。”

en: “Pooh!” cried J. T. Maston, mounting his steed.
zh: “呸!”J · T · 马斯顿一边叫，一边骑上了他的战马。

en: “All right,” said the Floridan;
zh: “好吧,”Floridan 表示;

en: “but it is true enough, nevertheless.”
zh: “但这是真的，无论如何。”

en: “Gentlemen,” answered Barbicane, “I thank you for your kind attention; but it is time to be off.”
zh: “先生们,”巴比肯回答说，“谢谢你们的关心，但是该走了。”

en: It was five A.M. when Barbicane and his party, quitting Tampa Town, made their way along the coast in the direction of Alifia Creek.
zh: 早上五点，巴比肯和他的同伙离开坦帕镇，沿着海岸向阿利菲亚河方向前进。

en: This little river falls into Hillisborough Bay twelve miles above Tampa Town.
zh: 这条小河流入坦帕镇上空12英里处的希利斯伯勒湾。

en: Barbicane and his escort coasted along its right bank to the eastward.
zh: 巴比肯和他的护卫沿着它的右岸向东滑行。

en: Soon the waves of the bay disappeared behind a bend of rising ground, and the Floridan “champagne” alone offered itself to view.
zh: 很快，海湾的波浪消失在一个上升的地面弯道后面，只有佛罗里达州的“香槟酒”供自己欣赏。

en: Florida, discovered on Palm Sunday, in 1512, by Juan Ponce de Leon, was originally named Pascha Florida.
zh: 1512年，胡安 · 庞塞 · 德莱昂在棕榈星期天发现了佛罗里达，最初的名字是帕斯卡 · 佛罗里达。

en: It little deserved that designation, with its dry and parched coasts.
zh: 由于海岸干燥炎热，它几乎不配得到这样的称号。

en: But after some few miles of tract the nature of the soil gradually changes and the country shows itself worthy of the name.
zh: 但是经过几英里的土地，土壤的性质逐渐发生变化，这个国家显示出了它的名副其实。

en: Cultivated plains soon appear, where are united all the productions of the northern and tropical floras, terminating in prairies abounding with pineapples and yams, tobacco, rice, cotton-plants, and sugar-canes,
zh: 开垦的平原很快就出现了，北方和热带植物区系的所有产物都在这里结合起来，终点是盛产菠萝和山药、烟草、水稻、棉花和甘蔗的大草原,

en: which extend beyond reach of sight, flinging their riches broadcast with careless prodigality.
zh: 它们伸手不见五指，肆无忌惮地挥霍着它们的财富。

en: Barbicane appeared highly pleased on observing the progressive elevation of the land;
zh: 巴比康看到陆地逐渐升高，显得非常高兴;

en: and in answer to a question of J. T. Maston, replied:
zh: 在回答 J · T · 马斯顿的问题时，他回答道:

en: “My worthy friend, we cannot do better than sink our Columbiad in these high grounds.”
zh: “我可敬的朋友，我们最好的办法莫过于在这些高地上击沉我们的 Columbiad。”

en: “To get nearer the moon, perhaps?” said the secretary of the Gun Club.
zh: “也许是为了接近月球?”枪支俱乐部的秘书说。

en: “Not exactly,” replied Barbicane, smiling;
zh: “不完全是,”巴比肯笑着回答;

en: “do you not see that among these elevated plateaus we shall have a much easier work of it? No struggles with the water-springs, which will save us long expensive tubings;
zh: “难道你没有看到，在这些高原中，我们可以更容易地完成这项工作吗?”？没有挣扎的水泉，这将节省我们长昂贵的油管;

en: and we shall be working in daylight instead of down a deep and narrow well.
zh: 我们将在白天工作，而不是在一口又深又窄的井里工作。

en: Our business, then, is to open our trenches upon ground some hundreds of yards above the level of the sea.”
zh: 那么，我们的任务就是在海平面以上几百码的地方打开我们的战壕。”

en: “You are right, sir,” struck in Murchison, the engineer;
zh: “您说得对，先生,”工程师默奇森河回答道;

en: “and, if I mistake not, we shall ere long find a suitable spot for our purpose.”
zh: “如果我没弄错的话，我们很快就会找到一个合适的地方”

en: “I wish we were at the first stroke of the pickaxe,” said the president.
zh: “我希望我们是在鹤嘴锄的第一击,”总统说。

en: “And I wish we were at the last,” cried J. T. Maston.
zh: “我希望我们是在最后,”J.T. 马斯顿喊道。

en: About ten A.M. the little band had crossed a dozen miles.
zh: 大约上午十点钟，这支小乐队已经走了十几英里。

en: To fertile plains succeeded a region of forests.
zh: 到肥沃的平原继承了一片森林。

en: There perfumes of the most varied kinds mingled together in tropical profusion.
zh: 各种各样的香水在热带地区混杂在一起。

en: These almost impenetrable forests were composed of pomegranates, orange-trees, citrons, figs, olives, apricots, bananas, huge vines, whose blossoms and fruits rivaled each other in color and perfume.
zh: 这些几乎无法穿越的森林由石榴、橘子树、柠檬、无花果、橄榄、杏、香蕉和巨大的藤蔓组成，它们的花朵和果实在颜色和香味上相互竞争。

en: Beneath the odorous shade of these magnificent trees fluttered and warbled a little world of brilliantly plumaged birds.
zh: 在这些气味浓郁的树荫下，羽毛鲜艳的鸟儿们翩翩起舞，歌唱着这个小小的世界。

en: J. T. Maston and the major could not repress their admiration on finding themselves in the presence of the glorious beauties of this wealth of nature.
zh: J · T · 马斯顿和少校无法抑制自己的钦佩之情，因为他们发现自己身处在这个大自然财富的光辉美景之中。

en: President Barbicane, however, less sensitive to these wonders, was in haste to press forward;
zh: 然而，对这些奇迹不那么敏感的巴比肯总统却匆匆向前推进;

en: the very luxuriance of the country was displeasing to him.
zh: 这个国家的奢华使他感到不快。
