en: They hastened onward, therefore, and were compelled to ford several rivers, not without danger, for they were infested with huge alligators from fifteen to eighteen feet long.
zh: 因此，他们加快了前进的步伐，不得不涉足几条河流，这样做并非没有危险，因为他们遭遇了十五到十八英尺长的大鳄鱼的袭击。

en: Maston courageously menaced them with his steel hook, but he only succeeded in frightening some pelicans and teal, while tall flamingos stared stupidly at the party.
zh: 马斯顿勇敢地用他的铁钩威胁他们，但他只成功地吓到了一些鹈鹕和青色的，而高大的火烈鸟愚蠢地盯着聚会。

en: At length these denizens of the swamps disappeared in their turn;
zh: 最后，这些沼泽里的居民依次消失了;

en: smaller trees became thinly scattered among less dense thickets—a few isolated groups detached in the midst of endless plains over which ranged herds of startled deer.
zh: 较小的树木稀稀疏疏地散布在密度较小的灌木丛中ーー一些孤立的群体分散在一望无际的平原中，平原上聚集着一群群受惊的鹿。

en: “At last,” cried Barbicane, rising in his stirrups, “here we are at the region of pines!”
zh: “终于到了,”巴比肯站在马镫上喊道，“我们到松树林里了!”

en: “Yes! and of savages too,” replied the major.
zh: “是的! 还有野蛮人,”少校回答。

en: In fact, some Seminoles had just came in sight upon the horizon;
zh: 事实上，一些塞米诺人刚刚出现在地平线上;

en: they rode violently backward and forward on their fleet horses, brandishing their spears or discharging their guns with a dull report.
zh: 他们猛烈地骑着他们的快马来回奔驰，挥舞着他们的长矛，或者用一种枯燥的报告开枪。

en: These hostile demonstrations, however, had no effect upon Barbicane and his companions.
zh: 然而，这些充满敌意的示威活动对巴比肯和他的同伴没有任何影响。

en: They were then occupying the center of a rocky plain, which the sun scorched with its parching rays.
zh: 他们当时占领了一个岩石平原的中心，阳光炙烤着这个平原。

en: This was formed by a considerable elevation of the soil, which seemed to offer to the members of the Gun Club all the conditions requisite for the construction of their Columbiad.
zh: 这是由于土壤的相当高的海拔形成的，这似乎为枪支俱乐部的成员提供了建造他们的哥伦比亚所需要的一切条件。

en: “Halt!” said Barbicane, reining up.
zh: “站住!”巴比肯勒住缰绳说。

en: “Has this place any local appellation?”
zh: “这个地方有什么地名吗?”

en: “It is called Stones Hill,” replied one of the Floridans.
zh: “它叫石头山,”一个佛罗里达人回答说。

en: Barbicane, without saying a word, dismounted, seized his instruments, and began to note his position with extreme exactness.
zh: 巴比康一言不发，下了马，拿起他的乐器，开始极其准确地记录他的位置。

en: The little band, drawn up in the rear, watched his proceedings in profound silence.
zh: 小乐队排在后面，静静地看着他的演奏。

en: At this moment the sun passed the meridian.
zh: 就在这时，太阳经过了子午线。

en: Barbicane, after a few moments, rapidly wrote down the result of his observations, and said:
zh: 过了一会儿，巴比肯迅速写下了他的观察结果，并说:

en: “This spot is situated eighteen hundred feet above the level of the sea, in 27° 7′ N. lat. and 5° 7′ W. long. of the meridian of Washington.
zh: “这个地点位于北纬27 ° 7’的海平面以上1800英尺的地方。和5 ° 7’W 长。华盛顿子午线。

en: It appears to me by its rocky and barren character to offer all the conditions requisite for our experiment.
zh: 在我看来，它的岩石和贫瘠的性质为我们的实验提供了所有必要的条件。

en: On that plain will be raised our magazines, workshops, furnaces, and workmen’s huts;
zh: 在那块平原上，我们的杂志、作坊、熔炉和工人的棚屋都将拔地而起;

en: and here, from this very spot,” said he, stamping his foot on the summit of Stones Hill, “hence shall our projectile take its flight into the regions of the Solar World.”
zh: “就在这里，从这个地方,”他在石头山顶上跺着脚说，“我们的炮弹就这样飞向太阳世界的各个地区。”

en: CHAPTER XIV. PICKAXE AND TROWEL
zh: 第十四章镐和铲

en: The same evening Barbicane and his companions returned to Tampa Town;
zh: 当天晚上，巴比肯和他的同伴们回到坦帕镇;

en: and Murchison, the engineer, re-embarked on board the Tampico for New Orleans.
zh: 工程师 Murchison 重新登上坦比科号前往新奥尔良。

en: His object was to enlist an army of workmen, and to collect together the greater part of the materials.
zh: 他的目标是招募一支工人大军，收集大部分的材料。

en: The members of the Gun Club remained at Tampa Town, for the purpose of setting on foot the preliminary works by the aid of the people of the country.
zh: 枪支俱乐部成员留在坦帕镇，以便在该国人民的援助下开始初步工作。

en: Eight days after its departure, the Tampico returned into the bay of Espiritu Santo, with a whole flotilla of steamboats.
zh: 离港8天后，坦比科号带着一整队汽船返回 Espiritu Santo。

en: Murchison had succeeded in assembling together fifteen hundred artisans.
zh: 默奇森成功地召集了一千五百名工匠。

en: Attracted by the high pay and considerable bounties offered by the Gun Club, he had enlisted a choice legion of stokers,
zh: 他被枪支俱乐部提供的高薪和可观的赏金所吸引，招募了一大批优秀的司炉工人,

en: iron-founders, lime-burners, miners, brickmakers, and artisans of every trade, without distinction of color.
zh: 铸铁工人、石灰炉工人、矿工、砖匠和各行各业的工匠，不分肤色。

en: As many of these people brought their families with them, their departure resembled a perfect emigration.
zh: 由于许多人都带着家人一起来，他们的离开就像是一次完美的移民。

en: On the 31st of October, at ten o’clock in the morning, the troop disembarked on the quays of Tampa Town;
zh: 10月31日上午10点，部队在坦帕镇的码头上岸;

en: and one may imagine the activity which pervaded that little town, whose population was thus doubled in a single day.
zh: 人们可以想象那个小镇上到处都是活动，因此一天之内人口就翻了一番。

en: During the first few days they were busy discharging the cargo brought by the flotilla,
zh: 头几天他们忙着卸船队带来的货物,

en: the machines, and the rations, as well as a large number of huts constructed of iron plates, separately pieced and numbered.
zh: 机器，口粮，以及大量的用铁板建造的小屋，分别装配和编号。

en: At the same period Barbicane laid the first sleepers of a railway fifteen miles in length, intended to unite Stones Hill with Tampa Town.
zh: 在同一时期，巴比肯铺设了一条15英里长的铁路的第一批枕木，这条铁路的目的是把石头山和坦帕镇连接起来。

en: On the first of November Barbicane quitted Tampa Town with a detachment of workmen;
zh: 11月1日，巴比肯带领一支工人分遣队离开坦帕市;

en: and on the following day the whole town of huts was erected round Stones Hill.
zh: 第二天，整个小镇的棚屋都建在石头山周围。

en: This they enclosed with palisades;
zh: 他们用栅栏围起来;

en: and in respect of energy and activity, it might have been mistaken for one of the great cities of the Union.
zh: 在能源和活动方面，它可能被误认为是联邦最伟大的城市之一。

en: Everything was placed under a complete system of discipline, and the works were commenced in most perfect order.
zh: 一切都被置于一个完整的纪律体系之下，工作以最完美的顺序开始。

en: The nature of the soil having been carefully examined, by means of repeated borings, the work of excavation was fixed for the 4th of November.
zh: 经过反复钻孔仔细检查土壤的性质，挖掘工作定于11月4日进行。

en: On that day Barbicane called together his foremen and addressed them as follows: “You are well aware, my friends, of the object with which I have assembled you together in this wild part of Florida.
zh: 那天，巴比肯召集了他的工头，对他们说: “我的朋友们，你们很清楚我把你们聚集在佛罗里达这个荒凉的地方的目的。

en: Our business is to construct a cannon measuring nine feet in its interior diameter, six feet thick, and with a stone revetment of nineteen and a half feet in thickness.
zh: 我们的任务是建造一座大炮，内径9英尺，厚6英尺，石头护壁厚19.5英尺。

en: We have, therefore, a well of sixty feet in diameter to dig down to a depth of nine hundred feet.
zh: 因此，我们有一口直径60英尺的井，可以挖到900英尺的深度。

en: This great work must be completed within eight months, so that you have 2,543,400 cubic feet of earth to excavate in 255 days;
zh: 这项伟大的工程必须在8个月内完成，这样你才能在255天内挖出2543400立方英尺的土地;

en: that is to say, in round numbers, 2,000 cubic feet per day.
zh: 也就是说，按整数计算，每天2000立方英尺。

en: That which would present no difficulty to a thousand navvies working in open country will be of course more troublesome in a comparatively confined space.
zh: 对于一千名在开阔地工作的海军来说，在相对狭窄的空间里工作当然更加麻烦。

en: However, the thing must be done, and I reckon for its accomplishment upon your courage as much as upon your skill.”
zh: 然而，这件事必须完成，我认为它的完成不仅取决于你的技术，也取决于你的勇气。”

en: At eight o’clock the next morning the first stroke of the pickaxe was struck upon the soil of Florida;
zh: 第二天早上八点，鹤嘴锄的第一次敲击敲打在佛罗里达的土地上;

en: and from that moment that prince of tools was never inactive for one moment in the hands of the excavators.
zh: 从那一刻起，工具王子在挖掘机的手中从未停止过活动。

en: The gangs relieved each other every three hours.
zh: 这两个帮派每三小时互相换班一次。

en: On the 4th of November fifty workmen commenced digging, in the very center of the enclosed space on the summit of Stones Hill, a circular hole sixty feet in diameter.
zh: 11月4日，50名工人开始挖掘，在石头山山顶封闭空间的正中央，有一个直径60英尺的圆形洞。

en: The pickaxe first struck upon a kind of black earth, six inches in thickness, which was speedily disposed of.
zh: 鹤嘴锄首先敲击在一块六英寸厚的黑土上，很快就被处理掉了。

en: To this earth succeeded two feet of fine sand, which was carefully laid aside as being valuable for serving the casting of the inner mould.
zh: 在这块土地上，有两英尺的细沙，这些细沙被小心地放在一边，作为铸造内模的宝贵材料。

en: After the sand appeared some compact white clay, resembling the chalk of Great Britain, which extended down to a depth of four feet.
zh: 在沙子出现之后，出现了一些紧凑的白色粘土，类似于英国的白垩，可以延伸到四英尺的深度。

en: Then the iron of the picks struck upon the hard bed of the soil;
zh: 接着，铁镐敲打在坚硬的地基上;

en: a kind of rock formed of petrified shells, very dry, very solid, and which the picks could with difficulty penetrate.
zh: 一种由石化的贝壳构成的岩石，非常干燥，非常坚硬，而且凿岩机很难穿透。

en: At this point the excavation exhibited a depth of six and a half feet and the work of the masonry was begun.
zh: 在这一点上，挖掘显示了六个半英尺的深度和砖石工作开始了。

en: At the bottom of the excavation they constructed a wheel of oak, a kind of circle strongly bolted together, and of immense strength.
zh: 在挖掘的底部，他们建造了一个橡木车轮，一种强烈的螺栓连接在一起的圆圈，具有巨大的力量。

en: The center of this wooden disc was hollowed out to a diameter equal to the exterior diameter of the Columbiad.
zh: 这个木制圆盘的中心被掏空，直径等于哥伦比亚号的外部直径。

en: Upon this wheel rested the first layers of the masonry, the stones of which were bound together by hydraulic cement, with irresistible tenacity.
zh: 在这个轮子上安放着第一层砖石，这些石头用硅酸盐水泥固定在一起，具有不可抗拒的韧性。

en: The workmen, after laying the stones from the circumference to the center, were thus enclosed within a kind of well twenty-one feet in diameter.
zh: 工人们把石头从周围铺到中心，就这样被围在一口直径21英尺的井里。

en: When this work was accomplished, the miners resumed their picks and cut away the rock from underneath the wheel itself, taking care to support it as they advanced upon blocks of great thickness.
zh: 当这项工作完成后，矿工们重新开始他们的采矿工作，并从车轮下方切开岩石，当他们在巨大厚度的石块上前进时，小心翼翼地支撑着它。

en: At every two feet which the hole gained in depth they successively withdrew the blocks.
zh: 在洞深每增加两英尺，他们就先后撤出石块。

en: The wheel then sank little by little, and with it the massive ring of masonry, on the upper bed of which the masons labored incessantly,
zh: 然后轮子一点一点地沉了下去，同时沉下去的还有巨大的石工圈，石工们在上面的石床上不停地劳作,

en: always reserving some vent holes to permit the escape of gas during the operation of the casting.
zh: 总是保留一些排气孔，以便在铸造操作过程中气体泄漏。

en: This kind of work required on the part of the workmen extreme nicety and minute attention.
zh: 这种工作需要工人们极其细致和细致的注意。

en: More than one, in digging underneath the wheel, was dangerously injured by the splinters of stone.
zh: 不止一个人在车轮下挖掘时，被石头的碎片击伤，情况十分危险。

en: But their ardor never relaxed, night or day.
zh: 但他们的热情从未放松，无论白天黑夜。

en: By day they worked under the rays of the scorching sun;
zh: 白天他们在灼热的阳光下工作;

en: by night, under the gleam of the electric light.
zh: 在夜晚，在电灯的微光下。

en: The sounds of the picks against the rock, the bursting of mines, the grinding of the machines, the wreaths of smoke scattered through the air,
zh: 锄头敲击岩石的声音，矿井爆炸的声音，机器摩擦的声音，空气中弥漫的烟圈,

en: traced around Stones Hill a circle of terror which the herds of buffaloes and the war parties of the Seminoles never ventured to pass.
zh: 在石头山周围划出一个恐怖的圈子，那里有成群的水牛和塞米诺尔人的战斗队伍从来没有冒险经过。

en: Nevertheless, the works advanced regularly, as the steam-cranes actively removed the rubbish.
zh: 尽管如此，随着蒸汽起重机主动清除垃圾，工程还是定期进行。

en: Of unexpected obstacles there was little account;
zh: 对于意想不到的障碍几乎没有考虑;

en: and with regard to foreseen difficulties, they were speedily disposed of.
zh: 对于预见到的困难，迅速予以解决。

en: At the expiration of the first month the well had attained the depth assigned for that lapse of time, namely, 112 feet.
zh: 在第一个月结束时，井已经达到了为这段时间分配的深度，即112英尺。

en: This depth was doubled in December, and trebled in January.
zh: 这个深度在12月份翻了一番，在1月份翻了三倍。

en: During the month of February the workmen had to contend with a sheet of water which made its way right across the outer soil.
zh: 在二月份，工人们不得不应付一片水流，这片水流正好穿过了外面的土壤。

en: It became necessary to employ very powerful pumps and compressed-air engines to drain it off, so as to close up the orifice from whence it issued;
zh: 有必要使用非常强大的泵和压缩空气发动机来排出它，以便关闭它从哪里发出的孔;

en: just as one stops a leak on board ship.
zh: 就像在船上堵漏一样。

en: They at last succeeded in getting the upper hand of these untoward streams;
zh: 他们终于成功地在这些不幸的溪流中占了上风;

en: only, in consequence of the loosening of the soil, the wheel partly gave way, and a slight partial settlement ensued.
zh: 只是，由于土壤松动，车轮部分地倒塌了，随之而来的是轻微的部分沉降。

en: This accident cost the life of several workmen.
zh: 这次事故夺去了几个工人的生命。

en: No fresh occurrence thenceforward arrested the progress of the operation;
zh: 此后再没有新的事件发生，阻止了行动的进展;

en: and on the tenth of June, twenty days before the expiration of the period fixed by Barbicane, the well, lined throughout with its facing of stone, had attained the depth of 900 feet.
zh: 六月十日，也就是巴比肯规定的期限到期前二十天，那口井已经到了九百英尺的深度。

en: At the bottom the masonry rested upon a massive block measuring thirty feet in thickness, while on the upper portion it was level with the surrounding soil.
zh: 砖石建筑的底部是一块厚达三十英尺的巨石，而上部则与周围的土壤水平。

en: President Barbicane and the members of the Gun Club warmly congratulated their engineer Murchison;
zh: 巴比肯总统和枪支俱乐部的成员热烈祝贺他们的工程师默奇森;

en: the cyclopean work had been accomplished with extraordinary rapidity.
zh: 独眼巨人的工作已经非常迅速地完成了。

en: During these eight months Barbicane never quitted Stones Hill for a single instant.
zh: 在这八个月里，巴比肯从来没有离开过石头山。

en: Keeping ever close by the work of excavation, he busied himself incessantly with the welfare and health of his workpeople,
zh: 他时刻关注着挖掘工作，不断地为工人的福利和健康而忙碌,

en: and was singularly fortunate in warding off the epidemics common to large communities of men, and so disastrous in those regions of the globe which are exposed to the influences of tropical climates.
zh: 并且非常幸运地避免了大量男性群体所共有的流行病，因此在那些受到热带气候影响的地区是灾难性的。

en: Many workmen, it is true, paid with their lives for the rashness inherent in these dangerous labors;
zh: 的确，许多工人为这些危险劳动中固有的轻率付出了生命的代价;

en: but these mishaps are impossible to be avoided, and they are classed among the details with which the Americans trouble themselves but little.
zh: 但这些不幸是不可避免的，它们被归类于美国人自找麻烦却很少的细节。

en: They have in fact more regard for human nature in general than for the individual in particular.
zh: 事实上，他们对人性的普遍重视程度超过了对个人的特殊重视程度。

en: Nevertheless, Barbicane professed opposite principles to these, and put them in force at every opportunity.
zh: 尽管如此，巴比康还是宣称自己的原则与这些原则相反，并且一有机会就把它们付诸实施。

en: So, thanks to his care, his intelligence, his useful intervention in all difficulties, his prodigious and humane sagacity, the average of accidents did not exceed that of transatlantic countries,
zh: 所以，多亏了他的关心，他的智慧，他对所有困难的有效干预，他的巨大和人道的智慧，事故的平均水平没有超过跨大西洋国家,

en: noted for their excessive precautions—France, for instance, among others, where they reckon about one accident for every two hundred thousand francs of work.
zh: 以过度谨慎著称ーー例如，在法国，他们估计每20万法郎的工作就会发生一起事故。

en: CHAPTER XV. THE FETE OF THE CASTING
zh: 第十五章铸造的庆典

en: During the eight months which were employed in the work of excavation the preparatory works of the casting had been carried on simultaneously with extreme rapidity.
zh: 在被用于挖掘工作的八个月期间，铸造的准备工作同时极其迅速地进行。

en: A stranger arriving at Stones Hill would have been surprised at the spectacle offered to his view.
zh: 一个陌生人来到石头山会对他所看到的景色感到惊讶。

en: At 600 yards from the well, and circularly arranged around it as a central point, rose 1,200 reverberating ovens,
zh: 在距井口600码的地方，围绕着它作为一个中心点，有1200个回响炉,

en: each six feet in diameter, and separated from each other by an interval of three feet.
zh: 每个直径六英尺，每个间隔三英尺。

en: The circumference occupied by these 1,200 ovens presented a length of two miles.
zh: 这1200个烤箱的周长为两英里。

en: Being all constructed on the same plan, each with its high quadrangular chimney, they produced a most singular effect.
zh: 它们都建在同一个平面上，每个平面上都有一个高高的四边形烟囱，产生了非常奇特的效果。

en: It will be remembered that on their third meeting the committee had decided to use cast iron for the Columbiad, and in particular the white description.
zh: 人们会记得，在他们的第三次会议上，委员会决定为 Columbiad 使用铸铁，特别是白色的描述。

en: This metal, in fact, is the most tenacious, the most ductile, and the most malleable, and consequently suitable for all moulding operations;
zh: 事实上，这种金属是最坚韧、最具延展性和最具延展性的，因此适用于所有的成型操作;

en: and when smelted with pit coal, is of superior quality for all engineering works requiring great resisting power, such as cannon, steam boilers, hydraulic presses, and the like.
zh: 用矿井煤冶炼时，对于所有需要很大阻力的工程作业，如火炮、蒸汽锅炉、液压机等，质量都是优良的。

en: Cast iron, however, if subjected to only one single fusion, is rarely sufficiently homogeneous;
zh: 然而，如果只经历一次熔合，铸铁很少是足够均匀的;

en: and it requires a second fusion completely to refine it by dispossessing it of its last earthly deposits.
zh: 它需要第二次完全融合，通过剥夺它最后的地球存款来提炼它。

en: So long before being forwarded to Tampa Town, the iron ore, molten in the great furnaces of Coldspring,
zh: 在被运往坦帕镇之前很久铁矿石在冷泉的巨大熔炉中熔化,

en: and brought into contact with coal and silicium heated to a high temperature, was carburized and transformed into cast iron.
zh: 并与煤和高温加热的硅接触，进行渗碳并转化为铸铁。

en: After this first operation, the metal was sent on to Stones Hill.
zh: 第一次手术后，金属被送到了石头山。

en: They had, however, to deal with 136,000,000 pounds of iron, a quantity far too costly to send by railway.
zh: 然而，他们必须处理136,000,000磅的铁，这个数量对于铁路运输来说太昂贵了。

en: The cost of transport would have been double that of material.
zh: 运输成本将是原材料成本的两倍。

en: It appeared preferable to freight vessels at New York, and to load them with the iron in bars.
zh: 它似乎比纽约的货船更可取，而且用铁条装载它们。

en: This, however, required not less than sixty- eight vessels of 1,000 tons, a veritable fleet,
zh: 然而，这需要不少于68艘1000吨的船只，一支名副其实的舰队,

en: which, quitting New York on the 3rd of May, on the 10th of the same month ascended the Bay of Espiritu Santo, and discharged their cargoes, without dues, in the port at Tampa Town.
zh: 它们于5月3日离开纽约，同月10日登上 Bay of Espiritu Santo，并在坦帕镇港口卸下了未缴纳的货物。

en: Thence the iron was transported by rail to Stones Hill, and about the middle of January this enormous mass of metal was delivered at its destination.
zh: 于是，铁被用铁路运到了石山，大约在一月中旬，这个巨大的金属块被运到了目的地。

en: It will easily be understood that 1,200 furnaces were not too many to melt simultaneously these 60,000 tons of iron.
zh: 人们很容易理解，1200个熔炉并不多，可以同时熔化这6万吨铁。

en: Each of these furnaces contained nearly 140,000 pounds weight of metal.
zh: 这些熔炉每个都含有近14万磅重的金属。

en: They were all built after the model of those which served for the casting of the Rodman gun;
zh: 它们都是按照罗德曼枪的铸造模型建造的;

en: they were trapezoidal in shape, with a high elliptical arch.
zh: 它们呈梯形，有一个高高的椭圆形拱门。

en: These furnaces, constructed of fireproof brick, were especially adapted for burning pit coal, with a flat bottom upon which the iron bars were laid.
zh: 这些用防火砖建造的炉子特别适合用来燃烧坑煤，炉底是平的，上面放着铁条。

en: This bottom, inclined at an angle of 25 degrees, allowed the metal to flow into the receiving troughs;
zh: 这个底部，倾斜25度角，使金属流入接收槽;

en: and the 1,200 converging trenches carried the molten metal down to the central well.
zh: 1200条汇合的沟渠将熔融的金属带到了中央的井里。

en: The day following that on which the works of the masonry and boring had been completed, Barbicane set to work upon the central mould.
zh: 第二天，砌筑和钻孔的工作已经完成，巴比肯开始在中央模具上工作。

en: His object now was to raise within the center of the well, and with a coincident axis,
zh: 他现在的目标是在井的中心上升，并与轴重合,

en: a cylinder 900 feet high, and nine feet in diameter, which should exactly fill up the space reserved for the bore of the Columbiad.
zh: 一个900英尺高，直径9英尺的圆柱体，这个圆柱体应该刚好能填满留给哥伦比亚号钻孔的空间。

en: This cylinder was composed of a mixture of clay and sand, with the addition of a little hay and straw.
zh: 这个圆筒是由粘土和沙子的混合物，加上一点干草和稻草组成的。

en: The space left between the mould and the masonry was intended to be filled up by the molten metal, which would thus form the walls six feet in thickness.
zh: 在模具和砖石之间留下的空间被熔融的金属填满，这样就形成了六英尺厚的墙壁。

en: This cylinder, in order to maintain its equilibrium, had to be bound by iron bands, and firmly fixed at certain intervals by cross-clamps fastened into the stone lining;
zh: 这个圆筒，为了保持它的平衡，必须用铁带绑住，并用交叉夹子固定在石头衬里上;

en: after the castings these would be buried in the block of metal, leaving no external projection.
zh: 在铸造之后，这些将被埋在金属块中，不会留下任何外部凸起。

en: This operation was completed on the 8th of July, and the run of the metal was fixed for the following day.
zh: 这次操作于7月8日完成，第二天金属的运行被固定下来。

en: “This fete of the casting will be a grand ceremony,” said J. T. Maston to his friend Barbicane.
zh: 马斯顿对他的朋友巴比肯说: “这次选角盛会将是一个盛大的仪式。”。

en: “Undoubtedly,” said Barbicane;
zh: “毫无疑问,”巴比肯说;

en: “but it will not be a public fete“
zh: “但这不会是一个公开的节日”

en: “What! will you not open the gates of the enclosure to all comers?”
zh: “什么! 难道你不打开围墙的大门让所有的人进来吗?”

en: “I must be very careful, Maston.
zh: “我必须非常小心，Maston。

en: The casting of the Columbiad is an extremely delicate, not to say a dangerous operation, and I should prefer its being done privately.
zh: “哥伦比亚号”的铸造工艺非常精细，更不用说是危险的操作了，我希望能私下进行。

en: At the discharge of the projectile, a fete if you like—till then, no!”
zh: 在发射时，如果你愿意的话，可以举行宴会——在那之前，不行!”

en: The president was right.
zh: 总统是对的。

en: The operation involved unforeseen dangers, which a great influx of spectators would have hindered him from averting.
zh: 这次行动涉及到意想不到的危险，大量的观众涌入会阻碍他避免这种危险。

en: It was necessary to preserve complete freedom of movement.
zh: 保持完全的行动自由是必要的。

en: No one was admitted within the enclosure except a delegation of members of the Gun Club, who had made the voyage to Tampa Town.
zh: 除了一个前往坦帕镇的枪支俱乐部成员代表团外，围场内不允许任何人入内。

en: Among these was the brisk Bilsby, Tom Hunter, Colonel Blomsberry, Major Elphinstone, General Morgan, and the rest of the lot to whom the casting of the Columbiad was a matter of personal interest.
zh: 其中有活泼的比尔斯比、汤姆 · 亨特、布卢姆斯伯里上校、埃尔芬斯通少校、摩根将军以及其他人，他们对哥伦比亚号的选角都很感兴趣。

en: J. T. Maston became their cicerone.
zh: J.T. 马斯顿成了他们的导游。

en: He omitted no point of detail;
zh: 他没有遗漏任何细节;

en: he conducted them throughout the magazines, workshops, through the midst of the engines, and compelled them to visit the whole 1,200 furnaces one after the other.
zh: 他带领他们穿过杂志，车间，穿过引擎，强迫他们一个接一个地参观整个1200个熔炉。

en: At the end of the twelve-hundredth visit they were pretty well knocked up.
zh: 在第1200次访问结束时，他们的肚子已经很大了。

en: The casting was to take place at twelve o’clock precisely.
zh: 选角将在十二点整准时举行。

en: The previous evening each furnace had been charged with 114,000 pounds weight of metal in bars disposed cross-ways to each other, so as to allow the hot air to circulate freely between them.
zh: 前一天晚上，每个炉子都装上了114,000磅重的金属棒，这些金属棒相互交叉排列，以便热空气在炉子之间自由流通。

en: At daybreak the 1,200 chimneys vomited their torrents of flame into the air, and the ground was agitated with dull tremblings.
zh: 黎明时分，1200个烟囱向空中喷出熊熊火焰，地面因为无声的震动而颤动起来。

en: As many pounds of metal as there were to cast, so many pounds of coal were there to burn.
zh: 有多少磅金属要铸造，就有多少磅煤要烧。

en: Thus there were 68,000 tons of coal which projected in the face of the sun a thick curtain of smoke.
zh: 因此，有68,000吨的煤在太阳的面前投射出一层厚厚的烟幕。

en: The heat soon became insupportable within the circle of furnaces, the rumbling of which resembled the rolling of thunder.
zh: 炉子里的热气很快就受不了了，轰隆隆的声音就像滚滚的雷声。

en: The powerful ventilators added their continuous blasts and saturated with oxygen the glowing plates.
zh: 强有力的通风装置增加了持续的爆炸，使发光板充满了氧气。

en: The operation, to be successful, required to be conducted with great rapidity.
zh: 这次行动要想成功，就必须迅速进行。

en: On a signal given by a cannon-shot each furnace was to give vent to the molten iron and completely to empty itself.
zh: 根据大炮发出的信号，每个熔炉都要把熔化的铁水排出去，然后把它自己完全倒空。

en: These arrangements made, foremen and workmen waited the preconcerted moment with an impatience mingled with a certain amount of emotion.
zh: 作出这些安排后，工头和工人们带着一种夹杂着某种情绪的不耐烦等待着预定的时刻。

en: Not a soul remained within the enclosure.
zh: 笼子里一个人也没有。

en: Each superintendent took his post by the aperture of the run.
zh: 每个管理人员都是凭借自己的能力上任的。

en: Barbicane and his colleagues, perched on a neighboring eminence, assisted at the operation.
zh: 巴比肯和他的同事们坐在附近的一个显要位置上，协助进行手术。

en: In front of them was a piece of artillery ready to give fire on the signal from the engineer.
zh: 在他们面前有一门炮，随时准备根据工程师发出的信号开火。

en: Some minutes before midday the first driblets of metal began to flow;
zh: 中午前几分钟，第一滴金属开始流动;

en: the reservoirs filled little by little;
zh: 水库一点一点地被填满;

en: and, by the time that the whole melting was completely accomplished, it was kept in abeyance for a few minutes in order to facilitate the separation of foreign substances.
zh: 而且，当整个熔化完成时，为了便于分离外来物质，它被暂停了几分钟。

en: Twelve o’clock struck! A gunshot suddenly pealed forth and shot its flame into the air.
zh: 十二点钟敲响了! 一声枪响突然响起，把火焰射向空中。

en: Twelve hundred melting-troughs were simultaneously opened and twelve hundred fiery serpents crept toward the central well, unrolling their incandescent curves.
zh: 一千二百个熔槽同时被打开，一千二百条火蛇缓缓爬向中央的井，展开它们炽热的曲线。

en: There, down they plunged with a terrific noise into a depth of 900 feet.
zh: 在那里，他们带着可怕的噪音跳入900英尺的深度。

en: It was an exciting and a magnificent spectacle.
zh: 这是一个令人兴奋和壮观的景象。

en: The ground trembled, while these molten waves, launching into the sky their wreaths of smoke,
zh: 大地颤抖着，而这些熔化的波浪，向天空发射出它们的烟圈,

en: evaporated the moisture of the mould and hurled it upward through the vent-holes of the stone lining in the form of dense vapor-clouds.
zh: 蒸发了霉菌的水分，然后以浓密的蒸汽云的形式，通过石头衬里的通风孔向上投掷。

en: These artificial clouds unrolled their thick spirals to a height of 1,000 yards into the air.
zh: 这些人造云把它们厚厚的螺旋展开到1000码的高度。

en: A savage, wandering somewhere beyond the limits of the horizon, might have believed that some new crater was forming in the bosom of Florida,
zh: 一个野蛮人，在地平线以外的某个地方徘徊也许会相信在佛罗里达州的怀抱中正在形成一些新的陨石坑,

en: although there was neither any eruption, nor typhoon, nor storm, nor struggle of the elements, nor any of those terrible phenomena which nature is capable of producing.
zh: 虽然没有任何喷发，没有台风，没有风暴，没有大自然的挣扎，也没有任何大自然能够产生的可怕现象。

en: No, it was man alone who had produced these reddish vapors, these gigantic flames worthy of a volcano itself,
zh: 不，只有人类产生了这些微红色的蒸汽这些巨大的火焰本身就值得一座火山,

en: these tremendous vibrations resembling the shock of an earthquake, these reverberations rivaling those of hurricanes and storms;
zh: 这些巨大的震动类似于地震的冲击，这些回响堪比飓风和风暴;

en: and it was his hand which precipitated into an abyss, dug by himself, a whole Niagara of molten metal!
zh: 是他的手沉入了一个深渊，是他自己挖的，一整个尼亚加拉河的熔融金属！

en: CHAPTER XVI. THE COLUMBIAD
zh: 第十六章哥伦比亚

en: Had the casting succeeded? They were reduced to mere conjecture.
zh: 选角成功了吗? 他们只能靠猜测了。

en: There was indeed every reason to expect success, since the mould has absorbed the entire mass of the molten metal;
zh: 确实有充分的理由期待成功，因为模具已经吸收了整个熔融金属的质量;

en: still some considerable time must elapse before they could arrive at any certainty upon the matter.
zh: 在他们就此事达成任何确定意见之前，还需要相当长的一段时间。

en: The patience of the members of the Gun Club was sorely tried during this period of time.
zh: 在这段时间里，枪支俱乐部成员的耐心受到了极大的考验。

en: But they could do nothing.
zh: 但他们无能为力。

en: J. T. Maston escaped roasting by a miracle.
zh: J · T · 马斯顿奇迹般地逃过一劫。

en: Fifteen days after the casting an immense column of smoke was still rising in the open sky and the ground burned the soles of the feet within a radius of two hundred feet round the summit of Stones Hill.
zh: 铸造十五天后，一个巨大的烟柱仍然在空中上升，地面烧伤的脚底方圆二百英尺的石头山顶。

en: It was impossible to approach nearer.
zh: 不可能再靠近了。

en: All they could do was to wait with what patience they might.
zh: 他们所能做的就是耐心等待。

en: “Here we are at the 10th of August,” exclaimed J. T. Maston one morning, “only four months to the 1st of December!
zh: “我们现在是8月10日,”一天早上 J · T · 马斯顿(J.T. Maston)喊道，“离12月1日只有四个月了！

en: We shall never be ready in time!” Barbicane said nothing, but his silence covered serious irritation.
zh: 我们永远不可能及时准备好!”巴比肯什么也没说，但他的沉默掩盖了严重的恼怒。

en: However, daily observations revealed a certain change going on in the state of the ground.
zh: 然而，每天的观测显示，地面状态正在发生某种变化。

en: About the 15th of August the vapors ejected had sensibly diminished in intensity and thickness.
zh: 大约在8月15日，喷射出来的蒸汽在强度和厚度上明显减少了。

en: Some days afterward the earth exhaled only a slight puff of smoke, the last breath of the monster enclosed within its circle of stone.
zh: 过了几天，大地只吐出一缕轻微的烟雾，这是怪物最后一次呼吸，它被包围在石圈里。

en: Little by little the belt of heat contracted, until on the 22nd of August,
zh: 热带一点一点地收缩，直到8月22日,

en: Barbicane, his colleagues, and the engineer were enabled to set foot on the iron sheet which lay level upon the summit of Stones Hill.
zh: 巴比肯、他的同事和工程师得以踏上平坦在石头山顶上的铁皮。

en: “At last!” exclaimed the president of the Gun Club, with an immense sigh of relief.
zh: “终于!”大炮俱乐部的主席大声说道，长长地舒了一口气。

en: The work was resumed the same day.
zh: 工作在同一天恢复进行。

en: They proceeded at once to extract the interior mould, for the purpose of clearing out the boring of the piece.
zh: 他们立即着手提取内部的模具，以便清除钻孔的作品。

en: Pickaxes and boring irons were set to work without intermission.
zh: 镐和镗铁被安置在不间断地工作。

en: The clayey and sandy soils had acquired extreme hardness under the action of the heat;
zh: 粘性土和砂质土在高温作用下获得了极高的硬度;

en: but, by the aid of the machines, the rubbish on being dug out was rapidly carted away on railway wagons;
zh: 但是，在机器的帮助下，正在挖掘的垃圾被迅速地用火车车厢运走了;

en: and such was the ardor of the work, so persuasive the arguments of Barbicane’s dollars, that by the 3rd of September all traces of the mould had entirely disappeared.
zh: 这件作品的热情是如此之高，巴比肯币的论据是如此有说服力，以至于到了9月3日，霉菌的所有痕迹都完全消失了。

en: Immediately the operation of boring was commenced;
zh: 钻孔作业立即开始;

en: and by the aid of powerful machines, a few weeks later, the inner surface of the immense tube had been rendered perfectly cylindrical, and the bore of the piece had acquired a thorough polish.
zh: 在强大的机器的帮助下，几个星期后，这根巨大的管子的内表面已经完全成了圆柱形，管子的内孔已经彻底抛光。

en: At length, on the 22d of September, less than a twelvemonth after Barbicane’s original proposition, the enormous weapon, accurately bored, and exactly vertically pointed, was ready for work.
zh: 终于，在9月22日，也就是巴比肯最初提出建议后不到12个月的时候，这个巨大的武器，精确地钻孔，并且精确地垂直指向，已经准备好工作了。

en: There was only the moon now to wait for;
zh: 现在只有月亮可以等待;

en: and they were pretty sure that she would not fail in the rendezvous.
zh: 他们很确定她不会在约会中失败。

en: The ecstasy of J. T. Maston knew no bounds, and he narrowly escaped a frightful fall while staring down the tube.
zh: J.T. 马斯顿的狂喜无边无际，他盯着电视机，险些摔倒。

en: But for the strong hand of Colonel Blomsberry, the worthy secretary, like a modern Erostratus, would have found his death in the depths of the Columbiad.
zh: 如果没有布隆斯伯里上校的强有力的手段，这位值得尊敬的秘书，就像现代的埃罗斯特拉图斯一样，会发现他死在哥伦比亚的深处。

en: The cannon was then finished;
zh: 然后大炮完成了;

en: there was no possible doubt as to its perfect completion.
zh: 毫无疑问，它完美地完成了。

en: So, on the 6th of October, Captain Nicholl opened an account between himself and President Barbicane, in which he debited himself to the latter in the sum of two thousand dollars.
zh: 因此，在10月6日，尼克尔上尉在他和巴比肯总统之间开了一个账户，在这个账户中，他借记了巴比肯总统2000美元。

en: One may believe that the captain’s wrath was increased to its highest point, and must have made him seriously ill.
zh: 人们可能会认为船长的愤怒达到了最高点，一定是他得了重病。

en: However, he had still three bets of three, four, and five thousand dollars, respectively;
zh: 然而，他还有三个赌注，分别是三千、四千和五千美元;

en: and if he gained two out of these, his position would not be very bad.
zh: 如果他从中得到两个，他的地位就不会很差。

en: But the money question did not enter into his calculations;
zh: 但金钱问题并没有进入他的计算之中;

en: it was the success of his rival in casting a cannon against which iron plates sixty feet thick would have been ineffectual, that dealt him a terrible blow.
zh: 他的对手成功地铸造了一门六十英尺厚的铁板根本无法对付的大炮，给了他可怕的一击。

en: After the 23rd of September the enclosure of Stones hill was thrown open to the public;
zh: 9月23日后，石头山的围墙向公众开放;

en: and it will be easily imagined what was the concourse of visitors to this spot!
zh: 很容易就能想象到这个地方的游客大厅是什么样子的！

en: There was an incessant flow of people to and from Tampa Town and the place, which resembled a procession, or rather, in fact, a pilgrimage.
zh: 人们不断地往返于坦帕镇和这个地方，看起来就像一个游行队伍，或者更确切地说，是一次朝圣之旅。

en: It was already clear to be seen that, on the day of the experiment itself, the aggregate of spectators would be counted by millions;
zh: 显而易见，在实验当天，观众的总数将达到数百万;

en: for they were already arriving from all parts of the earth upon this narrow strip of promontory.
zh: 因为他们已经从世界各地来到了这片狭长的海角地带。

en: Europe was emigrating to America.
zh: 欧洲移民到美国。

en: Up to that time, however, it must be confessed, the curiosity of the numerous comers was but scantily gratified.
zh: 然而，不得不承认，到那时为止，无数来访者的好奇心只是勉强得到了满足。

en: Most had counted upon witnessing the spectacle of the casting, and they were treated to nothing but smoke.
zh: 他们中的大多数人都指望能亲眼目睹选角的盛况，结果却只能看到烟雾。

en: This was sorry food for hungry eyes;
zh: 对于饥饿的眼睛来说，这是令人遗憾的食物;

en: but Barbicane would admit no one to that operation.
zh: 但是巴比肯不会让任何人参加那次行动。

en: Then ensued grumbling, discontent, murmurs;
zh: 然后是抱怨、不满、低语;

en: they blamed the president, taxed him with dictatorial conduct.
zh: 他们指责总统，对他的独裁行为征税。

en: His proceedings were declared “un-American.” There was very nearly a riot round Stones Hill;
zh: 他的诉讼程序被宣布为“非美国”

en: but Barbicane remained inflexible.
zh: 但是巴比康仍然顽固不化。

en: When, however, the Columbiad was entirely finished, this state of closed doors could no longer be maintained;
zh: 然而，当哥伦比亚完全建成时，这种关门的状态再也无法维持;

en: besides it would have been bad taste, and even imprudence, to affront the public feeling.
zh: 此外，冒犯公众的感情是不好的，甚至是轻率的。

en: Barbicane, therefore, opened the enclosure to all comers;
zh: 因此，巴比康向所有来者开放了围场;

en: but, true to his practical disposition, he determined to coin money out of the public curiosity.
zh: 但是，出于实际情况，他决定出于公众的好奇心而铸造货币。

en: It was something, indeed, to be enabled to contemplate this immense Columbiad;
zh: 事实上，这是一件能够让人思考这个巨大的哥伦比亚的东西;

en: but to descend into its depths, this seemed to the Americans the ne plus ultra of earthly felicity.
zh: 但是深入到它的深处，在美国人看来，这就是世俗幸福的最高境界。

en: Consequently, there was not one curious spectator who was not willing to give himself the treat of visiting the interior of this great metallic abyss.
zh: 因此，没有一个好奇的观众不愿意赏脸参观这个巨大的金属深渊的内部。

en: Baskets suspended from steam-cranes permitted them to satisfy their curiosity.
zh: 吊在蒸汽起重机上的篮子满足了他们的好奇心。

en: There was a perfect mania.
zh: 那是一种完美的狂热。

en: Women, children, old men, all made it a point of duty to penetrate the mysteries of the colossal gun.
zh: 妇女，儿童，老人，所有人都有责任去揭开这支巨大枪支的神秘面纱。

en: The fare for the descent was fixed at five dollars per head;
zh: 下山的票价固定在每人五美元;

en: and despite this high charge, during the two months which preceded the experiment, the influx of visitors enabled the Gun Club to pocket nearly five hundred thousand dollars!
zh: 尽管收费很高，在实验前的两个月里，大量游客的涌入使得枪支俱乐部赚了将近五十万美元！

en: It is needless to say that the first visitors of the Columbiad were the members of the Gun Club.
zh: 不用说，哥伦比亚大学的第一批访客是枪支俱乐部的成员。

en: This privilege was justly reserved for that illustrious body.
zh: 这个特权是为那个杰出的机构保留的。

en: The ceremony took place on the 25th of September.
zh: 仪式在9月25日上举行。

en: A basket of honor took down the president, J. T. Maston, Major Elphinstone, General Morgan, Colonel Blomsberry, and other members of the club, to the number of ten in all.
zh: 一篮子荣誉将总统 J · T · 马斯顿、艾尔芬斯通少校、摩根将军、布卢姆斯伯里上校和俱乐部的其他成员一起打倒在地，总共有十个人。

en: How hot it was at the bottom of that long tube of metal! They were half suffocated.
zh: 在那长长的金属管底部是多么热啊! 他们都快窒息了。

en: But what delight! What ecstasy!
zh: 但是多么令人高兴! 多么令人陶醉！

en: A table had been laid with six covers on the massive stone which formed the bottom of the Columbiad, and lighted by a jet of electric light resembling that of day itself.
zh: 一张桌子被放置在一块巨大的石头上，这块石头构成了 Columbiad 的底部，桌子被一束类似于白天的电光照亮。

en: Numerous exquisite dishes, which seemed to descend from heaven, were placed successively before the guests,
zh: 无数精美的菜肴仿佛从天而降，依次摆放在客人面前,

en: and the richest wines of France flowed in profusion during this splendid repast, served nine hundred feet beneath the surface of the earth!
zh: 在这丰盛的晚餐期间，法国最丰富的葡萄酒在地下九百英尺的地方流淌！

en: The festival was animated, not to say somewhat noisy.
zh: 这个节日非常热闹，更不用说有些吵闹了。

en: Toasts flew backward and forward.
zh: 祝酒词来来回回。

en: They drank to the earth and to her satellite, to the Gun Club, the Union, the Moon, Diana, Phoebe, Selene, the “peaceful courier of the night!”
zh: 他们向地球和她的卫星，向枪支俱乐部，联邦，月亮，戴安娜，菲比，瑟琳娜，“和平的夜晚信使!”

en: All the hurrahs, carried upward upon the sonorous waves of the immense acoustic tube, arrived with the sound of thunder at its mouth;
zh: 所有的欢呼声，随着巨大的声管的洪亮的波浪而向上传递，伴随着它口中的雷声而来;

en: and the multitude ranged round Stones Hill heartily united their shouts with those of the ten revelers hidden from view at the bottom of the gigantic Columbiad.
zh: 石头山周围的人群和那些隐藏在巨大的哥伦比亚山脚下的十个狂欢者一起热烈地欢呼着。

en: J. T. Maston was no longer master of himself.
zh: J · T · 马斯顿不再是自己的主人了。

en: Whether he shouted or gesticulated, ate or drank most, would be a difficult matter to determine.
zh: 至于他是大喊大叫还是打手势，是吃得最多还是喝得最多，则是一个难以确定的问题。

en: At all events, he would not have given his place up for an empire, “not even if the cannon—loaded, primed, and fired at that very moment—were to blow him in pieces into the planetary world.”
zh: 无论如何，他都不会为了一个帝国而放弃自己的位置，“即使在那一刻上膛、启动并发射的大炮把他炸成碎片，也不会。”

en: CHAPTER XVII. A TELEGRAPHIC DISPATCH
zh: 第十七章电报发送

en: The great works undertaken by the Gun Club had now virtually come to an end;
zh: 大炮俱乐部所进行的伟大工程现在实际上已经结束;

en: and two months still remained before the day for the discharge of the shot to the moon.
zh: 距离向月球发射火箭的日期还有两个月。

en: To the general impatience these two months appeared as long as years!
zh: 对一般人来说，这两个月的不耐烦似乎长达数年之久！

en: Hitherto the smallest details of the operation had been daily chronicled by the journals, which the public devoured with eager eyes.
zh: 到目前为止，这次行动的最小细节每天都被各种杂志记录下来，公众热切地关注着这些杂志。

en: Just at this moment a circumstance, the most unexpected, the most extraordinary and incredible,
zh: 就在此时此刻，一个最意想不到，最不可思议，最不可思议的情况,

en: occurred to rouse afresh their panting spirits, and to throw every mind into a state of the most violent excitement.
zh: 使他们气喘吁吁的精神重新振作起来，使每个人的头脑都进入一种极度兴奋的状态。

en: One day, the 30th of September, at 3:47 P.M., a telegram, transmitted by cable from Valentia (Ireland) to Newfoundland and the American Mainland, arrived at the address of President Barbicane.
zh: 一天，下午3点47分，9月30日收到一封电报，电报通过电缆从瓦伦蒂亚(爱尔兰)发往纽芬兰和美国大陆，抵达巴比肯总统的住所。

en: The president tore open the envelope, read the dispatch, and, despite his remarkable powers of self-control, his lips turned pale and his eyes grew dim, on reading the twenty words of this telegram.
zh: 总统撕开信封，读了这封电报，尽管他有着惊人的自制力，但是在读到这封电报的二十个字时，他的嘴唇变得苍白，眼睛变得昏暗。

en: Here is the text of the dispatch, which figures now in the archives of the Gun Club:
zh: 以下是枪支俱乐部档案中的调度文件:

en: FRANCE, PARIS, 30 September, 4 A.M. Barbicane, Tampa Town, Florida, United States.
zh: 法国巴黎9月30日上午4点美国佛罗里达州坦帕镇巴比肯。

en: Substitute for your spherical shell a cylindro-conical projectile.
zh: 代替你的球形外壳的是一个圆柱-圆锥形弹丸。

en: I shall go inside. Shall arrive by steamer Atlanta. MICHEL ARDAN.
zh: 我要进去，坐轮船到亚特兰大，米歇尔 · 阿尔丹。

en: CHAPTER XVIII. THE PASSENGER OF THE ATLANTA
zh: 第十八章亚特兰大号的乘客

en: If this astounding news, instead of flying through the electric wires, had simply arrived by post in the ordinary sealed envelope, Barbicane would not have hesitated a moment.
zh: 如果这个令人震惊的消息不是通过电线传来的，而是用普通密封的信封邮寄过来的话，巴比肯一点也不会犹豫。

en: He would have held his tongue about it, both as a measure of prudence, and in order not to have to reconsider his plans.
zh: 为了谨慎起见，也为了不重新考虑自己的计划，他本可以对此保持沉默。

en: This telegram might be a cover for some jest, especially as it came from a Frenchman.
zh: 这封电报可能是一些玩笑的幌子，尤其是它来自一个法国人。

en: What human being would ever have conceived the idea of such a journey?
zh: 什么样的人会想到这样的旅行？

en: and, if such a person really existed, he must be an idiot, whom one would shut up in a lunatic ward, rather than within the walls of the projectile.
zh: 而且，如果这样的人真的存在，他一定是一个白痴，人们会把他关在一个疯人院里，而不是把他关在发射器的墙里。

en: The contents of the dispatch, however, speedily became known;
zh: 然而，这封信的内容很快就为人所知;

en: for the telegraphic officials possessed but little discretion, and Michel Ardan’s proposition ran at once throughout the several States of the Union.
zh: 因为电报官员几乎没有什么自由裁量权，米歇尔 · 阿尔丹的提议立刻传遍了美国的几个州。

en: Barbicane, had, therefore, no further motives for keeping silence.
zh: 因此，巴比康没有其他保持沉默的动机。

en: Consequently, he called together such of his colleagues as were at the moment in Tampa Town, and without any expression of his own opinions simply read to them the laconic text itself.
zh: 因此，他把当时在坦帕市的同事们召集在一起，没有表达自己的任何意见，只是简短地向他们宣读了案文本身。

en: It was received with every possible variety of expressions of doubt, incredulity, and derision from every one, with the exception of J. T. Maston, who exclaimed, “It is a grand idea, however!”
zh: 除了 J · T · 马斯顿(J.T. Maston)以外，每个人都用各种各样的表情表示怀疑、怀疑和嘲笑，他们都接受了这个想法。马斯顿大声说: “不过，这是一个伟大的想法!”

en: When Barbicane originally proposed to send a shot to the moon every one looked upon the enterprise as simple and practicable enough—a mere question of gunnery;
zh: 当巴比肯最初提议向月球发射一枚导弹时，每个人都认为这个计划足够简单可行ーー只不过是一个射击问题;

en: but when a person, professing to be a reasonable being, offered to take passage within the projectile, the whole thing became a farce, or, in plainer language a humbug.
zh: 但当一个自称理智的人主动提出要在炮弹中通过时，整个事情就变成了一场闹剧，或者用更直白的语言来说，就是一场骗局。

en: One question, however, remained.
zh: 然而，还有一个问题。

en: Did such a being exist? This telegram flashed across the depths of the Atlantic, the designation of the vessel on board which he was to take his passage,
zh: 这样的存在真的存在吗？这封电报在大西洋深处一闪而过，上面写着他要乘坐的船只的名称,

en: the date assigned for his speedy arrival, all combined to impart a certain character of reality to the proposal.
zh: 为他的迅速到达指定的日期，所有这些加在一起，赋予了提案一定的现实性。

en: They must get some clearer notion of the matter.
zh: 他们必须对这件事有更清楚的认识。

en: Scattered groups of inquirers at length condensed themselves into a compact crowd, which made straight for the residence of President Barbicane.
zh: 分散的调查人员最后聚集成一个紧凑的人群，直奔巴比肯总统的官邸。

en: That worthy individual was keeping quiet with the intention of watching events as they arose.
zh: 那个值得尊敬的人一直保持沉默，目的是观察事态的发展。

en: But he had forgotten to take into account the public impatience;
zh: 但他忘了考虑公众的不耐烦;

en: and it was with no pleasant countenance that he watched the population of Tampa Town gathering under his windows.
zh: 他看着坦帕镇的人们聚集在他的窗下，脸上没有一丝愉快的神情。

en: The murmurs and vociferations below presently obliged him to appear.
zh: 楼下的窃窃私语和喧闹声迫使他不得不现身。

en: He came forward, therefore, and on silence being procured,
zh: 于是，他走上前来，在一片寂静中,

en: a citizen put point-blank to him the following question: “Is the person mentioned in the telegram, under the name of Michel Ardan, on his way here? Yes or no.”
zh: 一位市民直截了当地向他提出了以下问题: “电报中提到的那个名叫米歇尔 · 阿尔丹的人是否正在来这里的路上?”？是或不是

en: “Gentlemen,” replied Barbicane, “I know no more than you do.”
zh: “先生们,”巴比肯回答，“我知道的不比你们多。”

en: “We must know,” roared the impatient voices.
zh: “我们必须知道,”不耐烦的声音吼道。

en: “Time will show,” calmly replied the president.
zh: “时间会证明一切的,”总统平静地回答。

en: “Time has no business to keep a whole country in suspense,” replied the orator.
zh: “时间没有必要让整个国家悬而未决,”演说家回答说。

en: “Have you altered the plans of the projectile according to the request of the telegram?”
zh: “你是否按照电报的要求改变了发射计划?”

en: “Not yet, gentlemen; but you are right! we must have better information to go by.
zh: “还没有，先生们，但是你们是对的! 我们必须有更好的消息。

en: The telegraph must complete its information.”
zh: 电报必须完成它的信息。”

en: “To the telegraph!” roared the crowd.
zh: “去发电报!”人群大声喊道。

en: Barbicane descended; and heading the immense assemblage, led the way to the telegraph office.
zh: 巴比康下来了，带领着庞大的人群，一路走到电报局。

en: A few minutes later a telegram was dispatched to the secretary of the underwriters at Liverpool, requesting answers to the following queries:
zh: 几分钟后，有人发电报给利物浦保险公司的秘书，要求他回答以下问题:

en: “About the ship Atlanta—when did she leave Europe? Had she on board a Frenchman named Michel Ardan?”
zh: “关于亚特兰大号船ーー她是什么时候离开欧洲的? 她是不是上了一个叫米歇尔 · 阿尔丹的法国人的船?”

en: Two hours afterward Barbicane received information too exact to leave room for the smallest remaining doubt.
zh: 两个小时后，巴比肯收到的信息太精确，以至于无法留下最小的怀疑余地。

en: “The steamer Atlanta from Liverpool put to sea on the 2nd of October, bound for Tampa Town, having on board a Frenchman borne on the list of passengers by the name of Michel Ardan.”
zh: 从利物浦出发的亚特兰大号轮船于10月2日出海，驶往坦帕镇，船上载有一名名叫米歇尔 · 阿尔丹的法国人

en: That very evening he wrote to the house of Breadwill and Co., requesting them to suspend the casting of the projectile until the receipt of further orders.
zh: 那天晚上，他写信给 Breadwill 公司，要求他们在接到进一步的命令之前暂停投掷炮弹。

en: On the 10th of October, at nine A.M., the semaphores of the Bahama Canal signaled a thick smoke on the horizon.
zh: 10月10日上午9点，Bahama Canal 的信号灯发出了地平线上浓烟滚滚的信号。

en: Two hours later a large steamer exchanged signals with them.
zh: 两小时后，一艘大轮船与他们交换了信号。

en: the name of the Atlanta flew at once over Tampa Town.
zh: 亚特兰大的名字立刻飞过坦帕镇。

en: At four o’clock the English vessel entered the Bay of Espiritu Santo.
zh: 四点钟，英国船只进入 Bay of Espiritu Santo。

en: At five it crossed the passage of Hillisborough Bay at full steam.
zh: 五点钟，它全速驶过希利斯伯勒湾。

en: At six she cast anchor at Port Tampa.
zh: 六岁时她在坦帕港抛锚。

en: The anchor had scarcely caught the sandy bottom when five hundred boats surrounded the Atlanta, and the steamer was taken by assault.
zh: 锚刚刚停在沙滩上，五百艘船就包围了亚特兰大，轮船被突击队夺走了。

en: Barbicane was the first to set foot on deck, and in a voice of which he vainly tried to conceal the emotion, called “Michel Ardan.”
zh: 巴比康是第一个踏上甲板的人，他用一种叫做“米歇尔 · 阿尔丹”的声音试图掩饰自己的情绪，但却徒劳无功

en: “Here!” replied an individual perched on the poop.
zh: “在这里!”一个坐在便便上的人回答。

en: Barbicane, with arms crossed, looked fixedly at the passenger of the Atlanta.
zh: 巴比康双臂交叉，目不转睛地看着亚特兰大号的乘客。

en: He was a man of about forty-two years of age, of large build, but slightly round-shouldered.
zh: 他大约四十二岁，身材魁梧，但是肩膀略微有点圆。

en: His massive head momentarily shook a shock of reddish hair, which resembled a lion’s mane.
zh: 他那硕大的脑袋立刻摇动了一下，露出一撮红色的头发，看起来像狮子的鬃毛。

en: His face was short with a broad forehead, and furnished with a moustache as bristly as a cat’s, and little patches of yellowish whiskers upon full cheeks.
zh: 他的脸很短，前额很宽，留着像猫一样硬的胡子，两颊丰满，上面还有一小撮黄色的胡须。

en: Round, wildish eyes, slightly near-sighted, completed a physiognomy essentially feline.
zh: 圆圆的，野性的眼睛，稍微近视，完成了基本上是猫科动物的外貌。

en: His nose was firmly shaped, his mouth particularly sweet in expression, high forehead, intelligent and furrowed with wrinkles like a newly-plowed field.
zh: 他的鼻子很结实，嘴巴的表情特别甜美，额头高高的，聪明的，皱纹多的像刚犁过的田。

en: The body was powerfully developed and firmly fixed upon long legs.
zh: 身体有力地发展，牢牢地固定在长腿上。

en: Muscular arms, and a general air of decision gave him the appearance of a hardy, jolly, companion.
zh: 肌肉发达的胳膊和一副果断的样子使他看起来像一个强壮、快乐的伙伴。

en: He was dressed in a suit of ample dimensions, loose neckerchief, open shirtcollar, disclosing a robust neck;
zh: 他穿着一套尺寸很大的西装，宽松的围巾，敞开的衬衫领子，露出结实的脖子;

en: his cuffs were invariably unbuttoned, through which appeared a pair of red hands.
zh: 他的袖口总是解着扣子，从袖口里伸出一双红红的手。

en: On the bridge of the steamer, in the midst of the crowd, he bustled to and fro, never still for a moment, “dragging his anchors,” as the sailors say,
zh: 在轮船的驾驶台上，在人群中间，他来来回回，一刻也没有停下来，正如水手们所说的“拖着锚”,

en: gesticulating, making free with everybody, biting his nails with nervous avidity.
zh: 打着手势，和每个人都很随意，神经质地贪婪地咬着指甲。

en: He was one of those originals which nature sometimes invents in the freak of a moment, and of which she then breaks the mould.
zh: 他是大自然有时在一瞬间创造出来的原型之一，然后她打破了这种模式。

en: Among other peculiarities, this curiosity gave himself out for a sublime ignoramus, “like Shakespeare,” and professed supreme contempt for all scientific men.
zh: 除了其他特点之外，这种好奇心使他自己成为一个崇高的无知者，“像莎士比亚一样”，并宣称对所有科学家都极其蔑视。

en: Those “fellows,” as he called them, “are only fit to mark the points, while we play the game.” He was, in fact, a thorough Bohemian, adventurous, but not an adventurer;
zh: 那些“家伙”，他这样称呼他们，“只适合在我们玩游戏的时候标记分数。”事实上，他是一个彻头彻尾的波西米亚人，爱冒险，但不是一个冒险家;

en: a hare-brained fellow, a kind of Icarus, only possessing relays of wings.
zh: 一个头脑简单的家伙，一种伊卡洛斯，只有继电器的翅膀。

en: For the rest, he was ever in scrapes, ending invariably by falling on his feet, like those little figures which they sell for children’s toys.
zh: 其余的时候，他总是陷入困境，最后总是跌倒在地，就像那些卖给儿童玩具的小人儿一样。

en: In a few words, his motto was “I have my opinions,” and the love of the impossible constituted his ruling passion.
zh: 简而言之，他的座右铭是“我有自己的观点”，对不可能的事物的热爱构成了他的执政激情。

en: Such was the passenger of the Atlanta, always excitable, as if boiling under the action of some internal fire by the character of his physical organization.
zh: 亚特兰大号上的乘客就是这样，总是容易激动，好像因为身体机构的特点，在某种内部火力的作用下沸腾了一样。

en: If ever two individuals offered a striking contrast to each other, these were certainly Michel Ardan and the Yankee Barbicane;
zh: 如果说有两个人能够形成鲜明的对比，那一定是米歇尔 · 阿尔丹和扬基 · 巴比肯;

en: both, moreover, being equally enterprising and daring, each in his own way.
zh: 此外，两者都同样有进取心和勇气，各有所长。

en: The scrutiny which the president of the Gun Club had instituted regarding this new rival was quickly interrupted by the shouts and hurrahs of the crowd.
zh: 枪支俱乐部主席对这个新对手的审查很快就被人群的欢呼声打断了。

en: The cries became at last so uproarious, and the popular enthusiasm assumed so personal a form, that Michel Ardan, after having shaken hands some thousands of times,
zh: 人们的呼喊声终于变得如此喧嚣，民众的热情呈现出如此个人化的形式，以至于米歇尔 · 阿尔丹在与人们握了几千次手之后,

en: at the imminent risk of leaving his fingers behind him, was fain at last to make a bolt for his cabin.
zh: 他冒着把手指留在身后的危险，终于愿意为自己的船舱做一个螺栓。

en: Barbicane followed him without uttering a word.
zh: 巴比康一言不发地跟着他。

en: “You are Barbicane, I suppose?” said Michel Ardan, in a tone of voice in which he would have addressed a friend of twenty years’ standing.
zh: “我想你是巴比肯吧?”米歇尔 · 阿尔丹说，他本来要用这种语气对一位有二十年交情的朋友说话的。

en: “Yes,” replied the president of the Gun Club.
zh: “是的,”枪支俱乐部的主席回答说。

en: “All right! how d’ye do, Barbicane? how are you getting on—pretty well? that’s right.”
zh: “好吧! 你怎么样，巴比肯? 你过得怎么样? 很好吗? 是的。”

en: “So,” said Barbicane without further preliminary, “you are quite determined to go.”
zh: “那么,”巴比肯没有进一步的预备，“你是下定决心要去了。”

en: “Quite decided.”
zh: “决定了”

en: “Nothing will stop you?”
zh: “没有什么能阻止你?”

en: “Nothing. Have you modified your projectile according to my telegram.”
zh: “没什么，你有没有根据我的电报改装你的发射器”

en: “I waited for your arrival.
zh: 我等待着你的到来。

en: But,” asked Barbicane again, “have you carefully reflected?”
zh: “可是,”巴比肯又问，“你仔细想过了吗?”

en: “Reflected? have I any time to spare? I find an opportunity of making a tour in the moon, and I mean to profit by it.
zh: “反射？我有时间吗？我找到了一个去月球旅行的机会，我打算从中获利。

en: There is the whole gist of the matter.”
zh: 这就是问题的全部要点。”

en: Barbicane looked hard at this man who spoke so lightly of his project with such complete absence of anxiety.
zh: 巴比康凝视着这个人，他轻描淡写地谈论着自己的计划，完全没有一丝焦虑。

en: “But, at least,” said he, “you have some plans, some means of carrying your project into execution?”
zh: “但是，至少,”他说，“你有一些计划，一些方法来执行你的项目?”

en: “Excellent, my dear Barbicane;
zh: “好极了，我亲爱的巴比康;

en: only permit me to offer one remark: My wish is to tell my story once for all, to everybody, and then have done with it;
zh: 只请允许我说一句话: 我的愿望是把我的故事一次性地讲给所有人听，然后把它讲完;

en: then there will be no need for recapitulation.
zh: 那就没必要再重复了。

en: So, if you have no objection, assemble your friends, colleagues, the whole town, all Florida, all America if you like,
zh: 所以，如果你们不反对召集你们的朋友，同事整个小镇，整个佛罗里达，全美国，如果你们愿意,

en: and to-morrow I shall be ready to explain my plans and answer any objections whatever that may be advanced.
zh: 明天我将准备好解释我的计划，并回答任何可能提出的反对意见。

en: You may rest assured I shall wait without stirring. Will that suit you?”
zh: 你可以放心，我不会搅拌的，这样可以吗?”

en: “All right,” replied Barbicane.
zh: “好吧,”巴比肯回答。

en: So saying, the president left the cabin and informed the crowd of the proposal of Michel Ardan.
zh: 说着，总统离开了小屋，把米歇尔 · 阿尔丹的提议告诉了人群。

en: His words were received with clappings of hands and shouts of joy.
zh: 他的话受到了欢呼和掌声。

en: They had removed all difficulties.
zh: 他们排除了一切困难。

en: To-morrow every one would contemplate at his ease this European hero.
zh: 明天，每个人都会安心地思考这位欧洲英雄。

en: However, some of the spectators, more infatuated than the rest, would not leave the deck of the Atlanta.
zh: 然而，有些观众比其他观众更为痴迷，他们不愿离开亚特兰大号的甲板。

en: They passed the night on board.
zh: 他们在船上过了一夜。

en: Among others J. T. Maston got his hook fixed in the combing of the poop, and it pretty nearly required the capstan to get it out again.
zh: 在其他人中，J.T. 马斯顿在梳理粪便的时候把鱼钩固定住了，这几乎需要绞盘把它再次拉出来。

en: “He is a hero! a hero!” he cried, a theme of which he was never tired of ringing the changes;
zh: “他是一个英雄! 一个英雄!”他喊道，这是一个他从不厌倦的主题变化;

en: “and we are only like weak, silly women, compared with this European!”
zh: “和这个欧洲人相比，我们只是弱不禁风的傻女人!”

en: As to the president, after having suggested to the visitors it was time to retire, he re-entered the passenger’s cabin, and remained there till the bell of the steamer made it midnight.
zh: 至于总统，在向来访者建议是时候退休后，他重新进入客舱，一直呆在那里，直到汽船的铃声响到午夜。

en: But then the two rivals in popularity shook hands heartily and parted on terms of intimate friendship.
zh: 但随后，这两个受欢迎的对手热烈握手，并以亲密友谊的形式分手。

en: CHAPTER XIX. A MONSTER MEETING
zh: 第十九章怪物会议

en: On the following day Barbicane, fearing that indiscreet questions might be put to Michel Ardan,
zh: 第二天，巴比肯担心会有人向米歇尔 · 阿尔丹提出轻率的问题,

en: was desirous of reducing the number of the audience to a few of the initiated, his own colleagues for instance.
zh: 他希望把听众人数减少到少数几个初学者，比如他自己的同事。

en: He might as well have tried to check the Falls of Niagara! he was compelled, therefore, to give up the idea, and let his new friend run the chances of a public conference.
zh: 他还不如去检查尼亚加拉大瀑布呢！因此，他不得不放弃这个想法，让他的新朋友来主持一次公开会议。

en: The place chosen for this monster meeting was a vast plain situated in the rear of the town.
zh: 这次怪物大会选择的地点是位于城镇后方的一片广阔平原。

en: In a few hours, thanks to the help of the shipping in port, an immense roofing of canvas was stretched over the parched prairie, and protected it from the burning rays of the sun.
zh: 几个小时后，由于港口船只的帮助，一个巨大的帆布屋顶覆盖了干燥的草原，并保护它免受太阳灼热的射线。

en: There three hundred thousand people braved for many hours the stifling heat while awaiting the arrival of the Frenchman.
zh: 在那里，三十万人冒着闷热的天气等待法国人的到来，等了好几个小时。

en: Of this crowd of spectators a first set could both see and hear;
zh: 在这群观众中，第一组既能看又能听;

en: a second set saw badly and heard nothing at all;
zh: 第二组看得很糟，什么也没听见;

en: and as for the third, it could neither see nor hear anything at all.
zh: 至于第三个，它什么也看不见也听不见。

en: At three o’clock Michel Ardan made his appearance, accompanied by the principal members of the Gun Club.
zh: 三点钟，米歇尔 · 阿丹在枪支俱乐部主要成员的陪同下出现了。

en: He was supported on his right by President Barbicane, and on his left by J. T. Maston, more radiant than the midday sun, and nearly as ruddy.
zh: 他的右边是巴比肯总统，左边是 J.T。马斯顿，比正午的太阳还要灿烂，几乎和正午的太阳一样红润。

en: Ardan mounted a platform, from the top of which his view extended over a sea of black hats.
zh: 阿尔丹登上了一个平台，从平台的顶端，他的视野延伸到一片黑色帽子的海洋。

en: He exhibited not the slightest embarrassment;
zh: 他没有表现出丝毫的尴尬;

en: he was just as gay, familiar, and pleasant as if he were at home.
zh: 他就像在家里一样快乐，熟悉，愉快。

en: To the hurrahs which greeted him he replied by a graceful bow;
zh: 对于迎接他的欢呼声，他优雅地鞠了一躬;

en: then, waving his hands to request silence, he spoke in perfectly correct English as follows:
zh: 然后，他挥手请求安静，用完全正确的英语说道:

en: “Gentlemen, despite the very hot weather I request your patience for a short time while I offer some explanations regarding the projects which seem to have so interested you.
zh: “先生们，尽管天气非常炎热，我还是请你们耐心等待一会儿，同时我会就你们似乎非常感兴趣的项目提供一些解释。

en: I am neither an orator nor a man of science, and I had no idea of addressing you in public;
zh: 我既不是一个演说家，也不是一个科学家，而且我也不知道要在公共场合对你讲话;

en: but my friend Barbicane has told me that you would like to hear me, and I am quite at your service.
zh: 但是我的朋友巴比肯告诉我你想听我说，我很乐意为你效劳。

en: Listen to me, therefore, with your six hundred thousand ears, and please excuse the faults of the speaker.
zh: 因此，请用你的六十万只耳朵听我说，请原谅说话者的过失。

en: Now pray do not forget that you see before you a perfect ignoramus whose ignorance goes so far that he cannot even understand the difficulties!
zh: 现在请不要忘记，在你们面前的是一个完全无知的人，他的无知已经到了无法理解困难的地步！

en: It seemed to him that it was a matter quite simple, natural, and easy to take one’s place in a projectile and start for the moon! That journey must be undertaken sooner or later;
zh: 在他看来，这是一件相当简单、自然和容易的事情，可以在抛射物中找到自己的位置，然后开始向月球前进！这段旅程迟早要开始;

en: and, as for the mode of locomotion adopted, it follows simply the law of progress.
zh: 至于所采用的运动方式，则完全遵循进步的规律。

en: Man began by walking on all-fours;
zh: 人类最初是四肢着地行走的;

en: then, one fine day, on two feet; then in a carriage; then in a stage-coach; and lastly by railway.
zh: 然后，在一个晴朗的日子里，用两只脚走路; 然后坐马车; 然后坐马车; 最后坐火车。

en: Well, the projectile is the vehicle of the future, and the planets themselves are nothing else! Now some of you, gentlemen, may imagine that the velocity we propose to impart to it is extravagant.
zh: 嗯，抛射物是未来的载体，而行星本身不是别的！现在，先生们，你们中的一些人可能会认为我们提出的速度是奢侈的。

en: It is nothing of the kind.
zh: 不是那样的。

en: All the stars exceed it in rapidity, and the earth herself is at this moment carrying us round the sun at three times as rapid a rate,
zh: 所有的星星都在以极快的速度超过它，而地球本身此刻正以三倍于它的速度带着我们绕着太阳转,

en: and yet she is a mere lounger on the way compared with many others of the planets! And her velocity is constantly decreasing.
zh: 然而，与许多其他星球相比，她只不过是路上的一个懒汉！她的速度在不断下降。

en: Is it not evident, then, I ask you, that there will some day appear velocities far greater than these, of which light or electricity will probably be the mechanical agent?
zh: 那么，我问你们，有一天会出现比这些速度大得多的速度，其中光或电很可能是机械动力，这难道不是显而易见的吗？

en: “Yes, gentlemen,” continued the orator, “in spite of the opinions of certain narrow-minded people, who would shut up the human race upon this globe, as within some magic circle which it must never outstep,
zh: “是的，先生们,”演说家继续说道，“尽管有一些心胸狭窄的人的意见，他们会把人类关在这个地球上，就像关在一个魔法圈子里一样，这个魔法圈子永远不能超越,

en: we shall one day travel to the moon, the planets, and the stars, with the same facility, rapidity, and certainty as we now make the voyage from Liverpool to New York! Distance is but a relative expression, and must end by being reduced to zero.”
zh: 总有一天，我们会去月球、行星和星球旅行，就像我们现在从利物浦到纽约的航行一样，我们会有同样的设备、快速和确定性！距离只是一个相对表达式，最终必须归零。”

en: The assembly, strongly predisposed as they were in favor of the French hero, were slightly staggered at this bold theory.
zh: 集会，强烈倾向于因为他们赞成法国英雄，有点交错在这个大胆的理论。

en: Michel Ardan perceived the fact.
zh: 米歇尔 · 阿尔丹意识到。

en: “Gentlemen,” he continued with a pleasant smile, “you do not seem quite convinced.
zh: “先生们,”他继续愉快地笑着说，“你们似乎不太相信。

en: Very good! Let us reason the matter out.
zh: 很好! 让我们把事情理清楚。

en: Do you know how long it would take for an express train to reach the moon? Three hundred days;
zh: 你知道特快列车到达月球需要多长时间吗? 三百天;

en: no more! And what is that? The distance is no more than nine times the circumference of the earth;
zh: 不再是了! 那是什么? 距离不超过赤道的9倍;

en: and there are no sailors or travelers, of even moderate activity, who have not made longer journeys than that in their lifetime.
zh: 没有一个水手或旅行者，即使是中等程度的活动，在他们的一生中没有进行过比这更长的旅行。

en: And now consider that I shall be only ninety- seven hours on my journey.
zh: 现在想想，我的旅程只有97个小时了。

en: Ah! I see you are reckoning that the moon is a long way off from the earth, and that one must think twice before making the experiment.
zh: 啊！我看你是在估计月球离地球很远，在做实验之前必须三思而后行。

en: What would you say, then, if we were talking of going to Neptune, which revolves at a distance of more than two thousand seven hundred and twenty millions of miles from the sun!
zh: 那么，如果我们谈论去海王星，它旋转在距离太阳超过272亿英里的地方，你会说什么呢！

en: And yet what is that compared with the distance of the fixed stars, some of which, such as Arcturus, are billions of miles distant from us?
zh: 然而，与固定恒星的距离(其中一些恒星，如大角星，距离我们数十亿英里)相比，这又算得了什么呢？

en: And then you talk of the distance which separates the planets from the sun! And there are people who affirm that such a thing as distance exists.
zh: 然后你谈到行星与太阳之间的距离！有些人断言，距离这种东西是存在的。

en: Absurdity, folly, idiotic nonsense! Would you know what I think of our own solar universe? Shall I tell you my theory? It is very simple! In my opinion the solar system is a solid homogeneous body;
zh: 荒谬，愚蠢，愚蠢的废话！你知道我是怎么看待我们的太阳系宇宙的吗？要我告诉你我的理论吗？很简单！在我看来，太阳系是一个固体同质体;

en: the planets which compose it are in actual contact with each other;
zh: 组成它的行星实际上是相互接触的;

en: and whatever space exists between them is nothing more than the space which separates the molecules of the densest metal, such as silver, iron, or platinum!
zh: 无论它们之间存在什么样的空间，都只不过是分隔最致密金属分子的空间，例如银、铁或铂！

en: I have the right, therefore, to affirm, and I repeat, with the conviction which must penetrate all your minds, ‘Distance is but an empty name;
zh: 因此，我有权利确认，并且我重申，我的信念必须贯穿你们所有人的头脑，“距离不过是一个空洞的名字;

en: distance does not really exist!’”
zh: 距离根本不存在!”

en: “Hurrah!” cried one voice (need it be said it was that of J. T. Maston).
zh: “万岁!”一个声音喊道(不得不说，这是 J · T · 马斯顿的声音)。

en: “Distance does not exist!” And overcome by the energy of his movements, he nearly fell from the platform to the ground.
zh: “距离并不存在!”他被自己动作的力量压垮了，差点从平台上摔到地上。

en: He just escaped a severe fall, which would have proved to him that distance was by no means an empty name.
zh: 他刚从一个严重的坠落中幸免于难，这足以向他证明，距离绝不是一个空洞的名字。

en: “Gentlemen,” resumed the orator, “I repeat that the distance between the earth and her satellite is a mere trifle, and undeserving of serious consideration.
zh: “先生们,”演说家继续说道，“我再说一遍，地球和她的卫星之间的距离只是一个微不足道的小事，不值得认真考虑。

en: I am convinced that before twenty years are over one-half of our earth will have paid a visit to the moon.
zh: 我确信，在二十年之前，地球的一半都已经登上了月球。

en: Now, my worthy friends, if you have any question to put to me, you will, I fear, sadly embarrass a poor man like myself;
zh: 现在，我可敬的朋友们，如果你们有任何问题要问我，恐怕你们会令我这样一个穷人难堪;

en: still I will do my best to answer you.”
zh: 我仍然会尽力回答你

en: Up to this point the president of the Gun Club had been satisfied with the turn which the discussion had assumed.
zh: 到目前为止，枪支俱乐部主席对讨论的转折点感到满意。

en: It became now, however, desirable to divert Ardan from questions of a practical nature, with which he was doubtless far less conversant.
zh: 然而，现在转移阿尔丹对实际问题的注意力变得很有必要，因为他对这些问题无疑远远不那么熟悉。

en: Barbicane, therefore, hastened to get in a word, and began by asking his new friend whether he thought that the moon and the planets were inhabited.
zh: 因此，巴比肯赶紧插上一句话，开始问他的新朋友，他是否认为月亮和行星是有人居住的。

en: “You put before me a great problem, my worthy president,” replied the orator, smiling.
zh: “你把一个大问题摆在我面前，我尊敬的总统,”演说家微笑着回答。

en: “Still, men of great intelligence, such as Plutarch, Swedenborg, Bernardin de St.
zh: ”不过，像普鲁塔克，斯韦登堡，贝尔纳丁 · 德 · 圣。

en: Pierre, and others have, if I mistake not, pronounced in the affirmative.
zh: 如果我没记错的话，皮埃尔和其他人已经表示同意了。

en: Looking at the question from the natural philosopher’s point of view, I should say that nothing useless existed in the world;
zh: 从自然哲学家的角度来看这个问题，我应该说世界上没有无用的东西存在;

en: and, replying to your question by another, I should venture to assert, that if these worlds are habitable, they either are, have been, or will be inhabited.”
zh: 我敢断言，如果这些星球是可居住的，那么它们要么是可居住的，要么过去是可居住的，要么将来也是可居住的。”

en: “No one could answer more logically or fairly,” replied the president.
zh: “没有人能够回答得更有逻辑或更公平,”总统回答说。

en: “The question then reverts to this: Are these worlds habitable? For my own part I believe they are.”
zh: “接下来的问题又回到了这个问题上: 这些星球适合人类居住吗? 就我个人而言，我相信它们适合人类居住。”

en: “For myself, I feel certain of it,” said Michel Ardan.
zh: “就我个人而言，我对此深信不疑,”米歇尔 · 阿丹说。

en: “Nevertheless,” retorted one of the audience, “there are many arguments against the habitability of the worlds.
zh: “尽管如此,”一位听众反驳道，“还是有很多反对世界可居住性的论点。

en: The conditions of life must evidently be greatly modified upon the majority of them.
zh: 大多数人的生活条件显然必须大大改变。

en: To mention only the planets, we should be either broiled alive in some, or frozen to death in others, according as they are more or less removed from the sun.”
zh: 仅仅提到行星，我们要么在一些行星上被活活烤熟，要么在另一些行星上被冻死，因为它们或多或少离开了太阳。”

en: “I regret,” replied Michel Ardan, “that I have not the honor of personally knowing my contradictor, for I would have attempted to answer him.
zh: “我很遗憾,”米歇尔 · 阿尔丹回答说，“我没有荣幸亲自去了解我的反驳者，因为我本来想回答他的。

en: His objection has its merits, I admit;
zh: 我承认，他的反对是有道理的;

en: but I think we may successfully combat it, as well as all others which affect the habitability of other worlds.
zh: 但是我认为我们可以成功地战胜它，以及其他所有影响其他世界可居住性的因素。

en: If I were a natural philosopher, I would tell him that if less of caloric were set in motion upon the planets which are nearest to the sun, and more, on the contrary,
zh: 如果我是一个自然哲学家，我会告诉他，如果在离太阳最近的行星上运动的卡路里越少，反而越多,

en: upon those which are farthest removed from it, this simple fact would alone suffice to equalize the heat, and to render the temperature of those worlds supportable by beings organized like ourselves.
zh: 对于那些离它最远的星球，这个简单的事实本身就足以平衡热量，并使那些世界的温度由像我们这样有组织的生物所支撑。

en: If I were a naturalist, I would tell him that, according to some illustrious men of science,
zh: 如果我是一个自然主义者，我会告诉他，根据一些杰出的科学家的说法,

en: nature has furnished us with instances upon the earth of animals existing under very varying conditions of life;
zh: 大自然为我们提供了地球上动物的实例，这些动物生活在非常不同的生命条件下;

en: that fish respire in a medium fatal to other animals;
zh: 鱼类呼吸的介质对其他动物是致命的;

en: that amphibious creatures possess a double existence very difficult of explanation;
zh: 两栖动物具有双重存在，这很难解释;

en: that certain denizens of the seas maintain life at enormous depths, and there support a pressure equal to that of fifty or sixty atmospheres without being crushed;
zh: 海洋中的某些居民在巨大的深度维持生命，在那里承受着相当于五六十个大气压的压力而不会被压碎;

en: that several aquatic insects, insensible to temperature, are met with equally among boiling springs and in the frozen plains of the Polar Sea;
zh: 几种对温度不敏感的水生昆虫在沸腾的泉水中和在极地海的冰冻平原上同样遭遇;

en: in fine, that we cannot help recognizing in nature a diversity of means of operation oftentimes incomprehensible, but not the less real.
zh: 总而言之，我们不能不认识到，在自然界中，多种多样的操作手段常常是不可理解的，但并非不那么真实。

en: If I were a chemist, I would tell him that the aerolites, bodies evidently formed exteriorly of our terrestrial globe, have, upon analysis, revealed indisputable traces of carbon,
zh: 如果我是个化学家，我会告诉他陨石，显然是地球表面形成的物体，经过分析，显示出无可争议的碳的痕迹,

en: a substance which owes its origin solely to organized beings, and which, according to the experiments of Reichenbach, must necessarily itself have been endued with animation.
zh: 这种物质的起源完全归功于有组织的生物，而且根据莱辛巴赫的实验，这种物质本身必然被赋予了生命。

en: And lastly, were I a theologian, I would tell him that the scheme of the Divine Redemption, according to St.
zh: 最后，如果我是一个神学家，我会告诉他神圣救赎的计划。

en: Paul, seems to be applicable, not merely to the earth, but to all the celestial worlds.
zh: 保罗，似乎是适用的，不仅适用于地球，而且适用于所有的天体世界。

en: But, unfortunately, I am neither theologian, nor chemist, nor naturalist, nor philosopher;
zh: 但不幸的是，我既不是神学家，也不是化学家，也不是自然主义者，更不是哲学家;

en: therefore, in my absolute ignorance of the great laws which govern the universe, I confine myself to saying in reply,
zh: 因此，由于我对支配宇宙的伟大法则一无所知，我只能回答说,

en: ‘I do not know whether the worlds are inhabited or not: and since I do not know, I am going to see!’”
zh: “我不知道这些世界是否有人居住，既然我不知道，我就要去看看！”

en: Whether Michel Ardan’s antagonist hazarded any further arguments or not it is impossible to say, for the uproarious shouts of the crowd would not allow any expression of opinion to gain a hearing.
zh: 米歇尔 · 阿丹的对手是否冒险进行进一步的辩论，这是不可能说的，因为人群的喧闹声不会让任何意见的表达获得听证。

en: On silence being restored, the triumphant orator contented himself with adding the following remarks:
zh: 在恢复了沉默之后，这位得意洋洋的演说家满足地补充了以下几点:

en: “Gentlemen, you will observe that I have but slightly touched upon this great question.
zh: “先生们，你们会发现我只是稍微提到了这个伟大的问题。

en: There is another altogether different line of argument in favor of the habitability of the stars, which I omit for the present.
zh: 还有另外一种完全不同的论点支持恒星的可居住性，这一点我暂且不提。

en: I only desire to call attention to one point.
zh: 我只想提醒大家注意一点。

en: To those who maintain that the planets are not inhabited one may reply:
zh: 对于那些坚持认为行星无人居住的人，可以回答:

en: You might be perfectly in the right, if you could only show that the earth is the best possible world, in spite of what Voltaire has said.
zh: 你可能是完全正确的，如果你能证明地球是最好的可能的世界，尽管伏尔泰说。

en: She has but one satellite, while Jupiter, Uranus, Saturn, Neptune have each several, an advantage by no means to be despised.
zh: 她只有一颗卫星，而木星、天王星、土星、海王星各有好几颗，这种优势绝不容小觑。

en: But that which renders our own globe so uncomfortable is the inclination of its axis to the plane of its orbit.
zh: 但是，使我们自己的地球如此不舒服的是它的轴心向其轨道平面的倾斜。

en: Hence the inequality of days and nights;
zh: 因此，白天和黑夜是不平等的;

en: hence the disagreeable diversity of the seasons.
zh: 因此季节的多样性令人不快。

en: On the surface of our unhappy spheroid we are always either too hot or too cold;
zh: 在我们不快乐的球体表面，我们总是要么太热，要么太冷;

en: we are frozen in winter, broiled in summer;
zh: 我们在冬天被冻住，在夏天被烤熟;

en: it is the planet of rheumatism, coughs, bronchitis;
zh: 它是风湿病、咳嗽、支气管炎的发源地;

en: while on the surface of Jupiter, for example, where the axis is but slightly inclined, the inhabitants may enjoy uniform temperatures.
zh: 而在木星表面，例如，在地轴稍微倾斜的地方，居民可以享受统一的温度。

en: It possesses zones of perpetual springs, summers, autumns, and winters;
zh: 它拥有永恒的春天、夏天、秋天和冬天;

en: every Jovian may choose for himself what climate he likes, and there spend the whole of his life in security from all variations of temperature.
zh: 每个木星人都可以自己选择他喜欢的气候，在那里度过他的整个生命，在安全的所有变化的温度。

en: You will, I am sure, readily admit this superiority of Jupiter over our own planet, to say nothing of his years, which each equal twelve of ours!
zh: 我敢肯定，你会欣然承认木星比我们的星球更优越，更不用说他的年龄了，每年相当于我们的十二岁！

en: Under such auspices and such marvelous conditions of existence, it appears to me that the inhabitants of so fortunate a world must be in every respect superior to ourselves.
zh: 在这样的赞助和这样奇妙的生存条件下，在我看来，这样一个幸运世界的居民必须在各个方面都比我们优越。

en: All we require, in order to attain such perfection, is the mere trifle of having an axis of rotation less inclined to the plane of its orbit!”
zh: 为了达到这样的完美，我们所需要的仅仅是一个不那么倾向于其轨道平面的旋转轴!”

en: “Hurrah!” roared an energetic voice, “let us unite our efforts, invent the necessary machines, and rectify the earth’s axis!”
zh: “万岁!”一个充满活力的声音吼道，“让我们团结起来，发明必要的机器，修正地球的轴心!”

en: A thunder of applause followed this proposal, the author of which was, of course, no other than J. T. Maston.
zh: 这个建议引起了雷鸣般的掌声，当然，这个建议的作者不是别人，正是 J.T.Maston。

en: And, in all probability, if the truth must be told, if the Yankees could only have found a point of application for it,
zh: 而且，在所有的可能性中，如果必须说出真相，如果北方佬只能找到一个适合它的点,

en: they would have constructed a lever capable of raising the earth and rectifying its axis.
zh: 他们会建造一个杠杆，能够提升地球并且调整它的轴线。

en: It was just this deficiency which baffled these daring mechanicians.
zh: 正是这种缺陷困扰着这些勇敢的机械师。

en: CHAPTER XX. ATTACK AND RIPOSTE
zh: 第二十章攻击与反击

en: As soon as the excitement had subsided, the following words were heard uttered in a strong and determined voice:
zh: 兴奋过后，人们用坚定有力的声音说道:

en: “Now that the speaker has favored us with so much imagination, would he be so good as to return to his subject, and give us a little practical view of the question?”
zh: “既然演讲者这么有想象力地支持我们，他能不能回到他的主题上来，对这个问题给我们一点实际的看法呢?”

en: All eyes were directed toward the person who spoke.
zh: 所有的目光都集中在说话的人身上。

en: He was a little dried-up man, of an active figure, with an American “goatee” beard.
zh: 他是一个干瘪的小个子男人，身材活跃，留着美国式的“山羊胡”胡子。

en: Profiting by the different movements in the crowd, he had managed by degrees to gain the front row of spectators.
zh: 受益于人群中不同的动作，他渐渐地赢得了前排的观众。

en: There, with arms crossed and stern gaze, he watched the hero of the meeting.
zh: 在那里，他双臂交叉，目光严厉地注视着会议的英雄。

en: After having put his question he remained silent, and appeared to take no notice of the thousands of looks directed toward himself, nor of the murmur of disapprobation excited by his words.
zh: 问完这个问题，他一言不发，似乎没有注意到人们成千上万的目光投向他自己，也没有注意到他的话引起的不赞同的低声议论。

en: Meeting at first with no reply, he repeated his question with marked emphasis, adding, “We are here to talk about the moon and not about the earth.”
zh: 起初，他没有回答，只是强调地重复了他的问题，并补充道: “我们来这里是为了谈论月球，而不是地球。”

en: “You are right, sir,” replied Michel Ardan;
zh: “你说得对，先生,”米歇尔 · 阿尔丹回答说;

en: “the discussion has become irregular.
zh: 讨论已经变得不正常了。

en: We will return to the moon.”
zh: 我们将重返月球”

en: “Sir,” said the unknown, “you pretend that our satellite is inhabited.
zh: “先生,”那个不知名的人说，“你假装我们的卫星有人居住。

en: Very good, but if Selenites do exist, that race of beings assuredly must live without breathing,
zh: 很好，但如果赛莱尼特人真的存在那个种族的生物肯定必须在没有呼吸的情况下生存,

en: for—I warn you for your own sake—there is not the smallest particle of air on the surface of the moon.”
zh: 因为ーー为了你自己，我警告你ーー月球表面没有一丝一毫的空气粒子。”

en: At this remark Ardan pushed up his shock of red hair;
zh: 听了这话，阿尔丹竖起他那蓬乱的红头发;

en: he saw that he was on the point of being involved in a struggle with this person upon the very gist of the whole question.
zh: 他看到自己即将和这个人在整个问题的要点上进行一场斗争。

en: He looked sternly at him in his turn and said:
zh: 轮到他时，他严厉地看着他说:

en: “Oh! so there is no air in the moon? And pray, if you are so good, who ventures to affirm that?
zh: “哦！所以月球上没有空气？祈祷吧，如果你这么优秀，谁敢肯定这一点呢？

en: “The men of science.”
zh: “科学家”

en: “Really?”
zh: “真的吗?”

en: “Really.”
zh: “真的”

en: “Sir,” replied Michel, “pleasantry apart, I have a profound respect for men of science who do possess science, but a profound contempt for men of science who do not.”
zh: “先生,”米歇尔回答，“除了开玩笑之外，我对拥有科学的科学家怀有深深的敬意，但对不拥有科学的科学家怀有深深的蔑视。”

en: “Do you know any who belong to the latter category?”
zh: “你知道谁属于后一类吗?”

en: “Decidedly. In France there are some who maintain that, mathematically, a bird cannot possibly fly;
zh: “毫无疑问，在法国，有些人坚持认为，从数学上讲，一只鸟不可能飞;

en: and others who demonstrate theoretically that fishes were never made to live in water.”
zh: 还有一些人从理论上证明了鱼类从来就不是生活在水里的。”

en: “I have nothing to do with persons of that description, and I can quote, in support of my statement, names which you cannot refuse deference to.”
zh: “我和这类人没有任何关系，我可以引用一些名字来支持我的陈述，这些名字是你不能拒绝尊重的。”

en: “Then, sir, you will sadly embarrass a poor ignorant, who, besides, asks nothing better than to learn.”
zh: “那么，先生，你会让一个可怜的无知者感到难堪，而他，除了学习之外，别无所求。”

en: “Why, then, do you introduce scientific questions if you have never studied them?” asked the unknown somewhat coarsely.
zh: “那么，如果你从来没有研究过科学问题，为什么还要提出这些问题呢?”这个不知名的人有些粗鲁地问道。

en: “For the reason that ‘he is always brave who never suspects danger.’ I know nothing, it is true;
zh: “因为‘他总是勇敢的，从不怀疑危险。’我什么都不知道，这是真的;

en: but it is precisely my very weakness which constitutes my strength.”
zh: 但正是我的弱点构成了我的力量”

en: “Your weakness amounts to folly,” retorted the unknown in a passion.
zh: “你的弱点相当于愚蠢,”那个不知名的人激动地反驳道。

en: “All the better,” replied our Frenchman, “if it carries me up to the moon.”
zh: “这样更好,”我们的法国人回答，“如果能把我送上月球的话。”

en: Barbicane and his colleagues devoured with their eyes the intruder who had so boldly placed himself in antagonism to their enterprise.
zh: 巴比康和他的同事们用眼睛吞噬了这个入侵者，他如此大胆地将自己置于与他们的事业对立的境地。

en: Nobody knew him, and the president, uneasy as to the result of so free a discussion, watched his new friend with some anxiety.
zh: 没有人认识他，总统对这样自由讨论的结果感到不安，有些焦虑地看着他的新朋友。

en: The meeting began to be somewhat fidgety also, for the contest directed their attention to the dangers, if not the actual impossibilities, of the proposed expedition.
zh: 会议也开始有些坐立不安，因为比赛把他们的注意力引向了计划中探险的危险，如果不是实际上不可能的话。

en: “Sir,” replied Ardan’s antagonist, “there are many and incontrovertible reasons which prove the absence of an atmosphere in the moon.
zh: “先生,”阿尔丹的反对者回答说，“有许多不容置疑的理由可以证明月球上没有大气层。

en: I might say that, a priori, if one ever did exist, it must have been absorbed by the earth;
zh: 我可以说，先验地说，如果真有这么一个生命存在，它一定已经被地球吸收了;

en: but I prefer to bring forward indisputable facts.”
zh: 但我更喜欢提出无可争辩的事实。”

en: “Bring them forward then, sir, as many as you please.”
zh: “那就把他们带上来吧，先生，想带多少带多少”

en: “You know,” said the stranger, “that when any luminous rays cross a medium such as the air, they are deflected out of the straight line;
zh: “你知道,”陌生人说，“当任何光线穿过像空气这样的介质时，它们会偏离直线;

en: in other words, they undergo refraction.
zh: 换句话说，它们经历了折射。

en: Well! When stars are occulted by the moon, their rays, on grazing the edge of her disc, exhibit not the least deviation, nor offer the slightest indication of refraction.
zh: 好吧！当恒星被月亮遮挡时，它们的光线掠过月盘的边缘时，没有显示出一丝一毫的偏差，也没有提供一丝折射的迹象。

en: It follows, therefore, that the moon cannot be surrounded by an atmosphere.
zh: 因此，月球不可能被大气层包围。

en: “In point of fact,” replied Ardan, “this is your chief, if not your only argument;
zh: “事实上,”阿尔丹回答说，“这是你的首领，如果不是你唯一的论据的话;

en: and a really scientific man might be puzzled to answer it.
zh: 一个真正的科学家可能会困惑地回答这个问题。

en: For myself, I will simply say that it is defective, because it assumes that the angular diameter of the moon has been completely determined, which is not the case.
zh: 就我个人而言，我会简单地说它是有缺陷的，因为它假定月球的角直径已经完全确定，而事实并非如此。

en: But let us proceed.
zh: 但我们继续吧。

en: Tell me, my dear sir, do you admit the existence of volcanoes on the moon’s surface?”
zh: 告诉我，亲爱的先生，你承认月球表面存在火山吗?”

en: “Extinct, yes! In activity, no!”
zh: “灭绝，是的! 活动，没有!”

en: “These volcanoes, however, were at one time in a state of activity?”
zh: “然而，这些火山曾一度处于活动状态?”

en: “True, but, as they furnish themselves the oxygen necessary for combustion, the mere fact of their eruption does not prove the presence of an atmosphere.”
zh: 没错，但是，当它们为自己提供燃烧所需的氧气时，仅凭它们喷发的事实并不能证明大气的存在

en: “Proceed again, then;
zh: “那么，再继续;

en: and let us set aside this class of arguments in order to come to direct observations.
zh: 让我们把这类论证放在一边，以便得出直接的观察结果。

en: In 1715 the astronomers Louville and Halley, watching the eclipse of the 3rd of May, remarked some very extraordinary scintillations.
zh: 1715年，天文学家 Louville 和哈雷在观察5月3日的日食时发现了一些非同寻常的闪烁现象。

en: These jets of light, rapid in nature, and of frequent recurrence, they attributed to thunderstorms generated in the lunar atmosphere.”
zh: 这些光的喷射，在性质上是快速的，并且经常重复出现，它们归因于月球大气层中产生的雷暴。”

en: “In 1715,” replied the unknown, “the astronomers Louville and Halley mistook for lunar phenomena some which were purely terrestrial,
zh: “在1715年,”未知的回答，“天文学家 Louville 和哈雷误认为月球现象，其中一些纯粹是地球上的,

en: such as meteoric or other bodies which are generated in our own atmosphere.
zh: 例如流星或其他在我们自己的大气层中产生的天体。

en: This was the scientific explanation at the time of the facts;
zh: 这是事实发生时的科学解释;

en: and that is my answer now.”
zh: 这就是我现在的答案。”

en: “On again, then,” replied Ardan;
zh: “那就再来一次,”阿尔丹回答说;

en: “Herschel, in 1787, observed a great number of luminous points on the moon’s surface, did he not?”
zh: 1787年，赫歇尔在月球表面观察到了大量的发光点，不是吗

en: “Yes! but without offering any solution of them.
zh: “是的! 但没有提供任何解决办法。

en: Herschel himself never inferred from them the necessity of a lunar atmosphere.
zh: 赫歇尔本人从未从他们那里推断出月球大气层的必要性。

en: And I may add that Baeer and Maedler, the two great authorities upon the moon, are quite agreed as to the entire absence of air on its surface.”
zh: 我还要补充一点，贝尔和梅德勒，月球上的两大权威，对于月球表面完全没有空气的问题，他们是完全一致的。”

en: A movement was here manifest among the assemblage, who appeared to be growing excited by the arguments of this singular personage.
zh: 一个运动在这里集会显示，他们似乎越来越兴奋的争论，这个非凡的人物。

en: “Let us proceed,” replied Ardan, with perfect coolness, “and come to one important fact.
zh: “让我们继续吧,”阿尔丹冷静地答道，“说到一个重要的事实。

en: A skillful French astronomer, M.
zh: 法国天文学家 M。

en: Laussedat, in watching the eclipse of July 18, 1860, probed that the horns of the lunar crescent were rounded and truncated.
zh: 在观看1860年7月18日的日食时，劳塞达特探测到月牙的角是圆的并且被截断了。

en: Now, this appearance could only have been produced by a deviation of the solar rays in traversing the atmosphere of the moon.
zh: 这种现象只可能是由于太阳光线在穿越月球大气层时发生偏移造成的。

en: There is no other possible explanation of the facts.”
zh: 对于这些事实，没有其它可能的解释。”

en: “But is this established as a fact?”
zh: “但这是事实吗?”

en: “Absolutely certain!”
zh: “绝对肯定!”

en: A counter-movement here took place in favor of the hero of the meeting, whose opponent was now reduced to silence.
zh: 这里发生了一场有利于会议英雄的反动运动，他的对手现在陷入了沉默。

en: Ardan resumed the conversation;
zh: 阿丹继续谈话;
