en: and without exhibiting any exultation at the advantage he had gained, simply said:
zh: 对于自己所获得的好处，他没有表现出任何狂喜，只是简单地说:

en: “You see, then, my dear sir, we must not pronounce with absolute positiveness against the existence of an atmosphere in the moon.
zh: “那么，我亲爱的先生，我们不能绝对肯定地反对月球上存在大气层。

en: That atmosphere is, probably, of extreme rarity;
zh: 这种氛围可能是极其罕见的;

en: nevertheless at the present day science generally admits that it exists.”
zh: 然而在今天，科学普遍承认它的存在。”

en: “Not in the mountains, at all events,” returned the unknown, unwilling to give in.
zh: “不在山里，无论如何,”那个不知名的人回答说，不愿意屈服。

en: “No! but at the bottom of the valleys, and not exceeding a few hundred feet in height.”
zh: 不是，是在谷底，高度不超过几百尺

en: “In any case you will do well to take every precaution, for the air will be terribly rarified.”
zh: “无论如何，你最好采取一切预防措施，因为空气将变得非常稀薄。”

en: “My good sir, there will always be enough for a solitary individual;
zh: “我的好先生，总是有足够的个人;

en: besides, once arrived up there, I shall do my best to economize, and not to breathe except on grand occasions!”
zh: 此外，一旦到了那里，我将尽力节约，除了在重大场合外，不呼吸!”

en: A tremendous roar of laughter rang in the ears of the mysterious interlocutor, who glared fiercely round upon the assembly.
zh: 神秘对话者的耳朵里响起一阵哄堂大笑，他凶狠地环视着大会。

en: “Then,” continued Ardan, with a careless air, “since we are in accord regarding the presence of a certain atmosphere, we are forced to admit the presence of a certain quantity of water.
zh: “那么,”阿尔丹漫不经心地接着说，“既然我们在某种气氛的存在上达成了一致，我们就不得不承认有一定量的水的存在。

en: This is a happy consequence for me.
zh: 这对我来说是个好结果。

en: Moreover, my amiable contradictor, permit me to submit to you one further observation.
zh: 此外，我亲爱的反对者，请允许我向你提出一个进一步的意见。

en: We only know one side of the moon’s disc;
zh: 我们只知道月球圆盘的一面;

en: and if there is but little air on the face presented to us, it is possible that there is plenty on the one turned away from us.”
zh: 如果我们看到的面孔上只有一点点空气，那么被我们拒之门外的面孔上可能有很多空气。”

en: “And for what reason?”
zh: “为什么?”

en: “Because the moon, under the action of the earth’s attraction, has assumed the form of an egg, which we look at from the smaller end.
zh: “因为月球在地球引力的作用下，变成了一个蛋的形状，我们从较小的一端观察它。

en: Hence it follows, by Hausen’s calculations, that its center of gravity is situated in the other hemisphere.
zh: 因此，根据豪森的计算，它的重心位于另一个半球。

en: Hence it results that the great mass of air and water must have been drawn away to the other face of our satellite during the first days of its creation.”
zh: 因此，它的结果是，大量的空气和水一定已经被吸引到我们的卫星的另一面，在其创建的第一天。”

en: “Pure fancies!” cried the unknown.
zh: “纯属幻想!”不知名的人叫道。

en: “No! Pure theories! which are based upon the laws of mechanics, and it seems difficult to me to refute them.
zh: “不! 纯粹的理论! 它们是基于力学定律的，我似乎很难反驳它们。

en: I appeal then to this meeting, and I put it to them whether life, such as exists upon the earth, is possible on the surface of the moon?”
zh: 我请求这次会议，我向他们提出，地球上存在的生命，在月球表面是否可能存在?”

en: Three hundred thousand auditors at once applauded the proposition.
zh: 三十万名审计员立刻为这个提议鼓掌。

en: Ardan’s opponent tried to get in another word, but he could not obtain a hearing.
zh: 阿尔丹的对手试图插嘴，但他没有得到听证会的机会。

en: Cries and menaces fell upon him like hail.
zh: 哭声和威胁像冰雹一样落在他身上。

en: “Enough! enough!” cried some.
zh: “够了! 够了!”有人喊道。

en: “Drive the intruder off!” shouted others.
zh: “把入侵者赶走!”其他人喊道。

en: “Turn him out!” roared the exasperated crowd.
zh: “把他赶出去!”愤怒的人群吼道。

en: But he, holding firmly on to the platform, did not budge an inch, and let the storm pass on, which would soon have assumed formidable proportions, if Michel Ardan had not quieted it by a gesture.
zh: 但是他紧紧地抓住平台，一动不动，任由风暴过去，如果米歇尔 · 阿丹没有用一个手势使它平静下来的话，这场风暴很快就会变成一场可怕的风暴。

en: He was too chivalrous to abandon his opponent in an apparent extremity.
zh: 他太有骑士精神了，不会在明显的极端情况下抛弃他的对手。

en: “You wished to say a few more words?” he asked, in a pleasant voice.
zh: “你想再说几句话吗?”他用愉快的声音问道。

en: “Yes, a thousand; or rather, no, only one! If you persevere in your enterprise, you must be a—”
zh: “是的，一千个; 或者更确切地说，不，只有一个! 如果你坚持你的事业，你必须是一个——”

en: “Very rash person! How can you treat me as such? me, who have demanded a cylindro-conical projectile, in order to prevent turning round and round on my way like a squirrel?”
zh: “非常鲁莽的人！你怎么能这样对我？我，为了防止像松鼠一样在路上不停地转来转去，竟然要求一枚圆柱-圆锥形的炮弹?”

en: “But, unhappy man, the dreadful recoil will smash you to pieces at your starting.”
zh: “但是，不幸的人，那可怕的后坐力会在你开始的时候把你打得粉身碎骨”

en: “My dear contradictor, you have just put your finger upon the true and only difficulty;
zh: “我亲爱的反驳者，你刚刚指出了真正的、唯一的困难;

en: nevertheless, I have too good an opinion of the industrial genius of the Americans not to believe that they will succeed in overcoming it.”
zh: 尽管如此，我对美国人的工业天赋有着非常好的看法，我不相信他们会成功地克服这一点。”

en: “But the heat developed by the rapidity of the projectile in crossing the strata of air?”
zh: “但是由于子弹穿过空气层的速度太快，所产生的热量呢?”

en: “Oh! the walls are thick, and I shall soon have crossed the atmosphere.”
zh: “噢! 墙壁很厚，我很快就能穿过大气层了。”

en: “But victuals and water?”
zh: “但是食物和水呢?”

en: “I have calculated for a twelvemonth’s supply, and I shall be only four days on the journey.”
zh: “我已经计算了十二个月的补给，我只要在路上呆四天就够了。”

en: “But for air to breathe on the road?”
zh: “但是在路上呼吸空气呢?”

en: “I shall make it by a chemical process.”
zh: “我将用化学方法制造它”

en: “But your fall on the moon, supposing you ever reach it?”
zh: “但是你在月球上的下降，假设你曾经到达它?”

en: “It will be six times less dangerous than a sudden fall upon the earth, because the weight will be only one-sixth as great on the surface of the moon.”
zh: “它的危险性是突然坠落在地球上的六倍，因为它的重量只有月球表面的六分之一。”

en: “Still it will be enough to smash you like glass!”
zh: “但它仍然足以像玻璃一样砸碎你!”

en: “What is to prevent my retarding the shock by means of rockets conveniently placed, and lighted at the right moment?”
zh: “什么可以防止我通过放置方便的火箭，并在适当的时候点燃来减缓冲击?”

en: “But after all, supposing all difficulties surmounted, all obstacles removed, supposing everything combined to favor you,
zh: 但毕竟，假设所有的困难都克服了所有的障碍都消除了假设所有的事情都对你有利,

en: and granting that you may arrive safe and sound in the moon, how will you come back?”
zh: 如果你能安然无恙地到达月球，你将如何回来?”

en: “I am not coming back!”
zh: “我不会回来了!”

en: At this reply, almost sublime in its very simplicity, the assembly became silent.
zh: 听到这个简单得近乎崇高的回答，大家都安静了下来。

en: But its silence was more eloquent than could have been its cries of enthusiasm.
zh: 但它的沉默比它的热情呐喊更有说服力。

en: The unknown profited by the opportunity and once more protested:
zh: 未知因机遇而受益，并再次提出抗议:

en: “You will inevitably kill yourself!” he cried;
zh: “你将不可避免地自杀!”他喊道;

en: “and your death will be that of a madman, useless even to science!”
zh: “你将成为一个疯子，对科学毫无用处!”

en: “Go on, my dear unknown, for truly your prophecies are most agreeable!”
zh: “去吧，我亲爱的未知数，因为你的预言真的是最令人满意的!”

en: “It really is too much!” cried Michel Ardan’s adversary.
zh: “这真是太过分了!”米歇尔 · 阿尔丹的对手叫道。

en: “I do not know why I should continue so frivolous a discussion! Please yourself about this insane expedition! We need not trouble ourselves about you!”
zh: “我不知道我为什么要继续这种无聊的讨论！随你怎么说这次疯狂的探险！我们不必为你而烦恼!”

en: “Pray don’t stand upon ceremony!”
zh: “请不要站在仪式上!”

en: “No! another person is responsible for your act.”
zh: “不，另一个人要为你的行为负责”

en: “Who, may I ask?” demanded Michel Ardan in an imperious tone.
zh: “我可以问问是谁吗?”米歇尔 · 阿尔丹用专横的语气问道。

en: “The ignoramus who organized this equally absurd and impossible experiment!”
zh: “组织这个同样荒谬和不可能的实验的无知者!”

en: The attack was direct.
zh: 袭击是直接的。

en: Barbicane, ever since the interference of the unknown, had been making fearful efforts of self-control;
zh: 自从受到未知因素的干扰后，巴比康一直在努力克制自己

en: now, however, seeing himself directly attacked, he could restrain himself no longer.
zh: 然而，现在看到自己受到直接攻击，他再也无法克制自己了。

en: He rose suddenly, and was rushing upon the enemy who thus braved him to the face, when all at once he found himself separated from him.
zh: 他突然站起来，冲向那个勇敢地面对他的敌人，这时他突然发现自己和他分开了。

en: The platform was lifted by a hundred strong arms, and the president of the Gun Club shared with Michel Ardan triumphal honors.
zh: 一百只强壮的手臂举起了讲台，大炮俱乐部的主席和米歇尔 · 阿丹一起分享了胜利的荣誉。

en: The shield was heavy, but the bearers came in continuous relays, disputing, struggling, even fighting among themselves in their eagerness to lend their shoulders to this demonstration.
zh: 盾牌很重，但是搬运工们不断地接力，争论，挣扎，甚至在他们自己之间争斗，他们渴望借助他们的肩膀来示威。

en: However, the unknown had not profited by the tumult to quit his post.
zh: 然而，这位不知名的人并没有从这场骚乱中获益而辞去他的职务。

en: Besides he could not have done it in the midst of that compact crowd.
zh: 此外，他不可能在拥挤的人群中做这件事。

en: There he held on in the front row with crossed arms, glaring at President Barbicane.
zh: 在那里，他交叉着双臂站在前排，怒视着巴比肯总统。

en: The shouts of the immense crowd continued at their highest pitch throughout this triumphant march.
zh: 在整个胜利的行军过程中，人群的呼喊声一直保持在最高的音调。

en: Michel Ardan took it all with evident pleasure.
zh: 米歇尔 · 阿尔丹显然很高兴地接受了这一切。

en: His face gleamed with delight.
zh: 他的脸因高兴而闪闪发光。

en: Several times the platform seemed seized with pitching and rolling like a weatherbeaten ship.
zh: 有好几次，平台似乎像饱经风霜的船只一样倾斜和翻滚。

en: But the two heros of the meeting had good sea-legs.
zh: 但是这次会议的两位英雄都晕得很厉害。

en: They never stumbled;
zh: 他们从不跌跌撞撞;

en: and their vessel arrived without dues at the port of Tampa Town.
zh: 他们的船没有交费就抵达了坦帕市的港口。

en: Michel Ardan managed fortunately to escape from the last embraces of his vigorous admirers.
zh: 米歇尔 · 阿丹幸运地逃脱了他那些狂热崇拜者的最后拥抱。

en: He made for the Hotel Franklin, quickly gained his chamber, and slid under the bedclothes, while an army of a hundred thousand men kept watch under his windows.
zh: 他向富兰克林饭店走去，很快回到自己的房间，钻进被窝里，同时一支十万人的军队在他的窗户底下守着。

en: During this time a scene, short, grave, and decisive, took place between the mysterious personage and the president of the Gun Club.
zh: 在这段时间里，神秘人物和枪支俱乐部主席之间发生了一幕短暂、严肃和决定性的情景。

en: Barbicane, free at last, had gone straight at his adversary.
zh: 巴比康终于自由了，他径直向他的对手冲去。

en: “Come!” he said shortly.
zh: “来吧!”他简短地说。

en: The other followed him on the quay;
zh: 另一个在码头上跟着他;

en: and the two presently found themselves alone at the entrance of an open wharf on Jones’ Fall.
zh: 不久，两人发现自己独自一人站在琼斯瀑布的一个露天码头的入口处。

en: The two enemies, still mutually unknown, gazed at each other.
zh: 两个互不相识的敌人互相凝视着。

en: “Who are you?” asked Barbicane.
zh: “你是谁?”巴比肯问。

en: “Captain Nicholl!”
zh: 尼克尔船长

en: “So I suspected. Hitherto chance has never thrown you in my way.”
zh: “所以我怀疑。迄今为止，机会从来没有把你扔在我的方式。”

en: “I am come for that purpose.”
zh: “我就是为此而来”

en: “You have insulted me.”
zh: “你侮辱了我”

en: “Publicly!”
zh: “公开!”

en: “And you will answer to me for this insult?”
zh: “你要为你的侮辱负责吗?”

en: “At this very moment.”
zh: “此时此刻”

en: “No! I desire that all that passes between us shall be secret.
zh: 不，我希望我们之间的一切都是秘密。

en: Their is a wood situated three miles from Tampa, the wood of Skersnaw.
zh: 他们所在的森林距离 Skersnaw 的森林坦帕三英里。

en: Do you know it?”
zh: 你知道吗?”

en: “I know it.”
zh: “我知道”

en: “Will you be so good as to enter it to-morrow morning at five o’clock, on one side?”
zh: “请你明天早上五点钟从一边进去好吗?”

en: “Yes! if you will enter at the other side at the same hour.”
zh: “是的! 如果你在同一时间进入另一边。”

en: “And you will not forget your rifle?” said Barbicane.
zh: “你不会忘记你的步枪吧?”巴比肯说。

en: “No more than you will forget yours?” replied Nicholl.
zh: “就像你不会忘记你的一样吗?”尼科尔回答。

en: These words having been coldly spoken, the president of the Gun Club and the captain parted.
zh: 这些话冷冷地说完，枪支俱乐部的主席和船长就分开了。

en: Barbicane returned to his lodging;
zh: 巴比康回到他的住处;

en: but instead of snatching a few hours of repose, he passed the night in endeavoring to discover a means of evading the recoil of the projectile,
zh: 但是他并没有抓住几个小时的休息时间，而是花了一整夜的时间试图找到一种躲避炮弹后座力的方法,

en: and resolving the difficult problem proposed by Michel Ardan during the discussion at the meeting.
zh: 并解决米歇尔 · 阿尔丹在会议讨论中提出的难题。

en: CHAPTER XXI. HOW A FRENCHMAN MANAGES AN AFFAIR
zh: 第二十一章法国人如何处理外遇

en: While the contract of this duel was being discussed by the president and the captain—this dreadful, savage duel,
zh: 当总统和船长正在讨论这场决斗的合同时这场可怕的野蛮决斗,

en: in which each adversary became a man-hunter—Michel Ardan was resting from the fatigues of his triumph.
zh: 每个敌人都变成了猎人ーー米歇尔 · 阿尔丹正在从胜利的疲惫中休息。

en: Resting is hardly an appropriate expression, for American beds rival marble or granite tables for hardness.
zh: 休息几乎不是一个恰当的表达，因为美国床的硬度可以与大理石或花岗岩桌子相媲美。

en: Ardan was sleeping, then, badly enough, tossing about between the cloths which served him for sheets,
zh: 阿尔丹正在睡觉，睡得很不好，在他用来铺床单的布料间辗转反侧,

en: and he was dreaming of making a more comfortable couch in his projectile when a frightful noise disturbed his dreams.
zh: 他正梦想着在他的投射物里做一个更舒服的沙发，这时一个可怕的声音打扰了他的梦想。

en: Thundering blows shook his door.
zh: 雷鸣般的声音震动着他的门。

en: They seemed to be caused by some iron instrument.
zh: 好像是某种铁器造成的。

en: A great deal of loud talking was distinguishable in this racket, which was rather too early in the morning.
zh: 这是一个相当早的早晨，在这种喧闹声中可以辨别出大量的喧闹声。

en: “Open the door,” some one shrieked, “for heaven’s sake!” Ardan saw no reason for complying with a demand so roughly expressed.
zh: “开门,”有人尖叫道，“看在上帝的份上!”阿尔丹认为没有理由服从如此粗暴的要求。

en: However, he got up and opened the door just as it was giving way before the blows of this determined visitor.
zh: 然而，他站起来，打开了门，正当它在这个坚定的访客的打击之前让路的时候。

en: The secretary of the Gun Club burst into the room.
zh: 枪支俱乐部的秘书冲进房间。

en: A bomb could not have made more noise or have entered the room with less ceremony.
zh: 炸弹不可能制造出更多的噪音，也不可能以更简单的方式进入房间。

en: “Last night,” cried J. T. Maston, ex abrupto, “our president was publicly insulted during the meeting.
zh: “昨天晚上,”马斯顿(J.T.Maston)突然喊道，“我们的总统在会议期间受到了公开的侮辱。

en: He provoked his adversary, who is none other than Captain Nicholl! They are fighting this morning in the wood of Skersnaw.
zh: 他激怒了他的对手，不是别人，正是尼科尔船长！他们今早在 Skersnaw 的森林里打起来了。

en: I heard all the particulars from the mouth of Barbicane himself.
zh: 我从巴比肯本人口中听到了所有的细节。

en: If he is killed, then our scheme is at an end.
zh: 如果他被杀了，我们的计划就完了。

en: We must prevent his duel;
zh: 我们必须阻止他的决斗

en: and one man alone has enough influence over Barbicane to stop him, and that man is Michel Ardan.”
zh: 只有一个人对巴比肯有足够的影响力来阻止他，那个人就是米歇尔 · 阿尔丹”

en: While J. T. Maston was speaking, Michel Ardan, without interrupting him, had hastily put on his clothes;
zh: 马斯顿说话的时候，米歇尔 · 阿丹没有打断他，匆匆穿上了衣服;

en: and, in less than two minutes, the two friends were making for the suburbs of Tampa Town with rapid strides.
zh: 不到两分钟，这两个朋友就快步向坦帕市郊走去。

en: It was during this walk that Maston told Ardan the state of the case.
zh: 正是在这次散步中，Maston 告诉了 Ardan 案件的情况。

en: He told him the real causes of the hostility between Barbicane and Nicholl;
zh: 他告诉他 Barbicane 和尼科尔之间敌意的真正原因;

en: how it was of old date, and why, thanks to unknown friends, the president and the captain had, as yet, never met face to face.
zh: 为什么会这样，为什么由于不知名的朋友，总统和船长至今还没有面对面地见过面。

en: He added that it arose simply from a rivalry between iron plates and shot, and, finally, that the scene at the meeting was only the long-wished-for opportunity for Nicholl to pay off an old grudge.
zh: 他补充说，这只是因为铁板和镜头之间的竞争，最后，会议现场只是尼科尔长期希望的机会，以偿还旧怨。

en: Nothing is more dreadful than private duels in America.
zh: 在美国，没有什么比私人决斗更可怕的了。

en: The two adversaries attack each other like wild beasts.
zh: 两个敌人像野兽一样互相攻击。

en: Then it is that they might well covet those wonderful properties of the Indians of the prairies—their quick intelligence, their ingenious cunning, their scent of the enemy.
zh: 那么，他们很可能觊觎大草原印第安人那些奇妙的特性ーー他们敏捷的智慧、机智的狡猾、敌人的气味。

en: A single mistake, a moment’s hesitation, a single false step may cause death.
zh: 一个错误，一个犹豫，一个错误的步骤可能会导致死亡。

en: On these occasions Yankees are often accompanied by their dogs, and keep up the struggle for hours.
zh: 在这种情况下，北方佬经常带着他们的狗，并持续几个小时的斗争。

en: “What demons you are!” cried Michel Ardan, when his companion had depicted this scene to him with much energy.
zh: “你们是什么恶魔!”米歇尔 · 阿尔丹喊道，他的同伴已经精神饱满地向他描述了这一幕。

en: “Yes, we are,” replied J. T. Modestly;
zh: “是的，我们是,”J.T. 谦虚地回答;

en: “but we had better make haste.”
zh: “但我们最好快点”

en: Though Michel Ardan and he had crossed the plains still wet with dew, and had taken the shortest route over creeks and ricefields, they could not reach Skersnaw in under five hours and a half.
zh: 尽管米歇尔 · 阿尔丹和他已经穿越了仍然被露水浸湿的平原，并且走过了小溪和稻田间最短的路线，他们还是不能在五个半小时内到达斯科斯诺。

en: Barbicane must have passed the border half an hour ago.
zh: 巴比肯半小时前肯定过境了。

en: There was an old bushman working there, occupied in selling fagots from trees that had been leveled by his axe.
zh: 有一个老布什曼人在那里工作，忙于出售被他的斧头砍倒的树上的干柴。

en: Maston ran toward him, saying, “Have you seen a man go into the wood, armed with a rifle? Barbicane, the president, my best friend?”
zh: 马斯顿朝他跑过来，说: “你有没有看见一个人拿着来福枪进了树林？巴比肯，总统，我最好的朋友?”

en: The worthy secretary of the Gun Club thought that his president must be known by all the world.
zh: 值得尊敬的枪支俱乐部秘书认为他的主席必须为全世界所知。

en: But the bushman did not seem to understand him.
zh: 但是那个丛林人似乎并不理解他。

en: “A hunter?” said Ardan.
zh: “猎人?”阿尔丹说。

en: “A hunter? Yes,” replied the bushman.
zh: “猎人? 是的。”布希曼回答。

en: “Long ago?”
zh: “很久以前?”

en: “About an hour.”
zh: “大约一个小时”

en: “Too late!” cried Maston.
zh: “太晚了!”马斯顿叫道。

en: “Have you heard any gunshots?” asked Ardan.
zh: “你听到枪声了吗?”阿尔丹问。

en: “No!”
“Not one?”
zh: “一个都没有?”

en: “Not one! that hunter did not look as if he knew how to hunt!”
zh: “一个也没有! 那个猎人看起来好像不知道怎么打猎!”

en: “What is to be done?” said Maston.
zh: “怎么办?”马斯顿说。

en: “We must go into the wood, at the risk of getting a ball which is not intended for us.”
zh: “我们必须进入森林，冒着得到一个不是为我们准备的球的风险。”

en: “Ah!” cried Maston, in a tone which could not be mistaken, “I would rather have twenty balls in my own head than one in Barbicane’s.”
zh: “啊!”“我宁愿自己脑袋里有二十个球，也不愿意 Barbicane 脑袋里有一个。”

en: “Forward, then,” said Ardan, pressing his companion’s hand.
zh: “那就往前走吧,”阿丹说着，按住同伴的手。

en: A few moments later the two friends had disappeared in the copse.
zh: 过了一会儿，这两个朋友消失在灌木丛中。

en: It was a dense thicket, in which rose huge cypresses, sycamores, tulip-trees, olives, tamarinds, oaks, and magnolias.
zh: 那是一片茂密的灌木丛，里面长满了巨大的柏树、悬铃木、郁金香树、橄榄、罗望子、橡树和木兰。

en: These different trees had interwoven their branches into an inextricable maze, through which the eye could not penetrate.
zh: 这些不同的树木把它们的枝条交织成一个无法解开的迷宫，眼睛无法穿过这个迷宫。

en: Michel Ardan and Maston walked side by side in silence through the tall grass, cutting themselves a path through the strong creepers,
zh: 米歇尔 · 阿丹和马斯顿默默地并肩走过高高的草丛，在茂密的爬山植物中开辟出一条小路,

en: casting curious glances on the bushes, and momentarily expecting to hear the sound of rifles.
zh: 向灌木丛投去好奇的目光，随时期待着听到步枪的声音。

en: As for the traces which Barbicane ought to have left of his passage through the wood, there was not a vestige of them visible:
zh: 至于巴比肯在穿过树林时应该留下的痕迹，却一点也看不出来:

en: so they followed the barely perceptible paths along which Indians had tracked some enemy, and which the dense foliage darkly overshadowed.
zh: 于是他们沿着几乎看不见的小路前进，印第安人沿着这条小路追踪着一些敌人，浓密的树叶遮住了他们的视线。

en: After an hour spent in vain pursuit the two stopped in intensified anxiety.
zh: 在徒劳地追了一个小时之后，这两个人停下来，心里越发焦急。

en: “It must be all over,” said Maston, discouraged.
zh: “一定会结束的,”马斯顿气馁地说。

en: “A man like Barbicane would not dodge with his enemy, or ensnare him, would not even maneuver! He is too open, too brave.
zh: “像巴比肯这样的人不会和敌人一起躲避，不会诱捕他，甚至不会移动！他太开放，太勇敢了。

en: He has gone straight ahead, right into the danger, and doubtless far enough from the bushman for the wind to prevent his hearing the report of the rifles.”
zh: 他径直向前走，直接进入了危险之中，毫无疑问，他离丛林人足够远了，风吹得他听不到来福枪的报告。”

en: “But surely,” replied Michel Ardan, “since we entered the wood we should have heard!”
zh: “可是,”米歇尔 · 阿尔丹回答说，“自从我们进了树林，我们就应该听到了!”

en: “And what if we came too late?” cried Maston in tones of despair.
zh: “如果我们来得太晚怎么办?”马斯顿绝望地喊道。

en: For once Ardan had no reply to make, he and Maston resuming their walk in silence.
zh: 这一次阿尔丹没有回答，他和马斯顿又默默地走了回去。

en: From time to time, indeed, they raised great shouts, calling alternately Barbicane and Nicholl, neither of whom, however, answered their cries.
zh: 的确，他们时不时地大喊大叫，交替地叫着巴比肯和尼科尔，然而，两人都没有回应他们的呼喊。

en: Only the birds, awakened by the sound, flew past them and disappeared among the branches, while some frightened deer fled precipitately before them.
zh: 只有鸟儿被这声音惊醒，从他们身边飞过，消失在树枝间，一些受惊的鹿在他们面前仓皇逃窜。

en: For another hour their search was continued.
zh: 他们又搜寻了一个小时。

en: The greater part of the wood had been explored.
zh: 木材的大部分已经勘探过了。

en: There was nothing to reveal the presence of the combatants.
zh: 没有任何迹象表明战斗人员的存在。

en: The information of the bushman was after all doubtful, and Ardan was about to propose their abandoning this useless pursuit, when all at once Maston stopped.
zh: 布希曼的情报毕竟是可疑的，阿丹正要提议他们放弃这种无用的追求，这时马斯顿突然停了下来。

en: “Hush!” said he, “there is some one down there!”
zh: “嘘!”他说，“下面有人!”

en: “Some one?” repeated Michel Ardan.
zh: “某个人?”米歇尔 · 阿尔丹重复道。

en: “Yes; a man! He seems motionless. His rifle is not in his hands. What can he be doing?”
zh: “是的，一个男人! 他看起来一动不动。他的步枪不在他的手里。他在做什么?”

en: “But can you recognize him?” asked Ardan, whose short sight was of little use to him in such circumstances.
zh: “可是你能认出他来吗?”阿尔丹问道，在这种情况下，他的近视对他没有什么用处。

en: “Yes! yes! He is turning toward us,” answered Maston.
zh: “是的! 是的! 他正转向我们,”马斯顿回答。

en: “And it is?”
zh: “是吗?”

en: “Captain Nicholl!”
zh: 尼克尔船长

en: “Nicholl?” cried Michel Ardan, feeling a terrible pang of grief.
zh: “尼科尔?”米歇尔 · 阿尔丹叫道，感到一阵可怕的悲痛。

en: “Nicholl unarmed! He has, then, no longer any fear of his adversary!”
zh: “尼科尔手无寸铁! 那么，他不再害怕他的对手了!”

en: “Let us go to him,” said Michel Ardan, “and find out the truth.”
zh: “让我们去找他,”米歇尔 · 阿尔丹说，“找出真相。”

en: But he and his companion had barely taken fifty steps, when they paused to examine the captain more attentively.
zh: 但是他和他的同伴刚走了五十步，他们就停下来更专心地检查船长。

en: They expected to find a bloodthirsty man, happy in his revenge.
zh: 他们希望找到一个嗜血的人，在他的复仇中快乐。

en: On seeing him, they remained stupefied.
zh: 一见到他，他们就目瞪口呆。

en: A net, composed of very fine meshes, hung between two enormous tulip-trees, and in the midst of this snare, with its wings entangled,
zh: 两棵巨大的郁金香树之间，悬挂着一张网，网上有很细的网眼。在这个陷阱的中间，有一对翅膀纠缠在一起,

en: was a poor little bird, uttering pitiful cries, while it vainly struggled to escape.
zh: 是一只可怜的小鸟，发出可怜的叫声，挣扎着想要逃走。

en: The bird-catcher who had laid this snare was no human being, but a venomous spider, peculiar to that country, as large as a pigeon’s egg, and armed with enormous claws.
zh: 设下这个陷阱的捕鸟人不是人，而是一只毒蜘蛛，那个国家特有的，有鸽子蛋那么大，还有巨大的爪子。

en: The hideous creature, instead of rushing on its prey, had beaten a sudden retreat and taken refuge in the upper branches of the tulip-tree, for a formidable enemy menaced its stronghold.
zh: 这个可怕的生物没有冲向它的猎物，而是突然撤退，躲进了郁金香树的上面的树枝里，因为一个可怕的敌人正在威胁着它的据点。

en: Here, then, was Nicholl, his gun on the ground, forgetful of danger, trying if possible to save the victim from its cobweb prison.
zh: 然后，尼科尔就在这里，他的枪放在地上，忘记了危险，试图尽可能地把受害者从蜘蛛网般的监狱里救出来。

en: At last it was accomplished, and the little bird flew joyfully away and disappeared.
zh: 终于完成了，小鸟高兴地飞走了，消失了。

en: Nicholl lovingly watched its flight, when he heard these words pronounced by a voice full of emotion:
zh: 尼科尔深情地注视着它的飞行，当他听到一个充满感情的声音发出这样的声音:

en: “You are indeed a brave man.” He turned. Michel Ardan was before him, repeating in a different tone:
zh: “你确实是一个勇敢的人。”他转过身来。米歇尔 · 阿尔丹在他面前，用不同的语调重复着:

en: “And a kindhearted one!”
zh: “而且心地善良!”

en: “Michel Ardan!” cried the captain.
zh: “米歇尔 · 阿尔丹!”船长喊道。

en: “Why are you here?”
zh: “你为什么在这里?”

en: “To press your hand, Nicholl, and to prevent you from either killing Barbicane or being killed by him.”
zh: “按下你的手，尼克尔，防止你杀死巴比肯或被他杀死。”

en: “Barbicane!” returned the captain.
zh: “巴比康!”船长回答。

en: “I have been looking for him for the last two hours in vain. Where is he hiding?”
zh: “我找了他两个小时都没找到，他躲在哪里?”

en: “Nicholl!” said Michel Ardan, “this is not courteous! we ought always to treat an adversary with respect;
zh: “尼科尔!”米歇尔 · 阿丹说，“这是不礼貌的! 我们应该永远尊重对手;

en: rest assureed if Barbicane is still alive we shall find him all the more easily;
zh: 放心吧，如果巴比肯还活着，我们就更容易找到他;

en: because if he has not, like you, been amusing himself with freeing oppressed birds, he must be looking for you.
zh: 因为如果他没有像你一样，用释放受压迫的鸟来自娱自乐的话，他一定是在找你。

en: When we have found him, Michel Ardan tells you this, there will be no duel between you.”
zh: 等我们找到他，米歇尔 · 阿丹会告诉你，你们之间不会有决斗”

en: “Between President Barbicane and myself,” gravely replied Nicholl, “there is a rivalry which the death of one of us—”
zh: “巴比肯总统和我之间,”尼科尔严肃地回答说，“有一种竞争，我们中的一个人死了ーー”

en: “Pooh, pooh!” said Ardan.
zh: “呸，呸!”阿丹说。

en: “Brave fellows like you indeed! you shall not fight!”
zh: “像你们这样勇敢的家伙! 你们不能战斗!”

en: “I will fight, sir!”
zh: “我会战斗，先生!”

en: “No!”
“Captain,” said J. T. Maston, with much feeling, “I am a friend of the president’s, his alter ego, his second self;
zh: “上尉,”J.T. 马斯顿感慨万千地说，“我是总统的朋友，他的另一个自我，他的第二个自我;

en: if you really must kill some one, shoot me! it will do just as well!”
zh: 如果你真的要杀人，就杀了我吧! 这样也好!”

en: “Sir,” Nicholl replied, seizing his rifle convulsively, “these jokes—”
zh: “先生,”尼科尔回答，抽搐着抓起他的步枪，“这些笑话ーー”

en: “Our friend Maston is not joking,” replied Ardan.
zh: “我们的朋友马斯顿不是在开玩笑,”阿尔丹回答。

en: “I fully understand his idea of being killed himself in order to save his friend.
zh: 我完全理解他为了救朋友而自杀的想法。

en: But neither he nor Barbicane will fall before the balls of Captain Nicholl.
zh: 但无论是他还是巴比肯都不会倒在尼克尔船长的蛋蛋面前。

en: Indeed I have so attractive a proposal to make to the two rivals, that both will be eager to accept it.”
zh: 实际上，我有一个非常有吸引力的提议要向两位竞争对手提出，双方都会迫不及待地接受它。”

en: “What is it?” asked Nicholl with manifest incredulity.
zh: “那是什么?”尼科尔怀疑地问道。

en: “Patience!” exclaimed Ardan.
zh: “耐心点!”阿尔丹喊道。

en: “I can only reveal it in the presence of Barbicane.”
zh: “我只能在巴比肯面前说出来”

en: “Let us go in search of him then!” cried the captain.
zh: “那就让我们去找他吧!”船长喊道。

en: The three men started off at once;
zh: 三个人同时出发了;

en: the captain having discharged his rifle threw it over his shoulder, and advanced in silence.
zh: 上尉已经开了枪，把枪扔过肩头，沉默地向前走去。

en: Another half hour passed, and the pursuit was still fruitless.
zh: 又过了半个小时，追捕仍然没有结果。

en: Maston was oppressed by sinister forebodings.
zh: 马斯顿被不祥的预感压迫着。

en: He looked fiercely at Nicholl, asking himself whether the captain’s vengeance had already been satisfied, and the unfortunate Barbicane, shot, was perhaps lying dead on some bloody track.
zh: 他恶狠狠地看着尼科尔，问自己船长的复仇是否已经得到了满足，而那个倒霉的巴比肯，也许已经死在某条血迹斑斑的铁轨上了。

en: The same thought seemed to occur to Ardan;
zh: Ardan 似乎也有同样的想法;

en: and both were casting inquiring glances on Nicholl, when suddenly Maston paused.
zh: 两个人都向尼科尔投去询问的目光，这时，马斯顿突然停了下来。

en: The motionless figure of a man leaning against a gigantic catalpa twenty feet off appeared, half-veiled by the foliage.
zh: 一个人影一动不动地倚在二十英尺外的一棵巨大的梓树上，半遮着树叶。

en: “It is he!” said Maston.
zh: “是他!”马斯顿说。

en: Barbicane never moved.
zh: 巴比康从没动过。

en: Ardan looked at the captain, but he did not wince.
zh: 阿丹看着队长，但他没有退缩。

en: Ardan went forward crying:
zh: 阿尔丹走上前哭着说:

en: “Barbicane! Barbicane!”
zh: “巴比肯! 巴比肯!”

en: No answer! Ardan rushed toward his friend;
zh: 没有回答! 阿丹冲向他的朋友;

en: but in the act of seizing his arms, he stopped short and uttered a cry of surprise.
zh: 但是在抓住他的胳膊的时候，他突然停了下来，发出一声惊讶的叫喊。

en: Barbicane, pencil in hand, was tracing geometrical figures in a memorandum book, while his unloaded rifle lay beside him on the ground.
zh: 手里拿着铅笔的巴比康正在一本备忘录上描绘几何图形，而他那把没有上膛的步枪就放在身旁的地上。

en: Absorbed in his studies, Barbicane, in his turn forgetful of the duel, had seen and heard nothing.
zh: 巴比肯专心致志地学习，也忘记了决斗，什么也没看见，什么也没听见。

en: When Ardan took his hand, he looked up and stared at his visitor in astonishment.
zh: 当阿尔丹握住他的手时，他抬起头来，惊讶地盯着他的客人。

en: “Ah, it is you!” he cried at last.
zh: “啊，是你!”他终于叫了起来。

en: “I have found it, my friend, I have found it!”
zh: “我找到了，我的朋友，我找到了!”

en: “What?”
zh: “什么?”

en: “My plan!”
zh: “我的计划!”

en: “What plan?”
zh: “什么计划?”

en: “The plan for countering the effect of the shock at the departure of the projectile!”
zh: “抵消子弹离开时冲击力影响的计划!”

en: “Indeed?” said Michel Ardan, looking at the captain out of the corner of his eye.
zh: “真的吗?”米歇尔 · 阿丹说，用余光看着船长。

en: “Yes! water! simply water, which will act as a spring—ah! Maston,” cried Barbicane, “you here also?”
zh: “是的! 水! 简单的水，就像泉水一样——啊! 马斯顿,”巴比肯喊道，“你也在这儿吗?”

en: “Himself,” replied Ardan;
zh: “他自己,”阿尔丹回答

en: “and permit me to introduce to you at the same time the worthy Captain Nicholl!”
zh: “同时请允许我向你们介绍尊敬的尼科尔船长”

en: “Nicholl!” cried Barbicane, who jumped up at once.
zh: “尼科尔!”巴比肯立刻跳了起来。

en: “Pardon me, captain, I had quite forgotten—I am ready!”
zh: “对不起，船长，我差点忘了——我准备好了!”

en: Michel Ardan interfered, without giving the two enemies time to say anything more.
zh: 米歇尔 · 阿尔丹插手干预，没有给两个敌人时间再说什么。

en: “Thank heaven!” said he.
zh: “谢天谢地!”他说。

en: “It is a happy thing that brave men like you two did not meet sooner! we should now have been mourning for one or other of you.
zh: “像你们两个这样勇敢的人没有早点相遇，这是一件令人高兴的事情！我们现在应该为你们中的一个人哀悼。

en: But, thanks to Providence, which has interfered, there is now no further cause for alarm.
zh: 但是，多亏了上帝的干预，现在没有进一步的恐慌的理由了。

en: When one forgets one’s anger in mechanics or in cobwebs, it is a sign that the anger is not dangerous.”
zh: 当一个人在机械或蜘蛛网中忘记了自己的愤怒，这是一个迹象，表明愤怒并不危险。”

en: Michel Ardan then told the president how the captain had been found occupied.
zh: 然后，米歇尔 · 阿尔丹告诉总统，船长是如何被发现被占领的。

en: “I put it to you now,” said he in conclusion, “are two such good fellows as you are made on purpose to smash each other’s skulls with shot?”
zh: “我现在告诉你,”他总结道，“像你们这样的好人，是故意用枪打碎对方的头骨的吗?”

en: There was in “the situation” somewhat of the ridiculous, something quite unexpected;
zh: 在“情况”中有些荒谬，有些出乎意料;

en: Michel Ardan saw this, and determined to effect a reconciliation.
zh: 米歇尔 · 阿尔丹看到了这一点，决心实现和解。

en: “My good friends,” said he, with his most bewitching smile, “this is nothing but a misunderstanding.
zh: “我的好朋友们,”他带着最迷人的微笑说，“这只不过是一场误会。

en: Nothing more! well! to prove that it is all over between you, accept frankly the proposal I am going to make to you.”
zh: 仅此而已！好吧！为了证明你们之间已经结束，坦率地接受我将向你们提出的建议。”

en: “Make it,” said Nicholl.
zh: “做吧,”尼科尔说。

en: “Our friend Barbicane believes that his projectile will go straight to the moon?”
zh: “我们的朋友巴比肯相信他的炮弹会直接飞向月球?”

en: “Yes, certainly,” replied the president.
zh: “是的，当然,”总统回答。

en: “And our friend Nicholl is persuaded it will fall back upon the earth?”
zh: “我们的朋友尼科尔相信它会回到地球上吗?”

en: “I am certain of it,” cried the captain.
zh: “我确信这一点,”船长喊道。

en: “Good!” said Ardan.
zh: “好!”阿丹说。

en: “I cannot pretend to make you agree;
zh: “我不能假装让你同意;

en: but I suggest this: Go with me, and so see whether we are stopped on our journey.”
zh: 但我建议: 跟我走，看看我们的旅程是否会停下来。”

en: “What?” exclaimed J. T. Maston, stupefied.
zh: “什么?”J.T. 马斯顿惊讶地叫道。

en: The two rivals, on this sudden proposal, looked steadily at each other.
zh: 两个竞争对手在这突如其来的提议下，面面相觑。

en: Barbicane waited for the captain’s answer.
zh: 巴比康等待船长的回答。

en: Nicholl watched for the decision of the president.
zh: 尼科尔观察总统的决定。

en: “Well?” said Michel.
zh: “怎么样?”米歇尔说。

en: “There is now no fear of the shock!”
zh: “现在不用害怕震惊了!”

en: “Done!” cried Barbicane.
zh: “完成了!”巴比肯喊道。

en: But quickly as he pronounced the word, he was not before Nicholl.
zh: 但是当他说出这个词的时候，他已经不在尼科尔面前了。

en: “Hurrah! bravo! hip! hip! hurrah!” cried Michel, giving a hand to each of the late adversaries.
zh: “万岁! 万岁! 万岁! 万岁! 万岁! 万岁!”米歇尔大声喊道，向每一个已故的对手伸出了手。

en: “Now that it is all settled, my friends, allow me to treat you after French fashion.
zh: “既然事情都解决了，我的朋友们，请允许我以法国时尚的方式款待你们。

en: Let us be off to breakfast!”
zh: 我们去吃早餐吧!”

en: CHAPTER XXII. THE NEW CITIZEN OF THE UNITED STATES
zh: 第二十二章美国的新公民

en: That same day all America heard of the affair of Captain Nicholl and President Barbicane, as well as its singular denouement.
zh: 同一天，整个美国都听说了尼克尔上尉和巴比肯总统的事情，以及它的结局。

en: From that day forth, Michel Ardan had not one moment’s rest.
zh: 从那天起，米歇尔 · 阿尔丹没有一刻休息。

en: Deputations from all corners of the Union harassed him without cessation or intermission.
zh: 来自联盟各个角落的代表团不间断地骚扰他。

en: He was compelled to receive them all, whether he would or no.
zh: 不管他愿不愿意，他都不得不接受这一切。

en: How many hands he shook, how many people he was “hail-fellow-well-met” with, it is impossible to guess! Such a triumphal result would have intoxicated any other man;
zh: 他和多少人握过手，和多少人“见过面”，这是不可能猜到的！这样的胜利结果会使任何其他人陶醉;

en: but he managed to keep himself in a state of delightful semi-tipsiness.
zh: 但他设法使自己保持在一种令人愉快的半醉状态。

en: Among the deputations of all kinds which assailed him, that of “The Lunatics” were careful not to forget what they owed to the future conqueror of the moon.
zh: 在攻击他的各种代表中，“疯子”代表小心翼翼地不忘记他们欠未来月球征服者的东西。

en: One day, certain of these poor people, so numerous in America, came to call upon him, and requested permission to return with him to their native country.
zh: 有一天，这些穷人中的一些人，在美国人数众多，来拜访他，请求允许他和他一起回到他们的祖国。

en: “Singular hallucination!” said he to Barbicane, after having dismissed the deputation with promises to convey numbers of messages to friends in the moon.
zh: “奇异的幻觉!”他对巴比肯说，在解散了代表团后，他承诺将向月球上的朋友传达数字信息。

en: “Do you believe in the influence of the moon upon distempers?”
zh: “你相信月亮对瘟疫的影响吗?”

en: “Scarcely!”
zh: “几乎没有!”

en: “No more do I, despite some remarkable recorded facts of history.
zh: “尽管有一些非凡的历史记录，我也不会再这样做了。

en: For instance, during an epidemic in 1693, a large number of persons died at the very moment of an eclipse.
zh: 例如，在1693年的一次流行病中，大量的人在日食发生的那一刻死去。

en: The celebrated Bacon always fainted during an eclipse.
zh: 著名的培根总是在日食时晕倒。

en: Charles VI relapsed six times into madness during the year 1399, sometimes during the new, sometimes during the full moon.
zh: 查理六世在1399年期间六次复发，有时在新月期间，有时在满月期间。

en: Gall observed that insane persons underwent an accession of their disorder twice in every month, at the epochs of new and full moon.
zh: 加尔观察到，精神错乱的人每个月会在新月和满月的时候发生两次精神错乱。

en: In fact, numerous observations made upon fevers, somnambulisms, and other human maladies, seem to prove that the moon does exercise some mysterious influence upon man.”
zh: 事实上，对发烧、梦游和其他人类疾病的大量观察似乎证明了月球确实对人类产生了某种神秘的影响。”

en: “But the how and the wherefore?” asked Barbicane.
zh: “可是怎么回事?”巴比肯问。

en: “Well, I can only give you the answer which Arago borrowed from Plutarch, which is nineteen centuries old.
zh: “好吧，我只能告诉你阿拉戈从普鲁塔克那里借来的答案，它已经有19个世纪的历史了。

en: ‘Perhaps the stories are not true!’”
zh: ‘也许这些故事不是真的!’

en: In the height of his triumph, Michel Ardan had to encounter all the annoyances incidental to a man of celebrity.
zh: 在米歇尔 · 阿丹的成功的巅峰时期，他不得不面对一个名人所带来的所有烦恼。

en: Managers of entertainments wanted to exhibit him.
zh: 娱乐公司的经理想要展出他。

en: Barnum offered him a million dollars to make a tour of the United States in his show.
zh: 巴纳姆给了他一百万美元让他在美国巡回演出。

en: As for his photographs, they were sold of all size, and his portrait taken in every imaginable posture.
zh: 至于他的照片，他们出售的大小和他的肖像拍摄在每一个可以想象的姿势。

en: More than half a million copies were disposed of in an incredibly short space of time.
zh: 超过50万份拷贝在极短的时间内被销毁。

en: But it was not only the men who paid him homage, but the women as well.
zh: 但不仅仅是男人们对他表示敬意，女人们也是如此。

en: He might have married well a hundred times over, if he had been willing to settle in life.
zh: 如果他愿意在生活中安定下来的话，他可能早就结一百次婚了。

en: The old maids, in particular, of forty years and upward, and dry in proportion, devoured his photographs day and night.
zh: 尤其是那些四十岁以上的老姑娘们，她们比例相当干燥，日日夜夜地吞食着他的照片。

en: They would have married him by hundreds, even if he had imposed upon them the condition of accompanying him into space.
zh: 即使他强加给他们陪伴他进入太空的条件，他们也愿意嫁给他几百个人。

en: He had, however, no intention of transplanting a race of Franco-Americans upon the surface of the moon.
zh: 然而，他并不打算将一个法裔美国人种族移植到月球表面。

en: He therefore declined all offers.
zh: 因此，他拒绝了所有的提议。

en: As soon as he could withdraw from these somewhat embarrassing demonstrations, he went, accompanied by his friends, to pay a visit to the Columbiad.
zh: 一旦他可以从这些有点尴尬的示威中退出，他就在朋友的陪同下去参观哥伦比亚博物馆。

en: He was highly gratified by his inspection, and made the descent to the bottom of the tube of this gigantic machine which was presently to launch him to the regions of the moon.
zh: 他对自己的视察感到非常满意，于是下到了这个巨大机器的管子底部，这个机器不久就要把他送到月球的各个地方去。

en: It is necessary here to mention a proposal of J. T. Maston’s.
zh: 这里有必要提一下 J.T.Maston 的提议。

en: When the secretary of the Gun Club found that Barbicane and Nicholl accepted the proposal of Michel Ardan, he determined to join them, and make one of a smug party of four.
zh: 当枪支俱乐部的秘书发现巴比肯和尼科尔接受了米歇尔 · 阿丹的求婚时，他决定加入他们，成为一个四人自鸣得意的派对中的一员。

en: So one day he determined to be admitted as one of the travelers.
zh: 所以有一天他决定成为其中一名旅行者。

en: Barbicane, pained at having to refuse him, gave him clearly to understand that the projectile could not possibly contain so many passengers.
zh: 巴比康因为不得不拒绝他而感到痛苦，他清楚地告诉他，这枚炮弹不可能装下这么多乘客。

en: Maston, in despair, went in search of Michel Ardan, who counseled him to resign himself to the situation, adding one or two arguments ad hominem.
zh: 马斯顿绝望地去找米歇尔 · 阿尔丹，阿尔丹建议他听天由命，在人身上加了一两条理由。

en: “You see, old fellow,” he said, “you must not take what I say in bad part;
zh: “你看，老伙计,”他说，“你不能把我说的话当真;

en: but really, between ourselves, you are in too incomplete a condition to appear in the moon!”
zh: 但事实上，我们私下说，你的状态太不完整了，不能出现在月球上!”

en: “Incomplete?” shrieked the valiant invalid.
zh: “不完整?”勇敢的病人尖叫道。

en: “Yes, my dear fellow! imagine our meeting some of the inhabitants up there! Would you like to give them such a melancholy notion of what goes on down here?
zh: “是的，我亲爱的朋友！想象一下我们在那里遇到一些居民！你愿意让他们对这里发生的事情有一个如此忧郁的概念吗？

en: to teach them what war is, to inform them that we employ our time chiefly in devouring each other, in smashing arms and legs,
zh: 告诉他们什么是战争，告诉他们我们的时间主要用来吞噬对方，用来打碎对方的胳膊和腿,

en: and that too on a globe which is capable of supporting a hundred billions of inhabitants, and which actually does contain nearly two hundred millions?
zh: 在一个有能力养活上千亿居民，而且实际上有近两亿居民的地球上也是如此吗？

en: Why, my worthy friend, we should have to turn you out of doors!”
zh: 为什么，我尊敬的朋友，我们应该把你赶出门去!”

en: “But still, if you arrive there in pieces, you will be as incomplete as I am.”
zh: “但是，如果你到达那里的时候是支离破碎的，你就会像我一样不完整。”

en: “Unquestionably,” replied Michel Ardan;
zh: “毫无疑问,”米歇尔 · 阿尔丹回答说;

en: “but we shall not.”
zh: “但我们不会”

en: In fact, a preparatory experiment, tried on the 18th of October, had yielded the best results and caused the most well-grounded hopes of success.
zh: 事实上，在10月18日进行的一次预备性实验已经取得了最好的结果，并且产生了最有根据的成功希望。

en: Barbicane, desirous of obtaining some notion of the effect of the shock at the moment of the projectile’s departure, had procured a 38-inch mortar from the arsenal of Pensacola.
zh: 巴比肯希望了解炮弹发射时的冲击效果，他从彭萨科拉军火库购买了一枚38英寸的迫击炮。

en: He had this placed on the bank of Hillisborough Roads, in order that the shell might fall back into the sea, and the shock be thereby destroyed.
zh: 他把这个放在希利斯伯勒路的岸边，以便炮弹落回海里，从而破坏冲击力。

en: His object was to ascertain the extent of the shock of departure, and not that of the return.
zh: 他的目的是确定离开的震惊程度，而不是回来的震惊程度。

en: A hollow projectile had been prepared for this curious experiment.
zh: 为了这个奇怪的实验，已经准备好了一个空心弹。

en: A thick padding fastened upon a kind of elastic network, made of the best steel, lined the inside of the walls.
zh: 一个厚厚的衬垫固定在一种弹性网上，由最好的钢材制成，衬在墙的内侧。

en: It was a veritable nest most carefully wadded.
zh: 这是一个名副其实的巢穴，被小心翼翼地填满了。

en: “What a pity I can’t find room in there,” said J. T. Maston, regretting that his height did not allow of his trying the adventure.
zh: “真遗憾，我在里面找不到地方,”J.T. 马斯顿说，他为自己的身高不允许他尝试冒险而感到遗憾。

en: Within this shell were shut up a large cat, and a squirrel belonging to J. T. Maston, and of which he was particularly fond.
zh: 在这个壳里面关着一只大猫，还有一只松鼠，这是 J.T. 马斯顿的，他特别喜欢这只松鼠。

en: They were desirous, however, of ascertaining how this little animal, least of all others subject to giddiness, would endure this experimental voyage.
zh: 然而，他们渴望弄清楚这只小动物，尤其是那些容易眩晕的动物，将如何忍受这次实验性的航行。

en: The mortar was charged with 160 pounds of powder, and the shell placed in the chamber.
zh: 迫击炮装有160磅的火药，炮弹放在炮膛里。

en: On being fired, the projectile rose with great velocity, described a majestic parabola,
zh: 发射后，炮弹以极快的速度上升，形成一条雄伟的抛物线,

en: attained a height of about a thousand feet, and with a graceful curve descended in the midst of the vessels that lay there at anchor.
zh: 到达了大约一千英尺的高度，在停泊的船只中间有一条优美的曲线下降。

en: Without a moment’s loss of time a small boat put off in the direction of its fall;
zh: 没有片刻的时间浪费，一只小船朝着它倒下的方向停了下来;

en: some divers plunged into the water and attached ropes to the handles of the shell, which was quickly dragged on board.
zh: 一些潜水员跳入水中，在贝壳的把手上绑上绳索，贝壳很快就被拖上了船。

en: Five minutes did not elapse between the moment of enclosing the animals and that of unscrewing the coverlid of their prison.
zh: 从把动物关起来到打开监狱的盖子，五分钟没有过去。

en: Ardan, Barbicane, Maston, and Nicholl were present on board the boat, and assisted at the operation with an interest which may readily be comprehended.
zh: 阿尔丹、巴比肯、马斯顿和尼科尔都在船上，他们以一种很容易理解的兴趣协助这次行动。

en: Hardly had the shell been opened when the cat leaped out, slightly bruised, but full of life, and exhibiting no signs whatever of having made an aerial expedition.
zh: 壳刚一打开，猫就跳了出来，身上有点淤青，但是充满了活力，没有任何迹象表明它曾经进行过空中探险。

en: No trace, however, of the squirrel could be discovered.
zh: 然而，没有发现松鼠的踪迹。

en: The truth at last became apparent—the cat had eaten its fellow-traveler!
zh: 真相终于明朗了ーー那只猫吃了它的同行者！

en: J. T. Maston grieved much for the loss of his poor squirrel, and proposed to add its case to that of other martyrs to science.
zh: J · T · 马斯顿为他那只可怜的松鼠的死感到非常悲痛，并提议把它的情况加入到其他科学殉道者的情况中去。

en: After this experiment all hesitation, all fear disappeared.
zh: 经过这次实验，所有的犹豫，所有的恐惧都消失了。

en: Besides, Barbicane’s plans would ensure greater perfection for his projectile, and go far to annihilate altogether the effects of the shock.
zh: 此外，巴比肯的计划将确保他的炮弹更加完美，并走得更远，以完全消除冲击的影响。

en: Nothing now remained but to go!
zh: 现在什么都没有了，只剩下去！

en: Two days later Michel Ardan received a message from the President of the United States, an honor of which he showed himself especially sensible.
zh: 两天后，米歇尔 · 阿尔丹收到了美国总统的来信，对此他表现得特别明智。

en: After the example of his illustrious fellow-countryman, the Marquis de la Fayette, the government had decreed to him the title of “Citizen of the United States of America.”
zh: 在他杰出的同胞法耶特侯爵的榜样之后，政府授予他“美利坚合众国公民”的头衔

en: CHAPTER XXIII. THE PROJECTILE-VEHICLE
zh: 第二十三章射弹-车辆

en: On the completion of the Columbiad the public interest centered in the projectile itself, the vehicle which was destined to carry the three hardy adventurers into space.
zh: 哥伦比亚号完成后，公众的兴趣集中在抛射体本身，这个飞行器注定要把三个勇敢的冒险家送上太空。

en: The new plans had been sent to Breadwill and Co., of Albany, with the request for their speedy execution.
zh: 新的计划已经送到了 Breadwill 公司，并要求尽快执行。

en: The projectile was consequently cast on the 2nd of November, and immediately forwarded by the Eastern Railway to Stones Hill,
zh: 炮弹于11月2日发射，随即由东部铁路运往石山,

en: which it reached without accident on the 10th of that month, where Michel Ardan, Barbicane, and Nicholl were waiting impatiently for it.
zh: 那个月10日，它无意中到达了那里，米歇尔 · 阿尔丹、巴比肯和尼科尔正在那里焦急地等待着它。

en: The projectile had now to be filled to the depth of three feet with a bed of water, intended to support a water-tight wooden disc, which worked easily within the walls of the projectile.
zh: 现在必须用水床将弹丸填充到三英尺的深度，以支撑一个不透水的木制圆盘，这个圆盘在弹丸的内壁内很容易发挥作用。

en: It was upon this kind of raft that the travelers were to take their place.
zh: 正是在这种筏子上，旅行者们取代了他们的位置。

en: This body of water was divided by horizontal partitions, which the shock of the departure would have to break in succession.
zh: 这片水域被水平分隔开来，离开的冲击力必须一个接一个地打破。

en: Then each sheet of the water, from the lowest to the highest, running off into escape tubes toward the top of the projectile, constituted a kind of spring;
zh: 然后，每一片水，从最低的到最高的，流入向弹丸顶部的逃生管道，构成了一种弹簧;

en: and the wooden disc, supplied with extremely powerful plugs, could not strike the lowest plate except after breaking successively the different partitions.
zh: 木制圆盘配有极强力的插头，除非先后打破不同的隔板，否则不能打到最低的圆盘。

en: Undoubtedly the travelers would still have to encounter a violent recoil after the complete escapement of the water;
zh: 毫无疑问，在完全脱离水面之后，旅行者仍然会遇到强烈的反冲力;

en: but the first shock would be almost entirely destroyed by this powerful spring.
zh: 但是第一次冲击几乎会被这个强大的弹簧完全摧毁。

en: The upper parts of the walls were lined with a thick padding of leather, fastened upon springs of the best steel, behind which the escape tubes were completely concealed;
zh: 墙的上半部分用厚厚的皮革衬里，固定在最好的钢制弹簧上，后面的逃生管道完全隐藏起来;

en: thus all imaginable precautions had been taken for averting the first shock;
zh: 因此，为了避免第一次冲击，已经采取了一切可以想象得到的预防措施;

en: and if they did get crushed, they must, as Michel Ardan said, be made of very bad materials.
zh: 如果它们真的被压碎了，就像米歇尔 · 阿尔丹说的那样，它们一定是用非常糟糕的材料制成的。

en: The entrance into this metallic tower was by a narrow aperture contrived in the wall of the cone.
zh: 进入这个金属塔的入口是由一个狭窄的孔在锥体的墙上设计的。

en: This was hermetically closed by a plate of aluminum, fastened internally by powerful screw-pressure.
zh: 这是密封的铝板，内部紧固强大的螺丝压力。

en: The travelers could therefore quit their prison at pleasure, as soon as they should reach the moon.
zh: 因此，旅行者们可以随心所欲地离开他们的监狱，只要他们一到达月球。

en: Light and view were given by means of four thick lenticular glass scuttles, two pierced in the circular wall itself, the third in the bottom, the fourth in the top.
zh: 光线和视野是通过四个厚的透镜玻璃漏斗给予的，其中两个在圆形的墙壁上穿孔，第三个在底部，第四个在顶部。

en: These scuttles then were protected against the shock of departure by plates let into solid grooves, which could easily be opened outward by unscrewing them from the inside.
zh: 然后，这些煤斗被放入固体槽内的板子保护起来，防止受到离开的冲击，固体槽可以通过从内部拧开它们而轻易地向外打开。

en: Reservoirs firmly fixed contained water and the necessary provisions;
zh: 水库固定牢固，含水量及必要的配备;

en: and fire and light were procurable by means of gas, contained in a special reservoir under a pressure of several atmospheres.
zh: 火和光是可以通过气体获得的，在几种大气压力下，气体被储存在一个特殊的容器中。

en: They had only to turn a tap, and for six hours the gas would light and warm this comfortable vehicle.
zh: 他们只需转动一个水龙头，六个小时的煤气就会点燃并加热这辆舒适的汽车。

en: There now remained only the question of air;
zh: 现在只剩下空气的问题;

en: for allowing for the consumption of air by Barbicane, his two companions, and two dogs which he proposed taking with him, it was necessary to renew the air of the projectile.
zh: 考虑到巴比肯、他的两个同伴和他提议带走的两只狗消耗了空气，有必要重新给炮弹充气。

en: Now air consists principally of twenty-one parts of oxygen and seventy-nine of nitrogen.
zh: 现在空气主要由二十一份氧气和七十九份氮气组成。

en: The lungs absorb the oxygen, which is indispensable for the support of life, and reject the nitrogen.
zh: 肺吸收维持生命所必需的氧气，排斥氮气。

en: The air expired loses nearly five per cent.
zh: 空气过期损失近5% 。

en: of the former and contains nearly an equal volume of carbonic acid, produced by the combustion of the elements of the blood.
zh: 它含有几乎相等体积的碳酸，是由血液中的元素燃烧而产生的。

en: In an air-tight enclosure, then, after a certain time, all the oxygen of the air will be replaced by the carbonic acid—a gas fatal to life.
zh: 在一个密闭的环境中，过了一段时间，空气中的所有氧气都会被碳酸所取代，碳酸是一种对生命致命的气体。

en: There were two things to be done then—first, to replace the absorbed oxygen;
zh: 当时有两件事要做ーー第一，更换被吸收的氧气;

en: secondly, to destroy the expired carbonic acid;
zh: 二是破坏过期碳酸;

en: both easy enough to do, by means of chlorate of potassium and caustic potash.
zh: 两者都很容易做到，通过钾的氯酸盐和苛性钾。

en: The former is a salt which appears under the form of white crystals;
zh: 前者是以白色晶体的形式出现的盐;

en: when raised to a temperature of 400 degrees it is transformed into chlorure of potassium, and the oxygen which it contains is entirely liberated.
zh: 当温度提高到400度时，它就变成了钾的氯化物，其中含有的氧气完全释放出来。

en: Now twenty-eight pounds of chlorate of potassium produces seven pounds of oxygen, or 2,400 litres—the quantity necessary for the travelers during twenty-four hours.
zh: 现在28磅的氯酸钾可以产生7磅的氧气，也就是2400升，这是旅行者在24小时内所需要的量。

en: Caustic potash has a great affinity for carbonic acid;
zh: 苛性钾对碳酸有很强的亲和力;

en: and it is sufficient to shake it in order for it to seize upon the acid and form bicarbonate of potassium.
zh: 摇晃它就足以使它吸收酸并形成碳酸氢钾。

en: By these two means they would be enabled to restore to the vitiated air its life- supporting properties.
zh: 通过这两种方式，它们将能够恢复受损空气的维持生命的特性。

en: It is necessary, however, to add that the experiments had hitherto been made in anima vili.
zh: 然而，有必要补充一点，迄今为止这些实验都是在灵魂中进行的。

en: Whatever its scientific accuracy was, they were at present ignorant how it would answer with human beings.
zh: 无论它的科学准确性如何，他们目前还不知道它将如何回答人类。

en: The honor of putting it to the proof was energetically claimed by J. T. Maston.
zh: J · T · 马斯顿(J.T. Maston)积极主动地宣称，有幸证明了这一点。

en: “Since I am not to go,” said the brave artillerist, “I may at least live for a week in the projectile.”
zh: “既然我不去,”勇敢的炮兵说，“我至少可以在炮弹里活一个星期。”

en: It would have been hard to refuse him;
zh: 要拒绝他是很难的;

en: so they consented to his wish.
zh: 所以他们同意了他的愿望。

en: A sufficient quantity of chlorate of potassium and of caustic potash was placed at his disposal, together with provisions for eight days.
zh: 供他使用的是足够数量的氯酸钾和腐蚀性钾盐，以及八天的粮食。

en: And having shaken hands with his friends, on the 12th of November, at six o’clock A.M., after strictly informing them not to open his prison before the 20th, at six o’clock P.M.,
zh: 和他的朋友们在11月12日上握了手在严格通知他们不要在20号之前在下午6点之前打开他的监狱之后,

en: he slid down the projectile, the plate of which was at once hermetically sealed.
zh: 他顺着弹片滑下去，弹片立刻被密封起来。

en: What did he do with himself during that week? They could get no information.
zh: - 那一周他都做了什么?-他们得不到任何信息。

en: The thickness of the walls of the projectile prevented any sound reaching from the inside to the outside.
zh: 炮弹壁的厚度防止任何声音从内部传到外部。

en: On the 20th of November, at six P.M.
zh: 11月20日下午6点。

en: exactly, the plate was opened.
zh: 没错，盘子是打开的。

en: The friends of J. T. Maston had been all along in a state of much anxiety;
zh: J · T · 马斯顿的朋友们一直处于非常焦虑的状态;

en: but they were promptly reassured on hearing a jolly voice shouting a boisterous hurrah.
zh: 但是，当他们听到一个欢快的声音大声欢呼时，他们立即放心了。

en: Presently afterward the secretary of the Gun Club appeared at the top of the cone in a triumphant attitude.
zh: 不一会儿，枪支俱乐部的秘书以胜利者的姿态出现在圆锥体的顶端。

en: He had grown fat!
zh: 他长胖了！

en: CHAPTER XXIV. THE TELESCOPE OF THE ROCKY MOUNTAINS
zh: 第二十四章落基山脉的望远镜

en: On the 20th of October in the preceding year, after the close of the subscription,
zh: 在前一年的10月20日，在认购结束后,

en: the president of the Gun Club had credited the Observatory of Cambridge with the necessary sums for the construction of a gigantic optical instrument.
zh: 枪支俱乐部的主席将建造一个巨大的光学仪器所需的资金归功于剑桥天文台。

en: This instrument was designed for the purpose of rendering visible on the surface of the moon any object exceeding nine feet in diameter.
zh: 这台仪器的设计目的是使任何直径超过9英尺的物体在月球表面可见。

en: At the period when the Gun Club essayed their great experiment, such instruments had reached a high degree of perfection, and produced some magnificent results.
zh: 在大炮俱乐部进行伟大实验的时候，这些仪器已经达到了很高的完美程度，并产生了一些辉煌的成果。

en: Two telescopes in particular, at this time, were possessed of remarkable power and of gigantic dimensions.
zh: 特别是在这个时候，有两架望远镜拥有惊人的能量和巨大的尺寸。

en: The first, constructed by Herschel, was thirty-six feet in length, and had an object-glass of four feet six inches;
zh: 第一个是赫歇尔建造的，长三十六英尺，有一个四英尺六英寸的物体玻璃;

en: it possessed a magnifying power of 6,000.
zh: 它拥有6000倍的放大能力。

en: The second was raised in Ireland, in Parsonstown Park, and belongs to Lord Rosse.
zh: 第二个是在爱尔兰的帕森斯敦公园长大的，属于罗斯勋爵。

en: The length of this tube is forty-eight feet, and the diameter of its object-glass six feet;
zh: 这管子的长度是四十八英尺，它的物体——玻璃的直径是六英尺;

en: it magnifies 6,400 times, and required an immense erection of brick work and masonry for the purpose of working it, its weight being twelve and a half tons.
zh: 它放大了6400倍，需要巨大的砖块和砖石建造它，它的重量是12.5吨。

en: Still, despite these colossal dimensions, the actual enlargements scarcely exceeded 6,000 times in round numbers;
zh: 然而，尽管有这些巨大的尺寸，实际的放大倍数在整数上仅仅超过6000倍;

en: consequently, the moon was brought within no nearer an apparent distance than thirty-nine miles;
zh: 因此，月亮被带到了不超过三十九英里的视距之内;

en: and objects of less than sixty feet in diameter, unless they were of very considerable length, were still imperceptible.
zh: 直径小于六十英尺的物体，除非它们的长度非常可观，否则仍然无法察觉。

en: In the present case, dealing with a projectile nine feet in diameter and fifteen feet long, it became necessary to bring the moon within an apparent distance of five miles at most;
zh: 在目前的情况下，处理一个直径9英尺、长15英尺的抛射物，有必要把月球带到最多5英里的视距之内;

en: and for that purpose to establish a magnifying power of 48,000 times.
zh: 为了达到这个目的，我们建立了48000倍的放大能力。

en: Such was the question proposed to the Observatory of Cambridge, There was no lack of funds;
zh: 这就是向剑桥天文台提出的问题: 不缺资金;

en: the difficulty was purely one of construction.
zh: 困难纯粹是建设的问题。

en: After considerable discussion as to the best form and principle of the proposed instrument the work was finally commenced.
zh: 在就拟议文书的最佳形式和原则进行了大量讨论之后，工作终于开始了。

en: According to the calculations of the Observatory of Cambridge, the tube of the new reflector would require to be 280 feet in length, and the object-glass sixteen feet in diameter.
zh: 根据剑桥天文台的计算，新反射器的管子需要280英尺长，物镜直径需要16英尺。

en: Colossal as these dimensions may appear, they were diminutive in comparison with the 10,000 foot telescope proposed by the astronomer Hooke only a few years ago!
zh: 尽管这些维度看起来非常巨大，但与天文学家胡克几年前提出的10,000英尺的望远镜相比，它们还是显得微不足道！

en: Regarding the choice of locality, that matter was promptly determined.
zh: 关于地点的选择，那件事很快就决定了。

en: The object was to select some lofty mountain, and there are not many of these in the United States.
zh: 我们的目标是选择一些高耸的山峰，而这样的山峰在美国并不多见。

en: In fact there are but two chains of moderate elevation, between which runs the magnificent Mississippi, the “king of rivers” as these Republican Yankees delight to call it.
zh: 事实上，只有两条中等海拔的链条，其间流淌着壮丽的密西西比河，这些共和党的美国佬喜欢称之为“河流之王”。

en: Eastwards rise the Appalachians, the very highest point of which, in New Hampshire, does not exceed the very moderate altitude of 5,600 feet.
zh: 阿巴拉契亚山脉向东隆起，其最高点位于新罕布什尔州，海拔不超过5600英尺。

en: On the west, however, rise the Rocky Mountains, that immense range which, commencing at the Straights of Magellan,
zh: 然而，在西边，是落基山脉，这个巨大的山脉，从麦哲伦海峡开始,

en: follows the western coast of Southern America under the name of the Andes or the Cordilleras, until it crosses the Isthmus of Panama, and runs up the whole of North America to the very borders of the Polar Sea.
zh: 以安第斯山脉或科迪勒拉斯山脉的名义沿着南美洲西海岸直到穿过巴拿马地峡沿着整个北美洲直到极地海的边界。

en: The highest elevation of this range still does not exceed 10,700 feet.
zh: 这个范围的最高海拔仍然不超过10,700英尺。

en: With this elevation, nevertheless, the Gun Club were compelled to be content, inasmuch as they had determined that both telescope and Columbiad should be erected within the limits of the Union.
zh: 尽管如此，枪支俱乐部还是不得不满足，因为他们已经决定，望远镜和哥伦比亚望远镜都应该建在联邦的范围内。

en: All the necessary apparatus was consequently sent on to the summit of Long’s Peak, in the territory of Missouri.
zh: 因此，所有必要的仪器都被送到密苏里领地的朗峰顶上。

en: Neither pen nor language can describe the difficulties of all kinds which the American engineers had to surmount, of the prodigies of daring and skill which they accomplished.
zh: 无论是笔还是语言，都无法描述美国工程师们必须克服的种种困难，无法描述他们所取得的天才般的勇气和技巧。

en: They had to raise enormous stones, massive pieces of wrought iron, heavy corner-clamps and huge portions of cylinder, with an object-glass weighing nearly 30,000 pounds,
zh: 他们不得不举起巨大的石头、大块的锻铁、沉重的角夹和大块的圆柱体，还有一个重近3万磅的物体玻璃,

en: above the line of perpetual snow for more than 10,000 feet in height, after crossing desert prairies, impenetrable forests, fearful rapids, far from all centers of population,
zh: 在一万多英尺高的积雪之上穿越沙漠大草原，无法穿越的森林，可怕的急流，远离所有人口中心,

en: and in the midst of savage regions, in which every detail of life becomes an almost insoluble problem.
zh: 在蛮荒之地，生命的每一个细节都成为一个几乎无法解决的问题。

en: And yet, notwithstanding these innumerable obstacles, American genius triumphed.
zh: 然而，尽管有这些无数的障碍，美国天才还是取得了胜利。

en: In less than a year after the commencement of the works, toward the close of September, the gigantic reflector rose into the air to a height of 280 feet.
zh: 在工程开始后不到一年，接近九月底的时候，这个巨大的反光镜升到了280英尺的高度。

en: It was raised by means of an enormous iron crane;
zh: 它是用一个巨大的铁吊车吊起来的;

en: an ingenious mechanism allowed it to be easily worked toward all the points of the heavens, and to follow the stars from the one horizon to the other during their journey through the heavens.
zh: 一种巧妙的机制使它能够轻易地运行到天空的所有点，并且在星星穿越天空的旅程中能够跟随它们从一个地平线到另一个地平线。

en: It had cost $400,000.
zh: 花了40万美元。

en: The first time it was directed toward the moon the observers evinced both curiosity and anxiety.
zh: 第一次它被指向月球时，观察者表现出好奇和焦虑。

en: What were they about to discover in the field of this telescope which magnified objects 48,000 times?
zh: 他们将要在这个放大了48000倍的望远镜里发现什么呢？

en: Would they perceive peoples, herds of lunar animals, towns, lakes, seas? No! there was nothing which science had not already discovered!
zh: 他们会看到人类，成群的月球动物，城镇，湖泊，海洋吗？不！没有什么是科学没有发现的！

en: and on all the points of its disc the volcanic nature of the moon became determinable with the utmost precision.
zh: 在月盘的所有点上月球的火山性质变得极其精确。

en: But the telescope of the Rocky Mountains, before doing its duty to the Gun Club, rendered immense services to astronomy.
zh: 但是落基山脉的望远镜，在为枪支俱乐部服务之前，为天文学提供了巨大的服务。

en: Thanks to its penetrative power, the depths of the heavens were sounded to the utmost extent;
zh: 由于它的穿透力，天空的深处被探测到了极限;

en: the apparent diameter of a great number of stars was accurately measured;
zh: 精确测量了大量恒星的视直径;

en: and Mr. Clark, of the Cambridge staff, resolved the Crab nebula in Taurus, which the reflector of Lord Rosse had never been able to decompose.
zh: 剑桥工作人员克拉克先生解决了金牛座的蟹状星云问题，罗斯勋爵的反射器从来没有分解过这个星云。

en: CHAPTER XXV. FINAL DETAILS
zh: 第二十五章最后细节

en: It was the 22nd of November;
zh: 是11月22日

en: the departure was to take place in ten days.
zh: 出发将在十天后进行。

en: One operation alone remained to be accomplished to bring all to a happy termination;
zh: 只有一项行动尚待完成，以便使所有人都能幸福地结束;

en: an operation delicate and perilous, requiring infinite precautions, and against the success of which Captain Nicholl had laid his third bet.
zh: 这是一次微妙而危险的行动，需要无限的预防措施，尼科尔船长已经为此下了第三次赌注。

en: It was, in fact, nothing less than the loading of the Columbiad, and the introduction into it of 400,000 pounds of gun-cotton.
zh: 事实上，这不亚于装载了“哥伦比亚号”，以及装载了40万磅的炮棉。

en: Nicholl had thought, not perhaps without reason, that the handling of such formidable quantities of pyroxyle would, in all probability, involve a grave catastrophe;
zh: 尼科尔想过，也许并非没有理由，处理如此大量的火山灰很可能会引起一场严重的灾难;

en: and at any rate, that this immense mass of eminently inflammable matter would inevitably ignite when submitted to the pressure of the projectile.
zh: 无论如何，这个巨大的易燃物质的质量将不可避免地点燃当屈服于抛射物的压力。

en: There were indeed dangers accruing as before from the carelessness of the Americans, but Barbicane had set his heart on success, and took all possible precautions.
zh: 美国人的粗心大意确实带来了危险，但巴比肯一心想要成功，并采取了一切可能的预防措施。

en: In the first place, he was very careful as to the transportation of the gun-cotton to Stones Hill.
zh: 首先，他非常小心地把炮棉运到石头山。

en: He had it conveyed in small quantities, carefully packed in sealed cases.
zh: 他小批量运输，小心翼翼地装在密封的箱子里。

en: These were brought by rail from Tampa Town to the camp, and from thence were taken to the Columbiad by barefooted workmen,
zh: 这些是从坦帕镇用火车运到营地的，然后由赤脚工人从那里运到哥伦比亚,

en: who deposited them in their places by means of cranes placed at the orifice of the cannon.
zh: 他们通过放在大炮口的起重机把它们放在各自的位置上。

en: No steam-engine was permitted to work, and every fire was extinguished within two miles of the works.
zh: 没有蒸汽机被允许运转，工厂方圆两英里内的所有火灾都被扑灭了。

en: Even in November they feared to work by day, lest the sun’s rays acting on the gun-cotton might lead to unhappy results.
zh: 即使在11月，他们也害怕白天工作，以免阳光照射在棉花上会导致不愉快的结果。

en: This led to their working at night, by light produced in a vacuum by means of Ruhmkorff’s apparatus, which threw an artificial brightness into the depths of the Columbiad.
zh: 这导致了他们在夜间工作，通过鲁姆科夫的仪器在真空中产生的光线，向哥伦比亚号的深处投射出人造的亮度。

en: There the cartridges were arranged with the utmost regularity, connected by a metallic thread, destined to communicate to them all simultaneously the electric spark,
zh: 在那里，墨盒被极其规则地排列着，由一根金属线连接，注定要同时传递给它们所有的电火花,

en: by which means this mass of gun-cotton was eventually to be ignited.
zh: 通过这种方式，这团火药棉最终被点燃。

en: By the 28th of November eight hundred cartridges had been placed in the bottom of the Columbiad.
zh: 到11月28日的时候，已经有八百枚子弹被放置在哥伦比亚号的底部。

en: So far the operation had been successful! But what confusion, what anxieties, what struggles were undergone by President Barbicane! In vain had he refused admission to Stones Hill;
zh: 到目前为止，手术是成功的！但是巴比肯总统经历了怎样的困惑，怎样的焦虑，怎样的斗争！他徒劳地拒绝了石头山的入场许可;

en: every day the inquisitive neighbors scaled the palisades, some even carrying their imprudence to the point of smoking while surrounded by bales of gun-cotton.
zh: 好奇的邻居们每天都爬上栅栏，有些人甚至带着他们的轻率，在一捆捆枪支棉花的包围下抽烟。

en: Barbicane was in a perpetual state of alarm.
zh: 巴比康一直处于惊慌失措的状态。

en: J. T. Maston seconded him to the best of his ability, by giving vigorous chase to the intruders, and carefully picking up the still lighted cigar ends which the Yankees threw about.
zh: J · T · 马斯顿尽其所能地支持他，他奋力追赶入侵者，小心翼翼地拾起北方佬扔来扔去仍然点着的雪茄烟头。

en: A somewhat difficult task! seeing that more than 300,000 persons were gathered round the enclosure.
zh: 一个有点困难的任务! 看到超过300,000人聚集在围栏周围。

en: Michel Ardan had volunteered to superintend the transport of the cartridges to the mouth of the Columbiad;
zh: 米歇尔 · 阿尔丹自愿监督将弹药筒运送到哥伦比亚号口的工作;

en: but the president, having surprised him with an enormous cigar in his mouth, while he was hunting out the rash spectators to whom he himself offered so dangerous an example,
zh: 但是总统，他嘴里叼着一支巨大的雪茄，这让他感到惊讶，当他在寻找那些鲁莽的观众的时候，他自己给他们树立了一个如此危险的榜样,

en: saw that he could not trust this fearless smoker, and was therefore obliged to mount a special guard over him.
zh: 他意识到他不能相信这个无畏的烟民，因此不得不在他身上安排一个特别的警卫。

en: At last, Providence being propitious, this wonderful loading came to a happy termination, Captain Nicholl’s third bet being thus lost.
zh: 最后，幸运的是，这次精彩的装船终于圆满结束，尼科尔船长的第三次赌注就这样输掉了。

en: It remained now to introduce the projectile into the Columbiad, and to place it on its soft bed of gun-cotton.
zh: 现在剩下的工作就是把这种炮弹引入 Columbiad，并把它放在柔软的炮棉床上。

en: But before doing this, all those things necessary for the journey had to be carefully arranged in the projectile vehicle.
zh: 但在此之前，所有这些必要的旅程必须仔细安排在抛射车辆。

en: These necessaries were numerous;
zh: 这些必需品数不胜数;

en: and had Ardan been allowed to follow his own wishes, there would have been no space remaining for the travelers.
zh: 如果阿尔丹能够按照自己的意愿行事，旅行者们就没有多余的空间了。

en: It is impossible to conceive of half the things this charming Frenchman wished to convey to the moon.
zh: 这个迷人的法国人想传达给月亮的东西，有一半是不可能想到的。

en: A veritable stock of useless trifles! But Barbicane interfered and refused admission to anything not absolutely needed.
zh: 真是一堆没用的东西! 但是巴比肯插手干预，拒绝接受任何不是绝对需要的东西。

en: Several thermometers, barometers, and telescopes were packed in the instrument case.
zh: 仪器箱里装着几个温度计、气压计和望远镜。

en: The travelers being desirous of examing the moon carefully during their voyage, in order to facilitate their studies, they took with them Boeer and Moeller’s excellent Mappa Selenographica,
zh: 旅行者们渴望在旅行中仔细观察月球，为了方便他们的学习，他们带走了波尔和默勒的优秀的月球地图,

en: a masterpiece of patience and observation, which they hoped would enable them to identify those physical features in the moon, with which they were acquainted.
zh: 这是耐心和观察的杰作，他们希望这能使他们辨认出月球上他们所熟悉的那些物理特征。

en: This map reproduced with scrupulous fidelity the smallest details of the lunar surface which faces the earth;
zh: 这张地图一丝不苟地再现了面向地球的月球表面的最小细节;

en: the mountains, valleys, craters, peaks, and ridges were all represented, with their exact dimensions, relative positions, and names;
zh: 山脉、山谷、火山口、山峰和山脊都有精确的尺寸、相对位置和名称;

en: from the mountains Doerfel and Leibnitz on the eastern side of the disc, to the Mare frigoris of the North Pole.
zh: 从圆盘东侧的 Doerfel 和莱布尼茨山脉到北极的冰海。

en: They took also three rifles and three fowling-pieces, and a large quantity of balls, shot, and powder.
zh: 他们还带走了三支步枪和三个猎枪，以及大量的弹丸、子弹和火药。

en: “We cannot tell whom we shall have to deal with,” said Michel Ardan.
zh: “我们不知道该和谁打交道,”米歇尔 · 阿尔丹说。

en: “Men or beasts may possibly object to our visit.
zh: 人类或野兽可能会反对我们的到访。

en: It is only wise to take all precautions.”
zh: 采取一切预防措施才是明智之举。”

en: These defensive weapons were accompanied by pickaxes, crowbars, saws, and other useful implements,
zh: 这些防御性武器配有镐、撬棍、锯子和其他有用的工具,

en: not to mention clothing adapted to every temperature, from that of polar regions to that of the torrid zone.
zh: 更不用说适应各种温度的衣服，从极地到炎热地区。

en: Ardan wished to convey a number of animals of different sorts, not indeed a pair of every known species,
zh: 阿丹希望传达一些不同种类的动物，实际上并不是所有已知物种的一对,

en: as he could not see the necessity of acclimatizing serpents, tigers, alligators, or any other noxious beasts in the moon.
zh: 因为他看不出有必要让蛇、老虎、短吻鳄或任何其他月球上的有毒动物适应环境。

en: “Nevertheless,” he said to Barbicane, “some valuable and useful beasts, bullocks, cows, horses, and donkeys, would bear the journey very well, and would also be very useful to us.”
zh: “尽管如此,”他对巴比肯说，“一些有价值和有用的牲畜，公牛，牛，马和驴，将承担旅程非常好，也将是非常有益于我们。”

en: “I dare say, my dear Ardan,” replied the president, “but our projectile-vehicle is no Noah’s ark, from which it differs both in dimensions and object.
zh: “我敢说，亲爱的阿尔丹,”总统回答说，“但是我们的飞行器不是诺亚方舟，它在尺寸和物体上都不同。

en: Let us confine ourselves to possibilities.”
zh: 让我们把自己限制在各种可能性中。”

en: After a prolonged discussion, it was agreed that the travelers should restrict themselves to a sporting-dog belonging to Nicholl, and to a large Newfoundland.
zh: 经过长时间的讨论，大家一致同意，旅行者应该限制自己的运动狗属于尼科尔，并大纽芬兰。

en: Several packets of seeds were also included among the necessaries.
zh: 几包种子也包括在必需品中。

en: Michel Ardan, indeed, was anxious to add some sacks full of earth to sow them in;
zh: 事实上，米歇尔 · 阿尔丹急于添加一些装满泥土的麻袋来播种;

en: as it was, he took a dozen shrubs carefully wrapped up in straw to plant in the moon.
zh: 事实上，他拿了一打用稻草小心包裹起来的灌木种在月亮上。

en: The important question of provisions still remained;
zh: 规定的重要问题仍然存在;

en: it being necessary to provide against the possibility of their finding the moon absolutely barren.
zh: 有必要防止他们发现月球上绝对贫瘠的可能性。

en: Barbicane managed so successfully, that he supplied them with sufficient rations for a year.
zh: 巴比肯成功地管理了这一切，他给他们提供了足够一年的口粮。

en: These consisted of preserved meats and vegetables, reduced by strong hydraulic pressure to the smallest possible dimensions.
zh: 这些包括腌制的肉类和蔬菜，通过强大的水压减少到最小的可能的尺寸。

en: They were also supplied with brandy, and took water enough for two months, being confident, from astronomical observations, that there was no lack of water on the moon’s surface.
zh: 他们还得到了白兰地的供应，并且取了足够两个月的水，从天文观测来看，他们确信月球表面并不缺水。

en: As to provisions, doubtless the inhabitants of the earth would find nourishment somewhere in the moon.
zh: 至于食物，毫无疑问地球上的居民会在月球的某个地方找到食物。

en: Ardan never questioned this;
zh: 阿丹从未质疑过这一点;

en: indeed, had he done so, he would never have undertaken the journey.
zh: 事实上，如果他这样做了，他就永远不会踏上这段旅程了。

en: “Besides,” he said one day to his friends, “we shall not be completely abandoned by our terrestrial friends;
zh: “此外,”有一天他对他的朋友们说，“我们不会完全被我们地球上的朋友们抛弃;

en: they will take care not to forget us.”
zh: 他们会小心不要忘记我们。”

en: “No, indeed!” replied J. T. Maston.
zh: “不，真的!”J.T. 马斯顿回答。

en: “Nothing would be simpler,” replied Ardan;
zh: “没有比这更简单的了,”阿尔丹回答说;

en: “the Columbiad will be always there.
zh: 哥伦比亚号将永远在那里。

en: Well! whenever the moon is in a favorable condition as to the zenith, if not to the perigee, that is to say about once a year,
zh: 好吧！每当月球处于天顶的有利状态，如果不是近地点，也就是说大约一年一次,

en: could you not send us a shell packed with provisions, which we might expect on some appointed day?”
zh: 你能不能寄给我们一个装满粮食的贝壳，我们可以在某个指定的日子里期待它的到来?”

en: “Hurrah! hurrah!” cried J. T. Matson;
zh: “万岁! 万岁!”J.T. 马特森喊道;

en: “what an ingenious fellow! what a splendid idea! Indeed, my good friends, we shall not forget you!”
zh: “多么聪明的家伙! 多么好的主意! 真的，我的好朋友们，我们不会忘记你们的!”

en: “I shall reckon upon you! Then, you see, we shall receive news regularly from the earth, and we shall indeed be stupid if we hit upon no plan for communicating with our good friends here!”
zh: “我会指望你的！那么，你看，我们将定期收到来自地球的消息，如果我们偶然发现没有计划与我们在这里的好朋友交流，那我们就真的愚蠢了!”

en: These words inspired such confidence, that Michel Ardan carried all the Gun Club with him in his enthusiasm.
zh: 这些话激起了人们的信心，以至于米歇尔 · 阿丹以他的热情把整个枪支俱乐部的人都带上了。

en: What he said seemed so simple and so easy, so sure of success, that none could be so sordidly attached to this earth as to hesitate to follow the three travelers on their lunar expedition.
zh: 他所说的似乎是那么简单，那么容易，那么肯定会成功，以至于没有一个人会如此卑鄙地依附于这个地球，以至于犹豫不决地跟随三个旅行者进行他们的月球探险。

en: All being ready at last, it remained to place the projectile in the Columbiad, an operation abundantly accompanied by dangers and difficulties.
zh: 最后，一切准备就绪，它仍然把炮弹放在 Columbiad，这一行动充满了危险和困难。

en: The enormous shell was conveyed to the summit of Stones Hill.
zh: 巨大的贝壳被运到了石头山的山顶。

en: There, powerful cranes raised it, and held it suspended over the mouth of the cylinder.
zh: 在那里，强有力的起重机把它举起来，并把它悬挂在圆筒的口上。

en: It was a fearful moment! What if the chains should break under its enormous weight? The sudden fall of such a body would inevitably cause the gun-cotton to explode!
zh: 这是一个可怕的时刻！如果锁链在它巨大的重量下断裂了呢？这样一个身体突然倒下，不可避免地会引起炮棉爆炸！

en: Fortunately this did not happen;
zh: 幸运的是，这种情况并没有发生;

en: and some hours later the projectile-vehicle descended gently into the heart of the cannon and rested on its couch of pyroxyle, a veritable bed of explosive eider-down.
zh: 几个小时后，投射车轻轻地下降到大炮的中心，停在它的火山灰沙发上，一个名副其实的爆炸羽绒床上。

en: Its pressure had no result, other than the more effectual ramming down of the charge in the Columbiad.
zh: 美联储的施压没有任何结果，只是在 Columbiad 更有效地压制了这种指责。

en: “I have lost,” said the captain, who forthwith paid President Barbicane the sum of three thousand dollars.
zh: “我输了,”船长说，他立即付给巴比肯总统三千美元。

en: Barbicane did not wish to accept the money from one of his fellow-travelers,
zh: 巴比肯不愿意接受同行者的钱,

en: but gave way at last before the determination of Nicholl, who wished before leaving the earth to fulfill all his engagements.
zh: 但在尼科尔下定决心之前，他终于让步了。尼科尔希望在离开地球之前完成他所有的使命。

en: “Now,” said Michel Ardan, “I have only one thing more to wish for you, my brave captain.”
zh: “现在,”米歇尔 · 阿尔丹说，“我还有一件事要祝福你，我勇敢的船长。”

en: “What is that?” asked Nicholl.
zh: “那是什么?”尼科尔问。

en: “It is that you may lose your two other bets! Then we shall be sure not to be stopped on our journey!”
zh: “这是你可能会失去你的另外两个赌注！那我们一定不会在旅途中被拦下来!”

en: CHAPTER XXVI. FIRE!
zh: 第二十六章，开火！

en: The first of December had arrived! the fatal day! for, if the projectile were not discharged that very night at 10h. 48m. 40s. P.M.,
zh: 十二月的第一天到了！致命的一天！因为，如果抛射物没有在当晚10点发射。4800万。40多岁。下午,

en: more than eighteen years must roll by before the moon would again present herself under the same conditions of zenith and perigee.
zh: 十八年过去了，月亮才会再次出现在同样的天顶和近地点的条件下。

en: The weather was magnificent.
zh: 天气很好。

en: Despite the approach of winter, the sun shone brightly, and bathed in its radiant light that earth which three of its denizens were about to abandon for a new world.
zh: 尽管冬天即将来临，太阳依然明亮地照耀着大地，沐浴在灿烂的阳光之中，而大地上的三个居民正准备离开这里，去到一个新的世界。

en: How many persons lost their rest on the night which preceded this long-expected day! All hearts beat with disquietude, save only the heart of Michel Ardan.
zh: 在这个期待已久的日子的前一天晚上，有多少人失去了休息！所有人的心都因不安而跳动，只有米歇尔 · 阿尔丹的心例外。

en: That imperturbable personage came and went with his habitual business-like air, while nothing whatever denoted that any unusual matter preoccupied his mind.
zh: 那个镇定自若的人来来去去，带着他惯常的公事公办的神气，脑子里却没有任何异常的东西。

en: After dawn, an innumerable multitude covered the prairie which extends, as far as the eye can reach, round Stones Hill.
zh: 黎明过后，无数的人群覆盖了一望无际的大草原，环绕着石头山。

en: Every quarter of an hour the railway brought fresh accessions of sightseers;
zh: 每隔一刻钟，铁路就会带来新的游客;

en: and, according to the statement of the Tampa Town Observer, not less than five millions of spectators thronged the soil of Florida.
zh: 根据《坦帕市观察家报》的报道，至少有五百万观众聚集在佛罗里达州的土地上。

en: For a whole month previously, the mass of these persons had bivouacked round the enclosure, and laid the foundations for a town which was afterward called “Ardan’s Town.”
zh: 整整一个月以前，这些人在围墙周围露宿，为一个后来被称为“阿尔丹城”的城镇奠定了基础

en: The whole plain was covered with huts, cottages, and tents.
zh: 整个平原被小屋、农舍和帐篷所覆盖。

en: Every nation under the sun was represented there;
zh: 每个国家都有代表出席;

en: and every language might be heard spoken at the same time.
zh: 每种语言都可以同时被听到。

en: It was a perfect Babel re-enacted.
zh: 这是一个完美的巴别塔再现。

en: All the various classes of American society were mingled together in terms of absolute equality.
zh: 美国社会的各个阶层在绝对平等的条件下混杂在一起。

en: Bankers, farmers, sailors, cotton-planters, brokers, merchants, watermen, magistrates, elbowed each other in the most free-and-easy way.
zh: 银行家、农民、水手、棉花种植者、经纪人、商人、水手、地方官员以最自由自在的方式相互推搡。

en: Louisiana Creoles fraternized with farmers from Indiana;
zh: 路易斯安那州克里奥尔人与来自印第安纳州的农民交好;

en: Kentucky and Tennessee gentlemen and haughty Virginians conversed with trappers and the half-savages of the lakes and butchers from Cincinnati.
zh: 肯塔基州和田纳西州的绅士们和傲慢的弗吉尼亚州人与捕猎者以及来自辛辛那提的半野蛮人和屠夫们交谈。

en: Broad-brimmed white hats and Panamas, blue-cotton trousers, light-colored stockings, cambric frills, were all here displayed;
zh: 宽边白帽，巴拿马，蓝色棉裤，浅色丝袜，细麻花边，都摆在这里;

en: while upon shirt-fronts, wristbands, and neckties, upon every finger, even upon the very ears, they wore an assortment of rings, shirt-pins, brooches, and trinkets,
zh: 而在衬衫正面、腕带和领带上，在每个手指上，甚至在耳朵上，他们戴着各种各样的戒指、别针、胸针和小饰品,

en: of which the value only equaled the execrable taste.
zh: 其价值只相当于可恶的味道。

en: Women, children, and servants, in equally expensive dress, surrounded their husbands, fathers, or masters, who resembled the patriarchs of tribes in the midst of their immense households.
zh: 妇女、儿童和仆人，穿着同样昂贵的衣服，围绕着他们的丈夫、父亲或者主人，这些人在他们庞大的家庭中就像是部落的族长。

en: At meal-times all fell to work upon the dishes peculiar to the Southern States, and consumed with an appetite that threatened speedy exhaustion of the victualing powers of Florida,
zh: 在用餐时间，所有人都忙着做南方各州特有的菜肴，他们的胃口很大，可能很快就会耗尽佛罗里达州的食物供应能力,

en: fricasseed frogs, stuffed monkey, fish chowder, underdone ’possum, and raccoon steaks.
zh: 炖青蛙，填充猴子，鱼汤，半熟负鼠，还有浣熊肉排。

en: And as for the liquors which accompanied this indigestible repast! The shouts, the vociferations that resounded through the bars and taverns decorated with glasses,
zh: 至于伴随着这难以消化的餐点的酒！喊叫声，喧闹声回荡在酒吧和酒馆的玻璃装饰,

en: tankards, and bottles of marvelous shape, mortars for pounding sugar, and bundles of straws! “Mint-julep” roars one of the barmen;
zh: 大酒杯、形状奇妙的瓶子、捣糖用的迫击炮和一捆捆稻草! “薄荷酒”向一个酒保咆哮;

en: “Claret sangaree!” shouts another;
zh: “红葡萄酒!”另一个人喊道;

en: “Cocktail!” “Brandy-smash!” “Real mint-julep in the new style!” All these cries intermingled produced a bewildering and deafening hubbub.
zh: “鸡尾酒!”“白兰地酒!”“新风格的真正薄荷酒!”所有这些叫喊混杂在一起，产生了令人眼花缭乱和震耳欲聋的喧哗。

en: But on this day, 1st of December, such sounds were rare.
zh: 但在12月1日这一天，这样的声音很少见。

en: No one thought of eating or drinking, and at four P.M.
zh: 没有人想到吃或喝，在下午四点。

en: there were vast numbers of spectators who had not even taken their customary lunch!
zh: 有大量的观众甚至没有吃他们的习惯性午餐！

en: And, a still more significant fact, even the national passion for play seemed quelled for the time under the general excitement of the hour.
zh: 还有一个更重要的事实，即使是全国人民对游戏的热情似乎也在这个时刻的普遍兴奋之下暂时平息了下来。

en: Up till nightfall, a dull, noiseless agitation, such as precedes great catastrophes, ran through the anxious multitude.
zh: 直到夜幕降临，一种沉闷、无声的骚动，如大灾难之前的骚动，在焦虑的人群中蔓延开来。

en: An indescribable uneasiness pervaded all minds, an indefinable sensation which oppressed the heart.
zh: 一种难以形容的不安充斥着所有的心灵，一种难以形容的感觉压迫着心灵。

en: Every one wished it was over.
zh: 每个人都希望这一切结束。

en: However, about seven o’clock, the heavy silence was dissipated.
zh: 然而，大约七点钟的时候，沉重的寂静被驱散了。

en: The moon rose above the horizon.
zh: 月亮从地平线上升起。

en: Millions of hurrahs hailed her appearance.
zh: 数百万人为她的出现欢呼。

en: She was punctual to the rendezvous, and shouts of welcome greeted her on all sides, as her pale beams shone gracefully in the clear heavens.
zh: 她准时到达约定地点，欢迎的声音从四面八方传来，她苍白的光芒在晴朗的天空中优雅地闪耀着。

en: At this moment the three intrepid travelers appeared.
zh: 就在这时，三个勇敢的旅行者出现了。

en: This was the signal for renewed cries of still greater intensity.
zh: 这是再次发出更强烈呼喊的信号。

en: Instantly the vast assemblage, as with one accord, struck up the national hymn of the United States, and “Yankee Doodle,”
zh: 大家立刻齐声唱起了美国国歌《美国佬的涂鸦》

en: sung by five million of hearty throats, rose like a roaring tempest to the farthest limits of the atmosphere.
zh: 由五百万个热情的喉咙演唱，像一场咆哮的暴风雨一样升到大气层的最远端。

en: Then a profound silence reigned throughout the crowd.
zh: 接着，整个人群陷入了深深的沉默。

en: The Frenchman and the two Americans had by this time entered the enclosure reserved in the center of the multitude.
zh: 这时，法国人和两个美国人已经走进了人群中保留下来的围栏。

en: They were accompanied by the members of the Gun Club, and by deputations sent from all the European Observatories.
zh: 他们由枪支俱乐部的成员和所有欧洲天文台派来的代表团陪同。

en: Barbicane, cool and collected, was giving his final directions.
zh: 巴比康镇定自若地给出了最后的指示。

en: Nicholl, with compressed lips, his arms crossed behind his back, walked with a firm and measured step.
zh: 尼科尔紧闭着嘴唇，双臂交叉在背后，迈着坚定而有分寸的步伐走着。

en: Michel Ardan, always easy, dressed in thorough traveler’s costume, leathern gaiters on his legs,
zh: 米歇尔 · 阿尔丹总是很随和，穿着一身旅行者的服装，腿上绑着皮靴,

en: pouch by his side, in loose velvet suit, cigar in mouth, was full of inexhaustible gayety, laughing, joking, playing pranks with J. T. Maston.
zh: 他身着宽松的天鹅绒西装，嘴里叼着雪茄，腰包里装满了无穷无尽的欢乐，笑声，玩笑，和 J.T. 马斯顿开玩笑。

en: In one word, he was the thorough “Frenchman” (and worse, a “Parisian”) to the last moment.
zh: 总而言之，直到最后一刻，他都是一个彻头彻尾的“法国人”(更糟糕的是，一个“巴黎人”)。

en: Ten o’clock struck! The moment had arrived for taking their places in the projectile!
zh: 十点钟敲响了! 他们在炮弹中各就各位的时刻到了！

en: The necessary operations for the descent, and the subsequent removal of the cranes and scaffolding that inclined over the mouth of the Columbiad, required a certain period of time.
zh: 下降的必要操作，以及随后移除倾斜在 Columbiad 口的起重机和脚手架，都需要一定的时间。

en: Barbicane had regulated his chronometer to the tenth part of a second by that of Murchison the engineer, who was charged with the duty of firing the gun by means of an electric spark.
zh: 巴比康把他的计时器调整到十分之一秒，由工程师默奇森负责，他负责用电火花发射火炮。

en: Thus the travelers enclosed within the projectile were enabled to follow with their eyes the impassive needle which marked the precise moment of their departure.
zh: 这样，被包围在炮弹内的旅行者就能够用眼睛跟踪标志着他们离开的精确时刻的无动于衷的针。

en: The moment had arrived for saying “good-by!” The scene was a touching one.
zh: 说“再见”的时刻已经到来，这一幕令人感动。

en: Despite his feverish gayety, even Michel Ardan was touched.
zh: 尽管米歇尔 · 阿尔丹狂热而欢快，但他也被感动了。

en: J. T. Maston had found in his own dry eyes one ancient tear, which he had doubtless reserved for the occasion.
zh: J.T. 马斯顿在自己干涩的眼睛里发现了一滴古老的泪水，毫无疑问，这是他为这个场合准备的。

en: He dropped it on the forehead of his dear president.
zh: 他把它掉在了他亲爱的总统的额头上。

en: “Can I not go?” he said, “there is still time!”
zh: “我能不去吗?”他说，“还有时间!”

en: “Impossible, old fellow!” replied Barbicane.
zh: “不可能，老家伙!”巴比肯回答。

en: A few moments later, the three fellow-travelers had ensconced themselves in the projectile, and screwed down the plate which covered the entrance-aperture.
zh: 过了一会儿，三个同行的人把自己安置在炮弹里，拧下盖住入口孔的板子。

en: The mouth of the Columbiad, now completely disencumbered, was open entirely to the sky.
zh: Columbiad 的入海口现在完全没有任何阻碍，完全向天空敞开。

en: The moon advanced upward in a heaven of the purest clearness, outshining in her passage the twinkling light of the stars.
zh: 月亮在最纯净的天空中向上升起，在她的通道中闪烁着星星的光芒。

en: She passed over the constellation of the Twins, and was now nearing the halfway point between the horizon and the zenith.
zh: 她经过双子星座，现在正接近地平线和天顶之间的中点。

en: A terrible silence weighed upon the entire scene! Not a breath of wind upon the earth! not a sound of breathing from the countless chests of the spectators!
zh: 一阵可怕的沉默笼罩着整个场面！地上没有一丝风！无数观众的胸膛里没有一丝呼吸的声音！

en: Their hearts seemed afraid to beat! All eyes were fixed upon the yawning mouth of the Columbiad.
zh: 他们的心似乎害怕跳动! 所有的眼睛都盯着哥伦比亚号打哈欠的嘴巴。

en: Murchison followed with his eye the hand of his chronometer.
