zh: 默奇森用眼睛跟着他的计时器的指针。

en: It wanted scarce forty seconds to the moment of departure, but each second seemed to last an age!
zh: 离离开的那一刻还有四十秒钟，但是每一秒钟似乎都持续了一个世纪！

en: At the twentieth there was a general shudder, as it occurred to the minds of that vast assemblage that the bold travelers shut up within the projectile were also counting those terrible seconds.
zh: 到了二十号，大家都不寒而栗，因为在那一大群人的脑海中，那些被弹丸包围着的勇敢的旅行者们也在计算着那可怕的几秒钟。

en: Some few cries here and there escaped the crowd.
zh: 人群中有几声哭喊。

en: “Thirty-five!—thirty-six!—thirty-seven!—thirty-eight!—thirty-nine!—forty! FIRE!!!”
zh: “三十五!-三十六!-三十七!-三十八!-三十九!-四十! 着火了! ! !”

en: Instantly Murchison pressed with his finger the key of the electric battery, restored the current of the fluid, and discharged the spark into the breech of the Columbiad.
zh: 马上，默奇森用手指按下电池的钥匙，恢复了液体的电流，把火花放到哥伦比亚号的后膛里。

en: An appalling unearthly report followed instantly, such as can be compared to nothing whatever known, not even to the roar of thunder, or the blast of volcanic explosions!
zh: 一个骇人听闻的不可思议的报告接踵而至，如可比拟的什么都不知道，甚至没有雷声的轰鸣，或火山爆发的爆炸！

en: No words can convey the slightest idea of the terrific sound! An immense spout of fire shot up from the bowels of the earth as from a crater.
zh: 没有任何语言可以表达这种可怕的声音的最细微的想法！一股巨大的火焰从地球的内部喷射出来，就像从一个火山口喷射出来一样。

en: The earth heaved up, and with great difficulty some few spectators obtained a momentary glimpse of the projectile victoriously cleaving the air in the midst of the fiery vapors!
zh: 地面上升起来，几个观众好不容易才瞥见那颗炮弹在火焰的蒸汽中胜利地劈开空气！

en: CHAPTER XXVII. FOUL WEATHER
zh: 第二十七章恶劣天气

en: At the moment when that pyramid of fire rose to a prodigious height into the air, the glare of flame lit up the whole of Florida;
zh: 当火焰金字塔升到空中一个惊人的高度时，耀眼的火光照亮了整个佛罗里达;

en: and for a moment day superseded night over a considerable extent of the country.
zh: 在这个国家相当大的范围内，白天曾一度取代了黑夜。

en: This immense canopy of fire was perceived at a distance of one hundred miles out at sea, and more than one ship’s captain entered in his log the appearance of this gigantic meteor.
zh: 在一百英里外的海上，人们看到了这个巨大的火幕，不止一艘船的船长在他的航海日志中记录了这颗巨大流星的外观。

en: The discharge of the Columbiad was accompanied by a perfect earthquake.
zh: Columbiad 的泄漏伴随着一场完美的地震。

en: Florida was shaken to its very depths.
zh: 佛罗里达深受震动。

en: The gases of the powder, expanded by heat, forced back the atmospheric strata with tremendous violence, and this artificial hurricane rushed like a water-spout through the air.
zh: 火药的气体由于高温而膨胀，以巨大的力量迫使大气层向后移动，这个人造飓风就像水柱一样在空气中冲击。

en: Not a single spectator remained on his feet! Men, women children, all lay prostrate like ears of corn under a tempest.
zh: 没有一个观众站起来！男人，女人，孩子，都像暴风雨中的玉米穗一样匍匐在地。

en: There ensued a terrible tumult;
zh: 随之而来的是一场可怕的骚乱;

en: a large number of persons were seriously injured.
zh: 许多人受了重伤。

en: J. T. Maston, who, despite all dictates of prudence, had kept in advance of the mass, was pitched back 120 feet, shooting like a projectile over the heads of his fellow-citizens.
zh: J · T · 马斯顿不顾一切谨慎的要求，抢在群众之前，向后退了120英尺，像一发炮弹一样飞过同胞们的头顶。

en: Three hundred thousand persons remained deaf for a time, and as though struck stupefied.
zh: 三十万人暂时失聪，好像被吓傻了。

en: As soon as the first effects were over, the injured, the deaf, and lastly, the crowd in general, woke up with frenzied cries.
zh: 第一个效果一结束，受伤的，聋的，最后，一般的人群，都在疯狂的叫喊声中醒来。

en: “Hurrah for Ardan! Hurrah for Barbicane! Hurrah for Nicholl!” rose to the skies.
zh: “阿丹万岁! 巴比肯万岁! 尼科尔万岁!”。

en: Thousands of persons, noses in air, armed with telescopes and race-glasses, were questioning space, forgetting all contusions and emotions in the one idea of watching for the projectile.
zh: 成千上万的人，带着望远镜和种族眼镜，鼻子悬在空中，质疑着太空，忘记了所有的挫伤和情绪，只有一个想法，那就是观察抛射物。

en: They looked in vain! It was no longer to be seen, and they were obliged to wait for telegrams from Long’s Peak.
zh: 他们徒劳无功！他们不得不等待龙山发来的电报。

en: The director of the Cambridge Observatory was at his post on the Rocky Mountains;
zh: 剑桥天文台台长在落基山脉任职;

en: and to him, as a skillful and persevering astronomer, all observations had been confided.
zh: 对他来说，作为一个技巧娴熟、坚持不懈的天文学家，所有的观察都是秘密的。

en: But an unforeseen phenomenon came in to subject the public impatience to a severe trial.
zh: 但是一个意想不到的现象出现了，公众的不耐烦受到了严厉的审判。

en: The weather, hitherto so fine, suddenly changed;
zh: 到目前为止一直晴朗的天气突然变了;

en: the sky became heavy with clouds.
zh: 天空乌云密布。

en: It could not have been otherwise after the terrible derangement of the atmospheric strata,
zh: 在经历了大气层可怕的紊乱之后,

en: and the dispersion of the enormous quantity of vapor arising from the combustion of 200,000 pounds of pyroxyle!
zh: 以及由于燃烧200,000磅的火山灰而产生的大量蒸汽的扩散！

en: On the morrow the horizon was covered with clouds—a thick and impenetrable curtain between earth and sky, which unhappily extended as far as the Rocky Mountains.
zh: 第二天，地平线上布满了云彩——一层厚厚的、无法穿透的天幕挡在了天空和地球之间，不幸的是，天幕一直延伸到了落基山脉。

en: It was a fatality! But since man had chosen so to disturb the atmosphere, he was bound to accept the consequences of his experiment.
zh: 这是一个死亡！但是既然人类选择这样扰乱大气，他就必须接受他的实验的结果。

en: Supposing, now, that the experiment had succeeded, the travelers having started on the 1st of December, at 10h. 46m. 40s. P.M., were due on the 4th at 0h. P.M. at their destination.
zh: 现在假设实验成功了，旅行者们已经在12月1日10点钟开始旅行了。4600万。40多岁。下午4点到期。到达目的地。

en: So that up to that time it would have been very difficult after all to have observed, under such conditions, a body so small as the shell.
zh: 所以到那时为止，在这样的条件下，要观察到一个如此小的物体是非常困难的。

en: Therefore they waited with what patience they might.
zh: 因此他们耐心地等待着。

en: From the 4th to the 6th of December inclusive, the weather remaining much the same in America,
zh: 从十二月四号到六号，美国的天气基本保持不变,

en: the great European instruments of Herschel, Rosse, and Foucault, were constantly directed toward the moon, for the weather was then magnificent;
zh: 赫舍尔、罗斯和福柯等伟大的欧洲仪器不断地指向月球，因为当时的天气非常好;

en: but the comparative weakness of their glasses prevented any trustworthy observations being made.
zh: 但由于他们的眼镜相对较弱，无法进行任何可信的观察。

en: On the 7th the sky seemed to lighten.
zh: 7日，天空似乎变亮了。

en: They were in hopes now, but their hope was of but short duration, and at night again thick clouds hid the starry vault from all eyes.
zh: 他们现在满怀希望，但希望只是短暂的，夜幕降临时，厚厚的云层遮住了所有人的眼睛。

en: Matters were now becoming serious, when on the 9th the sun reappeared for an instant, as if for the purpose of teasing the Americans.
zh: 现在事情变得严重了，9日太阳又出现了一瞬间，似乎是为了戏弄美国人。

en: It was received with hisses;
zh: 人们对此嗤之以鼻;

en: and wounded, no doubt, by such a reception, showed itself very sparing of its rays.
zh: 毫无疑问，在这样的接待下，受伤的人显得非常冷淡。

en: On the 10th, no change! J. T. Maston went nearly mad, and great fears were entertained regarding the brain of this worthy individual,
zh: 10号，没有变化！J · T · 马斯顿几乎发疯了对这个有价值的人的大脑产生了巨大的恐惧,

en: which had hitherto been so well preserved within his gutta-percha cranium.
zh: 至今还保存在他的头盖骨里。

en: But on the 11th one of those inexplicable tempests peculiar to those intertropical regions was let loose in the atmosphere.
zh: 但是在11日，这些热带地区特有的一场莫名其妙的暴风雨在大气中肆虐。

en: A terrific east wind swept away the groups of clouds which had been so long gathering, and at night the semi-disc of the orb of night rode majestically amid the soft constellations of the sky.
zh: 一阵可怕的东风吹走了长久以来聚集在一起的云团，夜幕降临时，半圆形的夜球在柔和的天空星座中庄严地驰骋着。

en: CHAPTER XXVIII. A NEW STAR
zh: 第二十八章一颗新星

en: That very night, the startling news so impatiently awaited, burst like a thunderbolt over the United States of the Union, and thence, darting across the ocean,
zh: 就在那天晚上，人们迫不及待地等待着这个令人震惊的消息就像一道闪电划过美利坚合众国的上空，然后穿过大洋,

en: ran through all the telegraphic wires of the globe.
zh: 贯穿全球所有的电报线路。

en: The projectile had been detected, thanks to the gigantic reflector of Long’s Peak! Here is the note received by the director of the Observatory of Cambridge.
zh: 多亏了龙峰的巨大反射镜，炮弹被发现了！这是剑桥天文台台长收到的通知。

en: It contains the scientific conclusion regarding this great experiment of the Gun Club.
zh: 里面有枪支俱乐部这个伟大实验的科学结论。

en: LONG’S PEAK, December 12.
zh: 朗峰，12月12日。

en: To the Officers of the Observatory of Cambridge.
zh: 致剑桥天文台的官员们。

en: The projectile discharged by the Columbiad at Stones Hill has been detected by Messrs.
zh: 哥伦比亚号在石山发射的炮弹已经被梅斯探测到。

en: Belfast and J. T. Maston, 12th of December, at 8:47 P.M., the moon having entered her last quarter.
zh: 贝尔法斯特和 J.T. 马斯顿，12月12日，晚上8:47，月亮已经进入她的最后一个季度。

en: This projectile has not arrived at its destination.
zh: 这颗炮弹还没有到达目的地。

en: It has passed by the side;
zh: 它从旁边经过;

en: but sufficiently near to be retained by the lunar attraction.
zh: 但足够接近月球引力。

en: The rectilinear movement has thus become changed into a circular motion of extreme velocity, and it is now pursuing an elliptical orbit round the moon, of which it has become a true satellite.
zh: 因此，直线运动变成了极速的圆周运动，现在它正在绕月球进行椭圆轨道运行，从而成为一颗真正的卫星。

en: The elements of this new star we have as yet been unable to determine;
zh: 这颗新恒星的元素我们还无法确定;

en: we do not yet know the velocity of its passage.
zh: 我们还不知道它通过的速度。

en: The distance which separates it from the surface of the moon may be estimated at about 2,833 miles.
zh: 它与月球表面之间的距离估计约为2,833英里。

en: However, two hypotheses come here into our consideration.
zh: 然而，我们在这里考虑两个假设。

en: 1. Either the attraction of the moon will end by drawing them into itself, and the travelers will attain their destination; or,
zh: 1.要么月亮的吸引力会以吸引他们进入自己而结束，旅行者会到达他们的目的地; 要么,

en: 2. The projectile, following an immutable law, will continue to gravitate round the moon till the end of time.
zh: 2. 抛射体遵循一个不可改变的定律，将继续围绕月球运动，直到时间的尽头。

en: At some future time, our observations will be able to determine this point,
zh: 在未来的某个时候，我们的观测将能够确定这一点,

en: but till then the experiment of the Gun Club can have no other result than to have provided our solar system with a new star. J. BELFAST.
zh: 但在那之前，枪支俱乐部的实验除了给我们的太阳系提供了一颗新的恒星之外，不会有别的结果。J · 贝尔法斯特。

en: To how many questions did this unexpected denouement give rise? What mysterious results was the future reserving for the investigation of science?
zh: 这个意想不到的结局引起了多少问题？未来为科学研究保留了什么神秘的结果？

en: At all events, the names of Nicholl, Barbicane, and Michel Ardan were certain to be immortalized in the annals of astronomy!
zh: 无论如何，尼科尔、巴比肯和米歇尔 · 阿尔丹的名字一定会在天文学史上永垂不朽！

en: When the dispatch from Long’s Peak had once become known, there was but one universal feeling of surprise and alarm.
zh: 当人们知道龙山派遣舰队的消息时，只有一种普遍的惊讶和恐慌。

en: Was it possible to go to the aid of these bold travelers? No! for they had placed themselves beyond the pale of humanity, by crossing the limits imposed by the Creator on his earthly creatures.
zh: 有可能去帮助这些勇敢的旅行者吗？不！因为他们已经超越了人类的界限，超越了造物主对地球上的生物施加的限制。

en: They had air enough for two months;
zh: 他们有足够两个月的空气;

en: they had victuals enough for twelve;—but after that? There was only one man who would not admit that the situation was desperate—he alone had confidence;
zh: 他们有足够十二个人吃的食物，但是在那之后呢？只有一个人不愿承认形势令人绝望ーー只有他自己有信心;

en: and that was their devoted friend J. T. Maston.
zh: 那是他们忠实的朋友 J.T. 马斯顿。

en: Besides, he never let them get out of sight.
zh: 而且，他从不让他们离开视线。

en: His home was henceforth the post at Long’s Peak;
zh: 从此以后，他的家就成了龙峰的驿站;

en: his horizon, the mirror of that immense reflector.
zh: 他的地平线，那个巨大反射镜的镜子。

en: As soon as the moon rose above the horizon, he immediately caught her in the field of the telescope;
zh: 月亮一从地平线上升起来，他立刻用望远镜把她抓住;

en: he never let her go for an instant out of his sight, and followed her assiduously in her course through the stellar spaces.
zh: 他一刻也不让她离开自己的视线，在星空中孜孜不倦地跟着她。

en: He watched with untiring patience the passage of the projectile across her silvery disc, and really the worthy man remained in perpetual communication with his three friends,
zh: 他不厌其烦地看着炮弹穿过她的银色圆盘，真的，这个值得尊敬的人一直和他的三个朋友保持着永恒的联系,

en: whom he did not despair of seeing again some day.
zh: 他对有一天能再见到他并不感到绝望。

en: “Those three men,” said he, “have carried into space all the resources of art, science, and industry.
zh: “那三个人,”他说，“把艺术、科学和工业的所有资源都带到了太空。

en: With that, one can do anything;
zh: 有了它，你可以做任何事情;

en: and you will see that, some day, they will come out all right.”
zh: 你会看到，有一天，他们会好起来的。”
